For $29.95 I got a generous heap of grilled calamari on a bed of arugula and beans, a super fresh steak of seared halibut with tomatoes and olives, and an unforgettable scoop of amaretto custard ice cream with biscuits. The waiters were clearly proud of the food in the restaurant, and suggested that I split with my partner, who got a decadent truffle and mushroom risotto. We left this restaurant very full and satisfied, and swearing to come back soon.

I normally despise the Marina, but this place is good enough for me to venture there for a meal.
author: Ken H.

description:
First off: Dean, our server, was amazing. He exudes great pride for his work and all his "co-pilots" as he put it. Very knowledgeable, he introduced the entire menu with so much energy that made it all the more enticing. 

The foie gras was perfect. I recommend that you try it if you haven't done so already. For this dish, "great taste" is an understatement. For appetizer, I had the foie gras; zucchini for side dish (so good!); and halibut for main course. Do also try the truffle risotto. 

Perfect experience for a first time here. I highly recommend this place and dean! The servers were all attentive, I felt special the entire time.
author: Trish P.

description: We went to this restaurant with friends for a nice weekend dinner. It was delicious! The atmosphere on the back patio is festive with patio twinkle lights. We ordered all dishes to share, and everything was delicious...from the bread with sweet butter, to the incredible trump risotto, to the delicious maple duck. We ordered 7 dishes for 4 and left the restaurant feeling satisfied but not overstuffed. Will definitely be back!
author: Kelly S.

description: We surprised my dad for his birthday here last week. The back patio area was really cozy and enjoyable. The happy hour drinks were amazing, especially the cocktail named Seven. We ordered a lot of dishes and everything was delicious. Our favorites were the pasta, steak, sea bass, oysters and duck. The service was great. It became really busy during our meal and it took a bit long for them to cut the cake but other than that we have no complaints. We will be back definitely.
author: Mimi N.

description:
We booked Isa for dinner since it was close to Palace of Fine Arts, which was our afternoon venue.  The restaurant is located in the SF Marina/Cow Hollow neighborhood, on a busy street lined with restaurants, cafes, and motels/inns.  

OVERALL
4.5 stars rounding up to 5. Its French/Mediterranean cuisine and virtually all the dishes we had were superb. Price is very reasonable for the area - Union Square and FiDi places can run 25% to 50% higher based on what we ordered.

DRINKS
Happy hour is before 7pm, so $5 cocktails with Soju!  The first round both the Moscow Mule and Mojito were light, refreshing, and diluted.  The second round they seemed to add double the alcohol so it was like night and day!

APPS
Lobster broth - its a bubbly, foamy, and hot lobster soup with intense flavors and three fairly large prawns. 5 stars!

Grilled Calamari - Incredibly soft and tender calamari over white beans.  The taste of squid wasn't quite there for some reason, maybe overwhelmed by whatever marinade they used to tenderize the squid? 4 stars.

Grade A Foie Gras - Wow perfectly seared foie gras with a buttery brioche and poached pears - surely a winning combination!  Its one of the better preparations of foie gras and its a generous portion. 5 stars!

MAINS
Potato-Wrapped Seabass - Their signature dish of the past 16 years and we are fans!  Its a good-sized cylinder of soft, well-seasoned sea bass wrapped with a golden, crispy potato skin for additional texture and flavor.  5 stars!

Lamb Chops - Three very meaty chops and were among the softest, juiciest I've had.  Cooked medium rare of course.  I liked the chopped veggies that came with the dish too.  5 stars.

DESSERTS
We shared the flourless chocolate cake and vanilla gelato.  The cake was like a soufflé in texture, but with a nice light spongy filling and not a liquid center like say in a lava cake.  The warm cake paired well with the sweet, cold gelato. 5 stars.

OTHER
The restaurant is small and slightly cramped.  You also have to carefully wade through the back past the kitchen to access one of two Unisex restrooms (one was much cleaner than the other).  Other than those minor dings, I'm rounding up to 5 stars for the food!
author: Daniel C.

description: Love, love LOVE the back lounge. Really cool lighting. It's great for friends night out, or a date. I'm big on service and every waiter at Isa is super attentive with their own personality. Everything on the menu is tasty. Everything!Extremely tasty!!! Just a heads up ... SF is generally pretty chill when it comes to dressing, but for some reason people put effort into their look when going here.
author: Ali R.

description: Went to Isa for a nice, romantic dinner in the city and the experience exceeded our expectations. A wonderful staff, along side a tasty three-course meal and an inviting venue. I would recommend this place to any one whether it be business or casual related.
author: Nick S.

description: Over the last decade, I've been here almost a dozen times, and I've always left satisfied. Food is thoughtfully prepared with lots of flavor. There are a few Asian influences but wouldn't call this Asian Fusion. Standouts include: seared foie gras with currants and brioche, potato wrapped sea bass (potato is sliced thin like a chip and wrapped around the fish and the searing makes it almost a potato chip) and the duck breast. The service is great too. Also if you're gluten-free, 95% of the menu is already gluten-free and those dishes that aren't are marked with an asterisk and most likely can be modified.
author: Patricia L.

description: We ordered a bunch of different things and all were good. Decent wine selection. If you can come when they have special deals it's all the better.
author: Arianna G.

description:
Thursday night dinner in August.

Excellent service by server Domingo and his team.

All dishes are to be shared and we all felt that every dish was excellent.

Calamari was perfectly cooked as well as the beans and the rest with it rounded it out to perfection.

Seabass is one of their signature dishes and not to be missed.

Trufle risotto was amazing.

Ameretto desert also highly recommended.
author: Vic M.

description: Every time we go to Isa, we are thoroughly impressed by the creativity, taste and quality of the food, all made that much better by the superior waitstaff's service. Honestly, we should go more often!
author: Todd D.

description: I made reservations at 645pm for restaurant week. Our food took an hour long to bring out. We kept eatting their bread and wine for an hour.  Well most of the bread part was me. This dinner took 2.5hours to finish and the food wasnt all that great. The only course that was good was the tuna tartare and the duck breast. Then they gave me a gift envelope to open at the end. They said to not open, and bring it back to redeem for next time when you come back. I'm most likely not going to come back, so I went ahead and opened it. Free chamagne !!! oh wells
author: Jack C.

description: Oh, yummy. We've been to Isa many times and it has never disappointed. This time we had the Lobster Broth, the Foie Gras, the Duck Breast, and the Seafood Paella. A spectacular feast.
author: D. S. K.

description:
This place ISA gem! One of the best French Bistros I've tried. 

A friend and I came here on a weekday night for dinner during SF restaurant week, where they offered prix-fixe menus with 4 courses for only $40. WHAT?! WOW. JUST WOW. The price point for the quality of the food is unreal, you won't find a deal this good anywhere else in SF. First of all they had the most amount of options than any other restaurant participating in SF restaurant week, and all of the options sounded so, so appetizing that we were both having a hard time picking. I settled for the following 
Course 1: Arugula salad- Came with oranges and a delicious, but subtle lemon dressing. 
Course 2: Salmon Carpaccio - Garnished with cucumbers and came with cripsy crostinis. I kinda wished I went for the Tuna, but it was fresh, regardless. 
Course 3: Grilled scallops with mashed potato - Cooked to perfection, a little juice, a little chewy, and melts in your mouth all at the same time. Highly recommend this dish. 
Course 4: Vanilla bean creme brulee - Do I even need to say anything here?
Note: I also ordered 6 oysters ($1 each Mon-Thursday), and foie gras ($27 in addition to the $40 fixed menu). The oysters were a little too large for my liking, I like my oysters itty bitty, but the foie gras was oh-so-delicious. 

Final thoughts - Do yourself a favor, and give this place a try. The restaurant is a hole in the wall spot, so it feels very cozy. The interior decor is very romantic and intimate. It's perfect for date night or just a girls night out! Can't wait to go back and stuff my face with the chef's delicious creations! I'd give this place 10 stars if I could!
author: Niki J.

description:
Came here for SF Restaurant Week 2017 - four courses for $40.

The patio seating is beautiful and surprisingly warm and roof-covered. Food was really delicious and service was great! Total dine time was about 2 hours.

Complimentary unlimited(?) bread to start.

FIRST COURSE
- Potato Leek Soup: Light but flavorful. Really great.
- Arugula Salad: Good light salad with citrus tones. My boyfriend's favorite out of all the dishes.

SECOND COURSE
- Yellowfin Tuna: Great! I thought this dish was well done, probably my favorite. The tuna is prepared raw. Felt like I was almost eating at a nice sushi place :)
- Salmon Carpaccio: I didn't try too much of this - I was told it tasted "okay." But the salmon was a nice thin cut.

THIRD COURSE
- Duck Breast: Wasn't sure what to expect but the meat was quite juicy and tender. Enjoyed this one!
- Angus Flat Iron Steak: Rare was pretty much blue rare - way too chewy and undercooked for my tasting. I thought it was just okay.

FOURTH COURSE
- Semifreddo All'amaretto: Yummy almondy goodness! Served with two mini almond cookies.
- Grapefruit Granite: Tasted bitter but exactly like how a grapefruit does. I'm not a fan of grapefruit, but it was refreshing. It's basically shaved ice.

Overall a good dining experience!
author: Scott C.

description:
**reads 3.5 stars**

Isa offers one of the best prix fixe menus in SF. At $29.95, you're crying at how ridiculously affordable this fine dining experience costs you.  

Course 1/
Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese. Warm and oozing goat cheese fused with pine nut nuttiness. You get sweet and savory in one melting bite. Simple and delicious.

Course 2/
Truffle risotto. Though there were a lot of mushrooms, the heavy hand in reggiano overpowered the lovely earthiness that was intrinsic to this dish. Had I not devoured the goat cheese dish moments before, I probably would have enjoyed this dish more. Unfortunately, I was cheesed out by this point.

Course 3/
Grapefruit granite. Refreshing and tart.  
Semifreddo all'amaretto. Tastes just like the almond oil/extract one buys from the grocery store to bake with. Nothing special.

Overall, Isa is a phenomenal choice if you want fine dining on a budget. All their dishes are meant to be shared family style so if you come with a crowd, the tastings are limitless. Their appetizers are simple but solid; I took a sip of my friend's potato and leek soup and it was savory good－the kind that'll cure your sickness good. Main courses were really filling but "just okay" taste-wise. If I had to pick one area of weakness, it would have to be their desserts.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
What happened to one of my favorite restaurants in the Marina???

Yesterday, we came in at 7pm to grab dinner with family. We had two young children with us and we waited more than an hour and a half for our food even though the restaurant was only half full. 

I was so confused by this, when I lived in the Marina my husband and I used to frequent this place, and service was at the top of their list. So for years, we've been a huge fan. Not anymore after last night and I doubt we would return. 

Our waiter, nice guy, seemed disorganized and relied on several people to serve dishes ordered by his table. The bread they served was cold, which is another bizarre thing, typically this is great here. 

Then when asked about our order, everyone seemed nonchalant and didn't care. It took me to stand up and walk towards the front to ask about the delay. 

While the food was still good, (except for the overly peppered steak) the service left such a bad taste in my mouth. 

I'm sad this happened, it's like a break up with an old friend.
author: michelle z.

description:
Awesome restaurant with great food, great service, great atmosphere!

Went during restaurant week on a Saturday night (6pm), as a group of 5. They seated us immediately in the back courtyard, which was very cutely decorated with dangling lights. It was totally sheltered from the rain and cold. 

The menu was great, a lot of selections for a 4 course meal. All the favorites for a great deal at $40 for restaurant week. Happy hour til 7pm! Which made my drinking friends very happy. Moscow Mule was legit.

Food:
Yellowfin Tuna tartar - 4 
Salmon Capacio- 3 (not citrusy)
Muscles in wine sauce - 4 good size for appetizer 
Arugula Salad - 3.5
Duck Breast w beets and huckleberries - 5 so good!
Truffle Risotto - 5 no meat but so flavorful!
Seared scallops- 4
Foie Gras w peaches - 5 (extra $25 but worth it)

Dessert:
Semi Freddy all amaretto - 5 I'm going to be craving this ice cream dessert!
Grapefruit granite - 3 not sweet enough for me
Vanilla bean creme brûlée - 4
author: Limiao Z.

description:
First of all, I would like to give a shout out to my college friend and fellow foodie Joanna N. for suggesting this place and making reservations for a Friday night dinner with friends! I truly believe this place deserves to be on that Eater list of great deals for SF Restaurant Week due to the sheer number of choices! 

If you take a look at their menu, they break it down into 4 courses instead of the traditional 3, and all for $40. And to make things better, the second course is family-style, meaning we can all share the dishes amongst ourselves! Oh, and for an extra $25, you can try their foie gras! 

Anyway, on to the menu items we tried:

First Course: Smooth Potato Leek Soup, Butter Lettuce Salad, Arugula Salad.

Second Course: Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio, Yellowfin tuna, steamed Prince Edward Island mussels, and Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese.

Intermission: Seared foie gras.

Third Course: At this point, our group of 4 went our separate ways, so I can only speak for the Grilled Golden Gate Natural Angus Flat Iron Steak. 

Dessert: Semifreddo all'amaretto

From the first course, the dish that stood out definitely had to be the potato leek. Even though I was the only one who ordered this, the flavoring was simply on point, with a nice creamy consistency and balanced flavoring.

Every single dish offered in the second course was satisfactory, but my personal favorite had to be the goat cheese. I know people will be turned off by the strong flavor of it, but it actually appealed well to my tastes. The salmon and tuna were alright, and the mussels were too small (or in some cases, nonexistent)

Foie gras melted in my mouth upon first contact, and considering it was my first time trying it, I liked that feeling!  The angus flat iron steak were nice but didn't stand out too much. 

Finally, the semifreddo (which had the consistency of ice cream, not gelato as the waiter mentioned), was DELICIOUS. I tasted amaretto and almonds the whole time, and the little cookie pastries also complimented the dessert well.
author: Viet N.

description:
Isa is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  It's cozy, romantic, and welcoming.  All of their staff are very genuine, it does make everyone feel comfortable.  Food is delicious with very reasonable price.

I've been here a handful of times.  They offer happy hour everyday til 7pm: $5 selected wine and soju cocktail, $1 oysters sunday-thursday, $25 for pan seared foie gras (and only $15 on Thursdays).  Everything listed above is a must try!

Leek Soup - tasted bland, can skip
Salmon Carpaccio - must try
Yellowfin tuna - must try, tuna is fresh
Mussel - ok, tomato base is a bit salty for my taste

Portebello Mushroom - ok
Duck - pretty moist
Sear Scallop - must try, very tender

Creme Brulee - must try
Grapefruit Granite - must try, so refreshing

I recommend that you go with a small group (3-5 ppl) so you can try a variety of food by doing family style.
author: sandy h.

description:
Let me start by saying that everything we ordered from the menu was fantastic. Scallops, Goat cheese, and butternut squash soup were all perfect.

The problem was the service. We sat there for 13 minutes before anyone came and got a drink order. Then at the end of our meal our server never came back and we had to ask the person filling up the water if we could get our check, and this was after a good 20 minutes of being finished with our food and bottle of wine. Very disappointing. 

Maybe our server was just over seated, I'm not sure, but it's something to be wary of when you come here.
author: Tyler H.

description:
I wasn't too into French food. Maybe it's too fancy for me or too little portions, but this place changed my mind. It feels rustic and cozy inside. Our server, Dean, was so entertaining. He had a great laugh, he explained the menu thoroughly and made great food recommendations. There were 6 in our party and we ordered the mussels, tartare, shrimp, seared sea bass, jambalaya, calamari, crab salad and steak. As you know, French food is known for their small portions, but the portions were surprisingly decent. In fact, we shared most of the dishes and left feeling really satisfied. We thoroughly enjoyed all the food, but a couple really hit the spot.

Prince Edward Island Mussels - It was cooked to perfection and the broth was lick-the-bowl good! We literally scooped the broth with the delicious baguette they serve until the last drop. 

Tartare - This dish was a surprise! It was so tasty and fresh. Vey well flavored.

Seared Sea Bass - This was the star of the night! The fish was wrapped in thinly sliced but slightly crispy potatoes. There were capers, tomatoes and this buttery but very light sauce surrounding this magnificent fish. It was amazing! 

This would be a great place for a date. The atmosphere is romantic and the food is delicious, but not grossly filling. And if you're lucky maybe your server might speak French too!
author: Em P.

description:
Isa is just fine as a restaurant. I'm not sure how else to put it.

Service was polite and prompt, the menu has a good diversity of options, the dishes are allegedly meant to be shared family style (although the servings for at entrées are really only enough for one person).

I simply wasn't blown away, or impressed, or thrilled by any of the dishes. It was a fine meal in a nice atmosphere, just nothing memorable.
author: Claire S.

description:
I chose Isa once during DAT, or Restaurant Week, whatever they want to call it now. (Doesn't matter, because SFRW has gone way downhill.) Not only did they offer four courses, but their dishes actually had variety and were worth trying, unlike many of the other contenders churning out a cookie cutter 3-course menu of soup or salad, boring entree, and brownie dessert. The portions were a good size, just a touch smaller than their usual portions. I'll include the current prices.
We were seated in the covered patio area behind the restaurant, which was probably a backyard in the past. Even though it was cold outside, the heating lamps and covered awning provided enough warmth and shelter. It felt cozy and inviting.

$10 Maine Lobster Broth w/ prawns, tomato, celery & tarragon:
Hot & savory bowl that warmed me up from the first taste. There were just a couple pieces of lobster & prawn, but they were good-sized chunks. The broth was smooth and satisfying.

$15 Yellowfin tuna with spicy sriracha, toasted sesame, seaweed, avocado, nori & *low sodium soy:
Cubes of tuna served tartare style over creamy chunks of avocado, with seaweed salad. It was very good, but I wouldn't normally order this at a French restaurant.

$16 Dungeness Crab Salad w/ avocado, apples, grapefruit & tarragon:
The shredded crab was not too shredded and the pieces were still substantial enough to be satisfying. The avocado, apple slices, and grapefruit each added variations in texture, and some tart and sweet flavors to the mix.

$24 Seared Scallops w/ mashed potatoes, brussel sprouts, bacon & truffle sauce:
Scallops were seared just right with a browned surface, but still had a meaty and springy texture. Brussel sprouts were roasted to a nice crunch. The mashed potatoes were so good with the savory sauce.

$23 Grilled Golden Gate Natural Angus Flat Iron Steak w/ haricot vert, fingerling potatoes, moutarde verte & bordelaise sauce:
The slices of flat iron were juicy and tender. The sauce on top was like a chimichurri, good flavor, but could have used more of it.

$7 Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee: 
Creme brulee isn't my favorite dessert. I still do enjoy taking a spoon and giving the torched caramelized crust a whack and seeing the broken window effect. Surprisingly it didn't break, as it was a rather thick crust. The custard underneath was nice and smooth.

$7 Semifreddo all' Amaretto:
I didn't know what to make of this semifreddo. I've had semifreddos before, but this seemed like half ice cream and half frozen bread. At least that was the texture that came to my mind. The almond cookies were good. I don't care for presentation or garnishes, but in this case, the sprig of mint was much needed to make this dish look good.

Now that I think about it, I probably would enjoy the grapefruit granite. I wonder why I never tried it. 

The chef has quite an impressive resume. I can see how he's going for a Californian Provencal menu, but most of the dishes seem more Californian to me.
Would I eat here again? Since I've tried the above dishes, there's not much on the prix fix menu that intrigues me, except maybe the salmon carpaccio or the truffle risotto. I am interested in trying the foie gras though. If I were in the area, I would definitely stop by on a sunny day to relax in their patio area again for happy hour.
author: Joy W.

description:
Day 3 of San Francisco restaurant week.  Isa offers a 4 course prix fixe for $40...what a deal!  I love that the choices per course is abundant so you can really try what the restaurant has to offer.  

With that said, we tried everything!

First course:  Potato leek soup, butter lettuce salad, and arugula salad

Second course:  salmon carpaccio, yellowfin tuna tartare, and mussels

Third course:  scallops, truffle risotto (with mushroom medley galore!), maple leaf farm duck breast, and angus flat iron steak

Last but not least:  grapefruit granite (Italian ice with a wonderful grapefruit flavor!), semifreddo all'amaretto (almond gelato with ground almonds), and vanilla bean creme brûlée (hard crispy sugary shell...my fav!)

Overall, very nice meal and wonderful service.  I love the end touches of getting a secret envelop that can only be opened by the Isa staff if we come back next month, and an email drawing for a free dinner for 10.  Clever!
author: M L.

description: I regret not trying Isa sooner. Started with the grilled calamari which was excellent. Next was the Sea of Cortez prawns, also very good. First main course was the Lamb chops, good but not mind blowing. However, the final main course was the Potato wrapped Sea Bass. Hands down the best sea bass I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, the potatoes had a nice crispness and the lemon caper sauce was amazing. It will be hard to try anything other than the sea bass and I'm not sure I want to. The covered outside patio is pleasant surprise. Our server was Jonathan who bares a slight resemblance to Christoph Waltz was terrific. I'll definitely be frequenting this fine establishment more often.
author: Bob N.

description:
Isa never disappoints. On my most recent visit, I had the the potato and leek bisque, mussels, duck breast, creme brulee, and the foie gras. Everything was delicious but ohhhh the foie gras...I'm salivating just thinking about it!! Everything about this dish is perfect...they give you a generous piece of foie gras, the strawberry sauce has the perfect amount of tartness to it, and that piece of bread it comes with has just the right texture between soft and toasted! 

Service is always friendly and attentive. Even walking by the kitchen the cooks seem friendly and happy too. 

Sometimes I like to have a glass of port with dessert but I didn't see it on the menu. Decided to ask anyways and they do carry it! What a lovely finish to the perfect meal. Thank you Isa! Can't wait to come back!

(I just thought this was kind of funny but almost every table was asian! I guess this is an asian hotspot lol. But anyways, cheers! Enjoy your meal!)
author: Kim W.

description: Good food, friendly staff, cosy back patio. A little too noisy and hectic. All food came at a weird time, my side dish came 15 mins later than my main dish... still recommend to go there for a casual dinner, but not a special occasion or a date night.
author: Halina K.

description:
Amazing food, service, and prices! Highly recommend. Especially the 3 course dinner for $29.99 and happy hour drink specials before 7pm.

I came here for my birthday celebration via opentable reservation, and was greeted by such a cheerful waiter who explained everything on the menu, along with personal recommendations. My friends and I ordered from the 3 course menu which had different choices to choose from: appetizer, entree, and dessert. 

Appetizer: I had a salmon plate and it was so fresh and delicious. (Advertised as organic)

Entree: Steak. I'm not a big red meat eater, but this steak was phenomenal! 

Dessert: Almond gelato. It was delicious, and they even put a candle in it as a surprise.

Overall, I loved my experience here. The ambiance was warm and inviting, and the service was great. For $29.99, this was such a great deal for the variety of food served. My friends all agreed as well. Two thumbs up!
author: Corinna T.

description: The food was pretty cool. The mussels, duck, steak and truffle pasta was amazing. Great and helpful service here! I will comeback here!
author: Victoria C.

description:
This is not a good restaurant. The wine list is uninteresting. The food is fine, but boring and not well priced. At least, what they managed to serve us was boring; they only got us two plates within 90 minutes because, despite being mostly empty, other tables were "not sharing." Not for nothing, but at no point were we told that it might be a while or anything like that. 

There is nothing this restaurant does that other places in SF don't do better.
author: Jake S.

description: Went for a foundation dinner so my view might be skewed. Lovely covered outdoor patio with those string lights that always make a place look festive. A couple of classic salads to start - arugula, shaved parmesan, and a butter lettuce with pear, walnut and blue cheese.  Sirloin with a nice herb butter, zucchini and roast potatoes, an ok mushroom risotto (a little mushy and allegedly with truffle but I could barely tell).  A meh amaretto semifreddo and a bracing but delightful grapefruit granite to finish. Excellent service.  I would think a reliable spot for locals.
author: Rich P.

description:
This place was cute. They have indoor seating and patio seating. During restaurant week, dinner is $40 per person and each person gets to pick their 4 course meal from the prefix menu.

Since there was 3 of us, we were able to try more than half the menu. The starters are: potato and leek soup, arugula salad, and the butter lettuce salad. The second courses are: tuna, salmon capaccio, and mussels. Third courses are: lamb, duck, and chicken. Desserts are: hazelnut ice cream, grapefruit shave ice, and creme brulee.

My faves were the butter lettuce salad, the tuna, the duck, and the hazelnut ice cream. Everything was well presented and cooked perfectly. Nothing was steaming hot which was a negative for me. The food got cold quicker. Their $5 cocktails was good as well! Service was on point and cleared empty dishes quickly. 

We looked at their regular menu and noticed that most of their entrees is what we already had from their prefix menu. I wouldn't mind ordering the duck again!
author: Jenna T.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF.

Pros:
- The foie gras offer on Thursday is awesome and one of my favorite reasons to come here
- The tasting menu is also great, it's a great way to get a nice sampling of their menu.
- Service is great
- Ambiance is nice

Cons:
- I will say they do not offer the best desserts. 

I have no hesitations coming here.
author: Phat T.

description:
4.5 Stars

Good thing we made reservations a few days prior because the place was packed. They weren't even accepting walk-ins. It could be the same reason we came here for - SF Restaurant Week.

$40 Set Menu and an extra $25 if you want to add on Seared Foie Gras. I was sold at Foie Gras. I actually had it here before and this place still lands a spot in the top best places for Foie Gras. With that great deal, who can resist?!

4 course meal:

-Arugula Salad - Bland, literally just arugala with some fruit
-Steamed Mussels - large portion and lots of flavor!
-Duck Breast - cooked medium rare, very tender
-Grapefruit Granite - refreshingly bitter

For the price and quality of food options, I would say this place was a great choice for Restaurant Week, especially for my friends who have never been here before. Our server was a little weird though, but the food and getting to sit out in the cute and quaint patio made up for it.
author: Marissa C.

description:
This was a very disappointing experience.

We came in when it was half empty on a Sunday night. Our server recommended sharing 3 or 4 dishes for two people, so we ordered four dishes. It was 90 minutes before the first dish came out. 

After some time our second dish came out and then... more waiting. So we decided to leave. We were told that the extreme wait was because other patrons in the restaurant "weren't sharing." If this is true, it is completely unfair that we were ordering "correctly" and not getting our food. 

We were also never warned by the server that our food was running behind. 

Isa seems to suffer from mismanagement. The waitstaff didn't seem to know how to communicate with us and their kitchen was probably understaffed. I can't imagine what it's like when they are full. 

It's a shame that we weren't able to taste more of their food, what we had was okay but not worth the time or money.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Came here for SF Restaurant Week, and Isa did not disappoint! They're one of the very few restaurants offering a prix-fixe four-course menu for RW dinner for $40. 

INTERIOR
This place is super cozy for dinner, especially on rainy evenings. There were lots of people waiting in the front to be seated, but luckily I made a reservation. The hated patio seating is absolutely amazing and ask to be seated there if you can! There's plenty of heat lamps and wonderfully decorated string lights that really ups the ambiance more so than the other sections of the restaurant.

SERVICE
Excellent service! Our waiter was super friendly and smiley. Even though he was serving many tables that night, he was very patient with taking our orders and listening to our requests. The staff was very courteous overall. At the end of the meal, they gave us a sealed envelope with a surprise coupon inside, only to be opened by the staff when you visit next time. Very enticing! 

FOOD
I really liked that the food was meant for sharing, and the servers would bring the plates to the middle of the table instead to each of us. We never had to wait too long between courses, but there were some discrepancies when one of us got a course way before another, so it just felt like a continuous stream of plates being served. 

First Course
Arugula salad: Pretty delicious, standard salad. The dressing on these salads are usually very flavorful, and they never dump an obscene amount of dressing on it. 
Smooth potato leek soup: This dish was really good, and I preferred this over the salad. The soup is very, very umami flavored which is great. Wonderful to dip bread in! 

Second Course
Baked Goat Cheese: This one took a while to come out because baking takes a while, but I recommend this for people who love goat cheese (and pizza!) It tasted more like a pizza without the crust, so I naturally used the bread that came with the meal as a dipping tool. 
Yellowfin Tuna: My boyfriend ordered this and said it was comparable for the price point with an almost identical Yellowfin Tuna dish from Jean-Georges. Even though he's not a big fan of seafood, he thought it was prepared very well.

Third Course 
Truffle Risotto: yummm mushroom overload! Although, compared to other same-tier restaurants I've been to for RW, the truffle flavor wasn't as flavorful as others. Still very delicious though.
Angus flat iron steak: The waiter recommended medium-rare which is what my bf got, but he thinks it would have been overall if it was just cooked medium. This is more of a preference thing though.

Fourth Course
Grapefruit Granite: This was a very tarty grapefruit shaved ice, and while it was good, it didn't wow me since shaved ice can only impress so much. Our waiter recommended that we eat this dessert first since the flavor is much stronger than the other. 
Semifreddo all'amaretto: This dessert was fantastic! The flavors are not overwhelmingly sweet like I expected it to be, and all the flavors worked so well together that it felt like a light ice cream cake. I've actually never had semifreddo before and omg I can eat this forever.

OVERALL
Fantastic experience, service, ambiance. It was so cozy on a rainy day, and we loved every minute of our dining experience. Can't wait to be back!
author: Kelly L.

description: Wonderful service and delicious food. I like that they serve their entrees family-style essentially. That way you don't have to limit your choices. We had the potato-encrusted sea bass and the paella. Then dessert was coffee and the chocolate cake. Soufflé-like but a little lighter. Just right after a heavier meal.  We sat in the back, in the heated outdoor setting which was very comfortable. It was a little noisier than I hoped but that can't be helped. We will definitely be back.
author: Cheryl F.

description:
The food was great.  The service is some of the worst I've had in ages anywhere- and this was a quiet weekday evening.  

Had to ask two people three times for oil for the bread...which I was only eating because our food was insanely slow to arrive.  Friend told the waiter that she is highly allergic to tomatoes and he promised to make the appetizer without tomatoes.  Luckily she looked carefully before eating and saw the tomato pieces.  At that point, it had taken so long for the app I asked how long until the entrees because we may just skip the app. The reply- oh that will take a lot longer but you should be happy because on weekends it's much much worse.

They also kept pushing that we should order an app and dinner (menu states that too).  These were not small portions and it was mentioned so many times that I started to wonder if wait staff makes commission.  

These are just a few comments on a fully bad service experience. 

It's a neighborhood staple but I'm not sure I'd return seeing that their service has gone down so much.  The food was the saving grace of the night as it was all tasty.
author: Karen B.

description:
Four of us came during restaurant week.  Four courses for $40. There is a 3 course prix fixe Monday-Friday for $30.  Excellent value.  They also have happy hour cocktails for $5, even on the weekend.  The vodka is from Japan, only 40 proof.

The arugula salad was very fresh and a great start to the meal.  Next, I had the raw yellowfin tuna on a bed of avocado.  A very good take on a popular appetizer. Others had the mussels or salmon carpaccio.  I liked the mussels better than the salmon.  

Three people had the scallops and Brussels sprouts.  At the price for four courses, I knew there would not be a large serving of scallops. There were 4 nicely browned scallops on each plate with Brussels sprouts and mashed potatoes filling the plate.  

The duck breast (medium rare) was excellent.  It was served with spinach and
Potatoes.  I would definitely order the duck again

Two of us had Creme brûlée and two had the grapefruit granita. Both were excellent.

A very nice meal.  The servers kept encouraging us to share and eat whichever dish came out first.  This is good advice since there was often a long wait for the four dishes (for 4 people) of each course.  It didn't work so well for us because we did not order enough different things.  That's probably the biggest weakness

A very good value for fresh, well prepared dishes.
author: Joanna S.

description:
A for Acceptable

Came here for SF Restaurant week. We ended up sharing everything. Had a good time, waiter was friendly and helpful. Made me feel like home while served well presented food.

We got:
1) potatoe leek soup - this was a little too watery for me
2) arugula salad - well paired with pine nuts
3) mussels - godly when dipping bread in the broth
4) salmon carpaccio - I enjoyed this. went well with the capers
5) scallops - my friend really enjoyed this, again the side carb dish ( mashed potatoes) seemed to steal away from the main attraction
6) duck - ok this was my favorite, on the side there was what resembled hashbrowns that were amazing. the duck was also on point and tender
7) goat cheese 
8) creme brulee  

I didn't really feel this was worth $40 but I didn't feel like I was paying a lot for a poor meal either. Not much of a wow factor, but the food is decent
author: Tatiana T.

description:
Isa never loses its charm! A warm little cozy gem with deliciousness. We tried several of their menu items. I personally LOVED the goat cheese appetizer with fresh baked bread, arugula salad, truffle risotto, and the quinoa with fresh seasonal veggies; my mom enjoyed the salmon. I also love all their desserts. We were lucky to get the heart shaped white chocolaty decadent gelato peeking goodness, along with my all time favorite chocolate cake with gelato and creme brulée. 

The customer service provided was amazing. We loved the food, and loved the ambiance. All the recommendations were spot on! Ask Sameera for recommendations! She wont let you down!! Thank you for a lovely evening Isa. We will be back! :)
author: Nadim R.

description: First visit to this restaurant was during SF Restaurant week and it was amazing and since then have visited 2 times.  The service is great and the food is amazing.  All time favorite was the foie gras, I've ordered it during each visit and most likely will def order next.  Also love the outdoor seating in the back.
author: Linda L.

description:
The staff was the biggest set of hustlers I've ever seen. They tried forcing us to order 2 entrees per person and claimed it was a way to share. They made it seem that you weren't allowed to do it any other way. The waiter was so damn pushy it was unnerving. He clearly was attempting to rip us off. 

Here's the kicker, at the end of the meal, which I should note was very good, he pushed a FOIE GRAS sale on us! Saying we should come back and get a bunch of foie gras at cost. I'm surprised he didn't try to sell me a motorcycle or a timeshare in Boca. 

If we were on one of those hidden camera shows than bravo, you guys did a great job in confusing the hell out of us and attempting to rip us off. But next time tell the staff to lighten up and stop selling so damn hard. I seriously think I was in the sequel to Glen Gary Glenross
author: Robert G.

description:
Huge fan of their $30 for 3 courses price on Sundays through Thursdays. It's really an amazing deal for a nice atmosphere and delicious food. Could not recommend it more especially if you want to feel like you're fine dining but not pay the price. Service was super attentive and friendly.

Every dish that comes out is meant to be shared. If you each order the 3 course dinner can take a long time but it was very enjoyable. Free tasty bread and butter that they refilled for us. We got the salmon carpaccio and mussels for appetizers. The salmon was raw and fresh. The mussels came with a large serving size and had flavorful sauce for dipping your bread. I would recommend both.

For the main dish we got the truffle risotto and steak. The truffle risotto with mushrooms was the most memorable dish of the night. AMAZING! I don't even like mushrooms but it was such a flavorful creamy risotto. Definitely try this! The steak was good but nothing special. I like the zucchini slices served with it and I didn't like the potatoes since it was very salty.

At this point we were already very full but for dessert we got the grapefruit ice and goat cheese. The ice was super refreshing and the goat cheese very creamy (the waiter's favorite). Overall wonderful experience and deal! I've been recommending this place to many friends!
author: Linda X.

description:
My first time having French cuisine and it was amazing! Easy reservations made through OpenTable. Our waiter Domingo was a delight. The place was really pretty with string lights. Our table was a bit cramped though.

To start, we had a bottle of Riesling. Domingo came and poured us each a glass. Tasty, me likey. We were given a basket of bread and butter. YUM. For appetizers, we had Grilled Calamari and Foie Gras. I never had Foie Gras before and OMG it is DELICIOUS. Mouth watering as I type this. I was informed that it was a little bit under which gave it a soft texture. The taste and texture reminded me of pork belly. I think it came with a side of cranberry sauce, regardless it went well with the foie gras. The custard brioche was delicious too. The calamari was good. It was grilled to perfection and the flavors went well together.

For entrees, Domingo said it was a sharable size so we decided to share what we all thought was good. We had the Seared Scallops, Spaghetti, Potato wrapped Seabass, Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast, and the Grilled Golden Gate Natural Angus Flat Iron Steak.
   -The Scallops were a little undercooked. It wasn't that great IMO. The orzo below it was tasty so it sort of made up for the scallops. 
   -The Spaghetti was a little underwhelming. I wasn't really expecting much but for $20, it should have been a bomb ass spaghetti and it wasn't. It honestly could have used a bit more sauce. It was cooked al dente though.
   -The Seabass had the better flavor of all the entrees. Although it was a little overcooked, I enjoyed the flavor of everything together. The potato on the outside sort of gave it a salty flavor which went well with the sauce. Definitely a good dish to order.
   -The Duck breast was also a winner. It was a little chewy but good flavoring. I loved the potatoes on the side.
   -Lastly the steak. Steak was cooked to a good medium. It was juicy. The green beans were salty. And I wasn't too big of a fan for the polenta (not a polenta fan to begin with anyways).

All in all, I had a really positive first French experience. Service was excellent as was the food. Everything tasted great especially the foie gras. They also don't auto charge tip for large parties as they believe that tip is up to the customer. No cake cutting fee either. Will definitely come back for special occasions! Oh and Thursdays they have $15 Foie Gras. YESSSS.
author: Benita M.

description:
Never really had a bad experience!!! Great Staff. And I swear I saw ducks and chickens stay away from this place. Just seeing geese change their flight path ti stay away from Isa is a sight to see! I mean how could they have such food truck  prices for such good food that doesn't belong in TheCity! 

Thank you to the Staff and Owner who named the restaurant as her daughter for making people experience good food with no non sense mark ups!!!!

Thank YOU!
author: Wu T.

description: This place was delicious! Often I'm afraid to order seafood from restaurants I've never been to, but Isa's scallops were incredible (as was everything else my table ordered). Service was so fun and diligent. The back patio was quite large and lit up beautifully at night time. This was a nice surprise considering the small exterior. I would definitely come here again.
author: Sydney N.

description:
Yum. Yum. Yum. Cute little cozy joint. The halibut, grilled squid and the almond semifreddo were especially good. Not a snooty place, which I like. Staff wise that is. 

Only complaint: the customers. 
The quarter is a little tight and I'm not sure if it's the marina clientele or what, but had a run in with kinda arrogant customers next to us. The tables are tight and one of the lady at the table next to us walks up to the chairs between the two tables and expect my mother to move out of the way for her to pass, no excuse me please. No nothing. Just stood there with the "why are you not moving bitch face". Not to mention. Her boyfriend or husband or her own girlfriend's man is sitting in the other chair in her way. Why did he not  hmm want to move for her? He kept talking, not even expecting he would have to move. And it's not once, but twice both there and back. We got annoyed. More because some implicit expectation we should move for her even though both party (one that's her own) is in her way. If she just said please and thank you. People are more than happy to help her. But man, where are the manners marina crowd? Get off your high horse. Get some schooling on how to be a more courteous person. No one is here to wait on you. Don't act like a fucking princess. Having class is about how you behave and how you treat others. This, no class. Get over yourself.
author: P L.

description: Had a nice experience here. It was very busy and they were running behind schedule. But worth the wait. Always great service and at a really good price!
author: Anahi R.

description: The 3-course prefix menu was average. The appetizers were average (salmon carpaccio tasted too fishy, and the goat cheese was good and very rich that you would need to have it with bread) the main courses were average (the chicken dish was plain, and the fish fillet breaded and fried), and the dessert was the best part of the entire meal (the amaretto ice cream dessert is homemade and the grapefruit shaved ice was excellent). I expected higher quality but was disappointed. The ambiance is dim and romantic and service was friendly.
author: J A.

description: This is  more of a nice special occasion place than takeout, but they now show up on Seamless for delivery so I ordered. The food was absolutely delicious and packaged much better than a typical takeout delivery.
author: David T.

description:
Came in during SF Restaurant week. Obviously, this is a popular restaurant because they were packed. And rightly so. I have rarely seen  such an exhaustive menu offered during this time by any other restaurant. The food was equally matching its reputation. Baked Goat cheese was out of this world as an appetizer. Steak was truly delicious. And I have eaten steak all over the Bay Area. Nothing matches the Steak like I ate here.
Food however took a little while to arrive, but that's understandable since they were swamped.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Bejan J.

description:
I'm not easily impressed by restaurants, but it's been weeks and I still can't stop raving about Isa.

It's not even good because its a gluten free restaurant it is AMAZING IN SPITE OF IT. There's no way anyone would not appreciate this place. The food here is just sublime, which is great because the service certainly isn't. :(

We ordered 4 dishes to share which included
(1)  Warm bread basket - Loved the bread, so soft and springy and absolutely delicious when it came piping hot out of the oven
(2) Tuna tartare - absolutely fresh and beautifully seasoned but a little on the salty side. You could give this a skip and try the foie gras instead. I know I wish I had. The fish is so fresh and perfect though.
(3) The scallops and asparagus - lovely. The scallops were cooked to perfection.
(4) THE ROAST CHICKEN. God I don't even like Roast chicken but this dish was amazing. Whatever they seasoned the chicken with was absolutely addictive and the chicken meat was so tender it melted in my mouth. Definitely my favorite dish of the night and a dish I'll remember for a long time.
(5) Potato wrapped halibut. The server claims this is their signature dish. Give it a miss, it's nothing to write home about.

nonetheless, the food was absolutely fabulous and affordable i would 100% come back again! :)
author: Sarah T.

description: Amazing new year tasting menu and great service! We had salmon carpaccio, butter lettuce salad, and ahi tuna for starters, then the shrimp and mussels for second course, and steak, duck, and pasta for entrees. We all had creme brûlée for dessert. Everything was delicious and the workers did an amazing job getting everything out to such a large crowd on a crazy holiday evening. At $80 for a 5 course meal and champagne, it was excellent value.
author: Clare F.

description:
Second time here after first trying this place during Restaurant Week 2015!

What we ordered for 3 people:
Simply sauteéd Sea of cortez wild prawns ($16) - simple but amazing flavors
Seared scallops with brussels sprouts, bacon, mashed potatoes & truffle sauce ($24) - big portion, great combination of flavors
Saffron Paella with peas, red peppers, clams, mussels, calamari, prawns & lobster broth ($26) - doesn't come with a paella pan, which is a disappointment and distracts from a true seafood paella flavor
Maple leaf farm duck breast with potato galette, spinach, bacon, currants, pinenuts & sherry vinaigrette sauce ($24) - a different duck flavor from another duck dish that was on the menu last winter. Meat was tender and great!

Actually surprisingly filling for three people. Probably could have ordered another appetizer, but their bread was so good that we ate two baskets heh. Also tasted a lot more bacon than we expected hah either we unintentionally chose bacon dishes or Isa just likes their bacon.

Large tapas, family-style. Highly recommended if you're interested in a fancier date night restaurant! Definitely take your girl here ;) this was my first date night place with the boyfriend during RW. Very intimate either in the front area or on the back patio!
author: Lucy Z.

description:
Great food.  Very disorganized though.  We had a reservation for 7pm and arrived a little late (approx. 7:10pm) but then had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table.  
They served my main course before my wife's and I waited until it was getting cold at which point she insisted that I start.  I was nearly done by the time her main course finally arrived. When we were done and waiting for the bill they had a very full house of people waiting for tables - I expected that they'd be prompt about running the credit card - but again a very long delay.  A+ for great food.  C+ for service (they were attentive and asked how things were etc.) but a D- for not being able to serve to main course at the same time, the delays and the disorganization.  Worth going for the food ... but beware of the chaotic nature of the service and delivery.
author: Brian B.

description: Unfortunately we had a horrible experience at Isa.   Three out of our table of five ordered their prefix menu.   We mentioned we were celebrating my cousin's birthday.   After ordering the waiter asked me if he could bring out a dessert with a candle to which I responded of course.   Once we finished the our appetizers and main course the waiter immediately brought out a dessert for my cousin with a candle.   She actually ordered a prefix so a dessert was included with her meal.   The waiter then asked my parents what they would like.  They debating between a chocolate cake (for an uncharge) and ice-cream.  They both decided ice-cream.   Shortly later the busboy brought them their ice-cream and then also brought another chocolate cake.   We sent back the chocolate cake as we didn't order it.   A few minutes later he came back and said the cake came with my cousins as part of her prefix dinner.   We explained she didn't order it but he left it anyway.   To make a long story short when the bill came we were charged $8.50 for one of the chocolate cakes and a $4 uncharge for another chocolate cake.   When I discussed the matter with the waiter (just out of principal) he said I authorized him to order a desert for my cousin at the beginning of the evening and that we also ordered an additional cake.   I told him her dinner should have come with a dessert and she wasn't even given a choice, and that we never ordered an additional dessert.   He argued with me that although we sent back the dessert that ultimately we "fully consumed" the dessert and thus we need to pay for it.   I asked him to do what was right since we did not order it, we sent it back, and we never ordered my cousins "uncharge" dessert.  Ultimately he offered to take $4 off the bill.   I asked for a manager and was told they left for the evening already (7pm).  My wife and I have been to this restaurant many times and it is a real disappointment on how were were treated.
author: Keith G.

description: Such a cute restaurant! Amazing food and drink, excellent atmosphere, knowledgeable servers. Highly recommend seating in the back and multiple visits to fully explore the menu!!
author: Jeremy A.

description: This place was good couple years back for restaurant week, but it has went downhill, steepily! Lobster broth is so bland and food is soso...  but the real issue is with management as they do not care about their customers. If you're bringing dessert here, make sure you ask them about the underlying dessert fee and ask them about mandatory 20% tips that goes with your bill. Just go to another place guys, this place is not worth it.
author: Davy Y.

description:
Made a reservation for 8 no problem. I was running a tiny bit late due to parking but not late enough to give away our seats thank god!
We got seated out on their patio which has a great ambiance because it has all the twinkly lights which adds a touch of romance. 
We ordered a round of drinks right before happy hour ended! Moscow mules all around but it tasted like water, which I'm not sure is a good or a bad thing. 
Our calamari appetizer came in along with yummy bread. It wasn't what I had expected even though I remembered briefly looking at other yelp photos of it. It just didn't process in my head so I was surprised when it didn't come out fried. But it was still good nonetheless. A bit too slimy for my personal preference though. 
The wait for our entrees took a while, so we were non stop eating our bread and the waiters were on top of their game refilling it for us about 3-4 times haha. 
These dishes are quite filling despite size as they are all hearty foods (and maybe we ate a bit too much bread). I ordered the scallops and the duck to share with my boyfriend. The scallops are fantastic, super buttery and melts into your mouth. And the mash underneath was also like butter! Sooo good. The duck was a bit too tough for me, which we thought was weird because we had it medium rare. 
I was also able to try a few other dishes my friends had ordered, like the seasonal fish (halibut at the moment) and that was fairly tasty. The paella was alright, I personally don't like the sauce. And the veal was also okay. 
The waiters were so nice to come over and sing me happy birthday, take videos for us and I even got a chocolate soufflé and a glass of delicious dessert white wine. 
Thank you for a great time Isa Restaurant!
author: Vence M.

description:
Really!  Does the restaurant pay Yelp to eliminate bad reviews and put the good ones at the top? Are we talking about the same restaurant?

It was one of the worst dining experiences that I have had in a long time.  The waiter did not come around once to check up on us.  Everyone was done eating their dinners before my husband's  food came out.  The manager came around to ask how everything was going and when I complained about the lack of food, she was extremely rude and defensive. She did not apologize or make an effort to check on the food.

She said that everything is served "family style" so it comes out at different times - like each dish comes out 45 minutes after the next?  She said that she cannot control the kitchen although as the manager, one would think that is part of her job description!

The seafood tasted a little burnt.  There was nothing special about the salad.  There are two restrooms for over 100 customers both of which are filthy.
author: Emily W.

description:
Come here on the weekdays to enjoy a very reasonably priced and delicious prix fixe menu! Bonus points for happy hour until 7 p.m. Been here several times and the food and service have been consistently good.

This place is great for groups as there is a large outdoor patio area with plenty of seating and heat lamps (because let's be real, SF is always friggin' freezing). 

In terms of entrees, the roasted rack of lamb is amazing and perfectly medium rare. Another star is the potato-wrapped seabass in terms of flavor and creativity; however, my fish was slightly overcooked (hoping that is a one-off). Though I have not personally experienced the truffle risotto, it is also one of their more popular dishes. 

For those with a sweet tooth and room in your stomach, the flourless chocolate cake and creme brulee are good bets.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a date, get-together or group outing. Solid food and great ambiance make this a win in my book.
author: Joan S.

description: The three course prix fixe here never disappoints and tonight's Greyhound was extra refreshing
author: Kelly T.

description: Just finished up at Isa for restaurant week and was really pleased with the experience. The restaurant and bar were packed even at 8:30 pm so I recommend a reservation. What's great about their restaurant week menu is that it offers so many selections, including an appetizer, a first course, the main course and a dessert or cheese course. We had a party of 6 and ended up splitting all of our dishes, which it is intended to be more family style. Favorite first courses were the tuna tartar and the goat cheese; favorite main courses were the chicken with scallop potatoes, the steak (very favorite) and the mushroom risotto; for dessert, most of us had the creme brulee which had a really nice hard shell of sugar and delicious vanilla filling. Service was also really good for being restaurant week. I live in the area so I'll definitely be back.
author: Aryn C.

description: What a delightful restaurant! Service was very warm and friendly, made us feel welcome from the start. Love the family style service, which invited dinner mates to try each other's food. Everything was delicious.  Some very interesting flavor combinations, too. Roasted asparagus with a dab of tapenade and parmesan. Beets and tiny radish slices accompanied the halibut special. A bite of all three flavors together was really unique. The shrimp were very well prepared and exceedingly fresh. A memorable dinner served by memorable staff!!
author: Glenn C.

description:
Came here for SF restaurant week, but they usually have set menu that is similar to the restaurant week menu anyways. 

The duck breast is divine! Definitely on top of my fav duck breast. Lamb was a bit meh, because it has olives and bell pepper, it reminded us of pizza because they overpowered lamb. Semifreddo is also a favorite among our group! Bread is also warm and delicious!
author: Ya K.

description:
Hudson Valley grade A foie gras with poached pears, huckleberry & custard brioche: the best foie I've ever had the privilege of tasting.  Beautifully seared, melts in your mouth, perfectly complimented by the savory brioche and delicate pear flavor. Make sure to order your own or there may be trouble!

Found my new "Last Meal on Earth" ;)
author: Jenny Q.

description:
I've only been to Isa for Dine about town. The first time was back in 2010. They still served their regular menu along with DAT. This was great because I was able to sample their foie and DAT menu! Since then, I've been a couple of times and they only have their DAT menu avail when participating in the promo. I took a group of 5 back in January 2013. DAT was $36.95 for four courses.

First course:
*Maine lobster broth http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#1SY2wTuHBPJ4AK5MGfPK2A
*Smooth potato and leek soup http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#jnML0AB0v-ZI_M1vIKfbLg

Second course:
*Tomales bay Pt Reyes oysters http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#cxrBRdhPC2g_JUtSrLhQVA
*Dungeness crab salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#Jw7IfavGdYLixMboh6hpkw
*Baked laura chenel goat cheese http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#wJ643vy-_b1M3UhpQw5rsQ
*Yellowfin tuna http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#jYH0-yf-AZzDCkL_rVVMUw
*Butter lettuce salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#q0eeva4rUH-H-EG4VnDOIg

Third course:
*Seared scallops http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#An87JqZ6LkQH-8HGQmjVxA
*Spaghetti with Himalayan truffles http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#4xut1HPKeVZPsT7YC4UxIg
*Grilled golden gate natural Angus flat iron steak http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#Xd0dhpXuJtdBq8UOOoYweg
*Pan roasted rocky mt range chicken http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#y406oLXyJf39jJVYyoWq3g
*Maple leaf farm duck breast http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#ZvTJQT5VN3dVQatOfgKSmw

Fourth course:
*Vanilla bean creme brulee http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#1P9dT6rizDTw8vGsawDKiw
*Semifreddo all'amaretto http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/isa-restaurant-san-francisco#-M-ekSGJs5ffDtDkkoyVmg

Even though the extra course is just soup, it's still a great deal when compared to other DAT menus that only provide three courses. Everyone in my group enjoyed their meals and we all had a great time!

If you've never been to Isa for DAT, I'd say they are one of the better restaurants left that participate in the promotion. The pickings for Dine about town seem to get slimmer and slimmer each year. So go check out Isa if you're debating on where to go this coming January!
author: Elena N.

description:
Our server Din was unbelievably sweet and on top of things. We got a bottle of wine and 4 different appetizers. The goat cheese appetizer was a bomb as well as shrimp and yellowtail mmmm delicious 
We also had this melting in your mouth beautiful chocolate cake and fresh delicious creams brûlée. I want to say his name was Jose who served it to us, so heads up to him for taking care of our dessert! I want to be back:) thank you!
author: Anastasiia R.

description: I'm not sure that this place necessarily NEEDS another review, but I'm going to write a short one of some initial impressions.  My friend had her rehearsal dinner here and we had a fairly large party of 16ish people.  The table was already set with pre-printed menus.  I sat next to the groom and he was constantly being updated and consulted about which wines to serve and whether to open another bottle, etc. etc.  There were constantly people coming in to check on us.  Water glasses were never empty, and food came out at a pretty reasonable pace.  I personally didn't find the food necessarily remarkable, but then again I didn't really get to choose what was on the menu (they had ordered shareable mini portions for the entire table).  It was good in that we were able to try a lot of different items.  The restaurant itself has a large patio / garden area which was where we sat, but walking through the restaurant, it looked like the interior was very cute and very intimate.  I really liked the space.  The service was very friendly and I'd recommend this place if you were looking to wine and dine a group of people because they made it seem very effortless!  :)
author: Tiffany C.

description: We were at one nearby restaurant but decided we wanted to eat somewhere else in the Marina within walking distance because we didn't want to give up our amazing parking. Went to Yelp, found Isa, reserved a table and headed over. It was pretty packed and cramped. There is an attempt to make the place seem romantic but the tight quarters and high-decibels make that a losing battle. I was hoping for a better wine list but it was reasonably priced. The best glass I had was a "mystery wine" thing that meant you got a discount for finishing up last of a bottle. It was super cheap and very nice. Service was attentive and friendly and the food was pretty good and my wife and I both had the same impression: If Isa was in most other cities, it would be remarkable but in SF, there are so many great options for what they charge, we doubt there is reason to return.
author: Brian B.

description: Excellent service, delicious food, good happy hour menu and the covered patio is a special touch to the venue.
author: Dolce Vita V.

description:
Came here last week for Restaurant Week and was very impressed! First and foremost, they have happy hour until 7! Yasss. I ordered the Greyhound Soju cocktail which was pretty sweeth and yummy and had just enough to kick. Since it was Restaurant week we had a prix fix menu. There were 3 of us so we got to try pretty much everything!

Starters:
Potato and leek soup - I really enjoyed this soup. It had a very down home feel to it and it was nice to dip our bread into. I can't say that I would order this on a normal day but it was definitely tasty.

Arugula salad: I'm usually not a fan of arugula. I guess I like more hardy salads. However, the salad had a great taste to it and the dressing was very nice.

Butter lettuce salad: Definitely my favorite! The salad was bustling with flavor from the apples, bleu cheese and walnuts. The dressing was quite nice as well. I would definitely order this again.

Second course: 
Ahi tuna: This was another one of my favorites. The tuna was super soft and almost buttery, it tasted very nice and fresh. The plate was presented very nicely. In every scoop I was able to get some tuna, seaweed salad and avocado. Definitely must order this dish!

Salmon carpaccio: This was also very tasty. It didn't stand out as much as the tuna but nonetheless was a great dish.

Mussels: The mussels were very tasty. I did wish that the broth was a lot warmer (temperature wise) But other than that it had great flavor and was a great size to share.

Final course:

Chicken and mashed potatoes: This was my choice and I was not let down. The chicken was nice and moist and had a great, light sauce on top. The mashed potatoes were my favorite! They were creamy and the perfect consistency. I'm talking like grandma's thanksgiving mashed potatoes caliber!

Lamb: I'm not a huge fan of lamb and the dish had olives which i'm also not very keen of. Also, the lamb tasted a little tough. 

Duck: The duck was very yummy. It wasn't too fatty tasting and it laid on top of a very tasty sauce. I would definitely order it again.

Dessert:

I'm not big on desserts. However, I loved the grapefruit shaved ice thing! (I think it had a fancier name than that) it was nice and tangy and very refreshing for my palate after our hearty meal. My friends were pretty obsessed with the ice cream as well.

All in all, great restaurant! The service is good. I did notice that sometimes the servers were a little too eager to take your plate. I will definitely be coming back!

I read on the menu that they do a Prix-Fix menu every week so I would definitely recommend coming and doing that with people to share. It's a great amount of food and it's nice to be able to try everything. Definitely worth it!
author: Jessica B.

description:
AMAZING SERVICE, FOOD, WINE, AMBIANCE. I WOULD DEFINITELY COME HERE AGAIN. FOR DINNER.
Expect to pay high prices for small, but delicious dishes!

Appetizer: Steamed Prince Edward island mussels with garlic, tomato confit, jalapenos, white wine, shallots & grilled bread came with a lot of mussels! Was more than plenty for 2! 

Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio with lemon, crème fraiche, cucumber, egg, capers & crostini was MEH. Did not like the sauce they put on the fish at all!

Entree: Truffle risotto was absolutely tasty! A bit too buttery, but that's what we pay for right? haha I would never use that much butter at home! Very savory!

I really enjoyed the Seared scallops with corn, cherry tomatoes, English peas, mashed potatoes & truffle sauce. Came with 4 small scallops seared to perfection and just tasted so amazing!

If you come between 5-7, they have special selection for happy hour wines!
author: Andrew S.

description: Tried out this place out during restaurant week! So damn good! The foie gras melts in ya mouth!  service was great! Definitely make a reservation but sitting at the bar isn't bad either.
author: Melissa A.

description: OMG everything was amazing!! I will definitely come back. Came here on recommendation of my clients today. Gotta have the foie gras!!
author: Theresa H.

description:
Clearly I am late on my review...we came here for restaurant week over a month ago....

Suffice to say this is what I remember vividly 

The plates are advertised as family style and meant to share but from a portion perspective not all dishes live up to that 

Tuna tower was the clear favorite while the salmon Carpaccio was the least favorite 
Red meats were underseasoned and quite lackluster 
Duck was cooked well but the skin tasted "burnt" 

Service is rushed but responsive

Food was sufficient with very little standouts 

Overall Thoughts

I'll have to venture back again when its non restaurant week to see if I feel differently about Isa
author: Eddie W.

description:
Food was great. Waitress Cassandra was terrific!!
Enjoyed the Bass & was amazed at how good the sweet breads were.  
The setting in the back was informal and very comfortable. Will go back.
author: John W.

description: What a fabulous dinner we had here! I forget the waiter's name but he was super helpful with the menu and made us feel right at home. Everything we are here from the Foie Gras to the Potato wrapped fish was YUM! If your looking for a restaurant with great food and a warm atmosphere, this is your place. I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Had the pleasure of coming here for a company holiday party so I can't comment on the normal dining experience. Service was very good - immediately upon walking in, a server asked what type of wine I wanted.

The covered patio out back was warm (they set up heating lamps for us), cozy and well-decorated with lights. The food was tasty - highlights were the goat cheese starter and scallop entree. The vanilla bean creme brulee was also very solid. Would be back to try eating here as a regular customer if I'm ever in the neighborhood.
author: Clinton L.

description:
As California chefs rejoiced earlier this year after the overturning of the foie gras ban, I was ecstatic for the fact that I could finally try this fine delicacy for the first time. Rich, velvety, and buttery, charred on the outside with melt-in-your-mouth creaminess inside, Isa's Hudson Valley grade A foie gras was a delicious treat. The accompanying toasted brioche was soft and fluffy, a perfect base for the fatty liver. The pairing with sweet, mild fruit (in Isa's case, poached pear and huckleberries) also helped balance the foie gras richness.

Aside from Isa's foie gras, other items on their menu didn't leave me in awe. The Dungeness crab salad was very light, therefore allowing the true freshness of the crab to shine through, but the salad overall wasn't outstanding. The tuna tartar was very fresh and had a nice kick from the spicy sriracha. But I felt the dish could've used some crackers or crisps as a base. The potato wrapped sea bass was very small for an entree. The fish was very mild, yet the tomato and caper flavors were just too strong and thus hindered the milder delicate fish flavor.

Service at Isa was very friendly and accommodating. The front part of the restaurant, which includes the bar, is rather small. But at the rear outdoor heated and covered patio makes Isa's dining experience more intimate and welcoming. For a balanced dining experience, Isa offers a pre-fixe 3-course meal Sunday through Thursday for only $30, which is an excellent deal given their use of fresh, quality ingredients.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I am surprised that this restaurant does not have 5 stars!! I came to isa for dine about town and it was amazing! Our dinning experience actually had a rocky start because they somehow lost our order so we didn't get out food for an hour. I didn't even notice the time, however, because they kept refilling our bowl with delicious bread and softened butter (it's a pet peeve of mine when the butter isn't soften.) Finally, I had to ask the waitress where our food was and they realized that our order got lost (I seem to be having bad luck recently.) The manager came out and was extremely apologetic and suddenly all of our dishes came pouring out. The manager kept apologizing and comped us moscato which was delicious. 

The food was well worth the wait. Among the 3 of us, we ordered 13 dishes - including foie gras. The dishes were EXTREMELY fresh. The cheese with the salads had a nice smoky hint to them and were generously placed on. The beets were very sweet and paired nicely with the arugula. While the mussels were on the smaller side, they were very fresh and sweet. They didn't need a lot of sauce because the quality of the mussels were already great. The scallop was cooked to perfection and not chewy or overdone at all. The duck was tender and the huckleberry sauce paired nicely with it. Generally you could taste each ingredient and all the dishes were balanced perfectly. The aged goat cheese came with the most delicious honey and candied walnuts. Everything was so pleasant.

The foie gras was amazing. Normally I don't like foie gras because it comes with just toast and taste like globs of fat. However, at isa they served it with a fruit compote and the sweetness balanced the foie gras very well. Rather than tasting like globs of fat, it taste like fruit smokey butteriness with a wonderful bold taste of duck. It was amazing. 

I would definitely come back to isa again and recommend it to a friend!
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
Five plus stars for Isa hosting our rehearsal dinner during the Memorial weekend! The service and cuisine was absolutely wonderful. 

Our wedding rehearsal was at the Presidio and we were looking for a restaurant with unique food, reasonable prices and close to the venue. We worked with Sameera and she was very sweet and helpful in helping us plan our dinner. We ended up booking the entire back room with 48 people to make it more of a private experience. The majority of our guests were coming from out of town and they were amazed with the delicious food and service.

Sameera was very fast, responsive to emails and the whole process was seamless. 

Our Dinner Menu Consist Of: 
Dungeness crab salad with avocado, apples and grapefruit 
Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese
Sauteéd sea of cortez wild prawns with parsley
Tarragon seared Scallops with with brussels sprouts, bacon, mashed potatoes; truffle sauce
Truffle risotto with baby shiitake
Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak with baby
Vanilla bean crème brulée and Semifreddo all' Amaretto

My favorite dishes were the risotto, shrimp and scallops. We had a wonderful time at Isa and definitely will be back. Thank you!
author: V N.

description: This is one of the best French restaurants I've ever been to. I ordered the foie gras which was nicely plated with persimmons and custard type of bread. My boyfriend ordered the lobster bisque plus calamari which came with mashed potatoes and bacon. We absolutely loved the beautiful patio seating with twinkle lights. The servers were very welcoming, kind and attentive. Thanks for making my visit to S.F memorable and enjoyable!
author: Grace L.

description:
I came here during Restaurant Week SF 2016 and its a good bang for you buck. Table of 4 and we literally tried everything on the menu. 

First course:
Potato Leek Soup: Smooth, creamy, and refreshing. 
Butter Lettuce salad: My personal favorite. Reminds me of my favorite Gorgonzola and pear salad.
Arugula Salad: Nice and refreshing for the summer time with the fruit pieces.

Second course:
Organic Loch Duart: Delicious and refreshing. I think they used smoke salmon for this plate.
Yellowfin tuna: Taste like your typical tuna tartare stacked.
Steamed PEI mussels: Its really hard not to mess up on this dish but loved every single bite. The restaurant gives out sourdough bread so ask for extra to dip the sauce!
Baked goat cheese: One of my favorite plates here. Super smooth and creamy.
 
Third coourse:
Seared scallops: Fresh, firm scallops. Sweet and simple herbs to enhance the scallop flavors.
Flat iron steak: Medium rare as always. Tender but its a bit dry. Thank goodness for the wine reduction for dip
Lamb tenders: One of my least favorite as the lamb has a slight odor to it. Not very fresh in my opinion. Very chewy. 

We had a side order of foie gras: My first taste, just as I suspected from my research. Slightly seared but still as soft and buttery. 

Fourth course:
Semifreddo all'amareto: Love the taste of the almond ice cream. 
Vanilla bean creme brulee: So smooth and light for a creme brulee. A must have.
Buche Au Lait De Chevre: Not my choice for dessert but yes for charcuterie.
Point Reyes Blue Cheese with fruits: Again not my choice for dessert.

My overall experience here is delightful. Amazing service, nice ambiance for a romantic dinner. I would come back here again for a special occasion.
author: Jenny N.

description:
I had a 9:15 reservation but got here about an hour early and checked to see if they can seat us early. Turned out they have a walk-in table. The table was all the way at a corner far from all the other tables so you kind of have you own little nook which was nice since I was here with my bf on Valentine's Day. Although we were secluded, the waiters did not fail to come back frequently to refill our water and bread, and to see if we needed anything - in short, the service was superb!

The Valentine's menu was a 4 course prix fix menu that came with a glass of champagne. The menu was designed to be shared (each person got to picked 4 courses).

Here's what we got: 
1. Tomales Bay Pt Reyes oyster - it came with a spicy orange mmigonette sauce that was delicious. It's a good change from using the typical Tabasco and cocktail sauce.
