2. Maine lobster broth - it came with a few pieces of prawns that were cooked perfectly, but no lobster meat. The broth was perfect for dipping their toasted bread in.  

3. Yellowfish tuna - this dish was good, but nothing about it really stood out. It was yellowfish tuna sashimi that I can get at any Japanese restaurant. 

4. Sauteed Prawns - it was cooked perfectly. There's that nice crunch when I bite into it and the sauce complimented the prawns really well. 

5. Potato wrapped Sea bass - this was a very pretty looking dish. but sadly to say it was my least favorite dish. The sea bass wasn't buttery like I expected. It was kind of dry. 

6. Roasted rack of lamb - it came with 4 lamb chops cooked to a perfect medium rare. It was seasoned really well, and the meat was tender. It was delicious! 

7. Creme Brulee - the creme brulee was very creamy and not overly sweet. 

8. Flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean gelato - this took about 15 minutes because they had to bake it. It was good but I liked the creme brulee more.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Quiet/calmer spot with good quality food in the marina. They have vegetarian and gluten free options and everything is just as hearty and satisfying. 
Their signature dish, the sea bass, is very good but add veggie side, such as the spinach.
author: Veronica V.

description:
Great place, great food.
Sun-Th is a prix-fixe menu for $29. Great value.
Happy hour for $5 till 7pm.
Make sure to make reservations. 
Good service, friendly, and accommodating.
Portions are large enough for two so watch out because the volume of food can get to be much very quickly with a large party.
Everything is good.
Well worth the visit.
author: David H.

description:
We took the  fix menu. For first we ordered the calamari and the baked goat cheese. Very mediocre... Nothing special taste wise and a pretty  dull presentation. Something that you can fix at home in no time.
For main we took the Hallibut and risotto. Fish was mediocre and flavor less no effort on the presentation. Risotto was good, actually the only dish we really enjoyed tonight.

Service was great and we had a wonderful spot in the window watching the street. Probably one of the things that made this evening great.

Overall was an ok dinner but don't believe will come back ....
author: Yolanda S.

description:
ACT I, SCENE I, at the restaurant of Isa
(Enter foodkid and Princess Carewee, overdressed in wannabe hipster attire)

Princess Carewee 
I daresay that the ambiance here is almost as beautiful as my eyes. 

foodkid 
Thou art too kind to thyself. But I agree with the beauty of this place. Reminds a young lad like myself of a Midsummer's Night Dream.

(Enters Romeo, the talented waiter)

Romeo 
'Tis true. We have much pride in our decoration. My name is Romeo, may I bring thou some light refreshments? 

Princess Carewee
I will have the Pinot. What say you my dear foodkid?

foodkid
I will have a cocktail that gets me as tipsy as a university student on Thursday night.

Romeo
Fine choices. These happy hour drinks are a bargain on our menu.

(Exits Romeo)

Princess Carewee
What is the name of thou's drink?

foodkid
I remember not. But what's in a name? That which we call a beer by any other name would get me just as drunk.

(End Act I Scene I)



ACT II, SCENE I, Appetizers
(Enters foodkid and Princess Carewee, both intoxicated from multiple rounds of drinks)

foodkid
Mine stomach is empty. Where is Romeo and whence is the food coming?

Princess Carewee
O Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo?

(Enters Romeo)

Romeo
I hast with me the Salmon Carpaccio and the Crab Salad. Welcome to Isa, mine cater-cousins. Enjoy thy delicious meal. 

Princess Carewee
Small cheer and great welcome makes a merry feast. Ye art a gentleman, Romeo. 

foodkid
The Crab Salad is sweet and refreshing. The Salmon Carpaccio flavorful.

Princess Carewee
I love this meal already!

foodkid
But love is blind, and lovers cannot see the pretty fatties that themselves commit.

Princess Carewee
Eat now, worry later. 

(End Act II, Scene I)



ACT II, SCENE II, Main Course
(Enters foodkid, Princess Carewee, and Romeo with the main courses)

Romeo
I present to thee the Cortez Wild Prawns, the Potato Wrapped Seabass, the Truffle Risotto, and the Roasted Rack of Lamb.

foodkid
The prawns art large, but tastes nay better than if they are small.

Princess Carewee
The Truffle Risotto is heavenly. Soft! What taste through yonder risotto breaks? It is a feast, and truffle is the sun. 

foodkid
What doth thou think about the seabass?

Princess Carewee
Mine father steams fish that hath a finer taste. 

foodkid
'Tis indeed a merry meal. The rack of lamb looks as appealing as ev'r.  

Princess Carewee
But mine stomach can hold no more, yet the little lamb entices me as if I am a savage beast. To eat or not to eat? That is the question!

foodkid
I hasth a better question. Are you gonna finish that? 



ACT II SCENE III, Dessert
(Enters foodkid and Princess Carewee, clearly stuffed from delicious food)

Romeo
May I interest thou in our sweet list of fine desserts?

Princess Carewee
Aye! Prithee bring me thou sweetest treats.

Romeo
As you wish.

foodkid
I thought thee on thou "low-carb" diet.

Princess Carewee
But I fell in love with sugar at a young age. If sack and sugar be a fault, God help the wicked!

Romeo
Creme Brulee, Vanilla Bean Gelato, and the Grapefruit Granite is on the house.

foodkid
Gramercy to thou, Romeo.

Romeo
Mine pleasure. Pardon me, Juliet hath just text'd me.

(Exits Romeo)

foodkid
Fie! Whence all the dessert go!?

Princess Carewee
Ate it all while thou was chatting with Romeo

(End Act II, Scene III)


ACT III, Scene I, The Soliloquy 
(foodkid and Princess Carewee asks for the check)

foodkid
A merry feast makes the bill an extraordinary beast.

Princess Carewee
Umm... I must step away for a while. To the ladies room!

(Exits Princess Carewee)

foodkid
Scoundrel! The bill arrives and she hastily goes.
The pressure is high for mine money is low. 
Farewell, Benjamin. You are my money borrowed.
And regardless, parting is such sweet sorrow. 
Although I thoroughly enjoyed my time at Isa,
The payment will no doubt cost mine Visa.
I will come again with Carewee, but my fate be reveresed,
For next time I'll be sure she Venmo me first. 

(END PLAY)

*Much props to my AP English teacher Ms. Mauroon for teaching us Shakespeare!*
author: Ringo M.

description:
Went here for SF restaurant week. Good deal: 4 courses for $40. It was busy, but the food was good. I went with a party of 6 so we were able to get a variety of the dishes.

1 star taken away only because we waited ~40 mins between our third and 4th course (dessert). I don't know what happened but the other courses came out quick and then no dessert for a long time. 

First course:
- Leek soup - truffle flavor really came out
- Butter salad - standard salad

Second course: 
- Salmon carpaccio - tasty
- Spicy tuna - delicious
- Mussels - not much flavor compared to other places where you get mussels

Third course
- Scallops - moist, not dry
- Truffle risotto - my favorite, but good for sharing because it was very rich
- Seared lamb tenders
- Duck breast - tender, not bad

Fourth course
- Grapefruit granite / ice - this was okay, hard to eat after taking bites of the sweeter desserts
- Semifreddo amaretto - my favorite, we killed this dish first
- Vanilla creme brulee - this was just ok, but classic brulee

Not sure if i would come back to this restaurant unless there was another deal going on, but good place to eat if you are in the neighborhood and other main restaurants are full. There is seating in the back so the initial (small) front room may look decieving. Also, they take reservations.

Tip: They only take a max of  2 credit cards so if you are going with a big party, make sure people have cash.
author: Cicely T.

description: Amazing food and service. Romantic, intimate setting. Rich, savory cuisine. Slightly salty but it is French food after all.  will definitely go back!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
My best friend from college celebrated her birthday a day early this month. She decided on trying out this restaurant because of their pre-fixed menu. BEST CHOICE EVER!

LOCATION: If you are tired of circling around the blocks in the Marina for a free parking spot, there is a garage just a block over from this restaurant. I paid around $8 for about 2.5 hours.

MOOD: We were seated in the nicely decorated alley of sorts towards the back of the restaurant. There was holiday decor all around so it set a great mood for the dinner.

MENU: The group (approximately 11 people) decided to order from the Pre-Fixed Sunday menu. I ordered the salmon carpaccio, truffle risotto, and the almond gelato. The entire meal was delicious! This was the best meal I've had in quite a while. Everyone around the table thoroughly enjoyed their meals as well. 

SERVICE: We were served by a charismatic, funny, and happy Asian gentleman who explained the menu and the meals with such great detail and character. He definitely made the experience greater than 5 stars.
 
PRICE: The pre-fixed Sunday menu was an amazing deal! Roughly around $30, but I paid slightly more due to gratuity and for helping pay my best friend's meal. All in all, I felt the price that I paid for the dinner was such a great deal, especially given the high quality food and service we received. 

RECOMMEND TO A FRIEND: 100% yes! I want to bring my family here!
author: Kristine L.

description:
Location: residential part of Marina, which mean it's hard to find metered parking. 

Ambiance: super bustling and is a good place for a date night or for a celebration dinner. There are two parts to the restaurant: regular tables and a back patio which was decorated nicely.

Service: our waiter was friendly and attentive. I like how he explained the history of the restaurant and the uniqueness of each plate. He was a little too quick to charge us for bringing our own birthday cake - we didn't eat it because we were full from the dinner but he charged us anyway. He fixed the bill once he realized we weren't eating our cake. 

Food: there is a three course menu offered Mondays through Thursday, I believe. You choose one appetizer, one entree and one dessert. The appetizers were on the smallish side but very tasty and nicely plated. The salmon and calamari appetizers were the best. The steak entree was phenomenal, especially the zucchini and cucumbers. Almond gelato was the highlight of the meal - super flavorful! Highly recommend.

Tip: the cocktails are yummy!
author: Ruby K.

description: Came for Restaurant week. It was packed! Excellent menu. The food was extremely filling and every dish was delicious. The timing of each dish was impeccable. We didn't wait I between dishes .
author: crystle w.

description: This place is amazing. Went there for New Year's Eve and was blown away with the variety of the menu, the quality of the food and the level service. Highly recommend it!
author: Simon W.

description: I would have loved this place because the food was honestly really tasty (highlights were the mussels and truffle spaghetti), but the service was just so bad. We ordered from a four course menu during restaurant week, and at each course, our food all came out at different times (there were only 3 of us). Two of our entrees were served a solid 10 minutes before the third came out. Our waiter noticed it hadn't arrived and said he would check on it and then never came back. There was also a 20+ minute gap between finishing our entrees and dessert being served. All in all, our meal took a full three hours. Not because we were moving at a slow pace and enjoying ourselves. Because we were waiting. Constantly. All in all, I would really hesitate to go back, but I would really not hesitate to order that truffle spaghetti to go.
author: Gianna M.

description:
My friends and I happened to be in SF during Dine About Town and am so, SO glad we chose to come to Isa.  I cannot stress how amazing it was and how friendly our server was.  To top it all off, instead of 3 courses, we got 4 (and the portions were very generous)!  It also had a lovely ambience.

Our server (I really wish I remembered his name) was extremely helpful with giving us a rundown of the wine list, as well as the menu.  Unlike other restaurants, the options were plentiful for each of the 4 courses.  For wine, we ended up getting a bottle of Cederberg which was delicious.  As for the food, I ended up taking the restaurant up on the $1 oyster special.  Because there were 5 of us, there wasn't too much overlap in our orders so was able to try a lot of the different dishes out.  My favorites have to be the yellowfin tuna and the salmon carpaccio.  The seared scallops were very yummy as well.  By the time the short ribs were served, I was so stuffed but I couldn't stop eating.  The meat was so tender that it fell right off the bones.

I'm pretty sure I still dream about this meal and wish that it were closer.  But definitely will be a must-stop spot if I ever find myself back in SF!
author: Michele Q.

description: Went in a group of 4 for dinner. Every single dish ordered was fabulous! We ordered the calamari, crab salad, tuna tartare, fois gras, lamb chops, risotto and sea bass. Literally every single dish was amazing. Ambience was great. Service was great. The wines and dessert went perfectly with the meal. Just go!!
author: Kiara S.

description:
A very normal, regular restaurant. Not very French, feels more Asian fusion, extremely marginal. Yellow Tuna was like sushi with no rice, Lamb chop was stir fry veggies with lamb. All cooked and seasoned normally like you would at home. 

The service though...like a Vietnamese restaurant. The older Asian server is very talkative like a friendly Asian owner. The hostess is like the unhappy daughter that was forced to work here on a Sunday. The Mexican server just throw everything on the table as soon as he could like a recently promoted busboy. Overall slow and inattentive, we almost had to walk out to the cashier to pay the bill just like in Vietnamese restaurant. Place is half empty.
author: SP Y.

description:
New Year's Eve Dinner at Isa!  Boy, were the waiters overwhelmed - hustling and bustling between the kitchen and waiting on the tables!  It was as if they wanted you in and quickly out, so they can accommodate the busy New Year's Eve dining peak time.

There was a special 4 course meal dinner for New Year's Eve.  Ideally, it is a 3 course dining affair.  There were choices on soup/salad, starters, main and desserts.  You get to pick one from each category per person.

The presentation of each dish, needs improvement.  It looked like it was just poured or slapped onto the platter, without much careful attention to the finishing or garnishing.

What we ordered up:

Maine Lobster Broth - the taste of the lobster was there and it was frothy.

Potato and Leek Soup - I preferred this one over the lobster.  The leek contributed to a nice soup flavor that you just can't quite find anywhere else.

Steamed Mussels - Cooked in white wine and garlic, their mussels were not only delicious, but also very fresh and full.  I have never eaten mussels that were still very full, within its own shell!  Loved this dish.

Sautéed Wild Prawns - I liked the garlic and lemon sauce.  The prawns were cooked on point.  The presentation was lacking and this starter lacked a bit of spazz to make it above the norm.

Grilled Scallop and Brussels Sprouts - Another well made dish, but lacked decoration!  The scallops were grilled to perfection and brussel sprouts were cooked with a rich brown color!

Braised Shortribs with Broccolini - Nice and tender Shortribs with well steamed Broccolini!  Presentation again, however, was lacking.

Creme Brûlée was a complimenting dessert for the meal. Their Truffled Cheese, was too strong to be taken lightly as a dessert.

I do like the semi-outdoor patio in the back.  It was nice to enjoy.  Overall, a deserving place to wine and dine at.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Isa is cozy restaurant with great service and pretty good food. My family and I had each got a 4 course prix fix for $40... (Thank you restaurant week!!!) 
   Course 1: Potato and Leek Soup
Loved the creaminess, and the truffle taste. The only let down was the 5 tiny pieces of bacon in the soup. :-( 4/5
   Course 2: Yellowfin Tuna Tartare 
It's great to look at, but not to eat... The sauce made everything on the dish very, very salty. I'll just say that I reached for my water multiple times. 3.5/5
   Course 3: Angus Flat Iron Steak
The steak was perfectly rare and tender, but it did not have any flavor. All of the flavor came from the red wine sauce, or the mustard sauce on top. The potatoes and zucchini were delicious! 4/5
    Course 4: Grapefruit Granite
Yum, yum, yum! I loved the grapefruit flavor, but I did not like the bitter aftertaste. I know that grapefruits are naturally bitter, but it's just my opinion... Eating the granite with the mint garnish takes away a little bit of the bitterness. 4.5/5
   Thank you Isa, for a lovely night!
author: Lauren L.

description:
I tried Isa during SF restaurant week and let me tell you, it completely blew me away. For $40, you get a 4 course meal while most other restaurants only offered a measly 3 course meal. I've also returned on a Sunday which they have 3 course meals for $30 (Sunday-Thursday) which is  a great deal and opportunity to try different dishes. There is also happy hour until 7pm every day of the week (wine glasses and soju cocktails for $5).

I really enjoyed the arugula salad, salmon carpaccio and the chenel goat cheese. You must try the goat cheese! Feel free to ask for extra bread to dip into the cheese and tomato concasse. It's so good!

As for the entrees, I've tried the truffle risotto, seared scallops, seasonal fish and flat iron steak. The truffle risotto is very rich, decadent and delicious. It is perfect for the vegetarians out there. The scallops are so perfectly buttered, well portioned and seared to perfection.  The steak was perfectly pink and served with a blue cheese topping. I thought it was a unique combination and should only be ordered if you like the taste of blue cheese. 

The service here is impeccable. They really go out of their way to make you feel at home and make great recommendations. The restaurant has a bar, indoor seating and a very well decorated covered patio. This spot is perfect for a classy night out on the town. One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco!
author: Hanhie D.

description: Really good food at a reasonable price for French fare. I'd go again if my cholesterol count would allow it!
author: Richard S.

description:
4.5 stars. 

I have this love for ISA that you just don't know about. There are days when I am sad cause I just blew nearly $100 on a meal here or I am happy because I just spent $100 on a meal here and loved every bite! One of my favorite things at Isa is the lobster broth. Simple, warm, yet so addicting. It comes with pieces of shrimp and tons of lobster flavor. No, there is no actual lobster meat in the soup but if there was, I think it would be incredible! Other highlights include the mussels which are so addicting that I would ask for extra bread to soak up the garlic-butter-wine sauce that accompanies it. Truffle spaghetti, seared duck breast are just some of my other favorites.

The truffle spaghetti is so simple but knocks it out of the ballpark with the intense truffle flavor. I wish the spaghetti came with some kind of meat but that's fine. Carb heaven I tell yah! Staff is extremely nice and they will take care of you, trust me. Be prepared to feel relaxed at the restaurant and enjoy the cozy vibe. If you do decide to go check it out, get the pre fix menu available on Sundays-Thursdays which is about $29 for a 3-course meal. What a bargain!
author: Danster L.

description: This restaurant has such a cool atmosphere! I love feeling like I'm outside while sitting inside. My favorite entrée is the Range Chicken. It's so tender, and the sauce is delicious. I also love the Mushroom risotto.
author: Larissa S.

description:
Came here for the boy's birthday celebration but since it's proximity to Valentine's Day, why not just kill two birds with one stone? The restaurant is very warm and inviting. The interior has a very rustic feel to it. A special highlight of this restaurant is their outdoor patio seating behind the half-opened kitchen. The patio seating is more like a large cabana tent held up by wooden beams that are lined with flowers, vines and small dangling white lights. We made reservations for 8:30pm but I realized I forgot to request their outdoor seating so I asked and was accommodated right away. 

Service: Our server looked like an ex-con and to be honest, I was a bit intimidated until he opened his mouth and he was just the sweetest, most hilarious man serving me cocktails that night. Our food took awhile to get to us and since we were very hungry, we took two rounds of breadbasket. Those who keep up with my reviews know that carbs are my mortal enemy.

Food: I got the duck-- cooked to a medium pink, meat was very tender and juicy with crispy skin; the portion was a little small but expected. As an avid instagrammer, this dish is very picture worthy. I love the colors complementing each other. The boy got the veal-- it was tender and juicy but the meat itself tasted a little bland. You know how sometimes you expect a standard taste to a dish...well I expected the dish to be a cut of veal but it turned out to be something very similar to a Chinese stir-fry. The sauce was overpowering flavorful, strong truffle and garlic notes, and I felt like I was eating the sauce...couldn't really taste the veal. I think the lamb and the foie gras would be better alternatives, next time! 

Impression: I loved how the patio temperature resembled a nice warm summer night.  It has a countryside France feel to it. However, I was a little disappointed by the food. The wait time for our food took an extremely long time, maybe I was hungry but it took well over thirty minutes. Our food also arrived at two separate times, which made dining together slightly inconvenient and uncomfortable with more waiting involved. I would recommend this restaurant for friends and couples that have not yet tried this place. I wouldn't recommend this place as a first date as it can be very noisey and at times it can even be hard to hear across the table. 



(12)
author: Nadeen H.

description: AMAZING SERVICE!!!  Seriously I cannot say enough about it! I came here with a difficult group (various food allergies) and they were so accommodating nonetheless!! In addition, the food was to die for! I had the scallops and a lobster broth for a starter and it was all truly top notch! I will be coming back!!
author: Catalina M.

description: HH everyday before 7pm! Came for drinks while strolling through the Marina
author: Christina T.

description:
I just came to Isa this past Sunday for SF Restaurant Week and I am so glad that I picked this restaurant. 

First of all the staff there is so nice and friendly, especially the manager, he was very attentive and made really good suggestions throughout our meal. 

They have outdoor back seating that is very covered and they also have heat lamps and it just feels very cozy. 

Our dishes:

Potato Leek Soup: mmmm I like soup in general but this was a liiiitle bland. but still tasty

Salmon Carpaccio: It was good and I love Salmon. 

Mussels: DELICIOUSSS and it actually comes with a lot, I usually don't like shell fish so you know this is a must-get

Goat cheese with fennel and tomato: This was also really good but I know goat cheese is either you love it or you don't. So I love it! 

Foie gras: IT'S LEGAL It comes with this toast and fruit jelly sauce-y 
We also paired this with a really sweet white wine that the manager reccommended. It was pretty good but suuuuper sweet. 

Truffle risotto: YES they use truffle oil here. After my truffle experience at La Folie I have decided I do not like to eat truffles not in tiny pieces or oil form. I really like risotto and all things cheesy and creamy so I really enjoyed this dish even the mushrooms. I actually finished everything. 

Duck Breast: It looked pretty good and had generous portions

Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee: It was made with real vanilla bean so I was super excited to eat it, but it seems like it all went to the bottom, but no worries I scooped every last bit.

Wine: 2010 Toulouse Winery Pinot Noir, Anderson Valley, CA
Recommended by manager $70ish for the bottle
It was really good and paired really well with each dish. I would totally buy this for girls wine  night. ... or for myself.... I'm not an alcoholic I swear!

I would totally come back. Thanks Isa Restaurant for a truly enjoyable night.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Have heard great things about this place from friends who live in the city, and jumped at the chance to eat a 4 course meal during Dine About Town a few weeks ago.

Luckily there was plenty of street parking nearby. The restaurant seems so tiny when you walk in, until you are guided to the back past the kitchens to a fairly large patio area. 

Our server, Jonathan, was a pleasure from beginning to end. He was an absolute delight, and made our experience that much better. He told us that this is a family sharing type of restaurant, so my friend and I opted for different choices so we could share. The food also comes out as it is ready, not in any particular order. We also made it in time for their happy hour drinks, so we had 2 glasses each of a sparkling wine from Spain. Very good and only $5 or $7 a pop!

We munched on some of their yummy bread, and our dungeness crab salad and our yellowfin tuna appetizer came out next. Lots of crab on the salad, and it was pretty good, but wish it had more flavor to the dressing. The fruits were a nice touch. The tuna app was pretty standard, and loved the avocado that went with it. Then our Maine lobster broth came out. This was by far a standout. Perfectly cooked with a huge tiger prawn. Very light but super flavorful. Then came our dozen Tomales Bays Pt. Reyes oysters. Yum! I could've eaten these all day, and they were only $1 an oyster! Such a steal!

For the entrees, I decided on the truffle mushroom risotto my friends had raved about. My friend with with the pan roasted rocky jr. chicken. Hers came out first, and I'm not a huge chicken person, but my goodness. This chicken was perfectly cooked, so juicy and tender, and they put the seasoning of herbs under the skin. WOW. So much flavor, and with the fluffy mashed potatoes and string beans, I was in heaven! The risotto came out next, and it was pretty darn amazing. A little on the heavy side, but enjoyed as much as I could since I was so full after the oysters! I would say the chicken was the winner to me since I was not expecting to have that wow factor from it.

Lastly, our desserts came out, and the only one that sounded appetizing to us was the semifreddo all amaretto, after Jonathan described it. It was almost like an almond cookie ice cream, not super cold, and had more of a substance of almond cookie mash. It was really good, and the manager brought me a glass of port for my bday. 

All in all, a great experience. Would definitley recommend this place to others, and they do a 3 course prix-fixe menu Sunday - Thursday for a really reasonable price. The service here is extraordinary, bussers and waiters constantly hustling to keep your table free of any mess.
author: Denise L.

description:
I came here for my cousin's birthday. I contacted the restaurant via yelp to organize a surprise dinner and I got a response in less than 15 minutes...AMAZE! The owner Sameera, was the loveliest most pleasant person to work with. She is soft spoken and super accommodating. We went with the 5 course sample for our party of 15. I was the only vegetarian in the group and even though the Truffle Risotto is a vegetarian dish, I ended up getting my own specialized meal (some BOMB quinoa, mushrooms thing). The menu was personalized with my cousin's name on it. The price was decent. I was here 5 years ago and I enjoyed the meal but wasn't too impressed by the service. This time around, the service was impeccable and we sat in the back tented room which was well heated. The birthday girl got a special drink and a personalized dessert. All my friends in attendance enjoyed their meals and the ambiance. I posted my pictures all on IG and foodietrip.com 
5 stars all around but here is what stood out the most;
Quick response from the owner
Polite and prompt service at the restaurant
Different pre-fixed menus for parties
Delicious risotto and the other veggie dish I had
Well heated out-back seating
author: leba g.

description:
I've been here several times with family and friends, and I've always enjoyed the food and atmosphere each time. The food always tastes great, and the staff is very accommodating.

During each of my visit, I've sat in the back patio due to the party size, and I think it's preferable, esp if you have younger kids with you. The tented tops tolerates a little more noise and has slightly more space than inside.

The tables and seats are usually very close together, so don't be surprised if you're bumping into the seats behind you. People don't seem to mind though.

The prices are a little high as the portions tend to be a bit smaller (somewhere between an entree and a tapas style appetizer). We usually spend about $35-40/person here, including a glass of their $5 happy hour wine.

Overall, I'd say this is a reliable night out restaurant where you're guaranteed good food and descent service, at an ok price.
author: Melody C.

description:
Dine SF 2015- 4.5 stars! 
$40 4 course dinner option at Isa! Not 3, but 4 delicious courses!!!! 
TO START
Potato Leek Soup- truffle oil, potatoes, a little watery, but still good 
Endive Salad with beets- light, beet love, etc. 

APPETIZER
Salmon Carpaccio- thinly sliced salmon on toast 
Yellowfin Tuna Tartare- a little spicy, but reminded me of home (Hawaii), served on a layer of avocado. YUMMM
Goat Cheese with pesto- this hit the spot. Creamy goat cheese, with pine nuts, balsamic tomatoes, and pesto. Spread it on the bread and you're in heaven. 

MAIN COURSE
Scallops with brussel sprouts, bacon, mashed potatoes- my FAVVVVorite dish. Everything on it was on point. I'm in love. 
Duck- it was a little too rare for me. I would have preferred it more on the medium side, but the huckleberry sauce went nice and it was very tender. 
Mushroom risotto- lots of mushrooms, nice and creamy like how risotto should be!! 

DESSERT
Semifreddo with ice cream- gingersnap cookies with an almond/cookie ice cream
Creme brulee- your standard creme brulee, nothing out of the ordinary

Soju cocktails- $9. The Moscow Mule was delicious! 

The service was alright, and the dishes were timed just right. However, we did have to wait a bit before we were seated even though we had a reservation, which was a little annoying. I also would have preferred to sit outside in the back so if you can request it, try um. Overall, this is a solid restaurant and I wouldn't mind returning, especially for the happy hour. $5 soju cocktails and glasses of wine before 7pm!!!
author: Sara S.

description:
Stopped by here for an easy dinner, was blown away by basically everything. 

Fresh bread aw yiss. Crunchy and warm. 
Yellowfin tuna and avocado - I don't even like raw fish and I loved this. 
Potato wrapped sea bass - crispy delicious exterior. 
Seasonal fish (halibut) - Golden on top, flaky throughout. great veggies. 
Truffle risotto (oh my god) - that kind of quality that can't really be described, it's just REALLY GOOD. 
Salmon - didn't have this, but heard it was good too. 
Amaretto ice cream - amazing!!
Grapefruit granite - (shaved ice basically) minty and refreshing. 

In short, make a reservation because it's really cozy and small in here (save for the big back patio). Service is super friendly and FAST. And the bathroom has a fragrant oil burner so it smells even better than the rest of the place.

Loved thoroughly, will come back and sit in the window nook sometime!
author: Connie L.

description: We happened upon this place and came in just for happy hour and decided to stay for dinner. Everything was delicious - the salmon carpaccio, yellowtail and their risotto was amazing. On top of that their cocktails were great and I had one of the best martini's there. Definitely a place I would return to.
author: Leilani R.

description:
Came to Isa today thanks to dine about town.  It's located in the Marina near Chestnut, a very lively part of the city and it fits there perfectly.  As you enter inside, there's a cool jazzy vibe and as you go further in past the kitchen in the center, there's an open space that's perfectly lit and with excellent air circulation with just the right amount of social ambience without being too loud.

For the dine about town, Isa offered up 4 courses: 1) a soup; 2) an appetizer/salad; 3) a main course; 4) dessert.

1) All three of us had the lobster broth.  It was excellent!  5 STARS.  I wasn't too buttery and had very good flavors.

2) For the appetizer, we ordered a) yellowfin tuna tartar with seaweed salad (4 stars), b) salmon carpaccio (4.5 stars), and c) baked laura chenel goat cheese(5 stars).

c) was the best to me; then b), then a) .  All were very good the but goat cheese was out of this world awesome

3) For the main course we ordered a) Spaghetti (with Himilayan truffle) (5 stars); b) Seasonal Fish (4.5 stars); and c) Maple Leaf Farm duck breast (5 stars)

c) was the best to me,  then a) then b).  

For dessert we tried  a) grapefruit sorbet (4.5 stars)  and crushed ice dish; b) an amaretto gelato combined with a dough and 4 cookies (3.75 stars); c) creme brulee (vanilla) (4 stars)

They were all good.

All in all, we had a good time.  I had one issue, we loved the food, but the staff were too eager to take away our plates prior to us finishing our dish and also rushed us which we didn't appreciate.  Rush service ruins one's appetite and good digestion Chi.

Other than that, the service was good and would definitely come here again.

The chef at this place has game.  A strong recommendation.
author: Tony U.

description: This place is not French and is very overpriced! We ordered the mussels amongst 4 other dishes and they were not fresh. Beware! The waiter did not listen to our questions or requests and tried to upsell us when we ordered more than enough food for three people. The place was empty on a Wednesday night and even saw a table sit down, look at the menu and walk out the door.
author: Kim H.

description: Great ambience. Good wine. Delicious food. I was reminded of my travels through Europe. Such a quaint place with the right amount of crowd and wonderful service. The owners kept checking on us and even though the waitress accidentally poured the wine down the boy's Ted Baker, the owner promptly came over to apologise and pick up the shirt for dry cleaning. We had no expectations because hey, accidents haopen, but we were pleasantly surprised. The calamari is a must have, super tender. The lamb was delicious and the steak while it had a good cook was a bit under seasoned. The food for the price was quite good. Will be back.
author: Trisha H.

description:
I can't believe I didn't write a review for this place.  It is wonderful.  Valentines Day 2/15/13 (went on a Friday instead). 

I know I'm writing this 9 months later, but what I remember is this: SCALLOPS were AMAZING, they were the best scallops I've ever had until I went to Le Bernardin 2 months ago, and this dish also came with bacon mashed potatoes that was phenomenal as well.  5/5!!

Scallops - 5/5
Crab Salad - 4/5
Mussels - 4/5 

ATMOSPHERE: Similar to many fine dining in SF.  Nice, but loud and cramped.  It's what you get for being in the city. 

OVERALL: I really liked it.  Service was good, food was great, overall nice dining experience.  I definitely recommend!
author: Raquel Y.

description: NEVER AGAIN. We used to come here frequently but the service and quality has consistently gotten worse and worse. Tonight's "meal" if you will, was our final straw. We sat at our table for an hour and 37 minutes without anything but a glass of wine and a butter lettuce salad. When we asked our server what was going on he kept shrugging things off saying the kitchen was backed up. We then approached the hostess/ manager who offered us a dessert for our inconvenience. Really? A free crappy dessert after nearly 2 hours without our entrées or even offered a second round of drinks? No thanks. Keep it. There is an abundance of great restaurants in SF - this place will not see another penny from us.
author: Morgan L.

description:
Dine about town! 

Stars: 4.5

I came here on a Thursday night. I made reservations 2 hours before. We decided to eat here around 6:30pm on Thursday, and I used open table to make an 8pm reservation the same day. We arrived there around 7:40pm, and although we were early for our reservation, they were able to seat us quickly!

So I ordered the lobster bisque, mussels, seared scallops and creme brulee. My friend ordered the lobster bisque, crab salad, short ribs (not printed on the menu but it is included in the dine about town menu), and some ice cream dessert I don't recall. 

They served us bread prior to the meal. I like bread chewier than crunchier. The inside was chewy but the outside was crispy. The bread is good to save for the lobster bisque or mussels. 

I really like the lobster bisque. The lobster flavor was distinct, and very flavorful. It was a strong, delicious aroma. They had two pieces of shrimp in there as well.

I like the crab salad as well except there were random bites of bitter taste. I think it's from the herb, so don't eat that. Other than that, I like it a lot. 

I like the mussels. I felt like it was a large portion for a 2nd course, I was satisfied with it. I used the tomatoes, onions and juices on the bottom to dip my bread in there. Yum!

As for the seared scallops and short ribs, I like the short ribs a little bit more than the scallops because it was so tender and juicy. The scallops are really good as well! Both of the mashed potatoes served on the plate tasted similarly to me, it wasn't too buttery or too garlicky, although I do like them super garlicky and buttery. So none of the flavors on the plate were too overpowering.

They did take awhile to bring out out our dessert. So I was a little annoyed with that. When the dessert came out, I tried my creme brulee. The top of it was slightly bitter, and I wasn't fond of that bitterness. I wasn't a big fan of the ice cream dessert, it had a distinct flowery taste and the cookies were okay. 

Overall, I think the wait staff was really great and nice. I really like the ambiance of the restaurant. It's dim but not too dim, it feels really bright but not too bright to feel casual. This is a great place to go for Dine about Town - it's really a 4 course meal for $40!!! I am not sure if I'll come back during regular hours but we'll see about that.
author: Margaret L.

description:
Came here to celebrate my sister and her son B-day I was kind of disappointed after the meal.
For a French cuisine this was not taste anywhere close to french maybe more close to italian.
some how both my sisters like it. but for me I will not go back again.1st thing that got to me was no free refill on my lemonade. u got to have free refill on that. besides is straight out of a can.but not a big deal. 2nd was the sitting is a little too tight come on a fat ass like me needs a lot of room to enjoy his diner we r talking about a french cuisine. As a kid we only would be able to taste french cuisine only in a movie but now I have been to a couple of french cuisine totally different story. is like any body can eat at these cuisine.what is the world coming to. I think french cuisine has got cheaper. and I dont mean price wise. is just Is like u got money u can eat there so there is no seperation from classes. back then I would not dream of eating french like todays because once u go in expect to spend easily couple of hundreds and not to mention is so delicate that most of us asian won't even fill up the stomach with the potion size. but look at today u can basically see alll kinds of people class eat here. loud mouth, cheap ass, don't even know what their eating. is just that french cuisine and japanese cuisine has got cheaper in their class.

1. foie gras not taste the way I think it should taste.
2. Arugula salad the Arugula was ok but the dressing a little too italian
3. Dungeness crab salad really not my taste it feels like a chinese lettuce wrap but with crab        instead of pork.
4. Organic Loch Duart salmon Carppico the salmon might be the worst i ever taste really not fresh taste just like costco packed salmon.
5, Tomales bay PT. Reyes oyster well I had Tomales bay oyster b4 but it does'nt taste anywhere near. it just taste like the cheap japanese restaurant oyster that U buy 1 for 10...
6.  Seared Scallop  at this point I just had enough of their seafood so I did'nt even bother to try
7. Seasonal Fish for my Dad he seems to like it. 
8. Roasted rack of Lamb well my brother in-law liked it 
9. Pan roasted rocky jr range chicken  one of my sister liked it as she can only eat chicken.
10. Grill Golden gate natural angus flat Iron steak three of us had it including me both me and my 2nd sister order rear i mean basically we both wanted to see blood on the steak well i dont know how hers was but mine came out medium pretty much closer to cooked than rare. Can people actually follow direction if u decide cookinf the steak to medium instead of rare than it would be u that is sitting and me thats working.still to today no one can follow direction like if I want to see blood u better make sure u know how to do it or just throw the piece of raw steak on the dish and serve it that way.they say is angus but I really don't think so. oh well

I kind of notice why because as I was going to the restroom because of the seafood if u know what I mean I saw a bunch of Mexican cooking inside the kitchen. for a minute there I though I was at a taqueria eating a burrito I am not discriminating but where is the french chef.The last french cuisine I went to it had mexican workers but not cooking the dishes.
author: Tommy M.

description:
Great service, friendly staff, delicious food, good sized portions. Nice selection of wines. Happy hour from 5:30-7PM.

Our party of eleven came for my brother's post wedding ceremony dinner. They sat us in the back  covered outdoor area on the raised deck and we had plenty of space. Heat lamps available. No one was trying to squeeze by us or anything. There was another large party below and we couldn't  hear them.

Our waiter was really friendly and explained everyone has worked there for years--he himself is a newbie of 8+ years at Isa. Other wait staff brought water and bread refills without us asking.

They have a nice prix fixe that is made up of dishes from the regular menu, same portion size. 

We had a lot of food and it was all yummy!
Starters:
Butter lettuce salad
Arugula salad
Crab salad
Mussels in broth
Truffle risotto--one of my favorites

Entrees:
Lamb--cooked just right 
Chicken--crispy skin almost like fried
Flat iron steak
Sea bass--one of their star dishes
Scallops--so tasty

Dessert:
Almond gelato

If I lived in the area, I would be a regular!
author: Kat H.

description:
We had a great time at ISA. The ambiance is just perfect for a week night date - I can see the place get crowded and too noisy on the weekends.

However the food was great, we've tried 8 different dishes between four of us. Everything was well prepared and tasty. 
Also, pricing is reasonsble for the quality you get.
author: Péter B.

description:
Came here on a Monday night - my friend had been here before for Dine About Town.  It was quiet when I got there and only a birthday party and one other table. I wanted to sit on the patio, but wished I sat inside since the heat lamps aren't warm enough for SF weather haha. We chose the prix fixe menu, in which case I got the capers and salmon appetizer, the steak, and the grapefruit slush for dessert. The salmon appetizer was whatevers...it was just raw salmon and capers. It lacked salt and flavor, although the salmon was very fresh. I think if you are going to serve plain salmon, might as well make it smoked salmon instead...

THe steak was VERY juicy and delicious. I really enjoyed the french green beans on the side. The grapefruit slush for dessert was really whatevers for me...would have liked gelato bettter. Had my friends cake thing and that was really good. 

We also had a bottle of wine and it was very good!
author: Annie K.

description:
We came with a party of 10 with reservations on Friday, and service and food were on point.

Ordered: Fairly big portions
1) Hudson Valley Grade A Foie gras: 4/5 delicious!!! They were very generous with the Foie Gras

2) Saffron Paella: 3/5 Wow, lot of seafood and very generous portion; however a very carby meal if this is your only dish; And a bit bland. I would skip this dish. 

3) Truffle risotto: 4/5 Delicious!

4) Seared scallops: 4/5 Cooked to perfection. The scallops were fresh.
author: Jen H.

description:
My Fiance and I came here to treat my BFF to her birthday dinner.

At the time they had a special where there was a set menu and you basically pay the set price for 1, soup, 1 appetizer, 1 entree, & 1 dessert you could choose from the list of what you'd like to try.

It worked out well because we all decided to try different things and we were able to try a lot of different dishes.

We made reservations and the place was very busy.  We actually arrived about 30 minutes early, we figured we'd try to get in or just wait for our set time.  They were very nice and accommodating.  They sat us about 5 minutes later, which was very kind of them.  We ended up getting seating in the "outdoor" patio that was covered.

This is the list of appetizers we had:
Smooth Corn Soup- Yummy, not too "corny" and it was delicious.
Maine Lobster Broth Soup- Very flavorful and my honey devoured it.
Steamed Prince Edward Island Mussels-  Very good!  The broth that they were cooked in was very good.  I wish there was more!
Organic Loch Duart Salmon Carpaccio-  Very good, simple and filling.  I always love smoked salmon
Dungeness Crab Salad-  The crab was very good and fresh, the salad itself is ok.  It's not something i'd order again.  I'd rather just get crab and eat it!

Entrees:
Seared Scallops-  Please, order this.. you will not be disappointed! This is probably the best scallops I've ever had.  They were moist, rich and flavorful!
Grilled Halibut-  This was the special fish, My BFF ordered it and she really enjoyed it.
Truffle Risotto- You had appetizers?  Don't order this.. even though it's SOO GOOD!  It's just so heavy and filling expect to take some home.

All our dishes were amazing.  From start to dessert finish.  Come here, you wont be disappointed.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Had reservations at 730 for a party of 4. arrived a little late but had no problem getting seated. Domingo was out waiter and was really nice and courteous. Recommended two do the prix fixe and two get a LA carte because they're big portions. I got the Prix fixe with the calamari, flat iron steak, and grapefruit dessert. All of the food was good but they did not ask how I wanted the steak cooked and Domingo told me the dessert I picked was more of a sorbet, but it was like grapefruit flavored shaved ice.
author: Anna D.

description:
Fine dining with a smile and a secret heated garden out back which was full of Christmas lights.

They managed to accommodate my party of four, last minute, and I'm so glad they did.

Our waiter was the happiest man ever, telling us all about the specials, and that it was his eighth year working here. Now that's a good sign.

It's fine dining fishy Italian, and the plates are small-ish so sharing is suggested. My friends loved the sea bass and oysters, and we sneakily ordered the cheese plate (from the dessert menu) as an entree.

I had the leek and potato soup, warm, filling, and tangy, and the free bread was hot and crusty.

They have a large wine menu which was fun to try, and if you have space, the vanilla bean gelato is great.

Lovely atmosphere, spacious, and enjoyed taking our time over dinner.
author: Zara S.

description:
Wow, Isa..highly recommended! 

I came into the restaurant for the first time last Tuesday for a birthday and we got to take advantage of the SF Dine About Town menu. With a group of five, we each got a taste of Isa's signature dishes. The courses were served family style as they were prepared..each one tastier than the last.

Isa is great for dates or dinners with a small group. I appreciated the fact that the kitchen is open for you to see as you walk to the back seating area. The layout was nice with tables in the front of the restaurant, and in the back covered patio. Since the meal is 
served family style, the table does tend to get cramped, but the waiters are very attentive and clear the dishes as soon as they can. 

The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful, providing recommendations for each course, including their drink menu. At the conclusion of our meal, the celebrant was given a complimentary birthday gelato and small glass of champagne. We were also invited to join Isa's exclusive events ;) Our group had the pleasure of being served by the owner of Isa herself. Thank you for a great SF dining experience, I will definitely be returning!

One con I will note, was the parking situation. Even on a Tuesday night, it took us about 15 minutes to find a spot on Lombard. Regardless, Isa is now on the top of my list of restaurants in SF.
author: Camille B.

description: One of my absolute favorites in the city! This time we tried the 4 course prefix menu for sf restaurant week: yellowfin tuna with spicy sriracha, seared scallops with brussels sprouts, steamed mussels, truffles risotto, vanilla bean creme brûlée and semiffredo all'amaretto. Everything was delicious and we were even able to squeeze in an order for 4 happy hour drinks before 7 o'clock for $5 each. Amazing!
author: Anji S.

description:
Incredible food. The kind that puts you in a zen-like state while you're eating it. My three friends and I all agreed after leaving that we couldn't remember the last time we had a dinner that good. 

The wine was great too and the prices are fair. The only problem is that all I want to eat now for the rest of my life is Isa's foie gras.
author: Sam K.

description:
Thank you Isa for making our special dinner for 50, wonderful and delicious. We reserved your beautiful private back room patio. Communication throughout the planning with Sameera was timely and helpful. We decided on a menu of passed appetizers, during the cocktail hour which were delicious.
The food was served family style, 5 tables of 10 people. Starters were Dungeness Crab salad with avocado, apples, grapefruit & tarragon, baked Laura Chenel goat cheese with basil pesto, tomato concassee & pinenuts and Simply sauteed sea of cortez wild prawns with parsley, garlic, lemon & lobster butter sauce. Shared entrees were Seared scallops with bacon, brussel sprouts, mashed potatoes & truffle sauce, Truffled risotto with baby shiitake, hon shimiji mushrooms & reggiano and Grilled Golden Gate natural Angus Flat iron Steak with roasted potatoes, zucchini, tarragon butter & red wine sauce. For dessert it was a choice of vanilla bean creme brulee or semifreddo all amaretto. The food was delicious and plentiful. Service was excellent. Water and wine glasses were constantly filled, bread baskets were always full and the waiters were efficient and polite. One guest had a peanut allergy so Sameera made sure she she received nut free food. 
 The prices of the food was reasonable, the food delicious and the atmosphere beautiful. I highly recommend this restaurant for it's private room and excellent food.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Finally got to come to Isa yesterday with a couple of friends after talking about coming here for the past few years.  Well worth the wait as the meal and entire dining experience was top notch. Isa is nestled in the heart of the Marina district, juxtaposed between other cute eateries, wineries, and boutique shops. Parking can be difficult here, as I had anticipated from previous Marina adventures, so my friends and I took the 45 bus from 3rd&Market (which took about 45 minutes) to get here.  

Isa's food is described as French-style cuisine which was apparent in some but not all the dishes.  I would describe their cuisine more as Asian-European fusion as many of their dishes had elements of different countries' cuisines on both continents. But overall all the dishes were delicious and well presented.  Isa's food is meant to be shared (e.g. Family style), and so my friends and I shared the dungeoness  crab salad, the baked goat cheese, grilled calamari, the yellowfin tuna, the scallops, the duck breast, the sea bass, and the wild mushroom truffle risotto.  I liked all the dishes, although my favorites were the (1) baked goat cheese which had elements of tomato and basil (almost like a caprese salad) which was totally melt-in-your-mouth watering and went well with the complimentary warm toasted bread, (2) the yellowfin tuna which was similar to Hawaiian poke and was accompanied by a wakame salad and lots of avocado, and (3) gooey, cheesy, soft truffle risotto with amazing, earthy wild mushroom & truffle flavors.  The other dishes were good too, but not as amazing as the three I just mentioned.  Although of note, the scallops were tasty but I thought the accompanied orzo tasted kind of funny (maybe because I'm not much of a fan of orzo).

My friends and I came here early, at 5:30 for dinner because we wanted to watch the fireworks in the Marina afterwards.  On weekdays, Isa offers a pretty extensive happy hour drinks menu list, which features some specialty cocktails and wines for $5 (until 7pm). Needless to say my friends and I both had 3 drinks each.  Most of the cocktails are pretty tasty, but the Negroni is pretty strong. I was hoping it would be on the sweeter side, which it ultimately was, but I could taste more alcohol than sweet/sugar. I couldn't enjoy that drink as much as I wanted.

The service here is top notch, as wait staff always come around to fill bread, water and ask if how the food is and if you want to order more drinks/food.  Very professional and attentive staff.

Overall my first experience at Isa was excellent as the food and service here were great! I'm glad I finally got to try this place out after many years of wanting to come here. Well worth the wait.  Four stars!
author: Matthew L.

description:
Went for a dinner during middle of the week.
Order: arugula salad. Veg pre fix menu and spaghetti.
Taste: 7/10 not extra ordinary but was tasteful
Arugula salad was quite good and so was risotto.
Ambience: 7/10 
Service: 7/10. Server was little nosy.
Price: 8/10 pre fix menu for $29 is quite reasonable.
Overall: 7.5/10 tab 40 per person with drinks
author: Abhijeet T.

description:
If you can, try to nap a seat out on their "patio" (it's an enclosed space with heat lamps - it's much cuter outside than inside). ALSO, get there before 7 pm for their happy hour (signature cocktails for $5 - yes, please!)

We came here for work and ordered a shit ton of food. Favorites were salmon carpaccio, fried goat cheese, ahi tuna poke, seared scallops, and truffled mushroom risotto! :D I don't eat foie gras, but everyone seemed to have loved and guzzled the foie gras down.

Service was great and very accommodating. The only caveat was that they didn't know how to make a French75, which I thought was odd since Isa is a "French"-styled resto. Nonetheless, not bad!
author: Christina C.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the city. The back patio is amazing, and the staff is always so welcoming and kind. They remember us each time we stop by, giving it a welcoming feel. 

If you have food allergies or restrictions this is a great option. They are very accommodating and have many options that fit common food restrictions (dairy free, gluten free). The wine selection is also fantastic!  

I've had nearly everything on the menu, and the standouts for me are the potato wrapped fish, duck breast, calamari, and lamb. You really can't go wrong, everything is delicious!

I always recommend this place to friends, you won't regret visiting!
author: Hayley N.

description:
When you have a large group that you need to seat at the last minute, who ya gonna call?  Isa, that's who!  They have a cavernous covered back patio with heat lamps; everyone will be comfortably seated.

Believe everything you read in the other reviews about HH (happy hour) cheap cocktails and the PF (prix fixe) menu.  And take seriously the comments about dishes coming out to your table when the kitchen decides that they're done -- people don't get served at the same time.

The food was OK.  We ordered a bottle of red wine -- the Clemence from McClean X vineyards.  It retails for around $20 and costs something like $44 at Isa.  The markup is tolerable; you're not getting ripped off at this establishment.  All in all, we felt that the price we paid (~ $40/person, including tax, tip and some alcohol) was totally fair.

The freshly baked bread (parbread) was very good and totally welcome.

There were a few strange things about the service -- for example, the cheese plates that you can choose for dessert are served with large spoons, but no knives.  No big problem, though.

One of the servers (an older guy) spoke some French.  No sign of Isa, though.

Walking in the neighborhood was a big plus for me; I sure don't come here often.  Street parking is basically a bad joke, but we happened onto a good space because some guy pulled out of a metered space just as we were trolling along.  Good luck!
author: Kenneth R.

description: What they say about this place as a hidden gem in the Marina is true. It looks very inconspicuous, and I almost missed it.However, the food is excellent, especially their Potato Wrapped Seabass. Saffron Paella are the best too.
author: Ashish J.

description: I planned a surprise dinner for my husband at this place and made early reservations and special requests (vegan and vegetarian). The restaurant staff is just amazing. They were able to provide all that I requested as they promised. The food was delicious and so was the dessert. And it's also in a very good neighborhood of San Francisco. Just loved the place and I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Puja I.

description:
A group of us visited Isa for a birthday dinner last weekend.  
We chose this place because I have Celiac disease and cannot eat Gluten.
It's nice to finally eat somewhere that uses food as it's ingredients (rather than fillers) and is simply delicious!!!!

We ordered everything!  From the Lamb to the amazing fish and shrimp.  The crab lettuce "thingys" were the BEST.  I can't wait to revisit this place.  It is very pricey so I can't say I will be frequenting Isa, maybe a trip once or twice a year will do.

One complaint I do have is:
The water!
We are currently in a drought and every little thing we do matters.  Many of us notice little things that can totally distract us from the rest of the evening.  I appreciate the attentive staff constantly refilling our water glasses.  However, our meal was practically over and we were ordering dessert yet our water glasses were being refilled.  Perhaps asking if anyone would like water or putting up some sort of sign for why you ask to refill glasses would help.  I felt obligated to drink the multiple glasses of water because I did not want it to go to waste!  The rest of my party isn't as drought conscious so they simply left full glasses of water behind.  Which I'm sure was thrown out.

Please please please change the water - refill procedure.
1. Do not leave full glasses of water out
2. Do not serve water unless guests want it
3. Be weary of refills

That was my only complaint.
author: Tricia N.

description:
tldr; 
I felt blatantly ignored and disrespected by several of the waiters at this restaurant, purely based on my race/skin color. I would highly advise anyone that dislikes a discriminating waitstaff serving them to eat elsewhere. I wouldn't eat at this haughty, arrogant establishment of you paid me.
-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-
This review is based purely on an experience I had today with the waitstaff as I attempted to pick up a food delivery (I work as a food courier). Also, I am a 20-something brown, mixed race female, to give you a fuller perspective of the situation.

As soon as I stepped into the restaurant at  ~8-9pm, I noticed the place was mostly deserted. I then proceeded to walk up to the counter to ask if the order was ready and I was ignored by both a Caucasian waiter who was moving around from the preparation area to the tables & by a worker washing glasses. I proceeded to politely wait for someone to move to the front of the counter in order to inquire about the order.

About one minute after I walked in and waited awkwardly at the counter, a Caucasian 30-something lady walked in and was IMMEDIATELY greeted by the Caucasian waiter. "Hello ma'am, what may I help you with today?" He asked. Apparently she was a courier too and he said "oh, you can have a seat at the bar while I check on your food", so she sat at the bar and I did as well since I wasn't going to continue standing awkwardly at the counter. Next, he walks around the food prep area & tells her "oh it'll be another 10 minutes for your order." He the looks dismissively at me and briefly asks "are you looking for something?" to which I answer "yes, I'm waiting for a food delivery order for _." He then tells me the same thing how he'll check on the order and goes in the back.

After a few minutes waiting near each other at the bar, an Indian server walks up to the Caucasian woman sitting next to me (on her cellphone, just as I was at the time) and asks "have you been helped already, ma'am?" The lady sitting next to me smiles and says "yes, thank you" and then the server walks away without even looking at me. 

The first waiter then comes back from the kitchen and tells me and the Indian server "your order should be ready in less than five minutes" & he gestures to me to show her that I'm waiting on the food to expedite the process. I then wait 10 minutes for the food to be prepared. Finally the food comes out & the Indian server then proceeds to pack it & leave it on the counter about two feet away from me (even though he said the order was for me) & walks away.
author: Bernice N.

description:
I had a very pleasant experience. It's a wonderful place with incredible food and great service from the beginning everything was outstanding salad, Lam desserts all of them were delicious and incredibly good.
The only place that I have tried the food like that was at very expensive cruise ship or at Ritz Carlton.
 I'm very happy and satisfied.
 I will go again.
author: Yevgeny D.

description:
Solid French food.  A friend and I came here for restaurant week, 4 courses for $40.

Starter - Potato and Leek Soup: Kind of watery and a lot less flavorful from what I expected from leek soup.

Second Course - Yellowfin Tuna: Delicious!  I loved the sauce they used on the fish and they gave us a pretty large portion.

Third Course - Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast: I don't think I've ever had duck I didn't like, but this was executed very well.  The duck was still pink, but the skin was nice and crispy.

Dessert - Semifreddo: Really nice and light way to end the meal, I'd recommend it if you're getting full from the rest of the courses.  

For what we ate, it was a pretty good deal and the atmosphere is really nice.  Another positive was our server, who seemed so excited about everything we ordered.  He was just as thrilled about my crispy-skinned duck breast as me, and he wasn't even eating it!  He also had a lot of suggestions for us, including the foie gras which, "is a small cut, but still the biggest in the city!"

Tips and Tricks
-3 courses for $30 from Sunday - Thursday 
-Happy hour drinks are only $5!
-My friend asked for her steak medium, but it came out very much medium-rare
author: Jessica L.

description:
Wow, what can I say about this place? I came to the city for a short visit and am SO happy that I decided to try this place. My boyfriend and I ordered the following dishes:

Dungeness Crab Salad - SO refreshing! The crab was fresh, the avocados buttery, and the oranges a perfect combination of sweet and tangy.
Saffron Paella - the flavors were just right. The seafood was delicious and fresh. I particularly loved the scallops, which were cooked to perfection. The only thing I would comment on would be that I wish there was more of a bite to the grains. It was a bit "mushy" for my taste.
Local Mushrooms - so good, and definitely great quality and very fresh. I loved that they're local supporting local farms as well!
Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast - by far my favorite dish. Absolutely delicious. We asked for the duck to be cooked medium instead of medium rare, and it was perfect. The huckleberry sauce was a surprising flavor, but it truly complimented the slight saltiness of the duck.

The food was amazing, but the service was just as great. The servers were very attentive, and our server in particular was very helpful. We asked for a wine recommendation, and although we had one in mind, she recommended another... which turned out to be wonderful. 

I know there are amazing restaurants throughout San Francisco, but I am definitely glad I chose to come here.
author: Laura L.

description:
I came here in January for the DineSF meal. I know they normally have a prix fix of three course, but I figured why not? The plates at Isa are meant for sharing and food will come out at different times. While that is a major eating pet peeve of mine, because the waitress was considerate enough to let us know in advance, it was absolutely fine. 

Overall, the meal was delicious and I'd come back for the scallops, risotto, and the yellowfin tuna. 

First Course: 
- Potato and Leek Soup -- this was ok. it wasn't super flavorful. it was a delicate kind of soup 

Extra: 
Grade A Foie gras, with seared apples, huckleberries & custard -- i love foie gras, but the fruit pairing was a little off. the fruits made it too sweet to go with the foie gras. 

Second Course: 
- Yellowfin tuna -- this was a tartare and it was delicious, seasoned nicely
- Salmon Carpaccio -- nothing fancy really. it was like smoked salmon on bread. wouldn't order it again
- Steamed Prince Edward island mussels -- this was good, but the mussels were teeny tiny. the flavor was ok. When it's not good enough for me to sop up my bread in the sauce, it's only ok. 

Third Course: 
- Truffle risotto -- this was really good and they gave a generous variety and amount of mushrooms. if you don't like mushrooms, don't get it. 
- Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak -- delicious, cooked perfectly.
- Seared scallops -- favorite item of the night, i would get this again. 
- Lamb tenders -- this was a weird item. it was good, but the lamb was chopped up in little bites over some veggies. I've never seen it prepared this way so it took me by surprise. 

Dessert: 
Vanilla bean crème brulé -- this wasn't my dessert, but it was really sweet 
Semifreddo all' amaretto -- loved it. i love hazelnut so I'm biased. the little cookies that accompanied it was good too. the ice cream had cookie bits in it and gave it a little crunch.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
One of the best meals I had in San Francisco. I would dock stars for our waiter, he was the worst, but I won't. I do want to say that our waiter maybe was trying to be friendly, but instead was completely inappropriate. Interrupting our conversations with his weird banter, monopolizing our time while my party of 6 was trying to catch up, we left with a horrible taste in our mouth, yet the food was so good. Server from Hawaii, chill. You pretty much ruined this dinner for our friends parents.

Onto the food. Wow. Everything we ordered was phenomenal or close to it. The grilled local calamari to start was seriously perfect. It was hard to share since this dish was extremely flavorful and light. A must. We also shared the baked goat cheese, again amazing and more than enough to go around.

The potato wrapped seabass was a pure delight and I can see why it's their signature dish, it was impressive. Exactly how it sounds, a buttery sea bass enveloped by a potato crust. I've had this dish before at a fancy restaurant in Nantucket, and Isa blew it out of the water. The truffle risotto was pillowy rich and one bite wasn't enough, I snuck two. My friend's butter fish special was the only let down of the meal. It was teeny and ultimately flavorless and I wouldn't recommend. My friend enjoyed his rack of lamb, but compared to my seabass, he was disappointed. 

We sat out back in the covered patio with heat lamps which was absolutely wonderful, although loud. I definitely recommend Isa.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Very good food and service.
Amazing how the kitchen and wait staff puts it all together.  We had two prix fixe and two ala carte dishes.  Steak, mussels, fish (sole) chicken and paella.
A welcoming place for our first night in the City.
Niles F. Placerville Ca.
author: Niles F.

description:
I went here for my birthday dinner on Sunday.

We had the 1/2 dozen oysters. It comes with spicy orange mignonette, which was really good! We also had the Yellowfin tuna - delicious. 

For the larger shared plates, we got the foie gras, potato wrapped sea bass, and the maple lead farm duck breast. Oh my god. No complaints. The duck, by far, was my favorite.

For dessert, I had the almond semifreddo and flourless chocolate cake with vanilla gelato. The semifreddo was INCREDIBLE! As a gift, they gave me a dessert wine.

Definitely stop by if you're in the area or after a walk/lounge by the Palace of Fine Arts (as it's within walking distance).
author: Amy C.

description:
Came here to celebrate with my friend for getting a new job.  Was seated right away after we walk in...and of course we had a reservation.  Our server greeted us and told us the specials, but both of us decided to go for the 3 course prix fix for $30/person.  Pretty good deal.

First courses:

Organic Loch Duart Salmon Carpaccio - Pretty yummy for a starter.  You get four pieces of crostini and 6 thin slices of salmon with all the goodies on top.  The salmon was pretty fresh.  The toppings went well with the salmon and crostini.  If there was a hint of lime, I think it would of tasted much more refresh, but nonetheless, it was still pretty delicious.

Steam Prince Edward Mussels - Yum!  The white wine sauce was so tasty that my friend even use the spoon and drank it.  The mussels tasted pretty fresh and it had the right amount of seasoning.  This dish comes with two pieces of grilled bread and it goes very well with the sauce.

Second Courses:

Truffle Risotto - Yummy!  Cooked to perfection.  The flavors on this dish is just perfect and the texture was good.  The truffle didn't over power any taste on this dish.  We were able to take the wine, mushrooms, and truffle flavors at the same time.  Perfect amount of mushrooms with this dish too.  Yum.

Spaghetti - This is a dish I didn't really care for.  The spaghetti is not as saucy as I liked it and it tasted like it was drenched in butter.  For spaghetti, I like more of a tomato-ey taste, but this dish just taste like it had too much butter.

Dessert:

Buche Au Luit De Chevre - Light and fluffy is how I can explain this dessert.  It wasn't overly sweet with the taste of hazelnut.  Yummy!

Grapefruit Granite - They said this is like a grapefruit sorbet, but to me its more like a grapefruit shave ice.  Nice way to end the meal. 

The overall experience here was great.  The service was great as well.  Our empty dishes were cleared out pretty quickly and our waters were always filled.  The servers check on us often to make sure that everything was good.  Will definitely come back here to try other items on the menu.
author: Ashley L.

description:
We enjoyed our anniversary dinner at this wonderful, dim, exquisite restaurant. We decided on dining at a French restaurant and chose Isa. It so happened they were participating in Dine About Town. As usual, we made our reservation via OpenTable. We arrived on time on a Saturday night and were seated at the patio within minutes.

Our server was Domingo. He was welcoming and enthusiastic and had a great presence. He mentioned that the restaurant is "family style", meaning the food is meant to be shared. We were fine with this since my hubby and I usually share our meals anyway. Domingo gave a couple of suggestions on what to order. The Dine About Town menu consisted of four-course meals and we chose:

1st Course:
Maine Lobster Broth: You can definitely taste the freshness of the lobster.
Potato & Leek Soup: Nothing really stood out with this item. No explosive flavors.

2nd Course:
Dungeness Crab Salad: The crab was almost non existent. It was more lettuce than anything. 
Yellowfin Tuna: Had just the right amount of spice. This item was one of the more memorable ones.

3rd Course:
Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast: Another memorable item that I will never stop thinking about. The meat was so tasty and tender and the beets were to die for.
Braised Short Ribs: Fall off the bone, tender meat served with mashed potatoes and veggies. So full of flavor and a definite MUST.

4th Course:
Semifreddo all' Amaretto: A yummy, creamy, not too sweet custard served with three small vanilla cookies. 
Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee: The name says it all. Pair this with the amaretto. 

Drinks: A glass of Riesling for me and a Stella for the hubby.

Service all around was on point. The silverware and plates were always cleared from the table and new sets were placed. The bread was neverending and delicious. During our dinner, there was a delay in the kitchen and the maitre d' informed each table and apologized for the wait. 

In the end, we were full and satisfied. We'd come back again
author: Heather R.

description:
We checked in at 5:20. The main course was served at 7:10. The waiter explained the shrimps take very long time to prepare...and so with the sweetbread...
At the end they charged the wrong amount on the credit card, they ran it 3 times until Visa blocked the card. They took a second card and ran it 3 times until the bank blocked the second card too.
Food very mediocre, service bad beyond belief.
Never again.
author: Emanuel B.

description:
I almost didn't want to review this place because it's a gem! Service was on par, not rushed or too slow. Food was fresh, made to order so it comes out hot! Very cute marketing ploy at the end of your meal: a secret envelope to be opened by Isa staff only the next time you dine at Isa, it could be a prize for free bottle of wine or a dining gift card..basically to get you to come back again, valid for the following month only.

SF restaurant week: 4 courses for $40 with lots of options per course to choose. They encourage family style, i.e. share your food, but that's totally up to the diners. The potato leek soup was actually my fave..piping hot, truffle oil, potato starchy creaminess, and the bacon!! I'm a sucker for potato leek soup but Isa's has more depth of flavors than I have had in the past from other restaurants. Butter lettuce salad wasn't memorable, butter lettuce, some crumbles of blue cheese, vinaigrette& pear slices.

2nd course: tuna avocado thing that very much tasted like poke to me with some seaweed salad as the base..wait a minute, it is tuna poke deconstructed in a sense...enjoyable as the tuna was fresh. Salmon carpaccio was a miss for me, it was lacking flavor & the creme fraiche drizzle (thank you for a light drizzle) wasn't really necessary...i guess cause i'm not a huge creme fraiche, white creamy sauce kind of person (gag). The mussels was ohkay, broth was yummy but mussel meat were teeny tiny..it shrank alot! Then again, that's my gripe about PEI mussels..Isa--contact Cuisinett Restaurant in San Carlos about which mussel farm they get their mussels from (apparently some farm from British Columbia, Canada) because their mussels are MEATY!

3rd course: Seared scallops were made perfectly, soft & tender but only 3 scallops to a mountain of mashed potatoes...wish there were 4 scallops. Flat iron steak made rare, wow...so tender I didn't even need to use the steak knife they gave us. And I made sure I smeared that tarragon butter ALL over the slices including the fingerling potatoes which were MADE PERFECTLY too! So perfectly flavored. Duck breast was delicious too, the end pcs of the duck breast without any of the sauce touching had such a crispy skin that it tasted like pork cracklins! the other parts of the breast were just as tasty too...all of us very much enjoyed most of our 3rd courses with the exception of the mashed potato ratio to scallops. I looked over other diner's table who ordered the pan roasted chicken & that looked tasty too.

4th course: grapefruit granite was refreshing & definitely tasted like real deal grapefruit. You can definitely taste the pith bitterness in it but that's expected as I am sure they used real grapefruit to make it..no artificial flavors there! The goat cheese w/honey paired very well together. The amaretto semifreddo was our least favorite..it was almond ice cream but it was too much almond. It's tasted like almond extract upon crushed almond in the ice cream & almond cookies...it wasn't our fave amongst the three. 

It was a lot of food & amazingly, I was just right! Not overly stuffed but just right..my sister was overly stuffed. We shared everything, had bites of everything. The portions were very decent, not too much but not skimpy. 

Cannot wait to come back in feb on a thursday with mom..you'll know why. And i am highly considering this place to host a party/small gathering this summer as the back patio tent area looks really cute (according to the yelp pics). 

After tip & tax, $40 four course meal, a cocktail ($9) plus the $25 foie gras (split btwn 2 ppl)..each person spent $77
author: Yolanda L.

description: Three of us went to dinner because of good experiences in the past. The food service was very iradkic. One of us received an appetizer 15 minutes before the other two. Same with the main course, one person receive their dish 20 minutes before the others. It made the dining experience uncomfortable and awkward. The food was good, but the service poor. Possibly they were short of servers that night. We probably won't return. There are too many other fine restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Adia L.

description:
Isa was hands down my favorite restaurant that we visited on our most recent trip to SF, and I can't say enough amazing things about this place. It was absolutely stellar. If this restaurant existed in Fort Worth I'd be so, so broke right now. I'm in love.
