Isa refers to itself as a "Cal-French small plate" restaurant, which is plain as day. I'm a fan of this easy description and the restaurant's lovely, fresh concept. Local California food with a French influence, served tapas style? Yes, yes, yes. I'm all in.

Every single thing we ordered looked and tasted so wonderfully complex, but the best part is that these dishes are actually so simple. No hidden ingredients. This is the kind of restaurant that doesn't have a gluten-free menu because they don't need one; all of the food descriptions are clear and our waiter was amazing with answering questions (even though I didn't really have any). He reassured me that our meals were GF. 

Adam and I decided to order three small plates to share. Their menu changes frequently because they only use seasonal and fresh foods, of course, but in early March we were lucky enough to have the "Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese" which comes with basil pesto, tomato concassée, and pinenuts. It's served with fresh sourdough bread (Adam loved it), and I ate this incredible cheese straight with a fork. OH MY GODS. It was so perfect. I love goat cheese and Isa's presentation was gorgeous.

We also ordered the "Grilled local calamari" which is made with honey spice, lemon zest, and arugula; served on a bed of flageolet beans. Whoa. At first I thought I'd be freaked out because I haven't eaten a lot of calamari that wasn't deep-fried (so it's been like, 5+ years since I've had any). I wasn't freaked out though, I was in love and obsessed... simply fawning over this amazing plate. The calamari had an incredible delicate yet meaty texture, they weren't chewy at all. They were sweet and a bit tart, and the hearty beans were the perfect accompaniment. 

Finally, we shared the "Local Mushrooms" plate. These buttery, rich, earthy shrooms were served with garlic, jus de veau (veal stock), and parsley. Damn. I mean seriously. I love mushrooms when they're raw and plain, so you can imagine how fantastic I thought these were... sauteed with such strong and beautiful ingredients. The garlic was sweet and powerful and the parsley added the perfect brightness. Who knew you could get so excited about and be so satisfied by a simple plate of mushrooms? I DID. And Isa delivered.

After eating slowly and indulging in every little bite, we decided to pass on dessert. We didn't skip the wine though! I had an amazing champagne. Isa also features plenty of cocktails (all made with Soju) and beer. I was 100% happy with my bubbles (and $8.50 per glass wasn't too bad). Actually, the prices overall were pretty awesome, I think. Our small plates each ran about $13, and they were so worth it.
author: Kendall S.

description:
I absolutely love this place. I've been twice, which isn't enough, but have now named it my go-to spot. All dishes are amazing, and a great selection of seafood. 
The steak was DELICOUS. Get as many items as you can. 3 of us got 4 appetizers and 3 entrees and it was the perfect amount. We shared everything.
Our server, Dean, is amazing! He was my server both times and brings such a huge smile to everyone's faces. 
The wine selection is great and decently priced.
I love the patio, such a wonderful ambiance! 
Yaaaaaay, Isa!!!
author: Kathryn M.

description:
If you're reading this review before the end of Jan 31 or between June 1-15 = GUESS WHAT, THEY'RE DOING DINE ABOUT TOWN!!! STAY THE F AWAY!!!

This is going to be my first rant of 2014 -- to begin: I was here last year for DAT with a friend and I enjoyed everything. Service / food = awesome. I didn't have a chance to review them then, because LIFE happened. 

I didn't think it was WORTH it for me to go back for regular pricing menu, I wasn't that impressed to begin with so this year, I wanted to take my family to check it out... I told my siblings about the food... and they said sure... let's try it... for DAT.

Made a reservation via opentable.com = all was set. Yesterday, Jan 23 - I get a confirmation call. The hostess tells me again that they're doing DAT and that they are busy and to come in on time. I told her = GOT IT. 

That same night, we parked at Wells Fargo and our reservation was at 6:15. I called to give them a courtesy call that "Hey, we're walking there now... just letting you know." 

To the management: I don't know who your hostess was or the person answering the phone, but she answered and told me this verbatim: "I JUST WANT TO REMIND YOU THAT THERE IS A PARTY OF THREE COMING IN AT 8:00 PM..." 

I didn't even bother saying thank you - because to me, that was a big FU! Seriously? What THE F?! 

I was calling to let you know that we were en route... a courtesy call... and if you know the Marina... the Well's Fargo parking is just a freaking block... 5 min walk tops! And you're going to respond to my call like that - with an effen attitude? 

HELLO?! You as a restaurant decided to be a part of Dine About Town and me as a customer, WAS planning on having a good time... with your food and possibly drinks, NOT rushed to be herded in and out!!! It's not a competition eating contest, is it? Because I didn't see that in the fine print and I'm a graphic designer and so I am aware of how small those fine prints are, because I design them!!!

How DARE you rush a customer who hasn't even step foot onto your establishment?! Can you imagine if we walked in there at 6:30 and we decided to get a bottle of wine or a couple of cocktails... then what? You're going to make us chug our drinks? 

ISA - WHAT THE F!? 

You are not Gary Danko. You are not Nobu. You are not Melisse. You are not the French Laundry  = so don't act like you are one. 

I have never been so furious and insulted at a restaurant that I wasn't even inside yet! EWWWW!

To the management and to that woman who answered my call at 6:18 pm on Jan 23, 2014 = SCREW YOU!!! My family and I went to Ristorante Parma next door and guess what, we dropped $300 for 3 people. Your DAT = $105. And seriously, check your reviews... they're all YELLOWS and now I know why!? 

I will tell all my friends / family / colleagues to freaking avoid this place and oh and guess what, I'm on YELP! 

To my fellow Yelpers... from my previous reviews - I keep it real. I give, to the best of my abilities, reviews that you care / can relate too. And this is one of those reviews that really, just infuriated me to the core. I have participated and enjoyed DAT - and never was I rushed through any of those previous dining experiences. 

ISA, check yourself!
author: Cath M.

description:
This place wasn't too shabby. We came here for what we call in Seattle "restaurant week", but I think in SF it's called "Dine" something something. Anyways the point is that we got to try a selection of different dishes for a certain amount.

So here's my opinion on the dishes:
Bread: Bread is awesome. Keep asking them for more.

Starters: Salad is all the same. Get the soup to separate yourself.

Appetizer: I really enjoyed the yellow-tail tuna. It was amazing! This by far was my favorite dish. It tasted very similar to poke.

Main Dish: I had the duck, but honestly it was just mediocre. Nothing to rave about. I also tried the scallops which was good, but you only get 3 and the rest is some type of orzo/ small noodle thingy. My suggestion is go with the chicken or the ribs. Apparently my friends said those were awesome but I wanted to be adventurous.

Desert: Ameretto desert. Get that one. It was legit. I love ameretto flavored stuff.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Came here during SF restaurant week with boyfriend and 2 friends. Our reservation was at 815pm on a Friday night. We didn't get seated right away since they were too packed that night. This was my second time there and food was not as good as I remembered. Service was lacking and they kept messing up on our orders. 

Fraise salad - best part were the beets 3 stars

Foie gras - melted in my mouth love. Bf thought it tasted too fatty 5stars

Flat iron steak - I asked for medium rare more rare and it can out medium. Very disappointed this time 2 stars

Duck breast - flavors were good but still slightly over cooked 4 stars

Vanilla bean creme brûlée - consistency wasn't good. Seemed like a little watered down. I can make better creme brûlée with it being more creamy texture 2 stars

Some coffee flavored dessert - perfect amount of coffee flavor. Be said that was the best part of dinner 5 stars
author: Ivy L.

description:
Solid californian cuisine with an Asian fusion flair, but the service was pretty spotty.

We sat in the back garden (which wasn't as nice during the night). I would recommend getting a table in the front. The bartender is super friendly -- I wouldn't hesitate to sit at the bar to dine.

Dungeness crab salad with avocado, apple, grapefruit & tarragon: many people wrote about this but I thought it was nothing too special. Fresh crab. it was good. not amazing

Special fish of the day -- bass cooked inside parch paper (the vietnamese way). Excellent. I would highly recommend this one.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Isa is one of my favorite French restaurants in the city for many many years now. I can't even count how many times I've been here. If you're someone that doesn't like heavy food, Isa is for you. The flavors are light so you can actually get through the 3-4 course prefix dinner without feeling gross and stuffed. 

My favorites:
-Mussels (love the tangy tomato broth base)
-Yellow fin tuna tar tar (def do not skimp on the tuna portion)
-The roasted chicken w/ mashed potatoes (chicken has a good balance of crisp and juiciness & mashed potatoes have great texture and creaminess)
-Fish: either the bacon potato wrapped sea bass or halibut
author: Yanni C.

description:
The positive: The food at this place was good. Most of the dishes were delicious. 
Now,  the outside area was very loud and a bit cold even after having the heater close by, it was a bit cold for me. The waiter insisted we must get a few dishes to share stating the portions were small, this was not the case, we ended up listening to him and ordered more by the end of the 3rd dish were were full and we still have another dish coming and the dessert which we bought as it was a Birthday celebration. By the way they charge $3 for each for cutting the cake.  I really loved the risotto dish and the crab salad ( very small portion for this one).   Having said this the food was tasty but if you want a nice ambiance, and cozy place, go elsewhere.
author: Alexa G.

description:
Hurry! Before Dine About Town SF is over!! Go visit this place!!

My coworker and I decided to do 3 places with Dine About Town SF and this was my fav. our of the three.  Everything was already looking up from the time i found parking right in front of the restaurant to dessert. First look, I thought this place was super small! Don't be deceived. They build an outdoor area with covers and it looks amazing. Loved the ambiance of the place.

****TIP****
HAPPY HOUR
Dollar oysters and half off alcohol menu!

The menu allowed us to have 4 entrées. The first course, I picked the potato leek soup and my coworker got the arugula salad.  The soup was alright in my book but paired with the bread and butter they gave us that I dipped into the soup make it amazing! The free bread and butter reminded me of France. The butter was so yummy! (I know....all the rave about the bread and butter but....oh well)

Since the waiter (who was super friend btw) told us they served everything family style and it comes out all together. The next thing that showed up was my coworker's salmon carpaccio (think that's what it was called) and that was super good! It had eggs and cucumber with it along with pieces of smoked salmon with a crustini. Yum! Before my yellow fin tuna came out, my risotto came out. Now, I'm not a big fan of mushrooms but it was a truffle risotto and of course I had to get it! Anything truffle, I'm ok with it...just other mushrooms makes me gag. Tried it and you get this heavy truffle taste along with parmesan . Yum! (Can I say, by this time I've engorged myself with so much bread and butter that I'm super stuffed!) But still, I couldn't help myself in scooping more risotto onto my plate. 

After that, the yellowfin tuna came out and it's of course, all raw. (Just realized that most everything we ordered were raw...hah) This was really delicious! The bottom had some avocado and drenched with some sriracha. Yum!  The combination gave me this heavy and spicy feeling and matched with the tuna, it was amazing! (Not sure if my description makes sense. hah)

Then, onto the duck my coworker ordered. This was my least favorite...I'm not much of a duck person but it was pretty good. This...was also cooked a little raw (i never knew you could eat duck raw!) Maybe it was my mentality but eating it raw kinda make me go...ehh...no. For some reason, anything that's a bird and raw makes me scared because of chicken. But it was really flavorful and I was glad by this point, I was super full so I didn't feel like I was missing out on anything.

Last but not least, the dessert. We both got the vanilla bean creme brulee. Yum! It was smooth and really delicious! At first, I couldn't crack the burnt sugar on top but once I got into that custardy goodness, I was in creme brulee heaven. I was so sad when I finished it.

Service:
My oh my was the service spectacular. All the waiters were super friendly and attentive. It was kind of funny though, because I asked for more bread and one of the waiters gave everyone bread but not our table =(. But I saw him walking back and forth trying to figure out with table wanted more bread! No biggie. Just asked another waiter and we got our bread. It was def. not a ding on their service because I mean, I can understand if someone can forget since it was so busy and it's only bread, no biggie. But the service was seriously amazing. I can't wait to go back!
author: Denise L.

description:
Came with a large stoned party of 9.  My aunt's 50th Bday.  We were seated in the back of the tent.   Our waiter was a bit intense, but  funny.  We were given 2 menus.The ala carte and the prie fixed.  But the waiter explained that even the pre fixe plates should be shared, which was a little confusing. He explained that the kitchen was small and small plates are how they operate. We were also a little bummed that there was not a full bar.  Just wine and Soju. 

It was raining pretty hard and a few members of our party were cold and had to keep asking for the heat lamps to be turned up.  The waiter was nice and funny about it and  even offered his jacket to one of us.  Once we ordered, the food came out quickly and was tasty.  Chicken was a hit, steak was a hit, duck was a hit, calamari, asparagus soup, and risotto were all popular with our table.  The wine was pretty good too.  A vino Verde from Portugal was sweet and light.  The sauvignon was perfect, and I was happy to see a french red on the wine list as well.  We had to remind them to bring our desert out. and it was alright.  The bill came, tip included and we were all pleasantly surprised, not too pricey. 

Even though I live in the city, this was the first time I had been in the Marina in over a  year.  I would not come out of my way to come back here, but would recommend it as a nice place to share some tasty small plates.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Five stars just based on the hostess alone. She was so completely accommodating and checked in on us several times throughout out our meal. Wonderful food slightly pricey but delish. My not negative would be that they don't serve hard alcohol. It says that it has a martini or Cosmo on the menus but they in fact are not served with vodka.
author: Kel C.

description:
Wow! Came here with some friends tonight and loved the food.  First, was very happy about the $5 happy hour drinks before 7pm -- the Moscow mule soju cocktail was nice and light.  

For the appetizers, I would recommend the tuna.  Served raw and cubed, over avocado and seaweed salad, it was seasoned well with soy and wasabi and a hint of sriracha. We also got the mussels and the calamari, which had good flavor.

For the entrees, we got the paella, steak, lamb chops, and risotto. It was a nice balance to share between us, and the lamb and the paella were the favorites.  The seafood and the lobster broth with the paella really made it stand out. The risotto was also delicious, and the steak was alright. 

I would say the only downside is parking. Also, they describe their dishes as tapas style, and recommend each person get two plates (or the prix fixe for $30, which is a great deal). I would recommend you not listen to this unless you are a big eater.  I consider myself to have a pretty voracious appetite, but I was really full. Their entrees are normal entree sized, and their appetizers are pretty large as well. We didn't even have enough room on our table for all the dishes, and they kept bringing out more bread -- though this probably should be considered a good thing :)

Would love to come back.
author: Debbie K.

description:
Tried this place for Dine About Town and even though I'm not a seafood person I thought this placed served a high quality meal! This place is very small and cramped, so its better for a date but not too intimate because people are literally 2 feet away from you. It still maintains a classy but casual ambiance. 

Our server first brought out oysters. They were pretty small but I like oysters and they tasted pretty fresh. Next was Maine lobster broth, the shrimp was nice and tender and the soup had ok flavor. Not too fishy. For appetizers we tried crab salad, which was light and refreshing. I also had the yellowfin tuna tartare which was slightly more spicy and substantive but not too heavy either. I tried a bit of the seared scallops which were cooked very well. The truffle risotto was very rich and I liked the savory flavor, I just wished the rice was cooked slightly more. For dessert I had a semifreddo for the first time- I liked the light texture but otherwise it could have used more flavor. 

A solid meal that ended up balancing out with dishes that were light versus those that were heavy. They know how to present seafood beautifully and balance it well!
author: Steven V.

description:
First timer and loved my experience.  The wait staff was warm and friendly, and very knowledgeable about their menu.  Food is family style so be sure to order multiple dishes. Family and I ordered the Truffle Risotto, the Potato wrapped sea bass, Maple Leaf Farm duck breast, Steamed Prince Edward island mussels, and spaghetti (for the little one in our party); most everything was tasty and delicious: the potato on the sea bass was salty but the fish was nice and flaky.  I would recommend everything we ordered.  For drinks, I ordered a Lemon Drop; for someone who doesn't drink often, and if I do prefer a light sweeter cocktail or white wine, I really enjoyed this nice cocktail.  It's quite light and enjoyably sweet, but not overly.  Definitely one I would recommend for those with a sweet palate.  
We opted to get dessert elsewhere, but the waiter told me he had a something for me and came out with a small ramekin of ice cream and a glass of Flip Flop Muscat dessert wine.  Figures someone said something, but that was very kind of the waiter.  Recommended place to celebrate and will definitely make a return trip for another occasion.
author: Jessica S.

description:
We found this lil gem through the SF restaurant week site. We sat on the back covered patio, they had plenty of space heaters going and it was very cozy. My only complaint for the whole experience was the table for 3 we had was very cramped. 

The food though and service more than made up for that! We ordered almost every dish off the  special SF restaurant week menu. Every dish was amazing. The salads, tuna tartare, mussles, baked goat cheese were all top notch. We also ordered the seared foie gras supplement and it was just amazing. For the mains we shared the seared duck, steak and the incredible mushroom risotto. 

The service was fast and so warm and friendly. Dean was very friendly and funny and the owner Samira came be our table several times to check on everything.

This place is not super fancy nor pretentious in any way. Amazing food, great service and truly and amazing deal for restaurant week.
author: Lulu S.

description: Went here on a Friday night for a double date with my girlfriend and my buddy / his girlfriend. The menu was great! 4 courses pre-fix menu for $40! I had the potato leek soup with bacon (good but broth was a bit bland), PEI mussels (amazing broth - loved them!), the skirt steak (very good!) and the vanilla bean creek brulee. They gave us an envelope at the end of dinner and said to bring it back unopened in February and it could be a $100 gift card, a free bottle of wine or something else inside on a gift card! Will definitely be back. Cocktails were also amazing!
author: Chris S.

description:
I went to Isa for Dine About Town and it was super good! After reviewing about 15 dine about town menus, I decided Isa was THE place to go. At first, we were on a wait list of 7 and thought we would not get a table. Then, a table opened for 5pm so we took it. They are offering a delicious 4-course meal for $36.95, where as other restaurants mainly offer a 3-course meal (that was a plus). We had the Maine lobster broth with prawns for the first course, which was not bad. The second course was my favorite...salmon carpaccio and the yellow fin tuna over avocado with seaweed salad and nori!! They were both sooo good!! For the third course, I had the braised short ribs which were super tender and delicious. I even had half leftover for the next day and it was still delicious the next day. For dessert, the vanilla bean crème brûlée tasted perfect. My friend ordered the maple leaf farm duck breast which was also nice...and the semifreddo all'amaretto, which tasted like amaretto ice cream. We also had soju cocktails...a lemon drop and a Cosmo. They were light (I'm not much of a drinker) and tasted pretty good. We also had the raw oysters which were a great value...only $1 each...and delicious. 
Overall, I was so happy with my experience at Isa. The service was great too...we had a nice friendly guy (I think he said his name was Dean, but not 100% sure).
I read another reviewer's experience about Isa and how she was very offended because the restaurant rushed her before she even got there. For my experience, originally I had a reservation for 2 for 5:00pm. I called and asked to change it to 3 people and they were accommodating, but informed me that a party was coming in at 6:30pm (so I pretty much had to get out by then). I did not mind though because I was already happy to get a reservation. Then, one friend couldn't make it so I changed the reservation back to 2 people (I know, annoying). However, the entire time I was dining at Isa, I did not feel rushed by any staff member or server (although they did give us the warning like the other reviewer experienced). I was afraid they would say something to us around 6:30pm, but 6:30pm came and went and nobody rushed us or made us feel like we had to leave at any certain time. I think they even still had one or two tables open (who knows, maybe people didn't show up. Lol, maybe it was that girl that didn't show up...j/k). It was so relaxing out on their covered patio. The food was fabulous and the service was excellent!! I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Jean S.

description:
Get the foie gras! That's the big take away message if you don't read the rest of this review. Even if you don't like liver, order the foie gras. $29.95 for a three course prix fix menu Sunday to Thursday. What a great deal! There's a pretty good selection for you to choose from too. On top of the prix fixe, you can get $5 happy hour drinks if you dine before 7PM. The happy hour menu consisted of either wine or soju cocktails. 

The boyfriend and I both opted for the prix fixe. As other have noted, the food is served tapas style and is meant to be shared, which worked out well for us. While it's not on the prix fix, the foie gras ($24) here is amazing, and is worth ordering off of the main menu. The foie gras came with some type of cake like bread and a side of baked pears seasoned with nutmeg. Everything on this plate was foodgasmic. I don't even typically like liver, but the foie gras was delicious. Besides the foie gras, we also had:

-Salmon carpaccio: I really liked this. Tastes very similar to Chapeau's trio of salmon. 
-Steamed mussels: This was ok, but I'm not much of a mussels person in general. 
-Pan Roasted Rocky Jr. Range chicken: This was recommended to us over the steak. I pretty much never choose chicken over steak, but this came so highly recommended by our server that we gave it a try. It's probably one of the best chicken dishes I've ever had. Chicken was crispy, mashed potatoes were buttery, and sauce was delicious. I wouldn't say that it's on the same level as a top of the game beef or pork dish, but still good. 
-Truffle risotto: This dish was disappointing, maybe because it was following up the chicken and the foie gras, which were both great. People on yelp seem to love it, but I'd skip this one in the future. There are better options on the menu if you're not a vegetarian.  
-Grapefruit Granite: Shaved ice with grapefruit flavoring on top. Skip this. Tasted like a bitter snow cone. It tasted like someone managed to extract all of the bad parts of a grapefruit and left all the good parts behind. 
-Semifreddo all amarteto: The better option if you're looking for a sweet dessert rather than a cheese plate. It tasted like a coffee cake had a baby with ice cream. 

 In terms of drinks, we went for the soju cocktails. We had the number 7 (blackberries, ginger, champagne), greyhound (grapefruit juice and bitters), and the mojito (soda, lime, mint, sugar). Of the three, we both liked the number 7, which was sweet and tart, and the mojito. The greyhound didn't have very much flavor to it. 

I usually don't comment too much on service, but the service here was remarkably slow. Our server was a really friendly guy and was great when he was around, but the food was very slow in coming out (like over half an hour between the first and second appetizer). I heard several complaints about this from other tables around us as well, but I think maybe the kitchen was just having an off night since the other reviews didn't mention this. They did pick up the speed after we mentioned it though. I've also had some tables in tight spaces in the past (it is SF after all), but this was the most cramped seating arrangement I've ever had.

Price: $107 for two people pre-tip
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Having enjoyed a memorable meal with friends at Isa a couple of years ago, we were really disappointed with our recent dinner.  It wasn't awful; just not particularly interesting or flavorful.  The grilled calamari tasted more sauteed than grilled, and were overwhelmed by the spice mix.  The Dungeness crab salad cups also suffered an unbalanced quality, as the crab was flavorless and was dominated rather than complimented by the grapefruit.  The duck breast was very good, but didn't overcome the shortcomings.  

It was also really LOUD in the back area, which could have just been a function of the fact that there were several tables of boisterous diners with piercing voices and laughs.  I hate to whine about other people enjoying themselves, but it actually made it hard for us to have a conversation.  Given the fact that we'd enjoyed Isa the first time, we may give it another shot, but this was definitely less than we'd hoped for.
author: Paul R.

description:
Great great food, but somewhat unexpectedly (clearly my fault because I simply failed to do math) pricey.

This place is all about the New American tapas, and everything except dessert is a share plate. Since it was our first time there and we didn't do our homework before we arrived, we took our waiter's advice and ordered an appetizer and a main for each person at the table... so eight plates total. At the end of the meal, we were stuffed... so we probably could've done with two appetizers and four mains. The risotto and the scallops were clear winners. Everything else was great but nothing particularly special.

The wine list is super curated and interesting. Every bottle has a story and the sommelier knows each wine well. We had the Lautrec pinot noir and it was fabulous.

Desserts here are a must. Both the cake and the creme brulee are 100% worth it.
author: Megan B.

description:
Great food and even better prices! Came here the other night with a friend, we were able to snag a table out front right in the sun which was clutch. The atmosphere and wait stuff were both great, we totally took our time at dinner and I never felt rushed to get out of there. We did the tasting menu -- $30 for app, entree and a dessert, talk about a steal! The serving sizes were the same as if you ordered off the menu. 

Everything is served tapa style, so it came out as it was ready and you shared, which I loved! We got the salmon carpaccio, baked goat cheese, fish of the day and the truffle risotto. It was all delicious but the truffle risotto and salmon carpaccio were my personal faves. Bonus, happy hour goes until 7pm and glasses of wine are only $5. 

I will absolutely be coming back soon, great spot with a friendly staff, killer food and fantastic prices!
author: Lizzy U.

description:
We decided to come here for their special four course NYE deal! It was only $49 which was really cheap. I had Maine Lobster Broth with Prawns, Organic Loch Duart Salmon with Lemon, Creme Fraiche & Capers, Truffle Risotto with Baby Shiitake, and a Semifreddo All Amaretto.

Overall I give Isa three stars... Food was delicious but I felt it was mediocre and that I could have had this type of food somewhere else. While the food was presented beautifully, there was nothing special about the taste of each dish. I guess I was expecting a "wow factor" and I did not get that here. Also my cousin ended up with really bad food poisoning at the end of the night. Not cool!
author: Debra T.

description:
HORRIBLY EXECUTED FOOD!

My first time at Isa 2.5 years ago was mediocre, however my friend had been craving foie gras for some time so I suggested we go to Isa with all the overwhelming reviews about their foie gras and also because of the Savored 30% off deal. With Savored (http://savored.com/), you pay $10 for a reservation and get 30% off your bill. I thought the second time would be a charm since Isa continues to get rave reviews. Boy, was I WRONG!

On Monday, 9.5.11, my friend and I arrived a little early for our 6:30 PM reservations but was promptly seated in the front dining room. I requested patio dining seating since it was nice day, but the hostess said with the Savored deal, there was assigned seating and if we wanted to sit in the patio we would have to forgo our deal. I wasn't going to lose the $10 I paid for the reservation and then have to pay full price for our meal. It didn't make sense to me but whatever, I digress.

F O O D
*GRADE A FOIE GRAS w/ Peaches & Custard Brioche ($22) - 0 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=U82JXqnl0FWSDRN2EhGPZA
Foie gras is one of things I enjoy most when dining out and the one at Isa is single-handedly the WORST foie gras I've ever had! The foie gras was burnt to a black char and any good chef would have NEVER let that leave the kitchen! Normally, foie gras should cut like butter and I felt like I was sawing through firewood. Because the foie gras was overcooked and burnt, it lost all of its luxurious richness it once had. Aside from this, the peaches were too big to handle and should have been cooked down to a compote for easier eating. The dish in its entirety was terrible and NOT cohesive. 

The couple next to us even commented that our foie gras looked "odd". I guess that's one way to put it!

*POTATO WRAPPED SEABASS w/ Capers, Fresno Peppers, Parsley, Tomato Confit, Brown Butter & Lemon ($22) - 2 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=jgh4kPoDih4X7Tu83OjnLw
I rarely order fish but I decided to order the potato wrapped seabass after all the glowing reviews. What a mistake! Though the seabass was tender, the potato that it was wrapped around was once again burnt. The caper, tomato confit, fresno pepper, and brown butter sauce masked some of the burnt flavor, however it completely drowned the fish with a very overpowering saltiness. Needless to say, the delicateness of the fish got lost in the sauce and I went scrambling for bread just to wash out all the salty flavor from my mouth.  

*VANILLA CRÈME BRULEE ($6) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=zVFJpL3AJP2LE3UZgSxN3A
The best part of our meal was the crème brulee though it was mediocre. The crème brulee had a very thick crust was very hard to chew. If I were any older, I would have probably lost a tooth from chewing on the oddly thick bruleed crust. Unfortunately, it just tasted like eating rock candy. 

S E R V I C E
Though the staff was friendly and checked on us several times, they needed help in the timing department because they made us feel rushed. We weren't even done with our appetizers before our entrees came so we had to rush to pick off whatever we wanted to make room for our entrée dishes. Not even two minutes before getting the bill, one of the waiters came to get the bill. I left the bill sleeve OPEN while I was grabbing my CC from my wallet (to split the bill) which should be an indication we were not ready to pay the bill. He was ready to take away the bill away with one CC and I had to kindly intervene to tell him we weren't ready to pay yet. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
The front dining room is dark, classy yet casual. I prefer the back patio better as it's more lit and more laid back. 

P A R K I N G
Parking in the area is difficult, so I suggest going here on a weeknight right at 6PM to snag metered street parking. Or better yet, cab it. 

I'm not much of Groupon/Living Social/HomeRun/Etc. girl because I buy deals which I end up forgetting about (I've wasted more money than I've saved) and service tends to be severely compromised. In addition, I feel like the business may only be offering these deals to compensate for something they lack. Same thing goes for Isa...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This place is amazing!  Great service...acted like they wanted us to be there!  Friendly, professional, and very helpful staff.  and then the food!!!
Great salad with blue cheese, nuts and pears!  Mussels, fresh warm bread, Amazingly tender steak,  perfectly cooked fish, great veggies, and then Dessert!    Cheese, fruit, and ice cream...i forgot to mention the drinks....wonderful....very attentive staff....can't wait to go back!
author: Donna A.

description:
Dine about town June 2014 review

My bff and I wanted to treat ourselves to a nice dinner when our boyfriends were out of town for the weekend and we finally decided on Isa after several recommendations from friends and the four course (not three course) dinner menu.

I booked the rsvp via open table for 5:30 on a Sat night and received a confirmation call around noon. 

When we arrived, we were immediately seated in the front dining room and the ambiance was nice and romantic with candles and dim lighting.

We were starving and already knew what to order by the time we finished reading the menu and scarfing down the bread. I had the arugula salad, tuna, flatiron steak and semifreddo while my friend had the butter lettuce salad, mussels, braised short rib and same dessert.

I hated my salad bc the arugula was too spicy for me (my mistake for choosing it) but the butter lettuce salad was good. There was nothing outstanding about them so I would skip salads the next time I come back during regular season.

On the other hand, we loved our apps. The mussels were fresh and flavorful and grilled bread to soak up the tasty broth. The yellowfin tuna was to die for-fresh and well seasoned. The lean protein with the avocado and seaweed salad was the perfect combo.

At this point we were getting full but more kept coming! We had the braised short rib with broccolini and buttery mashed potatoes. The mash was really good but the short rib was melt in your mouth delicious. It took a while for my flat iron steak to come out but maybe they knew we were stuffed at this point and need time to digest. I asked for medium rare but it came out a little too done on the exterior for my taste. Still tasted good but a bit chewy. Those potatoes were yummy though.

Before we could throw in the towel (or napkin in this case) we were reminded about dessert. We both had the semifreddo and it was the perfect way to end the night. It was sweet but not too sweet, light and airy along with some flavorful almond flavored cookies.

Isa had both food and service on point when I made the visit. I will definitely come back for our anniversary to try their regular menu very soon. Good job, Isa!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
After dining at Isa multiple times, I am definitely a fan of never-ending bread and butter. Yes, many restaurants have their own bread basket but none replenished the basket as quick as Isa.

For all those indoor dinners, make an exception for Isa and dine outdoors. The area feels spacious, like you are eating on your own two-level back porch, decorated with string lights. The good food adds to the experience.

Tried the dungeness crab salad, salmon carpaccio, grilled calamari, butter lettuce salad, arugula salad, steamed P.E.I. mussels, seared scallops, Hudson Valley foie gras, seasonal fish, truffle risotto, pan roasted chicken, roasted rack of lamb, maple leaf duck breast, flat iron steak, and all of the desserts. Great sauces (which was soaked up with bread), vegetables, and mashed potatoes. All of the meats, chicken, duck, steak, and lamb were cooked to perfection. My favorite appetizer is hands down, the dungeness crab salad. I would over this over the foie gras.

And if you come during happy hour, all of their drinks, expect two are just $5 each. 

Main issue with Isa is the location -- it is a parking nightmare when there is an event anywhere near this area. Almost every single time, I was able to find parking within a few minutes but I have a feeling very few people will have this parking experience.

What I recommend:
-- dungeness crab salad
-- maple leaf farm duck breast
-- grilled angus flat iron steak
-- come with parking patience
author: Andrew W.

description:
I arrived about 5 minutes before my reservation on a Friday night for DAT and the place was packed! 

They were only serving the DAT menu tonight, so the food came relatively fast. 

The free sliced baguette with butter was delicious. I haven't had free bread taste so good in a long while. I had at least 2 refills until I decided enough was enough, had to save space for the food I was paying for.

Our first course was the Main lobster broth, two jumbo sized prawns soaked in some lobster broth. You could smell the lobster from a mile away and it really made me crave it. 

The dungeness crab salad came next. I was at a loss on how to eat this dish. It was almost like an asian wrap, yet it didn't seem right to use my bare hands to eat this dish, so I ended up awkwardly using a fork. Also, there wasn't much crab flavor.  

The braised short ribs was the best entree of the night. Slightly fatty, the short ribs were super flavorful and just melted in my mouth on every bite. 

The flat iron steak was cooked medium rare and lacked flavor. Don't get me wrong, it was well made, but it was a bit too chewy for me and I prefer my steak savory. 

The vanilla bean creme brulee was creamy and sweet, and the vanilla flavor wasn't overpowering. I was not a fan of the chocolate hazelnut semifreddo after my first bite, but I started liking it more as the flavor started to sweeten after each bite. 

I was absolutely stuffed when I finished.
author: Edward W.

description: We visited this restaurant purely because of other reviews. We struggle with American white wines as we find them overly sweet or too oaked for our palate how wonderful to find a New Zealand Sauvignon for $5 a glass for happy hour. What a great start ! We chose the fixed price menu 3 courses I had salmon carpaccio followed by halibut and the flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream my brother had calamari followed by chicken and amaretti semi fredo all dishes were of good quality and tasty (see pics) if you can try this restaurant you won't be disappointed
author: Ann J.

description:
Went here for dine about town 2014 and had the 4 course dinner menu.

1a) half a dozen oysters - fresh, small, nice. $1 each. Can't go wrong!
1) Lobster broth with prawns: Tasted like lobster. Prawns were good size.
2) Yellowfin tuna: Fresh. Tasty. A little kick. The seaweed added a nice flavor. Would recommend.
3) Duck breast: Cooked almost perfectly but I can't complain because it was still really good. Portion size was quite generous. Side of beets and arugula tasted great. Can't really find any faults but it wasn't the best duck breast I've ever had. Nonetheless, it was still really good.
4) Grapefruit granite: It's like shaved ice with grapefruit juice! What more can one ask for??

Also tried:
- salmon carpaccio: tasteless, would not recommend
- crab salad: fresh and refreshing, would recommend
- chicken: it was ok. Outside had a nice crunch but I think without the sauce it would be a bit dry.
- short ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender. Quite flavorful. Pretty good but nothing to write home about.
semifreddo: This was a spectacular dessert. I had dessert envy.

Service was good. Waiter was nice and friendly and the manager (I think??) stopped by every so often to check up on us.

Last thing: their happy hour was until 7PM where they serve soju cocktails and wine for $5. What a deal!
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Great food in the Marina District at very affordable prices!  I love how all portions are meant to be shared and served family-style.   

Prix fixe meal from Sunday - Thursday is totally worth your dollars.  $29.95 for 3-courses, totally a steal!  However, minus 1 star for the their selection of desserts, but no need to fear, you can add an extra $2 to select a dessert from their regular list.  When Dine About Town comes around in January and June, they have one of the best DAT deals too, I always love seeing them as a participating restaurant.  

During my recent visit, the truffle risotto with baby shiitake, hon shimiji mushroom & reggiano and Sea of Cortez wild prawns with parsley, garlic & lemon were probably the highlights of our meal.  The grilled flat iron steak with moutarde verte & bordelaise sauce was also cooked very well + a good sized portion too.

Whether it's a nice night out on town or just a simple meal, Isa is a great place to be!
author: Janetto L.

description:
Be ready to wait 40-60 minuets till your order will be ready. 

If you are in rush, this is not right place for dinner.
author: Mukhammadiev B.

description:
A very cute French restaurant. Isa is located in the Marina area with all the restaurants and bar, parking on the street was limited. We we lucky to found a street parking at nearby residential area, just about 3 blocks from Isa.

I have to apologize for the dark pictures. It was pretty dark in Isa. Once you walked in, you will noticed a bar and few small tables across from it, that was where we were seated. Actually they have a back area, really cute! But it was booked for a private event that evening.

We opted for the 3 course Prix-Fix menu. The waiter told us everything on the menu was meant to be share. And yup, he was right! Portions were very generous for a French restaurant.

Complimentary bread were served. Warm and crusty with creamy butter!

Grilled Local Calamari & Steamed Mussels - Next comes our appetizer, I had the Grilled Local Calamari, and BF had the Steamed Mussels. I wasn't a big fan on my calamari, but boy, the mussels were extremely good. I used the Mussel sauce for the bread too. Portions were more than enough, more like a entree size.

Truffle Risotto & Angus Flat Iron Steak - Ok, by now, I was almost full! For the entree, I opted for the Truffle Risotto, and BF had the Angus Flat Iron Steak. The risotto was very fragrant! Love it! I didn't try the steak, BF said it was pretty good.

Blue Cheese with Fruits & Currant Grapefruit Granite - Finally, it was dessert time ... I was too full by now. But still, we ordered the Blue Cheese with Fruits and Currants, and Grapefruit Granite. The Blue Cheese was a little heavy for ending my meal, it was good, but too heavy for me. The Grapefruit Granite was perfect, light, real grapefruit flavor!

I had to take the risotto home, it became our next day dinner. Definitely a very nice little restaurant. I would love to come back!
author: Sandi C.

description: The restaurant is right across from the marina area, so it is in a great location. All of the food that we ordered was flavorful, fresh, and very memorable. Not pictured is the bread.. I think we asked at least 3x for a refill because it was so fresh - right out of the oven, crispy exterior and soft pillowy center! I would recommend getting the crab salad, grilled octopus, bass and spaghetti for two people. We were comfortably full and felt that were able to taste a range of the various options at the restaurant. We will definitely going back the next time we visit SF.
author: Julia K.

description:
Me and my husband went there to celebrate his bday. We ordered 2 prefixed menu and it was a lot. Their orders are family size and big portion size. The service is very fast and the  food kept coming at a faster pace then we could eat it. 
The next table couple did a smart thing by ordering one prefix menu and one extra appetizer. I think that wld be enough for 2.
By the time entree came I was super full. We stopped eating for a while to make sure the deserts did not come out early.

We ordered the mussels and they were ok. We got some which were really bad tasting.
The salmon Appetizer was good. The steak was the best. The seasonal fish wasn't that great.

I am giving 3 star for the fact that service was too fast and we felt like we were rushed. The food was ok. Maybe we would have a better experience  if we would have checked Yelp before ordering.
author: Tejal D.

description: The food here is absolutely delicious!!! We were so impressed with every single dish we ordered. All dishes are meant to be shared, as they come out to the table as soon as they are ready one at a time, and the restaurant suggests two dishes per person, which was perfect for us. We enjoyed the baked goat cheese, mussels, duck breast, and truffle risotto. This was one of the best, if not THE best, meals I have ever enjoyed. Everything was PERFECTLY prepared. We also ordered the flourless chocolate cake for dessert, and it did not disappoint. If I lived in San Francisco, I would be back regularly. The prices are also VERY reasonable for the quality of food received, and the service was great. Wonderful experience...I highly recommend.
author: Marisa M.

description:
Excellent service and food! Our waiter, Jonathan, was very knowledgeable and passionate about food. He gave us recommendations on what to get for our dinner. 

We decided to order from the 3 course menu. Everything on the menu here is meant to be shared, so you do not have to worry about not getting a  taste of everything.

We ordered the calamari and goat cheese for the appetizer, the iron steak and spaghetti for the main course, and the amaretto and honey goat cheese for the dessert. As for drinks, I got the "Number Seven", it is very delicious champagne mixed with black berries. Everything was bursting in flavor. Such a delicious meal and will definitely be back! We came out stuffed!
author: Kathy N.

description:
Isa has a problem. Its problem is that its foie gras dish is so out-of-this world good, very few dishes can compare, including its own. 

Had I not had the foie gras, perhaps I would've been more wowed by their truffle risotto (which I thought was mediocre) and perhaps that chicken would've been so mind blowing, I'd be raving about that instead (now that I think about it, I've never had better chicken--ever.)

Come here. Do order the foie gras, but ask for it to be served last, or else you'd be eating mouthfuls of delicious food yet still longing for another bite of that heavenly foie gras.

Another note: don't order the grapefruit granite for dessert. While I was eating it, I thought it would be much better as a palate cleanser than a dessert. It turns out, that's what it was intended for initially.
author: Newton L.

description: Family Style dining means you get to try more of the menu! At Isa you will be happy to have a bite of anything that comes to the table. The recipes have remained unchanged over the years and the warm ambiance is the perfect place for a date or family gathering. Each dish we tried was rich and warming with complements of texture and flavor. The potato wrapped sea bass was our favorite and the flourless chocolate cake melts in your mouth. The soju cocktails are delightful infusions, but be careful with soju it sneaks up on you. Isa is located in the Marina District just blocks away from a beautiful view of the bay.
author: TrueGaines P.

description:
Good place for nice dinner. We went there on our last night in SF for dinner. We were not disappointed and all our dishes were great. The only thing was the creamed corn soup didn't taste creamy and was a bit watered down. We told the waiter and he promptly took it away and said he would take it off the check as well. What awesome service!!! Our service there was top notched and our water never went emptied. Solid establishment with great food and better service!!! Kudos to the owners and their staff. Will definitely return when I'm in SF. 


p.s.  They have pre fix 3 course menu during the weekdays for $30
Wish I knew that!!! Please go try this place out.
author: J C.

description:
Yummy food!! Husband and I came here with a friend of our's over the holidays and had a fantastic time. Our friend had recommended this place, so we were excited to try this little spot near the Marina.

Like previous reviewers have stated, the food are all small plates, so they are meant to be shared. With that being said, the three of us split the following:

- Dungeness Crab Salad
- Grilled Local Calamari
- Steamed P.E.I. Mussels
- Truffle Risotto
- Halibut with Artichokes, Tomato Confit, Olives, Basil and Zucchini
- Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast 

All were great, with the exception of the Truffle Risotto. IMO, it was oversalted, had too much cream and butter, and the texture was past the recommended soft chewiness.

The Duck Breast was tasty, and a little on the rare side. I had never eaten Duck Breast being slightly rare, but it was really yummy. The accompanied tossed salad provided the tartness to offset the smokey flavors in the duck. A total winner, I'd get this for myself next time.

The Halibut was well seasoned and cooked well, with not too much butter. I enjoyed the basil zucchini flavors with olives, total umami.

The rest were well done, and throughout the entire meal, we marveled over the freshness in ingredients with great technique. Often times, you go to a place that doesn't get both right. Isa does it right, and at the end of the night, we were very happy with our meal. Service was attentive without being stuffy, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is really warm and lovely. We didn't opt to sit outside on the patio, but I'm sure it is just as lovely.

Another side note of great service, Husband and I got there early and had to wait for our friend to arrive. The hostess was super sweet, and told us that we had nothing to worry about in losing our reservation. In fact, she let us pick our table, and she kept it open as many people starting flocking into the restaurant! It was a really sweet gesture, and we appreciated it much. As we waited, the bar staff offered us some drinks, but all I ended up getting was water. Next time, I will try their fresh-squeezed juices.

Anyway, it's a good thing that I don't live close by, otherwise, I'd be here every few weeks! Next time I'm in town, I will definitely be coming here again. 

You should go....NOW!
author: Tara L.

description: Consistently tasty food. Good, friendly, service. It's never pretentious here, I always feel very comfortable. Varied menu, good veggie selections. The halibut is excellent, veggie sides like corn and haricot verts are all excellent. Great truffle risotto. There's nothing bad I can say about this place.
author: Artemis K.

description:
Romantic ambiance and great customer service. Our waiter (I forgot his name but I do remember he's from Cambodia, it may have been Dean) had excellent suggestions and great energy. 

Now... For the good stuff ... We started off ordering one appetizer and ended up ordering three more because of how amazing everything tasted. The roasted goat cheese, prawns, yellowfin tartare were equally tasteful and satisfying. For the main dish I ordered the sea bass and loved every bite of it. Keep in mind there is no side with the sea bass but it was still worth every dollar. 

I finished my meal off with the flour less chocolate cake which tasted good but not anything unique from what I've tastes at other restaurants. I think the vanilla bean creme burlee was a better option (I stole a bite from my friend).
author: Shireen K.

description: This was one of the most wonderful dinners I've had! So delicious! The service was very personal, welcoming and nice. The waiter told us a story of the place, shared his recommendations and came back to check if everything was ok several times. The food was incredible! The chef is so talented! Definitely is going to have a special evening spent there.
author: Daria L.

description:
Came here for dinner at 7:30pm and stayed until 10pm. The service w as excellent! Our server Nathan and Julio were very attentive with our table refilling our water and wine very promptly. The red wine we had (forgot the name :/.. Chateau something) was moved from a wine bottle to this really cute wine container to pour into our glasses. The servers were friendly and willing to give their honest opinions on recommendations. They joked around with us and talked to us which is a thumbs up because it showed me they were attentive and wants the customers to feel welcomed and relaxed. 

We had 4 orders of the Maine Lobster Broth, one Grilled Local Calamari, and one tomato dish with goat cheese. The soup of the Lobster broth was better tasting than the shrimp that comes with it. The grilled calamari was something different than having the usual fried calamari but it was delicious and the arugula that came with it was even more yummy to me! The tomato appetizer we had, had super sweet tomatoes that came with a crouton-like pieces which added a unique experience to tomatoes which were soft with a crunchy side to it.

For the entree among 6 people with a family-styled dinner, we had two orders of the Roasted Rack of Lamb, which I am not a fan of lamb but the veggies that came alongside it were delicious! Not usually a fan of eggplants but when chopped into pieces with zucchini, red peppers, and olives, it was delicious! Had an order of Potato Wrapped Seabass, which was my favorite entree dish! Flavorful and delicious when paired with potatoes! The last order we had was the Grilled Golden Gage Natural Angus Flat Iron Steak. The steak was well-done and a bit dry, but the zucchini was good and the flavor was very tasty. Four entrees with three different appetizers, we were definitely full, but not too full, meaning we had room for desserts!

We ordered two Vanilla Bean Creme Brûlée, one Flourless Chocolate Cake with vanilla bean gelato, and one order of the Semifreddo All Amaretto. The Creme brûlée was good because it wasn't too sweet, but tasteful enough to enjoy. The Flourless Chocolate Cake was my favorite because it was paired with vanilla bean gelato which tasted super good! Not a fan of the amaretto taste, but I really enjoyed the little cookie pieces inside the ice cream.

Overall, good meal. Will be back because I didn't get to try the Dungeness Crab Salad and Organic Loch Duart Calmon Carpaccio. The service was excellent. The wine had a nice aroma to it even though I'm not a red wine fan. Ordered a bottle to pair with the meal, which was nice. Had a lot of wine options and even offered some soju cocktails. Definitely will be back to try other things. But come a bit earlier than your reservation because parking isn't easy around here.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I came for restaurant week with a decent sized group. We chose this restaurant because it is supposed to be family style. Because it was family style I was expecting portions to be larger, however it was restaurant week and I wonder if the portions were made smaller to accommodate? We ordered the below for a group of 7. 

Arugula salad
Endive salad
Leek soup
Tuna Tower - favorite!! I was expecting some really tall stacking of cubes of tuna, but it was presented nicely and the flavor was so good. I wasn't expecting much from this dish, but it was the best.
Salmon carpaccio
Mussels - ok, normal mussels you can get anywhere.
Goat cheese
Scallops - I was expecting this to be spectacular due to another yelp reviewer, but it was ok. 
Duck breast
Steak - a bit tough and not spectacular
Short ribs - way too greasy for me. The fat and oil completely diminished the flavor.
Semi freddo 
Grapefruit granita - grapefruit juice on ice. haha I liked this after my meal.
Creme brule

They sat us on a small round table so I wouldn't suggest your extremely large group to come unless you like to bump elbows just a little bit. I grew up in a large family so eating while touching elbows and tucked into your side with the person next to you is completely normal to me. There is indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is completely covered so when the weather doesn't permit outdoor seating, it looks like they can make it work. There were heaters for those of us who run on the colder side.

Overall the experience was nice. The food was good and the atmosphere is a fun family style. It didn't blow me away, but perhaps I would come here again for a casual dinner.
author: Christina L.

description:
Super late review, but came here for Dine About Town 2013. Super great value for the 4 course meal per person! Parking is a bit hard to find in the Marina area, but definitely do-able. We had reservations for a party of 7 and were seated immediately at the back of the restaurant. It felt like we were in a garden/patio. Super cute!

My meal consisted of:

Martini: It was still during happy hour time so definitely worth the $5!

Maine Lobster Broth: Pretty good and pretty flavorful. Only a few pieces of tiger prawns in it. I used the provided bread to dip and eat it with the broth. Now THAT was good.

Steamed Prince Edward Island Mussels: Steamed with garlic, white wine, and parsley. I love seafood, so this was def. a plus for me! Loved their mussels especially their flavor. And this dish was just suppose to be my appetizer! I felt like it was already my main course! Plus, I used the provided bread to dip it into the broth and it was so delicious!!! 

Seared Scallops: The scallops was accompanied with brussels sprout, mashed potatoes, bacon and truffle sauce. Love their brussels sprout! I was pretty sad when there were only three scallops though. I wished there were more! But still, it was so flavorful. 

Semifreddo all' amaretto: This was pretty good and was presented nicely! It was soft and not too overwhelming. Reminded me of ice cream/cake and it was nicely paired with the cookies.

Service was excellent that night and I really enjoyed my experience at ISA. The price I paid for the 4-course meal was well worth it!
author: Philana C.

description:
Went on Saturday night with 4 people and sat at the bar. The food was fantastic. The owner made special recommendations about vegetarian options and the goat cheese appetizer and portabelo mushroom, kale, quinoa dish was delish! My companions had the steak with perfectly seasoned and cooked veges. I heard the veal was excellent too. 
The service was excellent, attentive, and so was the ambiance. Nothing pretentious about this place. We met the owner's wife who chatted us up while we wrapped up dinner.

Glad to have met an awesome couple and enjoy their restaurant. Highly recommend!
author: Samina S.

description:
Go for the 3 course prix-fix menu available from Sunday-Thursday. $29.95/per person -- definitely worth it.

Worth trying:
- Steamed mussels. It comes in a large portion with two grilled pieces of bread. The perfect appetizer to start your meal with.
- Seasonal fish (the day I went had halibut!) with artichokes, tomato confit, zucchini, olives and basil. The fish was flaky and light, while the vegetables gave the dish a little oompf of hardiness.
- Angus flat iron steak. The steak was cooked perfectly (bf like his meat medium well done) and juicy. The roasted potato fries were killerrrr.
- Semifreddo ameretto. Soft and creamy like ice cream/gelato. I would recommend to end your meal with this dessert.

Meh dishes:
- Grilled local calamari. The bf says it was too smokey -- I'd have to agree with him on this.
- Grapefruit granite. It was alright, just not memorable.
author: Annie S.

description:
It was nice to experience the same quality of food and service, again. I don't know why its taken ten years for me to go back. well, it's back on my list for a return visit, soon.

Three of us shared the salmon carpaccio. we also had the sweetbreads, seared scallops and the flat iron steak. while the food is plated to serve family style, we decided to eat our own entrees. everything was cooked to perfection. for dessert the creme brulee and the semifreddo. we like this semifreddo best since it wasn't very sweet. In fact, it was quite refreshing. 
 
The staff was very attentive in a non-intrusive way. they even approached us before the end of happy hour to see if we wanted another glass of wine. how great was that! 

We plan to go back for the $30 prix fixe menu sometime this summer. hopefully, they will still be serving it up.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Came here for my sister's graduation dinner last week during Dine About Town. Great service, great food, great atmosphere. Our server was awesome - a little talkative, but genuinely funny. Everyone at Isa is super friendly. If you have the option, sit out back. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants ever.

We had a large party so we all ordered different things but everyone really enjoyed everything that they ordered. I think the only thing that was slightly disappointing for me was their arugula salad, but I enjoyed their yellowfin tuna, duck breast, braised short ribs, and salmon carpaccio. Their creme brulee was delicious as well, as they use real vanilla bean seeds.

Not enough good things can be said about Isa so I'll just keep it short. Definitely come to Isa if you have the chance!
author: Trisha V.

description:
Location: In the heart of the marina district! No parking lot, but hey it's SF right? What can you say 

Customer Service: We were instantly seated since we did have a reservation and although we were 10minutes late due to parking issues they were welcoming still! We were seated and kindly greeted by our server who was so sweet! He was very informative of everything on the menu and he had a sense of humor which is always a plus! Apparently he's been with the restaurant for quite some time and you can tell her does love his job! It's very rare that you come across people that actually love what they do and it shows through him. I believe his name was Dean, I am sorry I'm bad with names but what I know is that he is this older khmer gentleman (Cambodian) and he is just all smiles, I'm sure you wont miss him if you come across him!

Decor: I didn't get to look around the restaurant but as you approach it, it's very inviting! We were seated in the outside patio which I absolutely LOVED, the atmosphere can be thought of in different ways. One it is romantic for all the lovebirds that come because although it is outside it is covered by a tarp and there are heated lamps and the lighting is dimmed but very romantic! For all the groups that come for birthdays or other occasions it's also a an inviting area to just have a good time with good company and have good food! 

Presentation of Food: The portions are fair and you will leave very full!

How did the food taste?: We did the prix fixed menu! We were full and everything was great!
1. Mussels and Calamari for appetizers! The mussels and the sauce were so good paired with their bread. As for the calamari I loved it! Don't expect the fried calamari this is grilled I believe with olives and white beans. Everything was good!
2. I had the steak which was cooked medium rare and the veggies that came with it were perfect! My bf had the chicken and although some people on yelp didn't like it what I can say is that if they replaced the pieces with all chicken thighs it would be better (it comes with chicken breat and a small chicken thigh) Although it was skin was seasoned well and it was crispy so that was  a plus!
3. The grapefruit granite was a good choice for dessert because it does clear your palet after that if you order the semi amaretto it's the perfect ending to a wonderful meal!

Overall Experience: They came out singing happy birthday which was very sweat and had a candle in the semi amaretto plus they gave me a small personal glass of prosecco on the house. Loved this!

Would I Come Back?: Yes!
author: Rosh E.

description: I love French food. This place has amazing fois gras, great cocktails... Loved the scallops too!!!
author: To-Nya S.

description:
The food is served family style. The server recommended ordering approximately one small plate and one larger plate per person from the A La Carte Menu. They also have a prix fixe meal option which includes a choice of one small plate, one larger plate, and a dessert from a more limited Prix Fixe Menu.

Our table of 4 ordered the following:
Loch Duart Salmon Carpaccio - I didn't try this, but the person who ordered it said he liked it.
Yellowfin Tuna - Raw yellowfin tuna cut to small bites presented well on the plate. I don't like raw fish so I didn't try any, but everyone else enjoyed it.
Laura Chenel Goat Cheese - warm and easy to spread on bread.
Calamari - delicious, non-breaded calamari.
Sea of Cortez Wild Prawns - 4 large prawns; these were a little too salty.
Saffron Paella - clams, mussels, calamari, and prawns on rice with lobster broth and red peppers. Definitely my favorite of the night. I would definitely order this again! However, some of the mussel and clam came empty.
Truffle Risotto - Definitely a strong mushroom taste. 
Flat Iron Steak - Cooked medium/rare. Definitely not for me. Other people at the table seemed to enjoy it.
Grapefruit Granite - Like shaved ice with grapefruit juice poured on. Tart. Delicious!
Semifreddo all' Amaretto - Had the texture of grainy ice cream that was more icy than creamy. Good flavor. Strange consistency. Not bad.

The food was overall great! I would give the food 4 stars!

Service was terrible. The server was attentive at the beginning, but I think they actually forgot about us towards the end of our meal. We had to walk over and find the server and ask them where the desserts we ordered were when they didn't arrive after 20 minutes of waiting. Then they only brought us one dessert when we ordered two and we had to find them again to ask for the second one. Then they dropped off the bill and never came back. We eventually just walked the check over to the bar to pay. I ultimately gave them 2 stars for the terrible service. The food was great! Eat here if you have a lot of time and nowhere to go.
author: Karen P.

description:
This place topped all my experiences of fine dining. Delicious food, beautiful ambiance and excellent service. We had a couple fasting in our group hence needed to move the reservation by an hour early, owners were  super accomodative and took great care of our group. Even came later to check on us :). 

We.dined in family style (7 ppl) hence got chance to taste everything on menu (couldn't get better ;) ) its hard to believe how good was each dish. Yum!!
Strongly recommend
- spicy tuna appetizer
- crab salad
- mussels
- grilled ca lamari
- spaghetti
- seafood paella
- fish with potato skin roll. (Dont remmeber name of fish )
author: Chandrika G.

description:
I am very unhappy with the services.   I came to this restaurant because I booked it through SF Restaurant week.   If this is a taste of the restaurant,  well,  I will not recommend for anyone.   The table was at 6:30 - My friend arrived on time while I was stuck on traffic.  At 6:45,  my friend called me and related the menu to me - because the waiter asked her to order the food for all 3 of us - they are back to back booked and cannot wait.  So I had to order over the phone while driving.   I got to the restaurant before 7pm.  I sat down and the waiting began.   The food were delivery one plate at a time to one of us (not all at the same time).  There were long wait before dishes.   Plus,  the table next to me ordered their food after I arrived - they got their appetizer (same dish) before us.  When I asked my waiter, where's our food.  He said,  "Food will come from kitchen when it does".   He could not explain and got upset.  He was irritated and offered to check the kitchen.  But he never came back with an answer.   After that,  the busboy served our food and the waiter poured water from time to time.   Let's just say it did not get any better after.   By the time we paid the bill (we paid cash because we could not wait for another 10 minutes for the credit card transaction),  it was 9pm.    I pitied the poor folks who were waiting near the door for their reservation.   We were one of the first seatings of this restaurant.

Also,  what's this about French food?   It was more like Asian fushion - was this a mislabel?  - Ahi tuna with srirarcha?  For the amount of money I spent (over $60 per person),  I expected more.  This is not it.
author: LouLo L.

description:
Before I left for ten days to Alaska, my boyfriend and I were able to squeeze in a date to Isa during Dine About Town! One of the reasons I chose Isa out of all the other restaurants was because they offer four courses instead of three like most of the other restaurants on the list. (Foodie much? Yes. Must eat ALL the foods.) 

The restaurant is really pretty. We were led to the back where it's decorated like an outside patio. The lights were dimmed and there were white Christmas lights hung across. Ah it was romantic and intimate. Perfect mood for a date. 

First course
Corn soup: Honestly can't remember much about this.
Maine Lobster Broth: It was rich in flavor and had a few pieces of lobster to chew on. Simple but very flavorful. 

Second course
Salmon Carpaccio: Omgosh, this dish was de-LICIOUS. I don't remember exactly what our waiter said but it was something along the lines of the salmon not being sold on the market and it's imported from another country. Yes..something like that. Whether I remember correctly or not, I can for sure tell you that salmon was out of this world. Yum! Definitely recommend this dish. 
Yellowfin Tuna: This was just as delicious as the salmon carpaccio. If you like raw fish, both of these dishes are perfect for a second course. 

Third course
Truffle Risotto: ABSOLUTELY recommend this dish! If you like truffle, you will love this dish. It's rich in flavor and very heavy so we couldn't eat much of it at once. 
Flat Iron Steak: This was a good choice as well. The steak was grilled to perfection (medium rare) and it went well with the zucchini and roasted potatoes.

Fourth course
We had the Vanilla bean crème brulée and Semifreddo all' amaretto. Both weren't too special compared to our rest of our meal. 

Oh and we also took advantage of the $1 oysters! We each had six and they were plump and juicy! Yum! 

All the dishes are served to be shared so be prepared for a lot of food! We were filled to the brim by the middle of the third course so we had a lot of leftovers to take home. I highly recommend Isa for their delicious food and their intimate ambience.
author: Judith L.

description: I'm going to upgrade Isa to four stars from the three I gave it before.  That doesn't make it 33% better, but it's now just four stars whereas it previously was the top end of the three star range.  I've now had two solid prix fixe dinners ($30) here which were good.  Nothing special but sound, properly prepared and tasty.  When you add that to the $5 drinks before 7pm, it becomes a decent value.  Just avoid the $5 white wine glass which is not so good.
author: Norman B.

description: Thanks to Lorenzo for making two out of towners feel special .. everything was excellent!
author: Jay B.

description:
Just visited this weekend for my birthday. The food was very good! Service is a little different...the food comes out as its ready, which is fine, but the menu isn't really set up as family style or tapas. It's more like everyone orders their own dinner, and they all come out at different times. 

Overall it was a good experience! The servers were really sweet and brought me out a glass of sparkling wine with my birthday dessert. Would recommend to others!
author: Katie B.

description:
I have heard such good things about this place so I had to give it a try especially when they offered the Dine About Town.  Went with a friend who is a fan of this place.  Now how can I refuse?

Making reservation was simple but finding a parking is a nightmare especially on a Friday nite in this part of the town.  As I entered, I noted that the place is a bit cramped with very little room to move around just to wait for your table.  Finally we got seated and yet the close proximity from the next table is close to zilch.  But I was glad to see that it is packed which gave me hope that it is a good place to dine.

Their they gave us the Dine About Town menu which if you haven't already known, showcase the Appetizers, Main entrees and Desserts that they will serve.  My friend and I started with a cocktail.  They were quick and good.  We ordered a sleuth of appetizers to seriously meet our palates for the evening.  

We ordered the dungeness crab salad, sauteed garlic prawns.  Both were absolutely delish! Next came the skirt steaks and the scallops.  Interestingly, our waiter which had a very heavy french accent did not bother asking us how our steak is done.  It came out bloody raw.  That really was the height of the nite that made me disappointed with this place.  We had two orders that never seemed to come out or want to come out.  So we cancelled that.  We finally ordered desserts which I am not a fan of amaretto or gelato.  They both came out half melted already.

All in all, quite disappointed with the service along with the ambience. I was told that they have a good size patio out in the back. They used brown paper you often seen when you buy something fragile they wrap with in store as a table cloth.  How plain is that?!!!  Our waiter either did not understand English or just plain dumb. It made a very uninviting nite for my friend and I.

I would say, given that it was a Dine About Town, the time and money spent would be ok I suppose.  On any other occasion, I probably would be reluctant to come back.
author: Angela L.

description:
I finally got to try Isa for a friend's birthday! We were a group of 15; with reservations, we just waited about 5 minutes. 

Unfortunately I came here not-so-hungry along with a few other not-so-hungries. So in order to be able to try more items with our tiny appetites, we decided to share a bunch of starters and entrees. We got mussels, tuna tar tar, grilled calamari, seared scallops with orzo, and truffle risotto. My favorite was the truffle risotto. So rich and flavorful! Mussels and scallops were a tied second. The mussels were perfectly cooked leaving the best garlicy sauce for the bread.
I'm surprised at how much we all still ate considering how full we were when we got to the restaurant. That's how good everything was!! 

Also I want to mention how great their service was. Although we were a huge group, and some of us picky (and needy) and part of the group sharing a bunch of dishes instead of ordering their own 3-courses, everyone serving us was delightful. They still explained the specials of the days, popular dishes, etc and didn't seem annoyed one bit even when they were constantly talked over. That takes much patience!

I can't wait to come back again and maybe do their prix fix --ballin' on a budget!
author: Athena L.

description:
Another great French restaurant in the city. I like the concept of sharing the dishes and eating as the dishes arrive.  

Even though we ate at Isa two months ago, I can still remember it like yesterday. Goat cheese, black truffle risotto, steak, blue cheese and fruit dessert were standout delicious. 

Prices were good especially if you catch their deals for prie fixe meals and come with a party of 4 to try everything! 

I would love to return to try Isa's other dishes, and I can't forget the goat cheese.
author: Winnie L.

description: Really want to love this place but the quality of food worth two stars even I give them a second chance(been there twice). Food is cheap(3 courses@29.95), quantity is good too but nothing more than that.
author: Mandy W.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE!  I came here for sf restaurant week, and i'm very glad that I got to try this place out.  The service at this place was exceptional, all the servers and waiters were proud of working at this establishment and were always friendly and came to check up on us often.  The only thing is, they don't have a system of splitting up tables between the waiters, so we had a lot of people asking if we'd been helped/if we ordered/ etc, because they didn't know if anyone else had done it yet.  I suppose  its better to get too much service than too little.  

The food here is amazing!  Chef Eduardo (excuse me if I spelled his name wrong) executed all the dishes beautifully.  I had the endive salad, which was nice and light.  The apples and mandarin oranges balanced out the arugala nicely :).  For the second course we had the salmon carpaccio, which was excellent!! Highly recommend.  I wasn't a huge fan of the crostini that came with the salmon.  The crunchiness of it took away from the texture of the salmon, so I ended up just eating the salmon by itself. :P  Also had the Prince Edward Island mussels, which was light and tomato-y.  Very yummy.  For our main courses, we had the braised short ribs and maple leaf farm duck breast.  Both were absolutely out of this world!  Warning:  both of the entrees were on the heavier/richer side, and very decadent.  The braised short ribs were melt-in-your-mouth good, and very tender and flavorful.  The duck breast was also very tender, slightly rare on the inside, and very fatty, which is to be expected of duck.
