3. Grapefruit Granite -- Never had something like this before, and was not disappointed! Grapefruit flavor was sour, sweet, and tangy. Flavor was lost after a few bites though, and was more icy.

Main negative of this place: extremely slow service. Don't get me wrong, I love taking my time wining & dining, but not when I have to feed my parking meter 3 times for an unexpected 2.5 hour dinner. 

Other Tips:
1. Small restaurant, so reservation is needed!
2. Parking is extremely limited in the Marina, so bring lots of quarters for the meters!
author: Evelyn S.

description:
500th review! :D I dedicate it to the mister who bravely tries out a lot of new restaurants with me.

I reserved a table here for the mister's birthday. It happened to be during the Dine About Town week, and even though I prefer to select items a la carte, their DAT menu looks extensive and so I decided to give them a try. They serve their food family style here anyway, which is interesting for French cuisine, but I like it that way.

First off, we ordered some cocktails. They were so-so -- I felt like the alcohol was a bit weak in them. Maybe it was because they were made with soju.

We started with the butter lettuce salad and the dungeness crab salad. Both were pretty good, and there were quite a bit of crab in the salad. We then had the foie gras, which was delicious with the sauce (some sort of berry?) and the brioche. The server recommended a sweet wine with the foie gras and that paired surprisingly well.

Then we had the scallops with asparagus and mashed potatoes, and the duck breast with huckleberry sauce. Both of the main entrées were done exceptionally well -- the scallops seared but not overcooked, the duck breast super tender and well seasoned. The portions were generous given the prices too!

The desserts were not bad. I like the creamy texture of the créme brûlée but was disappointed with the cookies that came with the amaretto icee. 

To be honest, I was a bit worried at first, since I never had great experiences with special menus that they have to cater to many people (e.g. Valentine's day meal, Thanksgiving, etc). However, the food quality, while not absolutely superb, was excellent nonetheless; and the price-to-quality ratio was amazing. The prix fixe menu here is definitely a must-try for the frugal eater who wants to have some good French cuisine for a change.
author: Alice C.

description: Everything I have had here has been good. Like everything. It´s a safe bet. Service is always good and it´s a good spot for when you need a larger table too as outer area can fit many.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Lovely evening but weak pours.

My first time at Isa didn't disappoint.  We were seated out on the patio, and our server gave us a very thorough explanation of the menu.  We had the tuna, prawns, lamb and risotto to share between the two of us.  Flavors were good but specific comments are that the prawns were over priced and the risotto, though very flavorful, seemed undercooked as it tasted more like rice then a creamy pasta.  

We were completely full after 4 dishes, and I would actually recommend only doing three in total next time (1 app and 2 entrees) instead.  

Overall great experience but one major criticism is that service was so prompt that we actually felt rushed.  And for a Saturday night date, a rushed experience is a bit of a bummer :(
author: Tami S.

description:
Wonderful! Came in on a Sunday evening for a birthday dinner, and enjoyed a leisurely three hour meal.  

They do a fix price menu Sun-Thurs, 3 courses for $30, (bottles of wine around $30). There are a lot of options on the fix price menu, as well as the regular menu a la carte. The plates come out one at a time, intended for sharing- perfect if you always want to try everyone's plate, like I do. 4 plates plus dessert was perfect for two people. 

To start off, even the fresh bread and butter is really good. The salmon with the capers was very fresh. I loved the potato leek soup! It was really wonderful, some of the best I've had. Delicate flavor, buttery and delicious! 

Really loved the truffle risotto- I love truffles, I love risotto- this was amazing! The flat iron steak was perfectly cooked and flavorful, with just a small topping of a tangy cream sauce. It was excellent. Awesome flavors.

Blue cheese and currants plus a grapefruit granite- sooo good!- were the perfect ending, along with the waitstaff's happy birthday serenade! Look for Dean for especially friendly service and food/wine recommendations, he was great! We were seated in the back porch area under the heat lamps and string lights, plenty warm. Nice atmosphere, quiet enough for a romantic dinner.
author: Kelly T.

description:
I've been to Isa a handful of times, and have always loved it.  My last visit was for a surprise bridal shower we were throwing a girlfriend - couldn't have picked a better spot for our celebration!  

I would go to Isa for the ambience (beautifully lit outdoor closed patio - I'd recommend requesting to sit outdoors every single time) and service alone.  The fact that the food has gotten significantly better is just an added bonus!
author: Nikki G.

description:
Date night with husband on a Monday night turned out to be great! 

We got pre-fix menu - Salmon carpaccio, Steak and blue cheese for desert at $30 plus Foie Gras, Tuna & Lobster soup on top of this 5 drinks at happy hour prices ($5) - total dinner cost - $140

Drinks were great! Food was yummy. Blue cheese was terrible. Service was attentive!
author: Anelya S.

description:
This restaurant is tapas style, but with french food.

Service is impeccable. There are a couple tables inside, but most of the seating is outside. 

The menu is filled with a great variety of proteins, spices, vegetables...we were overwhelmed so ordered from the prix fix at $30/person. 

We shared an order of the calamari which was not fried calamari. My brother and I really liked it, mom and dad could pass on it. Also, each table is served bread and butter, and the butter is mmmmmmmmm....top quality. Ate a ton of this, and we actually had to tell them to stop bringing it!

I had the mussels as my first course...soooo good. The broth was not the typical white wine and butter. Tomatoes and more flavor, and served with really good bread. For my meal, I had the chicken. It was pretty good and was accompanied by mashed potatoes. 

The dessert options were mostly cheese or ice cream. I didn't want cold or super sugary, so had the goat cheese with honey and candied walnuts. Was good, but very rich for the end of the meal.

We had a nice dinner, and would love to try other items from their menu...scallops, butter leaf salad...and many other things!
author: Amy O.

description:
Isa was a great place to enjoy a Friday night dinner with the girls!

Dungeness crab salad was great, fresh and well seasoned. The mussels were also surprisingly good! For our entrees, we tried the flat iron steak, halibut and duck. Although I'm a huge fan of steak and usually do not like duck, the duck really stole the show!!! Well flavored, tender but crispy on the outside. Yummm!

A huge plus about this place is the good portion sizes and nice ambiance. There are two sections of the restaurant, the front is dimly lit and more "romantic" and the back has a brighter patio feel. We were seated in the back area and I thought it was perfect for us so if you are making reservations, request accordingly!  Also, if you arrive before 7pm on a weeknight, you can order drinks for $5, happy hour price! I really enjoyed their Number Seven soju cocktail with champagne, ginger and fresh berries.

The only thing that bothered me slightly was the fact that I felt slightly rushed by our waiter. The service was great but you could tell they needed our table, understandably so, since it was a packed dine about town hot spot and a Friday night. We were asked many times if we were ready to order, food was brought out quickly, so quickly that they did not bring everyone's entree out at the same time. When he brought us our desserts, he dropped off the check and said "just in case you ladies have plans later tonight, wouldn't want to hold you up!"  We didn't really have plans for after, but I think Isa did... 

Overall, I wouldn't say the food was mind blowing but definitely decent.  I'd definitely come back again and try some of their other dishes, maybe on a less crowded night!
author: Gloria C.

description:
I can see why this place is highly reviewed with so many stars!  Having a great dinner experience is not only about the food.  Its also about the ambiance and service as well. 

Before I talk about the very cute decor I do want to address the parking situation.  Isa is in the Marina area with all the bars, restaurants, shops, etc.  Parking on the street is very limited at any time of day but with all the warnings from other Yelpers I kept my expectations low.  LUCKILY everything worked out well. 

On the Isa website they suggest several parking garages and the Wells Fargo parking lot after 6pm.  The Wells Fargo parking lot turns into a legit parking lot with an attendant.  It was $13 flat fee to park and it was a block away from the restaurant.  The Reserve a Parking spot on the website is MUCH more expensive and FURTHER so I would suggest that. 

The cocktails were tasty and I loved sitting outside but it still being covered. 

Food was very tasty.
author: Anya R.

description:
Isa proved to be even better than I had expected. Everything from the ambiance, to the friendly waitstaff, to the delicious food...it was a perfect night! 

Another point that I feel is important...this isn't just one of your restaurants where you're paying for an expensive meal and you leave hungry and need to stop by in n out after...you get large enough portions to get knocked into a food-induced coma.

I came here with the gf to try out their Dine about Town menu, which had a huge selection to choose from for both the appetizer and main course.

Starters: Salmon Carpaccio + Dungeness Crab Salad.  Fresh, long strips of salmon with capers, lemon creme sauce and some egg to go along with some bagel chips.  If you're a fan of raw salmon, this is a MUST GET. The dungeness crab salad had large chunks of dungeness crab combined with some other interesting ingredients that I felt mixed well (avocado, taragon, grapefruit, apple).

Entrees: Flat Iron Steak - tender, tender pieces of steak with string beans and potatoes to accompany.  Duck breast - Again, sizeable portions of duck breast to go along with a tasty salad.

Dessert: Grapefruit granite + creme brulee: I wasn't a huge fan of the creme brulee, but the grapefruit granite was described as a grapefruit sorbet, but it was more like a shaved chunks of ice with (natural) grapefruit flavoring. 

Definitely a must-try! Parking can get a little tricky because it's on a small street, but it's well worth the trip!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Second time here and it confirms why this place is one of my favorite restaurants. Great ambiance (sat in the back this time, beautiful set up they got back there), attentive service, amazing food. After raving about this place to the boyfriend, we came back after using VillageVines (totally worth it btw), and I'm glad the place lived up to the expectation again.

Foie Gras -- Again, this time around confirmed that this may be the best place I've had foie gras. I love just the simplicity of eating it as is--no fuss--just straight forward foie gras melt-in-your-mouth-amazing. 
Duck - Still rich, still delicious, still one of my favorite dishes to order
Seabass - Savory, lots of flavor. At this point, I started getting too full from all the heaviness of all the food
author: Diana Y.

description:
I chose this restaurant for a friends birthday dinner because it was highly recommended by a few of my friends. By looking at the pictures on Yelp I thought it would be a much larger restaurant but it was very quaint and adorable.

With the amount of people we had, we were able to sample several different plates and share.  Since everything on the menu is considered a small plates the waiter recommended to order two plates per person. This was plenty of food and it was more than I could eat. I would recommend to pick a few items and just share family style.

The crab salad was delicious and had very large delectible lumps of crab. The tuna tartare was by far the best dish on the menu and is a MUST TRY!!! The grade of the Tuna is made from the highest quality (the waiter says it cannot be purchased any where!). The shrimp had a wonderful sauce that had a nice kick to it. It was a very popular item for everyone to dip and soak their bread in. YUMM.

Definitely a great place to share with friends.
author: Tracy N.

description:
My fiance and I got engaged at ISA! :)

This restaurant was so perfect for our engagement.  We were seated towards the back of the restaurant, which had a garden-type feel to it, with string lights hanging from the ceiling/walls.  It is an extremely cute restaurant.

Our servers were Dean and Jonathan.  The two of them made my fiance and I feel so well taken care of.  Dean gave us great recommendations for our dinner and I am absolutely glad we took his recommendations.

We had the yellowfin tuna and maine lobster broth to start.  We also ordered the seared scallops and the potato wrapped seabass.  Every dish was extraordinary.  I especially liked the slight crispiness of the potato wrapped seabass.

For dessert, we ordered the flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean gelato.  It was so light yet decadent.  Definitely a must-try.

Our experience at ISA was so pleasant  that we will most definitely be coming back to celebrate our anniversaries in the future (even though we live in Los Angeles now!)
author: Anna L.

description: This place f*cking rocks!!! Get the sea bass, trust me. Food is great, service is great, and atmosphere is great.
author: Paul L.

description:
My wife and I had a really excellent dinner at Isa.  We were seated promptly and invited to sample drinks from the happy hour wine and cocktail menu which is $5 before 7p.  After taking our drink orders, our waiter told us about the specials and recommended several of his favorite selections from the menu.  The dishes are served tapas style with a recommendation of 2 plates per person.  Everything we had was very good but the potato wrapped sea bass was extraordinary.  

All-in-all we had a first rate experience at Isa and would definitely like to come back again.
author: Mark A.

description:
This place is excellent! We went here for Dine About Town and the place was packed. The service was extraordinary, even though I was late (as usual) we were able to get seated immediately. I ordered the dungeoness crab salad for my appetizer, the steak for entree, and the creme brulee for dessert. The salad was fresh with plenty of meaty crab pieces sprinkled all over the top. The steak was decadent and juicy it left me wanting more. My friend ordered the duck and I can honestly say, it was the best duck I've yet to have in the city. They even gave us a complimentary glass of wine for DAT. 

As it turns out, they have a regular prixe fixe menu during the week that is a little cheaper than the DAT price, although I wouldn't mind paying full price for the quality and service this place gives!
author: Le D.

description:
After seeing the ROTD of this place I had high hopes. The menu itself looks all really good. The restaurant was nice looking and clean on the inside. I was not impressed at all however with the quality of food and service.

The waiter at first was very attentive but after our main course it seemed like he was forgetting about us.

We had the Dine About Town menu and had the following:

Dungeness Crab Salad: The flavors of the salad did not come together in anyway.  The grapefruit did not go well in the salad. There was a large piece of crab cartilage attached to one of my pieces of crab too. The leaves of the lettuce were way too big and a bit bitter. There was also way to much thyme that it overpowered all of the other flavors. The crab was really tasty and fresh though.

Duck Breast with Spinach: The duck was very salty but cooked well. The spinach on the side was really tough. It should have been cooked or blanched for a tiny bit. If I wanted a spinach salad I would have ordered one but I've never gotten raw spinach with a main dish, it is always cooked. The vinaigrette on the spinach was good though.

Vanilla Bean Gelato with Biscotti: This was my favorite part of the whole meal. Although I'm thinking they didn't actually make the gelato and possibly the biscotti. This makes it hard to give my compliments to the chef and the restaurant if they didn't make this themselves. I could be wrong though.

***Another thing that I noticed was that the salt on the table was in a small dish and didn't have a spoon. How many people have put their fingers or used silverware in that? Eww. (I'm pretty sure this is a health code violation too.)

Overall I wasn't impressed and I probably won't be back.
author: Kristyn W.

description: Isa is quite simply the best French restaurant in San Francisco; food is outstanding, service is extraordinary and the owners take great care of all customers, especially repeat folks. I have been several times over the last few years and every time, the food is consistently perfect, whether you are a vegetarian  or a carnivore, you will enjoy everything they offer
author: Patricia S.

description:
This was my second time coming here. The first time I went with friends and sat in the back underneath the tent. It was great for our large group of girls. This time my boyfriend and I took his mother out to dinner. We made a reservation on open table- which was very convenient! I heard someone at the door trying to get in without a reservation and it sounded like it wasn't going to be possible on a Saturday night. 

We sat towards the front, had fabulous service and quality food. The food is shared, family style. The recommendation was 2 food items per person. We ordered 5 total items based on this recommendation and had way too much food. We are pretty big eaters so I honestly believe 2 items per person is a bit much. The soju drinks here are great and our favorite food was the Laura Chenel goat cheese. Best I've had in a very long time.
author: Allyson R.

description:
As a self-described French small plate restaurant, patrons are encouraged to share food family-style. This works out well because once you see the menu, you will want to sample everything, and sharing allows you to do just that while still getting a satisfying portion of everything. Some of our favorite dishes are the Dungeness Crab Salad, Roasted Rack of Lamb, Truffle Risotto, and the Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast. The one exception my boyfriend and I make to the rule is with the Hudson Valley Grade A Foie Gras, which is simply too delicious not to hog. Instead, we always order individual servings of the foie gras.  

The atmosphere is excellent. I love dining in the back patio area, which is hermetically sealed by an expansive canvas canopy and kept toasty with numerous patio heaters. The front offers a slightly more intimate environment. Overall, though, the environment is on the casual side, for French dining anyway. 

Make reservations ahead of time and to allow time for parking since it is smack in the middle of the shops along Chestnut.
author: Jenny C.

description:
We did the dine about town menu and between the four of us, were able to try almost everything. The restaurant is listed as French, but there wasn't much French on the menu - truffle risotto, yellowfin tuna (tasted like tuna poké), scallops with orzo, short ribs with mashed potatoes to name a few. The dishes ranged from okay to good, but nothing was great. Also, the waitress said the dishes are family style, but there was nothing family style about them. Family style means either big portions that are meant to be shared OR dishes with only one hero element so all the different dishes form a complete meal. Our entrees were normal portions with normal sides and garnishes like any other restaurant.

Although our waitress was nice, we had a rude encounter when we first arrived with whom I think was the owner. I ordered wine at the bar and it tasted sour. When I told him I thought my wine had turned, he denied it saying, "I don't think so because I just opened that bottle." As if wine can't go bad unless it's opened? He then pours himself a glass in front of us, drinks it and says, "Nope. Tastes fine to me." We were appalled. When I asked if I could get another glass, he said, "Fine, but I'm going to make you taste it first so I don't waste another glass of wine." It was almost comical.

I've never sent a drink back before, but I've seen it happen at much better restaurants with much more expensive wines and the response is always apologetic, no questions asked. Whatever complaints they might have is made behind the scenes. This guy made a big stink over a $5 happy hour glass of wine and shocked everyone at the bar. There are way too many great dining options in this city for us to ever return.
author: Janny J.

description:
So impressed by the quality of the food and the level of service from the staff. 
Every single course was perfect: lobster broth, bay shrimp, scallops, and creme brulee.
author: Elvina L.

description:
I had a quite a few wonderful dining experiences at Isa. I am a fan of french cuisine and Isa did not fail to impress me. The service was great and the food was prepared with attention. Its a shame that California banned foie gras, it was my favorite thing on the menu!

Duck Breast- This was pan fried and cooked to perfection. I loved this dish

Flat Iron -again, cooked to perfection and the sauce went very well with the steak

Dungeness Crab salad- Perfect way to start your meal. You can tell the crab was amazingly fresh 

I hope the foie gras ban goes away so I can enjoy your magic again!
author: Gary Y.

description: I was looking forward to trying this French restaurants with gluten-free options and organic ingredients. It is located near Chestnut Street, which makes it a great neighborhood restaurant and post-shopping retreat. The place is decorated in a cozy and somehow elegant manner. The menu offers a variety of dishes that are definitely appealing. We ordered the crab salad which was perfectly seasoned, but a little light on the crab. We then had the sea bass encased in a crispy potato crust and served with a tablespoon of chopped tomato and capers. The fish was cooked to perfection, but the taste of fried potato sort of ruined the experience. A little too oily to me. Some extra vegetables would also have been welcome on the plate. We also had the paella, which was tasty and more generous in quantity, although the rice was sticky like a risotto. For dessert, we chose the chocolate fondant which was disappointing. Not rich and dark enough in chocolate, too much egg and sugar and flavored with orange peel (not mentioned on menu). The vanilla ice cream that came with it was more satisfying and authentic. Wine was fine. Service was excellent - efficient and attentive - but I think the food could use a little upgrade in terms of presentation, added vegetables (could not see any sides on the menu), and quality of ingredients.
author: Alexandra L.

description:
I have been coming here for the past 2 years. The service is what you can expect.  Food quality is decent.  It is nothing spectacular.  Their menu has limited options - I feel like I am ordering the same thing every time.

Overall,  great place with great people.
author: Jo C.

description:
Such a cute restaurant (try to get seating in their back patio with romantic string lights!) with delicious food and a more casual ambiance. The service is super friendly and laid-back.

I ordered their flat-iron steak -- prepared to a perfect medium-rare. So tender and flavorful, I think I finished it a bit too fast, even for myself. I particularly liked the moutarde verte (green mustard) sauce -- such a distinct flavor and it paired so well with the meat! The sides of zucchini and potatoes were very tasty as well.

Husband ordered their duck -- I had to sample of course! It was probably the best duck I've had in my life...so juicy, tender, and balanced with flavor!

We had a large party of 10 and the restaurant was more than accommodating with reservations. We ended up sharing about 10 appetizers among all of us. 

Delicious! We split the bill evenly and it was surprising how reasonable it came out to be!! Would love to come back =)
author: Michelle L.

description:
A good friend of mine and SF local suggested this place when we went out to dinner.  We ordered the goat cheese appetizer: don't forget to spread it on the bread!  It was delicious and well made.  It is always worth it if a place can give me something I couldn't easily make for myself.  

Entree included the steak (medium cooked) with a side of buttered mashed potatoes and green beans (veggies vary based on the season).  I almost ordered the spaghetti but was glad I did not when I saw the table next to us and their puddle of watered down sauce and mediocre looking pasta.  

Everything was fresh and delicious, the steak was cooked exactly how I wanted it and was easy to eat.  Portions were reasonable.

Atmosphere is very quiet and sophisticated.  We were seated in the back porch which is completely covered but still has a rustic edge/out door feel.  

I was very impressed and would recommend this for a special occasion or even a good catch up with an old friend.
author: Rimi K.

description:
Very happy to re-visit Isa after 15+ years.  The first time I visited this restaurant was when it first opened over 15 years ago, and the restaurant was only days old.   The food was good then, and I kept this restaurant in the back of my head.

My husband and I came on Sunday as our date night.  Their prix fixe  was a steal - $29.95 for appetizer, entree and dessert! Happy Hour drinks were only $5!  In addition to the prix fixe, we added foie gras and the wine pairing with it.  

Appetizers:   The salmon carpaccio was fresh.  The steamed mussels were made in red sauce, different than what I normally experienced.  The mussels were small but good.  My ever craving foie gras finally arrived after 30 minutes of placing the order.  It was very good. Melted in my mouth.  But the pairings on the dish (cranberry sauce, slices of pear, etc) were a bit too sweet.

Entrees:  My medium rare steak was deeeelicious!  A perfect medium rare, tender and the blue cheese made the dish stand out.  My husband had the halibut.  It was fine.  A little bland, but it may have something to do with trying my powerful tasting of blue cheese sauce on the steak.

Desserts:  Goat cheese with honey and walnuts was fine.  We really enjoyed it with the grapefruit granite.  Perfect dessert to clear the palate after tasting the heavy goat cheese.  

Drinks:  We ordered 4 Happy Hour mixed drinks and the wine recommended to go with the foie gras.  All were fine but they were VERY small, about 2.5 - 3 oz.

Service:  Service was slow, especially from the bar.  Our waiter was waiting on many tables, and we didn't see him often.   Water glass was empty until I asked for refills.  Took about 30 minutes before our foie gras came out, but the recommended wine that paired with it came out immediately.

All in all, we had an awesome night at Isa.  We liked the food a lot.  Prices were great.  Service could be a bit better, but the food made up for it.
author: L C.

description:
It's not a fancy restaurant rather a family-style place.  They do not serve by courses like most of the french restaurant, but serve by plates when it's ready and for people to share.

Some people recommended me to sit on the back patio, and said it very good, but i was kinda disappointed, maybe it's not as I expected...:P

The food was great though...I mean EVERYTHING!!!

- The fois gras is great...unlike most of the pate-kind of fois gras, this is really a duck liver! Tender, juicy, and just melt in mouth! With peach and brioche, it's just perfect!

- Seared Scallop: Purely for the scallop, I like the one from Bisou better, but I like the side came with it--corn, mashed potato, beans, etc. The sauce is great too!

- Lamb Rack: Love the sauce, and the lamb is delicious! Very tender but not bloody and smelly...Love it~!

- Iron Steak: this one is more average compared to other dishes, it's pretty good and nicely made, but nothing very special.

Now it comes to dessert...Our server recommended us Vanilla Creme Brulee and Chocolate cake.  Creme brulee is average, not very special, but the chocolate cake with vanilla gelato is really really really good!!!!  -- I'm not a super chocolate fan, I only eat chocolate related food when it's really nicely done, but I couldn't stop eating it!!! You HAVE to try this if you go there!!!

Besides the great food, the service is really nice too. All servers are friendly and helpful, and gave us an awesome dinning experience there !

P.S. The parking around the area is pretty hard, good luck for that!
P.S. 2 The restaurant can get very crowded, so make sure to make reservation ahead of time!! :)
author: Chloé N.

description:
I love the idea of sharing food. We stopped here based on the yelp reviews and were not disappointed. Excellent service and fantastic food.

We ordered:

Steamed Mussel Appetizer - the sauce was amazing. We loved dunking our grilled bread in it and cleaned the whole plate. They brought us extra bread :)

Potato Wrapped Seabass - I'm still trying to figure out how they got the potato slices perfectly cooked and crispy without overcoming the Seabass. The sauce complimented the dish very well

Flat Iron Steak - the steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The flavors went well together

I would definitely stop here again on my next trip to San Francisco
author: Dory W.

description:
Came here for DAT and also because I had a Groupon type deal that was about to expire. When making the reservations on OpenTable, it wasn't noted that they're ONLY offering DAT menu. 

I get a call the day of my reservation and the guy is speaking super fast and with an accent, it's harder for me to understand what he's saying. But basically he was calling me to tell me that they're only offering their DAT menu.

We get there and there's only one table with patrons. The hostess was busy chatting with a couple so the host came over to help us.

Their DAT menu is $34.95 and I thought that was super expensive. I had a question about their menu where it was written "dishes are shared". Now I'm thinking, that the dishes are big enough for 2 people to share. I knew that probably wasn't the case so I asked the our host what "shared" meant. He was very rude and made me feel like I was 3 inches tall. He rudely said "shared!!! It means that not all the dishes will come out at the same time and that we'd have to share each other's dishes."

Um ok thanks for the explanation. * can you read my sarcasm?*

They had salt and pepper on the table. The pepper was in a shaker but the salt was in a tiny little dish. Gross! You can bet I didn't touch that germ infested shit! I'm pretty sure I spit in there too while talking. What? They couldn't afford the salt shaker?

We got the steak- tiny portion. Hold up your hand with all your fingers closed and touching ......yea that's how big er...small it was. Don't let the picture fool you. I wasn't asked how I wanted my meat cooked. I'm glad there was some kind of pink in there. It had no taste even though there was sauce underneath it. It was dry. It was tough and chewy with the strings attached. Yes I'm for reals. It came with some nicely seasoned veggies. 

We also got the mussels- most of the shells were empty. The ones that had meat in it , they were pretty small. 

The entree that stood out and was superb was the chicken. The skin was nicely fried and seasoned. And the meat inside was tender and juicy. The mashed potatoes was heaven! It's probably due to a lot of butter. This dish is a MUST!

Vanilla bean creme brulee- yum! Lots of vanilla beans specs.

Vanilla bean gelato with biscotti- yes!!!!

We're not big eaters so we had leftovers. Here's a tip- DON'T let them box anything up for you. You won't get everything boxed. Just what will fit in the box/container and also what they feel like boxing up. For reals! I think half of my mussels were re-served to another patron (ok I really hope not). Most likely it ended up in the trash.

Wait- foie gras?!?!? That's not on the DAT menu!!!! We always get it if it's offered at a restaurant. Reading another Yelp review, I'm glad we didn't order it. And reading another review where the waiter tells the patron that they offer this same 3 course menu for much cheaper?!?! Fucking rip off! 

Our water glasses were always filled up- the other guys were always on top of this! 

The unfriendly host never once came to check on how we were doing throughout the course of our meal. The lady wearing a gray suit did though and she was friendly. 

The mints at the front is super strong (a plus!) but also super nasty. 

Will I come back? No unless I want some bomb fried chicken and mashed potatoes.

Parking is a pain in this area as you may know.

We walked in on a Sunday without reservations and the owner went out of the way to find us a table eventhough it was busy.  We were dressed very casually and thought we would be turned away especially with two teenage boys.  Note - we had never been to the restaurant before but had heard about it and walked by just because we had found a parking space.  What luck!

The waiter explained that it was small plates, family-style sharing which was great for us as we had 5 diners.  Also made it in before 7pm thus got happy hour drinks at $5.  Nice selection of wine by the glass to choose from.  The waiter had a little trouble presenting the small-plate concept and how plates would be tabled throughout the evening.  He did not smile at all, but who cares as we were there for the food and knew how to order and share plates.

We had nine items (two lobster broths w/prawns, 1/2 dozen Pt. Reyes oysters, crab salad, mussels, grilled calamari, scallops, sea bass, rack of lamb, and flat iron steak), two desserts, two cappuccinos, and coffee.  Got out for $220 which is a great value.  Also went through 5+ baskets of warm bread with creamy butter (teens love warm bread and creamy butter) and very attentive care to the water glasses... wow....

The five of us discussed what were the oustanding dishes that would bring us back and noted - lobster broth w/prawns (you can smell and taste the essense of lobster), mussels (teenage son scarfed up most of it), grilled calamari (great grilled taste with a light sauce), scallops, and the rack of lamb (we had it medium rare).  The other four items were good too, but these five just stood out.

Additionally, the plates came out at a staggered pace and we could see the waiter was keeping an eye on our table to ensure that plates were not delivered all at once.  We had no more than two plates on the table through the night (two hour dinner).  Who cares if he did not smile, he knew how to professionally handle the pacing of a dining experience.

I would have to say this is a restuarant that you have to try.  If you live in the neighborhood, count your blessings as you could go more often without dealing with the issue of parking - tough to find spaces.  ISA has great food and great service as they are doing the little things right (making you feel important by going out of the way to arrange a table, proper pacing of the plate delivery, attentiveness to water and bread, etc...).

We will defintely go back and hope we have a similar experience!  Have the French waiter smile!
author: Scott L.

description:
Yum! A new DAT favorite!

I decided to take a backseat to the DAT planning this year and let my other friend take over. Boy, I'm sure glad she did! The main reason we chose this one was not only the menu, but the free glass of wine, which turned out to be an Argentinian Malbec. Not too dry, pretty smooth.

Our waiter explained to the 4 of us that they served all their food family style. Perfect! We chose 4 items from each section, so we got to try a little bit of everything! Our servers were excellent at refilling our bread basket (although why did they only give us 4 pieces at a time??). That bread was mighty good. Crunchy crust, soft and warm middle.

For appetizers, we had the Laura Chenel goat cheese. I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese, but it was manageable and I liked how they played on the typical mozzarella with basil and olive oil. Unfortunately, they were out of the pei mussels, so we substituted for arugula salad that was supposed to come with persimmons (which it did not). Slightly disappointed with the apps overall, but the entrees made up for it. The other apps were the smoked salmon and dungeness crab salad. 

All the entrees were delicious, with the truffle risotto being my favorite. I think my palette is changing... as I didn't feel like any one dish was particularly salty, but I felt like ingesting all of it together was a big salt intake. The flat iron steak cooked medium rare... delicious! The duck and the scallops were perfectly cooked, and all the sides (fingerling potatoes, green beans, brussel sprouts, etc) were also good.

Lastly, we got to try all 4 desserts. I'm not a huge grapefruit fan, but the grapefruit granita (or a glorified snow cone as I like to call it) tasted exactly as you would expect grapefruit to taste. Nothing else particularly extraordinary, but the vanilla bean gelato and the creme brulee were good, and the semifreddo amaretto (like a frozen mousse) slightly better. 

Overall, a very, very satisfying meal with fantastic service! Rounding a 4.5 stars up to 5!
author: Veronica C.

description:
Unpretentious but cool open neighborhoody Marina spot that's great for Dine About Town. 3.6 stars

Food: 3.5, Service: 3.5, Atmosphere: 3.5
Cost to worth it rating: 4
Return worthiness: maybe

Highlights:
- Great dine about town deal: the standard $35 3 courses with a good amount of choices but weeknights they also add in a glass of wine (of their choice)
- Patio: covered patio in the back gives it a casual, open feeling
- Crab salad: no mayo to be found which is just my style. Fresh, light, and delicious cups of crab-filled lettuce paired with avocado, apple, and grapefruit which gave it a nice balance of richness and freshness.
- Scallops: well cooked and enjoyed the bacon, brussel sprouts, and mashed potatoes it came with

Lowlights:
- Solely the dat menu: in case you wanted something else that might be an issue 
- Semifreddo: don't think it was as much a knock on them as me determining something in between an ice cream and a solid texture isn't my thing even if it's flavored with amaretti cookies which I love
- Felt bit rushed with them frantically serving so many tables 

Had a fine night there and wouldn't mind that crab salad again, but didn't quite make it on my list to rush back to.
author: Eve K.

description: Again got outside seating and this time shared the spicy tuna appetizer and the two soups - potato leek and lobster bisque. I really liked both soups. The mussels appetizer was also amazing - the tomatoes in the mussel broth was perfect for my love of tang. Mussels were cooked perfectly! I ordered the mushroom risotto and shared some of the duck. Duck also cooked perfectly! For sweets - got the crema brûlée and the grapefruit granita
author: Jamie T.

description:
My boyfriend & I came here for dinner on Monday night. I've always wanted to try this place based on their 4 solid star reviews on here. Made reservations for 6:30pm. We got there a lil bit earlier than 6:30pm, but got seated right away. The host lead us to the backroom which is like an extension of the restaurant. It's like a tent with string lights strung on the ceiling which gives it a romantic ambiance.

Dine About Town was going on so we went with that. We both got the Dungeness Crab Salad (Yum!), Flat Iron Steak (Bf said it was bit tough to chew; if it was ribeye steak- it would be mucho better), Creme Brulee (very hard top), & Freddo de Amaretto dessert (Almond-y flavor ice cream which was pretty good).

We found street parking right in front of Mel's Diner which was pretty easy.

Service was friendly & pretty fast. Oh & free glass of wine when you go Sun-Thurs during the DAT. ;)
author: Amy C.

description:
Awesome place!  Service was pretty thorough, meaning the waiter explained the menu and resolved any issues we had with allergies, although we had a small wait for the bill.

I got their prie fix set for dinner:

Calamari - had an interesting flavor to it, can't say that I like it or not 
Flat iron steak - I had this medium rare, but it was definitely on the medium side.  It still tasted good.  The fries that came with it were only ok.
Semmifreddo gelato -  very nice texture and flavor

I had a good experience overall and would recommend this place for a reasonably priced french restaurant.
author: Ben S.

description:
Right when you walk in the restaurant has 2 tablets which you can use to explore the menu or play games to occupy your time while you wait to get seated. The restaurant is pretty cramped but at least it has really good service. 

All the food here is served in plates that are meant to be shared, but whether you do or do not is completely up to you and yours. 
I had the:
Free Bread - The bread here is absolutely amazing
Crab Salad - Not too impressive, couldn't really taste the crab
Mussels - Everyone raves about the sauce, it was good but not phenomenal
Sea Bass - I loved the potato outside but the bass itself wasn't too memorable. Still good
Scallops - The scallops were good but I thought the mash potatoes were the best part about this dish. The mash potatoes were so soft and tasty, I wonder if you can order mash potatoes on the side...

Tip: Ask them to add you to their foie gras email list.
Overall 3.5 stars
author: Eddie K.

description:
My friend and I made reservations on a Saturday night. At first, I didn't know that they had a happy hour that goes on until 7PM. When we arrived, we asked the hostess if we could hang out at the bar before dinner, even though we had reservations. She informed us that we could order from the happy hour menu and still have dinner at the same time. Winner winner, chicken dinner!

After ordering a few happy hour drinks, we finally decided what to get. It took us a while because there are so many delicious dishes on the menu! Of all the happy hour drinks I had, I enjoyed the Kir Royale the most. I couldn't believe they had such a large selection of $5 drinks! While we were drinking away, bread was also served to us. It seemed freshly baked and was delicious with the butter they provided. When we were done with the initial basket, a water-boy came by with a new batch without us asking. Awesome!

Our server mentioned that as a family-style type of restaurant, it's recommended to order 3-4 dishes between two people. I'd recommed 3 dishes if you're not too hungry... but 4 if you really are. We started off with a hamachi tartare. It was delicious and the seaweed with a soysauce type of dressing just made the dish! We also ordered the seared foie gras and it was a generously huge portion of fatty goodness! For our entrees, we had the pan-seared scallops and the seafood paella. I would HIGHLY recommend the scallops! It came with 4 perfectly cooked scallops with a delicious potaote puree and asparagus. I was not at all impressed with the paella, but maybe I'm just not a paella person. It was too fishy for my taste. 

Our waiter was not too attentive but we didn't care because we were enjoying our meal. I can't wait to come back and try other dishes! FYI, Bloomspot offers $10 in bloombucks if you spend over $25, take a picture of your receipt, and submit it on the day of your meal!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Fantastic dinner!  The Man and I had dinner here on Saturday (the last night of Dine About Town) and had a great time.  The $1 point reyes oysters were soooo good, creamy and fresh.  The service was efficient, quick and non-intrusive.  I can't stand places that always interrupt your conversation- not the case here.  Our server (can't remember his name, mid 40s, thin & glasses) was super friendly and funny.  

You need reservations though, it was packed even at 10pm
author: Yvette T.

description:
This place has changed since it opened up (according to my parents)

I went there for a birthday dinner. It's a great small restaurant. We were seated at the indoor patio. It's decorated with many plants, very cute.

Service:
The servers were beyond helpful and very friendly. They would check on us from time to time and would made great food suggestions!

Food:  
Yellowfin Tuna Appetizer was perfect! It melted in my melt. To droool for!

Roasted Rack of Lamb was cooked perfectly, medium rare. 

The food was delicious

I would definitely try this place again!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
What a little Marina Gem. Never knew their patio was so cute (and so loud!). My SO and I went here on a date, which was lovely but the place is really loud. Better for groups or drunken dinners, which ours ended up being so it was cool.

The food quality and presentation were surreal. My boyfrined had the steak and I had the duck, which were both cooked perfectly. We also had some prawns, and a couple items on special. I always enjoy ordering the special at small spots like this, as I know it will be the freshest/best thing on the menu.

Wine was good, the list was all I needed. One of my new neighborhood faves for a good meal.
author: Meredith M.

description:
My trusty sidekick Danielle M. and I went to Isa for our New Year's dinner before heading over to the Exploratorium. 

Prix fixe menu for $70 seemed like a great deal considering the amount and quality of food. Plus we each got a glass of champagne.

Appetizers:
Butter lettuce w/blue cheese and candied walnuts. Delicious and healthy! (for the most part...)
Arugula w/pears - light and also healthy. I wanted more pears though.

Second Course:
Oysters were so fresh. I don't usually do oysters for dinner but it was NYE so I figured it seemed appropriate. 
Salmon carpaccio w/capers. Yum! One of my favorite things.

Main:
Scallops - they were HUGE. Perfectly cooked and paired with mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts w/bacon.

Dessert:
Grapefruit granita was a fresh, light end to this meal. 
Vanilla creme brulee. They know how to make it here, with the perfectly torched crust of sugar. 

Merci et bonne année!
author: Sara P.

description:
My friend and I were in SF for a holiday style party and decided to grab dinner. We couldn't decided where to eat and wandered around and stumbled upon this place. We saw a pre-fix menu, so that drew us in.

What we ordered:

Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio
Grilled Local Calamari
Seasonal Fish
Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak
Grapefruit granite
Semifreddo all' amaretto

Portions were a perfect size and we were able to share all our items. For the total cost of $65, it was a pretty good deal. We were so full near the end, we had some left overs. Everything we ordered was excellent. 

When I entered the restaurant, I thought the place was fairly tiny until they walked us to the back. The patio they had out there was great and cozy. I like that it felt like my own backyard. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone and come back when I'm in the city again.

I was so hungry that I forget to take pictures:0X
author: Huong N.

description:
I had dinner at Isa for my birthday and it was absolutely wonderful. The patio in the back is charming. Dean, our wonderful server, was attentive and knowledgeable. He checked on us consistently and always with an engaging personality and smile. His level of service was excellent.

We made it before 7pm and got two happy hour drinks. the house cab was very good. The food was so delicious. My friend and I split the mussels and the goat cheese for appetizers. We both had the sea bass which Dean had suggested, and loved it. For dessert Dean surprised me with a candle in my flour less chocolate cake. Dean and friends sang happy birthday to me.

Overall the food and service were excellent. We had 2 drinks each, 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts all for $110. Fine quality dining for a reasonable price. Definitely check out Isa. I will be back.
author: Heather H.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been here three times for dine about town (no known as restaurant week) and have never been disappointed. By the way, foie gras is back! We didn't try it this time, but we are looking forward to it!

First off, the service here is exceptional. The entire staff has really gotten the system down to take care of their patrons. Not matter how big our party size is, from just 2 or a party of 15, they have kept not disappointed.

This review is only based on their 2015 sfrw menu. I had the leek soup for my first course and it was nice and creamy. I didn't feel like I needed to add salt or pepper. It felt extra nice for the cold weather. My second course was a yellow fin tuna. It was like a tartare with a layer of avocado on the bottom. It was a wonderful combination of two of my favorite things. My third course was the seared scallop with brussel sprouts and mash potatoes. It was like a plate of buttery bacon oil heaven on a plate, in a good way. I even tasted a hint of it with my seared scallops. I just wish there were a few more. My final course was point reyes blue cheese with grapes and raisins. Mmmmm, I love my cheese. I wish they left me some bread for it though. My boyfriend had the creme brulee and that never disappoints. I love it when I can still see the vanilla bean bits on the bottom of this creamy goodness in a bowl.

Overall, they are amazing here! Even sang Happy Birthday to me for my belated :) It was cute.
author: Amimee D.

description:
Holiday Dinner - noun, occasions during the month of December where people tend to overindulge in consuming delicious foods, resulting in unavoidable growth of waist line (see: Holiday Weight).  This year is no different after my first holiday dinner of the year...and I can thank Isa for that.

As a whole, there are a lot of things I like about this restaurant.  The vibe itself is pretty unique considering that it's almost like two separate places in one.  In the front, you get more of a lounge type of feel, with a wine bar and a number of tables bunched together for some casual dining.  However, once you get past the middle kitchen area, the back doors open up onto a covered patio area with heat lamps sprinkled throughout the area.  If you're familiar with Park Chow, it's kind of similar to their rooftop dining area, and I really like both.

The concept of the food at Isa is pretty different too; the meal is meant to be family style with each plate being prepared to be shared amongst the table, rather than as plates for each individual.  As such, the plates will still come out in the traditional order of courses, but on a "ready to serve" basis, rather than at a single time for the entire table at a time.  So accordingly, got a chance to try several different dishes in addition to my own.  Everything was really solid, but as for what I had ordered:

Hudson Valley Grade A Foie Gras - AWESOME.  The portion size for my order was probably the largest I've ever received.  I had to restrain myself from taking huge bites out of it...it was that good.  The poached pear was perfectly sweet and ripe, and I loved the wild huckleberry and custard brioche.  I couldn't find something wrong with the dish even if I wanted to.

Potato Wrapped Seabass - I was a little worried about whether my foie gras and my second dish would be filling enough (it was a late dinner and I was starving), but the sea bass was a very filling second dish.  I remember seeing something similar to the description on an episode of Top Chef, and it pretty much sold me on trying this dish.  It definitely didn't disappoint - it was perfectly cooked, and was rather hefty in size.  Yum!

Creme Brulee - creamy, not overly sweet, and just good!  I loved seeing a whole mess of vanilla bean grinds at the bottom...good to know they didn't skimp on it.  To (literally) top it, the creme brulee had a perfect topping - firm, but cracked easily with a strike of my spoon.  Nothing is worse than a soft crust (see Steps of Rome).

Service was great, and our waiters were so friendly.  Adjacent to our table, there was a small company holiday party going on, and our waiters were kind enough to sneak a couple glasses of their wine to two of my friends.  Talk about brownie points...haha.  The back patio area lends itself to making Isa a decent date spot, but it can get kind of loud for intimate conversations.  However, Isa is definitely a great spot for group outings though.

Lastly, for those on a budget, they do offer a three course prix fix menu for $29 that includes a number of the same dishes you'll find on the regular menu.  It's only offered on Monday-Thursday, but it's pretty worth it (we were here on a Thursday, and all of my other friends opted for that option except for me).  They offer up about a half dozen choices for each of the first and second courses, followed by a handful of choices for dessert.  Definitely not a bad deal and something I'll consider on my next trip back.
author: Mike L.

description:
I want to thank the owner, Sameera for making my 32nd birthday memorable. From the time I booked the reservation to the time all my guests arrived, she went above and beyond to make sure we had a great dining experience. 

I consulted a foodie friend for suggestions on a restaurant that would be delicious as well as accomodating a large group. She gave me several options. After reading all the Yelp reviews on Isa...I decided this will be the place. I was on the phone with Sameera for a good 20 mins. before I gave her my credit card info. to reserve a spot. She told me that on Saturdays there will be Happy Hour on the drinks only from 5:30-7pm (soju cocktails, wine, and regular cocktails). So, I went ahead and booked an early dinner at 5:30pm. I figure my friends and sister can mingle and grab some drinks before sitting down for dinner.

Sameera convinced me to have the party in the patio area. I was worried my guests would be cold, so I went back and forth on the idea. She finally told me it was an enclosed area (think Cirque Du Soleil tent) with heating lamps. I'm so glad I decided to go with the patio. It was cute and totally set a different mood/atmosphere versus the cramped indoor seating. I had about 17 guests total. The other 6 guests had to sit at another table, so we can have enough elbow room. If I plan on doing this again with a big group...I would definitely cap it at 10 people. I like to be able to talk to all my friends instead of jumping from one table to the next.

Also, she had another big bridal party coming in after my reservation which she never told me. However, she came up to me and said you have plenty of time and gave me up until 8:30pm to eat dinner and cut the cake. Once again, I didn't feel rushed at all. Once the food came, we started munching away.

We had such a great waiter. He welcomed us to the restaurant and told us how the menu works. This is a Fusion French restaurant with small plates (family style). He told us each guest should order something from the top menu and one from the bottom menu. We had a master copy of the menu floating around, so everyone can check off their dishes. It was perfect! I was a little worried that we would still be hungry. By the time, all the dishes arrived we were full and content. 

All the dishes were delicious! There wasn't a single dish that I didn't like. We ordered almost everything from the menu, so we can have different samplings. I heard my friends ordering 2 paella dishes. I was going to interject and say only one since I was all paella out from my Spain trip. I have to say their paella was so delicious I'm glad we ordered it. I really loved the lamb chops, foie gras (just freaking melts in your mouth), mussels, duck breasts, tuna tartare, and chicken with mashed potatoes. Everything was excellent, so you can't go wrong! I included pics of all our dishes :)

During our phone conversation, Sameera told me she would waive the cake cutting fee since she wants to make this a great experience for us. She said just refer your friends to come in if you end up liking the restaurant. I told her I will be gladly to. So, $48 was waived for the cake cutting fee. The waiter brought the cake out and all my friends sang, "Happy Birthday" to me. This is one of my best b-days ever and I hope to come back to this restaurant soon :)

This restaurant can be pricey. Our tab came out to be a little over $700. Like I mentioned before, the food didn't disappoint me and I love the intimate and cozy ambiance!

Sameera, thanks again for accomodating such a big group and making this day special for me. I really appreciate it!
author: Melanie B.

description:
What a lovely place! The service was impeccable, and the food was delicious! I was in town with my parents, from Canada, visiting only for a few days (I'm in the US now), and we stopped here, not knowing what to expect.

The restaurant has a great concept of serving all the dishes family style i.e., to be shared all together. The wine was superb, and the waiter was very helpful in explaining well the marvelous dishes, and taking care of all our needs. 

Will definitely be back! Thank you so much :D
author: Emilie D.

description: Food was amazing. Lobster broth was very rich with lobster essence. Dungeness salad was very light, crisp and had a ton of crab meat. The season fish (black cod) was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. We also got one of the friendliest server's with one of the kindest smile I've ever seen. The price for the 4 course meal was something like $38/person which in retrospect is about right although I did go in because I had a friend tell me they have 3 course meals for $25/person - that might have been a while ago?
author: Thomas C.

description:
Butter lettuce salad - with pear, walnuts, blue cheese. Nice light taste, wasn't huge fan of the blue cheese, but when am I ever?

Grilled calamari - a little too soupy, but tasted amaaazing. Didn't look super grilled, but wasn't dripping either. The beans were tasty as well

Seared scallops - with mashed potatoes. Perfectly seared, a light crisp on the outside and moist and tender on the inside. I'm not sure how well it went with mashed potatoes and corn though.

Roasted chicken - with mashed potatoes. Chicken was tender and juicy. The jus that it came in was so flavorful. Not oily at all, just full of flavor.

Flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream - comes piping hot. Flourless chocolate cake in its own dish (burning to the touch) and gelato in a smaller dish. If they put the gelato on top, it would be melted by the time it hit the table. Sank out spoon into the cake and steam came out, that fresh! A true flourless cake. The rest of the meal was absolutely delicious, but I have to say this was perfection.
author: Victoria C.

description: Prix fixe is definitely the way to go. We had salmon carpaccio and arugula salad for 1st course, seasonal fish halibut and truffle risotto for second, grapefruit granita and semifreddo for desserts. Ingredients were fresh and everything tasted delicious. Will definitely come back!
author: Sunny C.

description:
I came here for my New Years Eve dinner. I didn't know where we were eating, as the dinner location was supposed to be a surprise, and I was more than delighted to find out that we'd be dining at Isa.

We arrived an hour earlier than our reservation, however, the waitress was able to seat us promptly in a cozy corner. First off, I have to say how wonderful the service is. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We had one main waiter for the night, even though others came by to check on the food and fill up our glasses. I really wished I had asked the name of our waiter. He was attentive and really funny, and made our night even more enjoyable.

As for the food, Isa was serving their New Years Eve dinner. We started off with some complimentary Champagne. My favorites were definitely the Steak and the Duck. All the elements in the dish worked so well together, and the sauces were simply amazing. I was literally wiping every last drop of sauce with the bread that was served in the beginning. The dessert was also delicious. Even though I was pretty full, I still finished the whole creme brulee. The chocolate cake was freshly baked, and was perfect with the smooth vanilla gelato.

I had a wonderful time at Isa, and spent more than two hours dining there. The restaurant was fully booked that day, and as I was sitting by the window, I was able to see how many happy faces that were coming in and out of Isa. Overall, they have some amazing dishes and top notch service. Hope you all had a great time with friends and family, and Happy New Year everyone!
author: Helen Y.

description:
Came here for DAT a few weeks ago and had an overall great experience. We arrived on time for our 8pm reservation but still had to wait a bit for a table. It wasn't so bad since we were able to sit at the bar and enjoy a drink and play on their iPad. 

The DAT prix fixe was a 4 course meal and the portions were huge so it was great for sharing and trying a lot of different dishes. All of us started with the lobster broth which was very yummy. We used the complimentary bread to dip :) For the second course we each chose something different so was able to try: salmon carpaccio, mussels, lobster salad and oysters.  The sauce for the mussels was to die for and we asked for more bread to use as dip! yum yum yum..  The 3rd course for each of us was just okay. I got the flat iron steak. It was tender and tasty but not WOW. And for the last course, we all got the vanilla bean creme brulee which was so good. They put real vanilla beans so you can really taste the vanilla. YUM!
author: Anna H.

description:
We came here 10 minutes early for Father's Day dinner, and they warmly received us and sat us down at a table. Our waiter was not only handsome, but also prompt, charismatic, and patient as we didn't actually have our order ready when we said we did. He helped us drive our decisions and change our minds to order the best dishes possible.

tl;dr you HAVE to order these dishes:

yellowfin tuna
potat-wrapped sea bass
seasonal fish (mine was halibut)
truffle risotto

long version: 

From the main menu, we ordered the yellowfin tuna and potato-wrapped sea bass. These two dishes are hands-down two of Isa's best dishes. The tuna melts in your mouth and is spiced with the right proportions of soy sauce. The external potatoes on the sea bass is crunchy and delicious, and the sea bass itself is wonderful. When we had it, it was a little old, but otherwise very good.
From the $29.95 3-course deal, we ordered the Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio (raw salmon with bread), arugula salad, seasonal fish (mine was halibut), and the truffle risotto. The fish had a lovely, salty panko-like crust on the top, with zucchini, tomatoes, olives, and what I think were artichokes on the bottom. The vegetables were also delicious, seeing that my family was fighting to get the veggies. 
The truffle risotto is a different story. Oh, my god it was so savory-- it was comfy like comfort food but still refined like fine wine. 

The other dishes we ordered were so-so. The next time I go, I'm going to order the goat cheese and scallops dish. I am definitely returning.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a SATURDAY! Yay! 

Decent selections on drinks + food. $5 each. You can't go wrong with that! Small, cozy place. Great service. I will be back for more!
author: Katherine N.

description:
I made the mistake of booking a reservation here on Mother's Day.  I don't know what I was thinking, so to be fair I can't give them a bad review for the service since the place was packed full and the waiters were doing the best they could. Also, and an even bigger tragedy, the regular menu was not offered but rather a special Mother's Day menu that did not include Rack of Lamb (which is why I went there in the first place).  So, I shall return and hopefully the next time will be more enjoyable.

The food was OK, nothing to get excited about.  The lobster broth was just plain awful. I mean it was seriously bad. I love a good lobster bisque so this slop was enough to ruin the meal.  I hope they reconsider this offering.

My date had the halibut (good) while I had the braised short ribs (very good) with a side of wallpaper paste that they call mashed potatoes.

Overall impression: not as good as they hype would suggest.  The place is tiny, tiny, tiny on the inside and the customers are packed so tightly that the waiters are constantly bumping into them.  I don't know why they think it is appetizing for customers to walk past the kitchen on the way to the tables.  It was not at all pleasant. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area, so if Isa is busy you may wish to go across the street.
author: Daniel M.

description: Isa is great for parties that are looking to share food. All of the appetizers are wonderful! The ambience is romantic yet casual, and is friendly for families and couples alike. The happy hour cocktails were amazing as well!
author: Lisa I.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Isa during Dine About Town this year. While looking for a restaurant to try out, I wanted to try something different than usual and French is something we don't have very often. After looking at several different menus, I loved that Isa offers small plates - that just means more food for me to try! I love the atmosphere here, especially in the back indoor patio area we sat it. Very casually upscale.

We chose to try the Maine Lobster Broth/Potato and Leek Soup, Yellowfin Tuna/Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese, Seareed Scallops/Truffle Risotto, Semifreddo all'amaretto/Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee. Everything was good, however, I especially liked the Potato and Leek Soup, Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese, Truffle Ristotto, and Semifreddo all'amaretto,

Although they serve up "small plates", each plate is a generous serving and you won't leave hungry.

We liked it so much and when my mom saw our pictures of the food, we decided that we'll be back for Mother's Day this year! Can't wait!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Overall I give them 3.5 

I came here with my boyfriend for the first time. Since a few of my frds raved about it. So I decided to checked out the website and they had a deal going on a four course meal for 36.95.i think it's called dine about town deal. 


First course:
Me-Main lobster broth 3stars this was pretty good but wasn't a fan on the herbs they added on top and the broth was a bit watery to me..

Him-Smooth potatoes and leek soup 3stars meh it was alright wasnt as creamy as I thought it would've been

Second:
Dungeness crab salad 4stars this was pretty good refreshing

Yellowfin tuna (tuna poke) 4stars this was surprisingly tasty 

Third:
Seared scallops 3.5 the scallops wasn't as fresh as I thought it would've been.. And it was slightly overcooked a bit rubbery... I'm guessing they were way too busy that day so they didn't really cared. :( 

Maple leaf duck breast for me honestly it was 2stars I wasn't a fan of the gamy taste.. 
For him.. he didn't mind the gaminess but it wasn't the best thing ever also.. so he gave it 3 stars

Fourth:
We both had the cream brulee 4stars

We also ordered some fresh oysters since they had a deal on the menu for $1 oyster.. I'd say 3 stars for that also.. It's not because of the sauce they gave us or the size. It is because there were too many shells in there. No one wants to slurp their oyster then discover shell when they chew. Grossss... But what can I really say it was $1 oysters.... =.= I think I'll just stick with Hog Island for oysters from now on LOL
author: Erisa W.

description:
Great food, with excellent services.

Food:  we were welcomed with a basket of warm bread instead of cold and hard sourdough in many other places we had been  We had dungeon crab salad and lobster broth with shrimp for starters. The crab salad was very fresh with slight citrous taste from grapefruit. The lobster broth provided a full smoky only lightly salted balance. For main dishes, we ordered sea bass and scallop.  The sea bass wrapped in a very thin slice of bacon, crispy out side with soft sea bass inside. The sauce is so tasty (but not salty at all)  we used it for bread dip.  The scallop was well cooked with a flavor of  truffle oil, which is just right to our taste, not overwhelming at all. We also had chocolate cake for deserts. It was warm and soft with true chocolate taste instead of heavy sugary taste that we found in many other places.

Service: The waiter was very professional, tentative, but not chatty. He gave good advice on wine, number of dishes, etc. came near our table once in awhile to check things, but was never intrusive. I finished my meal much earlier than my partner. He did not come to collect my plate till we both finished our meal, which is another rarity these days in the restaurant. 

We will definitely go back again.
author: LW C.

description: We went to Isa with a large party last night.  The service was incredible!  Dean the server was engaging, considerate, and had everybody laughing.  Food was great, would definitely recommend this place.
author: Chris F.

description:
During my stay for 3 days in San Francisco I had a chance to experience really good restaurant but I put ISA the first one and best one. 
I took a group of 23 people to have a dinner and everyone left very amazed by their food, ambiance , service , hospitality by the owner and everyone works this great restaurant. I will definitely go back and i am pretty sure I will find exactly same experience. Established and  successful business !!!! 
I highly recommend this place!

Seren Gulen

Happy customer
author: Seren G.

description:
i absolutely LOVED eating here.

Aside from the delicious food, our waiter Jonathan was amazing, a total delight. I think his contagiously good mood and great service really set the mood for a great meal.

We were seated at the lone table by the front window and were immediately skeptical that we would be forgotten. Luckily, we were assured that would not be the case and in fact, it ended up being the best table in the house away from the rest of the chatter and busy kitchen. 

*mussels - generous portion and the broth was nice and tangy. went great with the baked goat cheese and truffle risotto
*Truffle risotto - love that it's piled high with assorted mushrooms. so divine, rich, creamy and savory. good for sharing.
*vanilla bean creme brulee - i personally thought it was perfect. the carmelized sugar was really thick, the way i like it, so it shatters all the way to the edges when hit with the back of a spoon :)

Other highlights in my opinion: the lobster broth and semifreddo. The potato leek soup, baked goat cheese and flank steak were all pretty ordinary, but no complaints about any of it. 

great service, great food, & a great experience. I'll be returning!
author: bonnie y.

description:
My friends and I came to Isa last night to try their Dine About Town menu, and it was a very worthwhile dinner to go to. At $36.95, their four course DAT dinner menu is pretty generous, especially considering the quality of the food that you're getting here.

We had the potato and leek soup because they ran out of the Lobster Maine Broth, and it was fine--it was good for what it is. Then we all shared our 2nd courses, which were the Mussels, Yellowfin Tuna, Crab Salad, and the Oysters. Out of the four, I found that I really enjoyed the Mussels the most--and the remaining broth is great to soak up with bread. However, the Tuna and Crab Salad were both really fresh, and you can't really go wrong with Oysters.

For the third, I had the seared scallops, and I thought it was really great. The bacon provided a nice additional flavor to the dish, and the brussels sprouts were delicious.

Last, I had the Creme Brulee for dessert--the sugar might've been a little too torched so it was quite bitter instead of being caramelized, but the custard itself was nice.

Overall, the restaurant is a bit pricy without the Dine About Town menu, but the food here was great and I would come back here again.
author: Sylvia S.

description:
The deliciousness that is Isa can be summed up in two words: Tres bien!

On their website, their cuisine states modern French but expect a very Californian flavor as well. Isa takes what's in season and transforms these ingredients into one of SF's best dishes: fresh food that's seasoned well, you can't go wrong in dining here. 

If you've never been, try going on a weeknight between Mon - Thurs. Isa's 3 course menu costs only $29. You'll get a lot more bang for your buck than ordering a la carte. 

Our apps were big enough to pass as entrees: from the heirloom tomato salad with arugula and feta; butter lettuce salad with pears, roaring forties blue cheese and candied walnuts; grilled local calamari with honey sauce. 

Our main courses were all winners: Halibut ala pancha, steak and potatoes and roasted chicken. My halibut was gorgeously flaky highlighted with citrus oomph from the oranges and sweetness from the beets. 

The roasted chicken with mashed potatoes had two big pieces of moist chicken thigh & breast and the skin was nicely crisp. If you like your mashed potatoes on the creamy side, this will make you go: "wow! there's so much butter in here!"

The grilled flat iron steak done medium rare was presented with zucchinis and roasted fingerling potatoes in a wonderful bordelaise sauce. Steak snobs beware, you'll like it a lot. 

Even though the service was uneven, I still think Isa is a special place. It's one of those restaurants that you gush to your friends about, because simply put: the food is just too darn good.

* For Karen Y and Jonathan W, true foodies in and out of the Yelp world *
author: Janice C.

description:
5 Stars for the excellent service, 2 stars for the food.

Our server was the friendliest, most passionate server ever. I believe he said he'd been serving there for 13 years. He was very proud of the restaurant, the food and the chefs. Isa is lucky to have him,

As for the food, it was really nothing special. I started off with the crab salad appetizer. The flavor was good, but there were a bunch of shell pieces inside. For my entree, I ordered the seared scallops. They were cooked perfectly, but I wasn't crazy about the corn/truffle salsa. I thought it was way too garlicky. For dessert, we all shared the flourless chocolate cake, which was very tasty, but a little on the small side. Our server was sweet enough to bring a friend who had bad food allergies a complimentary grapefruit granite. The granite was THE best thing of the night. It was very light and fresh.

Overall, I probably won't be coming back. I felt the price was way too high for food that was just alright.
author: Lauren D.

description:
I came here for my birthday dinner and it was absolutely amazing. We were seated by very friendly staff in the back patio, which is covered and warm because it has a bunch of heat lamps. The atmosphere is so nice and very classy. It reminded me of LA restaurants with the outdoor garden-type setting, rustic wood tables, and strings of lights.

During DAT they offer only the DAT menu, but that is not a problem because there is such a wide selection. I would suggest getting a variety of dishes and sharing, which is what we ended up doing.

Apps: 
Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese with pesto, tomato, concassee & pinenuts- this was soooo good. It's creamy and tangy, though not too much. Yes, it's a simple dish, but the combination of flavors just works really well together. It tastes good on the bread, which is warm and pretty much bottomless (they kept bringing more and more bread to the table.. which can be pretty dangerous!)
Dungeness crab salad with avocado, apple, grapefruit & tarragon- this was good too, although I don't think the flavors worked as well. The crab was fresh but not particularly memorable. A little more citrus would have worked better. It's a nice big portion.

Mains:
Seared scallops with butternut squash, sweet potatoes, spinach, bacon & truffle sauce- this was a really good combo. I love the side veggies- bacon makes everything taste good. I couldn't taste much truffle though. I do think the scallops were a tad overcooked- I prefer scallops with a chewy center, and i would say these were cooked through.

Maple leaf farm duck breast with red cabbage, potato gallete & wild huckleberry sauce- the duck itself was amazingly tender and well-cooked, with a crispy skin. The berry sauce was quite good. The red cabbage was kind of WTF? it tasted mushy and sweet. I could do without it. The potato gallete was basically hash browns.

Desserts:
Semifreddo all'amaretto: This was kind of odd. It was icy on the edges, which is no bueno :( The amaretto cookies were forgettable.
Vanilla bean gelato with biscotti- The gelato was yum! You get two big scoops, so if you want lots of gelato this is a great option. The biscotti was good but soooo hard. I like the crumbly kind a lot better.
Flourless chocolate cake, vanilla bean gelato- The winner! It is the most popular dessert according to the waiter, and for good reason. It is warm and more of a souffle in my opinion. The middle is melty like lava cake. You get a tiny ball of gelato, which I mixed with my cake :)

Overall, amazing service and a TERRIFIC choice for DAT! I want to go back for their normal prix fixe and try some other things!
author: Cathy S.

description:
I've been here twice now and the last time was during dining about town. For the fixed price, you get 4 courses. Between the 3 of us, we got the lobster soup, mussels in white wine broth, warm goat cheese, tuna tartare, short ribs, rotisserie chicken, hangar steak, grapefruit granita and creme brulee. We had some trouble getting off our chairs.

I loved the mussels, goat cheese, warm bread, tuna tartare, chicken, steak and short ribs. I think the short rib was the best, tender, juicy, and savory over creamy, buttery mashed potatoes. It's the perfect entree.
I always have a great time here.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
We were actually planning on going to another restaurant up to the street, but they weren't taking anymore walk-ins on a Saturday night. We found this place via yelp, and decided to go in after the positive yelp reviews. 

Calling this place a French restaurant is a bit of a stretch. Aside from the copious amounts of butter used in a select dishes, I would consider this more of a modern hybrid restaurant. Lots of fresh seafood options, pastas. 

We weren't in the mood for wine that night, but I do like their wine selection, and very affordable price point. 

The service was mediocre at best. Our host made a face when we told him we didn't have reservations, and then 'suddenly' found a nook for us to be seated by the front door.
