Our waiter was very polite and attentive, but didn't really explain anything on the menu or have any suggestions, without us prompting him. 

The atmosphere is quite nice and I like the curtain at the front door preventing any drafts from the door opening coming in. A big plus for someone who is always cold. 

Now to the food. It wasn't the best restaurant we've been to, but for the price and  t
he freshness of the seafood, it would merit at least a 4 stars from me. 

We had the following: 

Half Dozen Oysters - $12 - Came out quickly and very fresh. 
Seared Scallops and some sort of pasta/rice side - Very very delicious. The butter usage was maximized on this dish. The side alone was worth ordering. 
Rack of Lamp - a bit over cooked beyond what we asked for, but very tender and flavorful. 

Portions were great. 

I would go back if we happen to be in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't run back to have any one dish.
author: Winny F.

description:
Last nite I had the pleasure of dining with two lovely ladies who I haven't seen in a long while. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of ISA, at first i thought it was a bit dark but that was only the area near the bar, in the back it had a nice and cozy. It can best be described as a Patio that had a roof dropped on it. The ladies and I decided to take advantage of Isa's prix fix. You can't beat 3 courses for 29 bucks, especially since ISA's normal menu prices will make your tummy happy but wallet very sad.

All the items on the Prix fix sounded delicious .  The ladies and i decided to do it up family style so we could fully experience ISA. For appetizers we ordered The Heirloom Tomato salad, the butter lettuce salad and the grilled calamari. 

Heirloom Tomato Salad was simple yet very delicious. A layout of 4 different heirloom tomatoes on a bed of arugula with feta, basil and what tasted like crouton crumbs. Drizzled on top was a balsamic vinaigrette.http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/O8_jDhc7WJXqdD9YgEXSRw/l

Butter lettuce salad was giant lettuce leaves with slices of Bartlett pear, candied walnuts, roaring fourty's blue cheese and watercress. Another fairly simple salad with a nice different taste.http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/IFOxOZejHWxYbQERk9BUNQ/l

Grilled Calamari was amazing, we all agree whenever we think of calamari we think FRIED! Grilled Calamari is a very good alternative if made right!! Isa's was spot on!  mmm tentacles, my favorite part ;) http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gtt3cE-PM9-kvrkwt1hsrQ/l

The main courses we chose were the Halibut, Flat Iron Steak and Free Range Chicken:

The Halibut came out first, its was simply captivating. With its crisp exterior and soft center it was cooked to perfection. There's almost no way we can make this at home!! What's their secret???? seriously! I would eat  fish more frequently if i could make it this perfect at home. Another thing that made this dish the best of the nite was the mix of the other ingredients gave it a totally different flavor from what i am used to. I love beets but hate prepping them for anything, cuz they stain everything! the orange slices were a nice touch and the orange vinaigrette was a great finish.http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OID21xWn91M0gH9x34RzIg/l

Flat Iron Steak with zucchini and potatoes was also cooked perfectly, the steak was tender and juicy, the zucchini had good flavor and the potatoes  mmmm MMMmmmm is all i can say. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vZIJ18tvYZ0h4YDWf3mRVw/l

Free Range Chicken: One breast and one thigh was prepped with a lot of spices which in turn make it very flavorful and delightful. Normally the mash potatoes i make or like usually has lumps it in. Isa's mashed potatoes were creamed to perfect....taste that butter...yum.http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XmRjgJ1RWl8yDa0T7KXeOQ/l


For Dessert it was a pic from two different cheese plates, Semifreddo all' Amaretto and the Grapefruit Granite

The ladies both opted out for the Semifreddo and i decided to be the odd one out and get the Grapefruit Granite. 

The Semifreddo: The texture seemed like ice cream but not as creamy and heavy. The plate was lined with hollow almond cookies, very fresh and yummy.http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0RacKXy674IyZUbIGsSWGQ/l

The Granite didn't strike me as anything special, it was basically Grapefruit shaved ice to me. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Y-3xPJ-u91kBPq3iNDOWtQ/l


Best Monday ever,  Janice L and Karen Y!!! Thanks Ladies ;)



*semifreddo: is a semi frozen dessert (ice cream cake, semi frozen custard, fruit tarts) it has a moose like texture because they are uniting two equal parts of ice cream and whipped cream.

*Granite: combining some sort of fruit juice with boiling water and fine sugar. You then freeze it on a pan and scrape it off. essentially its similar to shaved ice.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
I came here for DAT and OH MY GOD. Best decision, ever.

ATMOSPHERE
Parking is a pain because Isa is sandwiched in between a ton of eateries. We got lucky that we arrived at 6PM and were able to snag a spot in front of a meter right across the street.

Super cute restaurant with a very intimate and cozy feel to it. My girl friends and I got seated outside but it still felt like we were indoors because the outside patio was completely covered and there were a ton of heat lamps to keep us nice and toasty.

The service is amazing. Our waiter was a nice old Asian man who was very knowledgeable and smiley. He knew everything about the food, restaurant, chef, and food culture related to Isa. All the servers work as a team, and they definitely delivered on that promise: they were prompt and friendly during the entire meal.

FOOD
Their portions are HUGE and they are definitely FAMILY-STYLE, which is strange considering it's such a high end restaurant (food quality as good as the French Laundry).

The presentation was beautiful. The chef really is a perfectionist.

There were 4 of us, so we each ordered a DAT meal and we had SO much food.

DRINKS
Come before 7pm to catch their happy hour!
Their cocktails are SOJU cocktails, so watch out-- they're STRONG and CREEP UP on you!
1) Greyhound
2) Cosmo
3) Lemondrop

APPETIZERS
1) Dungeness crab salad with avocado, apple, grapefruit, and taragon
2) Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese with pesto, tomato, concassee, and pinenuts
3) Loch Duart salmon carpaccio with lemon, creme fraiche, cucumber, egg, capers, and corstini

ENTREES
4) Seared scallops with butternut squash, sweet potatoes, spinach, bacon, and truffle sauce
5) Pan roasted rocky jr. range chicken with fresh herbs, creamy potatoes, and jus de poulet
6) Grilled golden gate angus flat steak iron steak with zucchini, polenta, verte, and bordelaise sauce

DESSERTS
7) Semifreddo all'amaretto (almond gelato)
8) Flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean gelato

The CRAB SALAD was super fresh, crisp, and fruity. It came with 4 servings on beautifully clean lettuce cups.

The GOAT CHEESE dish was such a surprise hit. I'm not a fan of cheese, but HOLY COW-- This cheese was AMAZING. The pesto and tomato gave it such an Italian zest that made it irresistible. It tasted so good with the bread.

The SALMON CARPACCIO was my favorite. Thinly sliced, but extremely flavorful, it was a fresh burst of flavor on delicious cracked bread slices.

The SCALLOPS were a little small, but there were quite a few of them, so it was okay. This dish was a burst of flavor, thanks to all the veggies and of course, the BACON! I cleaned off my entire plate.

The CHICKEN was succulent and tender and had a crispy skin that didn't taste remotely fatty-- it was cooked to perfection. The mashed potatoes were a piece of fluffy heaven and went so well with the chicken.

The STEAK had a good flavor but my friends thought it was a little too chewy at times. The paired polenta tasted a little strange, but overall it was still a delicious dish.

The SEMIFREDDO was the better dessert choice. It had such a unique, but sophisticated taste. 

The FLOURLESS CHOCOLATE CAKE was not a hit. I guess it's because we didn't know what to expect, but it was mushy and didn't have that cake texture we were expecting. HOWEVER, the vanilla bean gelato saved the dessert. AMAZING.

Overall, one of the BEST MEALS I've ever had in my life-- and for $34.95? I LOVE DINE ABOUT TOWN!!
author: Krystie M.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday night after seeing this restaurant being promoted on the Village Vines website.

The front area with the bar seemed to be rather packed so we asked to be seated in the back. The restaurant looked small when i walked it but I was pleasantly surprised when the hostess took us to the back room. The back looked like a tent but was nicely lit and decorated to give off a nice ambiance. Service was great and we were constantly asked if we wanted more bread/water.

The menu suggests that each person orders 2 dishes, but for the both of us, a total of 3 dishes were more than enough. I guess it really depends how hungry you are, maybe I just ate too much bread before my meal came out (typical me).

We ordered:
- Yellowfin Tuna: This dish was absolutely delicious, more of an appetizer. 
- Saffron Paella: PAELLA! I am such a big fan of paella, so I highly recommend this dish. This was probably the most filling of the 3 dishes we ordered.
- Pan roasted rocky Jr. Range chicken: Chicken w/ mashed potatoes. The chicken was delicious but was a bit dry.
- Long Gamma wine and the French  beer

By the time our waiter brought the dessert menu we were both stuffed and decided to skip it.

Overall, a good experience, would come again. I also love the location of this restaurant. There's a super cute wine bar (Nectar?) right next to it that I'm definitely going to check out when I'm back in the area.
author: Angela K.

description:
I just ate here this evening with two friends and I must preface this review by saying the food was good. Not amazing, but good.

The service was incredibly rushed. So rushed in fact that all of our food came out at the same time.  There were 8 dishes of food squeezed together on our table.  Throughout the meal I felt like they wanted us to leave as soon as possible, but when I looked around, there were 2 other 4 tops that were empty. Mind you, we had reservations for our dinner a week in advance.

But the WORST was when our waiter ASKED us to leave!!! I still had half a glass of wine on the table! I eat out several times a week for dinner in SF and have NEVER had this happen! Ever!!! Again, when I looked around  there were several large birthday celebrations who were there before us and after us still sitting. In shock, we left, although in retrospect we should have stayed and finished our drinks.  We weren't finished chatting and stood in front of the restaurant under an awning in the rain for an additional 10 minutes to finish catching up.  

TERRIBLE hospitality.  There are many fabulous restaurants close by who have great food AND great service. There are too many good restaurants in SF to go to one with such a rude staff.  

If you are thinking about Isa, choose nearby Roses Cafe, Terzo, A16, or Ristobar instead. All have good food AND good service.
author: Anne W.

description:
Went to Isa for a random date night with my boyfriend right after work and let me tell you, this place did NOT disappoint at all. The ambiance is modern and has a romantic feel to it. Not only that, but as a film major and film noir fan, they had me sold with the decor the second we were seated next to the venetian blinds! ;) The waiters have excellent menu suggestions, and the bussers are on point and are always constantly giving you drink refills or clearing your table of any finished dishes immediately.

Our Menu:
Appetizers ~ Dungeness Crab Salad & Grilled Local Calamari
Entrees ~ Truffle Risotto & the Grilled Golden Gate Natural Angus Flat Iron Steak
Desserts ~ Chocolate Flourless Cake & Semifreddo al Amaretto

The food is just unbelievably delicious and the risotto was by far, the best I've had in the City. The truffle just adds so much flavor and the mushrooms give the risotto a nice texture. And for all you fellow dessert connoisseurs, you definitely have to try the flourless cake and the semifreddo! 

Dinner was just a smashing success overall. Now I want to come back so I can experience this romantic back door patio everyone is raving about!
author: Alexis A.

description: Wow! I love this place.  Just spent three nights in San Francisco.  Ate at two of the top 5 rated restaurants and then Isa.  Two highly rated restaurants were very good and a bit more adventurous but the simple clean flavors at Isa was my favorite.  This was my seventh or eighth visit over about a 10 years period.  I will be coming back on my next visit.
author: John W.

description:
Wow!!!! Incredible food. Everything was amazing. Service on par with the best. What else can I say. An excellent place to take someone who appreciates great food. 
My wife had the chicken, cooked to perfection, I had the steak, done the way a steak should be, and my daughter had the mushroom risotto,  heavenly.
author: Rick S.

description:
Came on a Saturday night, and the service was just awful. We were rushed through meals and plates arrived sporadically,. 

Food quality itself wasn't bad but because there was no rhyme or reason as to when dishes arrived it was very unsettling, and interfered with enjoying whatever quality was there. For example, one salad arrived, then 15 minutes later raw oysters, then another salad, then the entrees. Crazy.

One of my party decided to wait before eating until all four of us had our entrees. That  took 20 minutes, no lie. I asked about the remaining two meals twice to no effect. She finally sent hers back for re-heating as it had gone cold during the wait.

I did speak to the hostess about it. on the way out.

Won't go back; as there are too many restaurants in San Francisco to give a second chance to any restaurant that ruined an otherwise  fine Saturday evening.

Reading other reviews it appears others have had trouble with service as well.
author: E F.

description: Walked in on a whim, just looking for something to eat after walking around the city for the day. Certainly glad I did. I've gone twice now, the second time bringing my parents. Everything I've tried I would recommend.
author: Ben E.

description:
O...m...g. YUM

First of all I LOVE that everything is easily shared here because I'd rather eat a little of many things than a lot of one thing. Variety is good. We came here in a group of 6 and so got to try a large sampling of items. While waiting we grabbed some drinks at the bar up front and they have these portable electronic consoles that you can play games on. Definitely helped the wait go by faster.

We got seated in the back patio, which was really charming and cozy. To start with we had the baked goat cheese, the seared scallops with bacon and brussel sprouts in truffle sauce, the maine lobster broth, Yellowfin tuna with served on avocado with nori and toasted sesame, and the arugula salad. Stand outs were the scallops and the yellowfin tuna. The tuna tasted really yummy with the avocado and the spicy sriracha sauce. Main dishes: spaghetti with truffles, basil, parmesan cheese; potato wrapped seabass w/brown butter (MMMM); and Maple leaf farm duck breast. Everything was amazing. Yes even the spaghetti. All the flavors were so rich but not in an overpowering way. Don't leave without trying the vanilla creme brulee and flourless chocolate cake. As our waiter said, those are the only dessert options you should be looking at :)
author: Joyce H.

description:
+ Everything was cooked perfectly: duck, chicken, lobster soup, braised pork ribs, scallops, crab salad... flavors were on point. 
+ Jon, our waiter, was so awesome. "Old Ears; Young Heart" 
+ Five people is the perfect number to enjoy DAT - 5 dishes to try!
+ HH priced drinks. I like their selections of Cali wines & the Greyhound. 
+ I've been here once before a year ago on a regular night, and thoroughly enjoyed that meal/date too. 

- I wish we got more attention when we first sat down 5-10 min wait to order our drinks, and another 5 to order our first course. But, DAT weeks are always busier. 
- I wish my creme brulee was warmer.
author: M C.

description: Great food! We had the salmon carpaccio appetizer, fresh fish of the day, lamb chops and vanilla gelato--all delicious and well presented. The service was very friendly and efficient. Nice setting but just a bit cramped. Will go back.
author: James M.

description: I hadn't been to ISA for years until last week.  Three of us had a wonderful dinner and we will be back soon.  I'm sorry it fell "off my radar" for so long.
author: Juliette K.

description:
Ok, so after my last review of this place, the owner/manager  contacted me and was super nice and personally apologized for the behavior of her staff. 

Today, another friend of mine wanted to have a last minute celebration for a large group.  Even though the timing didn't work out, my interaction over the phone with the owner/manager was wonderful. 

After this, I definitely need to rescind my comment about never coming here again, which is good because Isa had really good food and was a fun place when I went a few years ago, and I didn't and don't want to have bad feelings about the place because of one cranky employee.
author: Shinny L.

description:
Yum. I came here recently for my boyfriend's birthday.  I made reservation extra early because we had a big group.  

We shared our appetizers which were the Yellow fin Tuna, Foie Gras, and Mussels.  Everything was exquisite.  The foie gras was rich and flavorful. The yellow fin tuna was sooooo good. Love. 

For my entree, I gotten the spaghetti and OMG this was some good spaghetti.  It was cooked al dente and the sauce was great. One of our friends had the chicken breast which came with mashed potatoes and I am a sucker for mashed potatoes and this was good mashed potatoes. 

Everything was good but I have to give them 4 stars this time because when we ordered desserts, they forgot to bring out half of our orders and it turns down they had forgotten about it.
author: Mimi P.

description:
I enjoyed a fabulous meal at Isa with a few friends for Dine About Town.  

AMAZING!

Our waiter encouraged us to share everything family style, which we did.  So, this is what we had:

- salmon carpaccio w/ creme fraiche - more toast please!
- baked Laura Chenel goat cheese - LOVE LOVE LOVE (highly recommended for goat cheese fans) Don't forget to ask for more bread!
- Dungeness crab salad - not much flavor, maybe a little acidity would help make the dish pop 
- seared scallops w/ spinach, bacon and truffle sauce - tiny scallops but tastey
- maple leaf farm duck breast w/ huckleberry sauce - very tender & flavorful...the sauce is perfect
- flat iron steak w/ bordelaise sauce - no wonder this dish is popular! so juicy and yummy polenta cake
- flourless chocolate cake and vanilla bean gelato

Our 3-course meal was a great deal for $35/person.  Happy hour is from 5pm-7pm EVERYDAY!  A glass of wine for $5 - yes, please!

Side note:  I've heard the Marina is known to have a lot of douche bags.  After spending just an hour, shopping and strolling the streets, it's true!  Who honks to rush a person walking across the street?  What a douche!  But hey, that's not going to stop me from coming back to Isa though.
author: Saweena K.

description:
Come here for your birthday. Why? Because everyone else is apparently. Ate here last night and in the back room they had 5 birthday parties, I spent half my dinner listening to the happy birthday song: 1 party of 27, 2 parties of 12, 1 party of 8, 1 party of 6. Thus it is obviously a popular bday destination and for good reason. Keep your date nights in the front part of the restaurant which is a bit more romantic.

Food was yummy as usual and love the fact that it's family style. For 3, we had the following. It was enough food to get us all full and all of it was good. Service was all attentive which was surprising given the number of large parties they had.

Crab salad- basic but good, not much avocado though
Foie gras - quite sweet given the strawberry sauce base but really well cooked, was tender - definitely a win
Risotto - had multiple different types of mushrooms. Not too creamy, general crowd pleaser
Scallop- comes with orzo, snap peas and tomatoes, that was the better part of the dish. Scallops tasted like they do anywhere
Butterfish - this was a special for the day. Came in an envelope that looked like the flaky part of spanokopita but this was not edible. Sauce was not noticable but the fish was very nicely prepared

For dessert we had a creme brulee (top was too hard but otherwise fine), chocolate cake (side of ice cream was tasty), vanilla bean gelato with espresso (this was heavy on the espresso as it's mixed in)

Only thing we didn't like were the drinks which is unfortunate. The number seven cocktail is just not very good. Will return though and order wine next time
author: sasha h.

description:
I was sad. I did not know that they ONLY have the Dine About Town menu. I was looking forward to foie gras.... but they didnt have it!!!! We came here for my friend's birthday dinner, so we thought it would be a nice place because some people can get DAT and others that are on a budget can just get one item. I guess we should not have assumed that ISA is like other restaurants that offers both DAT and the regular menu. But half of us were pretty upset once we sat down and realize there was only dine about town.... BUT that is now why i am only giving them two stars

Now for the service. The waiter and busers were really sweet, unfortunately, our waiter messed up twice on our order. My boyfriend order a glass of wine, and it did not come until 40 minutes later, WHEN my boyfriend told him to cancel it. But he decided to give it to us on the house. Now at dessert time, we told him we wanted 4 chocolate cake and 1 vanilla bean gelato. We ended up with 3 chocolate cake and 2 gelato, but again the waiter gave it to us on the house. But at this time, a few of us were quite fed up everything and wanted to leave, but we had to wait for the last chocolate cake to come out.

To the food. The free bread... was the highlight of the night, a lot of us needed it to go with the food cause it was a bit salty. But it was weird, some of the bread basket came to us warm, while others were cold... my friend only ate the warm ones. 

Anyways, I had the salmon carpaccio.... which was nothing special. Thing of salmon sashimi and capers and onions.... yea... that is pretty much it.

The duck breast was pretty good and so was the potatoes that came with it. But I hated hated the cabbage. This dish was pretty good, especially with the sauce, but it was a bit salty but the free bread helped balance it.

The chocolate cake was really good, but you definitely NEED to have the gelato with it. I think this was my favorite... until I ran out of gelato....
author: Alicia W.

description:
I came here for Dine About Town and while I'm not big on French food, I'm still giving this place a solid 4 stars. The food is good, ambiance is relaxed, drinks are tasty, and the service is pretty darn impeccable. My friend and I were running a little late and when we called to give a head's up, they were pretty nice about it (Note: Parking around here is trouble, especially at night, so try to come early to find some street parking!). I thought they were going to chuck our reservation but nope, it was all good! 

The front area looks pretty fancy but you get to walk past their open kitchen (pretty cool) and then they take you to the back, which is definitely more casual. The service was QUICK. They never let us run out of bread/butter, always made sure our water cups were full, and any empty plate was instantly cleared. Before we ordered, they emphasized that they served their meals "family style" and they were meant to be shared. Now, I left pretty darn full (not sure if it was the food or the 3 baskets of bread we devoured..) but I would say one person could definitely have a whole plate to themselves. It's either that or I eat a lot!

I had their Smooth Potato & Leek Soup, Butter Lettuce Salad, Duck Breast, and then the Amaretto. YUM. I read a review that said their Duck Breast was too salty but I thought it perfectly tender and delicious. No complaints here! Their Number Seven Soju Cocktail was also AMAZING. I highly highly recommend trying something off their drink menu while you're there. Makes your experience all the better :). All in all, good food, good service. I still think Chapeau! is my #1 for French food but if you're looking for a more casual atmosphere, definitely try out Isa's!
author: Frances L.

description:
Let me just put this out there: two things:
1. Isa has bomb ass bread
2. Isa hands down has consistently one of the best value DAT menus in SF

WOOT Clearly I'm a fan. I apparently went here when I was younger with family, but didn't remember. Isa has a cute dark cozy interior, and also a covered, awesome back patio area that doesn't get too chilly at night (BIG PLUS in the city). 

I've only been to Isa for DAT--the last two seasons--and they don't skimp on the menu: plentiful choices for all FOUR courses, unlike many restaurants that give you shabby little 2-3 courses for the same money. Scallops were huge and really nicely grilled--my cousin's fiancee enjoyed his duck--my main squeeze liked his fish. They grill really nicely at this place. I'd say the highlight was probably the apps--we shared mussels, tuna tartare, dungeness salad, and smoked salmon app (like bruschetta but with salmon...name is escaping me atm). The soup at the beginning was tasty too. Dessert was tasty too! Chose between creme brulee, grapefruit granita, and this almond italian dessert whose name is also escaping me @_@

Danger: The bread is good. It comes warm and the crust is delicious. Otherwise read as: BEWARE FOOD COMA because the bread just keeps coming and the water keeps pouring, and sooner than you or I know, you'll be full before the entrees even come. Learn from the mistakes of others. :)

Quality, solid food. Decent cocktails. Only downside is that there's NEVER any parking in the Marina.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I think this is my 3rd time coming here. Monday night is not crowded - Woo Hoo. Had the Crab salad and the lamb chops. Salad was just ok not alot of flavor but the lamb chops were perfectly done! 

Service was a little slow for water/bread but it's ok. Our waiter was awesome cuz one of our friends had a food allergy so he brought back the duck and had the chef redue it. Big points for you!
author: Thomas C.

description: Came here for a night out with my girlfriends and to try out Dine About Town for the first time. Good experience, the only thing is that they close at 10:30 and exactly at 10:30 my reservations were for 10:15 and about 5-10 min late and was kinda rushed...The food was good, the lobster broth soup was flavorful and light, loved the sweet and sourness of the mignonette sauce on the raw oysters, the duck was cooked perfectly and went well w/the spinach w/bacon bits and pin nuts and the creme brulee was perfectly burnt. I would go there again but do want to try all the other french places in sf first.
author: Candice B.

description:
Can I get a Fioe Gras?!  Love their "complimentary" foie Gras spread once a month special...keep it up and keep inviting me!!  Always with two options and I always get both!!

Now back to their other Devine food selections...

Lobster bisque was good...great lobster taste but lacks the chunks of lobster in it that I would prefer.

Mussels were delightful with a good taste to it.

Maple leaf farm duck breast, angus flat iron steak, or range chicken are the entree choices I would select.  All were very tasteful....
author: Patrick C.

description:
I am very conflicted on writing this review because the food was very good and very well prepared but the food quality is not all that goes into a restaurant experience.  So I had to honestly rate this 3 star.   If I did the food alone in a vacuum with nothing else then it is 5.  If I did everything else without the food it is a 1.    So here are my thoughts as a chef and owner of a large catering company.

The food was excellent.   Deftly prepared and well done.   We had the foie gras and that was excellent.  The portions were excellent and the searing was great.   The accompanying fruit was fig for 2 of them and strawberry for one.   There was no choice in this and they were just served that way.   This I didn't like.  I want to know what I am ordering and getting.  I don't like the concept of "surprise" when I am dining much less you get what I serve you.   The other guest ordered the Lobster Broth which was a bit thin in my estimation but was quite tasty.   
The mains were again well prepared.  Lamb rack was excellent, Halibut perfectly cooked, Scallops well cooked but on an Orzo which wasn't at all my favorite and the Scallops were a small portion as they were not very large, and Duck Breast which was a bit overcooked.   

Dessert was an Almond SemiFreddi which was excellent and a Crème Brulee which was not flavorful at all and didn't have enough crunch to the sugar portion.  Only a 2Star dessert in my opinion.   

My biggest issue issues are two-fold.   

First - the restaurant needs a major overhaul in it's interior and ambiance.   You are escorted through a relatively nice looking small dining room in the front, past a very open kitchen (but not a beautiful open kitchen as you would see in most open kitchen restaurants) and then to the back portion of the restaurant in our case which appeared to look like an old patio that had been covered with a roof.   It was not decorated well and the tables were covered with placemats and it all looked very much like a diner instead of a 5star restaurant.   There were overhead propane heaters which I found myself wondering how they used given that we were really in an indoor facility and I am pretty sure you cannot use propane indoors per SF fire code, and it just felt like I was in a cheap diner type place.   Here I was spending a significant amount of money on a nice "French" dinner and wine and I felt like the food and place were completely mismatched.

Then we were told that the dinner would be delivered "TAPAS STYLE".   I quickly understood that tapas style in this instance meant that the kitchen just didn't operate on a brigade style but rather each station just prepared what it was in charge of without any communication with any other part of the kitchen and things were sent out whenever they were ready.   However the menu was absolutely not a Tapas menu.   These were not small plates meant to be shared.   These were regular dinner plates with a main protein and an accompanying side dish just as in any other dinner restaurant but things were coming out whenever they were ready.   I was a bit put off at the fact that they felt they could just excuse this inability for their kitchen to coordinate itself so that all the dinners could come out at once and just call it Tapas Style.   This, for me really detracted from the meal.   I am not one who likes that sort of thing for THIS type of food.   This was not a Chinese banquet or other meal where that is expected.   Event hose type of meals the dishes are brought at relatively the same time.  Likewise for Tapas.  Often many of the dishes are brought all at the same time, but each dish will be just a small thing meant specifically to share.   So if this was really Tapas style for instance it would have been a Duck Breast with Cherry Sauce as one dish.  Then an additional dish would have been the braised cabbage and yet another dish would have been the potato gallette.   

So the food was very good, excellent in fact.   But I don't think I will go back because I was quite put off by the character of the restaurant and the fact that for that price I don't want my food served piecemeal.   For that amount of money they should be able to do a better job.   
There is HUGE potential here but it will take a bit more investment on their part to make the next grade.
author: Christian H.

description:
First off, I need to say this place has the BEST seabass ever.  It was perfectly cooked, the red pepper/caper sauce was delicious.  I used the never ending bread to soak up the sauce and ate every bit of it. YUM YUM YUM!

The service here was great, very attentive servers that made sure water was filled and bread was always on the table.

The covered patio seating area was comfortable with heat lamps.  I prefer it over the inside dining area which could be a lil too dark.  

The menu says the items are made for sharing and that they rec'd 2 portions per person.  I don't disagree.  Portions are small but flavors pack a punch.  

I also tried the flat iron steak (nothing spectacular) and the duck breast (good, but was a bit too rare).

if you come here, you must order the seabass.
author: Thien N.

description: Very cool and romantic setting, great for a date night or a catch up with good friends. Menu had great selection of fresh seafood and fresh ingredients. I usually stay away from carbs but the bread they had was soooo good. Had to contain myself from eating too much of it before the food arrived. Had the prefix dinner, family style. Ordered the calamari, mussels, risotto, spaghetti, and the amaretto and grapefruit sorbet. Quality food with good prices. Great services. The waiter that helped us was super friendly and welcoming. Recommended items on the menu depending on what we liked.
author: Fanny C.

description: I've been there several times in the last two years. The last two dining experiences were not as pleasant as the earlier ones. The quality of food was still great but the service has deteriorated. Both times they were under staffed. Isa offers good food without breaking your walletn in a trendy neighborhood . I just hope that the service would improve on my next visit.
author: Mary L.

description:
We came here on a Friday night. This place is pretty popular! My friend booked it on a Monday and they only have a table for two at 9:15pm and "cannot accommodate any larger party"

The menu is somewhat set, 36 + tips / person where we have two choices of soup, few choices for 'course 1' and then another few choices for 'course 2', and finally a few desserts to pick from. They also had this $1 oyster special, which of course we ordered. 

We picked lobster soup, dungeness crab salad, mussels, scallop, and duck breast. All 4 entrees were really yummy, I'd have to say. 

My only complaint is that the oysters didn't seem as fresh as I've wanted and the wait was pretty painful. (We weren't given a table till 930 940pm or so). 

Nonetheless, I'd definitely come back again when I feel like French fusion food.
author: Victor K.

description:
Parking:  sucky on weekends since its in a busy area of SF, so that is to be expected.

Food:  A++ would come again.

Notes:
Raw Oysters:  LARGE sized, very smooth and milky, not very briny.  Great flavor.
Salmon Carpaccio:  Very creamy slices of salmon served with some fresh cream and capers.  Even though it was an appetizer, it was one of my favorites.
Mussels in broth:  Knocked me off my feet.  The seafood flavor was delicious!  We ate the mussels and wanted to drink the broth!  The broth was some sort of butter garlic type broth.
Duck Breast:  Served with a berry jam.  It was very sweet, and was perfectly complemented by the glaze.
Lamb Rack:  Cooked to a perfect mid rare and served over some simple vegetables.  The outside seasoned and seared crust was awesome when paired with the nice and tender pink center.
Creme Brulee:  Typical, very creamy, very tasty.

Atmosphere is loud and fun.  Wait staff was great.  Would come back again!  The focus here was really the food.
author: David C.

description:
Great restaurant!

The service here was great, our server was kind, hilarious and was very helpful. I was impressed how our server memorized all the menu items and the ingredients. 

The food was great, large serving sizes but no reduction in the quality of the food. It's like a michelin rated plate but 2-3x the amount of food. 

Nice decoration and we enjoyed seating in the patio area.

I will definitely come back!
author: Michael L.

description:
Absolutely adorable French restaurant in the Marina. Delicious small plates to share make it easy to sample the menu. I've never been disappointed by the food here. Sometimes the atmosphere gets a tad noisy/busy/overwhelming on Friday and Saturday nights (due to the restaurant's close proximity to the cow hollow bar scene), but overall I love to eat here. My boyfriend and I frequently come here for our date nights.

What's good on the menu: the oysters, arugula salad, goat cheese appetizer, and the duck breast.  The chicken (which comes with delectable mashed potatoes and delicious gravy) is also a surprising go-to on their menu. The chicken is incredibly juicy, tasty, and perfectly proportioned to share with another person.

The service is always great; staff is generally helpful. The wine list is limited but good.  

Overall, Isa is the perfect place to come if you're in the mood to treat yourself to a delicious meal -- whether it's with a large group of friends or on a romantic date. You won't be disappointed.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Went to this one with family today, after reading all the good reviews. Mostly disappointed - not impressed with a single dish, big bucks though. Cannot be compared with Baker Street Bistro from any perspective.

Shame on the chef - sorry
author: Min L.

description: We met up with some family to have a meal at Isa and the family style worked perfect! I highly recommend the Scallops delicious!
author: Cailey K.

description: I ate here a while back and loved it! My boyfriend surprised me with dinner and I found this restaurant to be really lovely and cozy. I had the dungeness crab salad and my boyfriend had steak. I was surprised at how good my salad was! Would definitely come back.
author: Jamie B.

description:
Overall: 3.5 stars

Came for the Dine About Town Menu:

Maine lobster broth- 3 stars.  It's hard to give anything with lobster flavor an average rating, but thats what this soup was.  It was just a watery soup with a lobster essence. Very forgettable.

Organic Loch Duart Salmon Carpaccio- 4 stars.  Not too smokey.  The fish was good, but there was nothing about the dish that blew me away.  Still a pretty good appetizer though.

Mussels- 3.5 stars.  They were tasty, as mussels usually are.  I still thought it was missing a little something.  They came out in a watery tomato sauce, which wasn't bad, but not the greatest.  I think it could have used some garlic and butter.  I've had better mussels. 

Seared Scallops- 3.5 stars.  You get 4 scallops.  They were pretty tasty, but again, they weren't absolutely amazing like everyone else said.  I would probably try something different if I ever went back.

Risotto- 3.5 stars. Pretty good dish.  It had a very strong mushroom taste.  If you really like mushrooms then this is a good one.   

Creme Brulee- 4 stars.  Not overly sweet.  I really liked it.  I wish they gave a larger portion because I would have devoured it.   

Wine-  5 stars. from 5-7pm they have 5 dollar drinks and wine.  I loved the Cab Sauv they had. I would definitely recommend it.   

Service: 4 stars.  The service was pretty great all night.  The only downside is that our server forgot to bring us out our order of oysters, but it really didn't matter because I was really full anyway.
author: Mike T.

description:
Loved everything about this trendy dining spot. We were seated on the back patio and shared courses on the fixed price menu. The atmosphere was lovely - full of energy, yet also very soothing and comforting.

The only complaint I have about Isa is that it's pricy. In my opinion, the food, service, and ambience make it worth the extra cash - additionally, the prix fixe menu is a great option for cost-conscious diners.

Dining in a group of four, we had trouble narrowing our selection, so we decided to share. Therefore, I was lucky enough to sample the risotto, chicken, mussels, goat cheese, and more. The desserts were rich, tart, and delicious.
author: Elyse F.

description: Amazing food. We get seabass and rock of lamb. Both of them are amazing. And our server is super nice, he brings lots of surprises for us. Love this restaurant !
author: Boao Arthur C.

description:
We were a party of 5 and made reservations through VillageVines.com to make use of the 30% off the entire bill.
On a Thursday evening 5:30 we found parking spot right between Lombard and Steiner.  Just paid $2 for the parking as its free after 6PM.. lucky us =)

We were seated at the patio and then began devouring wonderful meals.  I should say I have become a fan of their salads that comes with some of their entree.  
Pt.Reyes Oysters (x2) with spicy orange mignonette - delicious

Yellowfin Tuna - my favorite dish with avocado, crispy seaweed and the vegetables were so fresh.

Sea of cortez wild prawns - around 6 pieces and tasted good.

Prince Edward island Mussels (x2) - tasted great and there were a lot of mussels that we should have probably ordered one plate perhaps.

Pan roasted rocky jr. range chicken - the server mentioned that people drive across the bridge just to try their roasted chicken --- it sure was worth it.. served with the buttery creamy mash potato ever!

Roasted rack of lamb (comes 3 racks and since we were 5 ordered 2 plates) - I should say that the roasted zuccini, olives, red peppers didn't complement the dish.. it tasted rather sour.

Maple leaf farm duck breast - tender breasts served with salad (spinach, bacon, pinenuts, raisins - yummO.. salad was crispy and fresh)

Hudson valley grade A foie gras - didn't try it but folks said that the portion is big compared to the price paid.

The dining experience was great and worth using the Villagevines program.  The bill after the 30% discount is a huge cut off.
author: Hema K.

description:
I absolutely LOVE ISA!

I still remembered when I first dined at Isa 3 years ago.....the food back then was so good! And now 3 years later, we finally returned for dine about town again.

They used to serve a la cart menu during dine about town too, but now, during DAT period, they only serve DAT menu. Even so, the DAT menu covered a variety of choices. And instead of 3 courses, they served 4 courses. We had four people so we got to try a lot of different dishes. 

Props to the bread! It was hot and crispy. Couldn't stop eating it and they kept refilling it. We also ordered a bottle of champagne from Spain. It was so good.

Then we started off with lobster broth. It was super delicious. The shrimp was the highlight. 

For second course we got
1. half dozen of raw oysters - fresh but tiny
2. crab salad - very yummy! super fresh~
3. mussels - cooked perfectly~ love dipping the bread in the broth
4. yellow fin tuna - it was awesome!

For main we got
1. seared scallop - scallop was cooked perfectly. it wasn't overcooked and tasted so   good with the mash potato and brussels sprouts. 
2. Flat Iron steak - my all time favorite! medium rare steak topped with green mustard imported from france. Delicious!
3. Maple duck breast - duck breast was medium rare, the side salad with pine nuts was so yummy!
4. Braised short ribs (off menu) - this was by far the best braised short ribs i've ever had! juicy and tender!

We ended our dinner with vanilla bean creme brulee. It was a very satisfying dinner! 

I would recommend Isa to everyone!
author: Louisa L.

description:
I came here for an anniversary dinner with my boyfriend, and we both left very pleased with our meal and experience there :) 

We came in for a prix fixe dinner ($30 per person) and it was more than worth it.

For the appetizers, we got the salmon carpaccio (not much flavor but it was still very good - I enjoyed the capers) and the steamed mussels (so delicious! Make sure to keep the sauce because there is so much of it - it tastes really good when you dip your bread in this sauce).

For our main courses, I got the chicken (we both agreed it was some of the best chicken we'd tried in our life - it was crispy on the outside and very tender and juicy in the inside. I also enjoyed the surprise layer of pesto that was spread in between the chicken and the chicken skin). My boyfriend got the steak, which is his staple meat at every restaurant, and also really enjoyed it. I liked that it came with sides like beans and potatoes. 

For dessert, I got the semifreddo amaretto - it was the first time I'd tried an amaretto! It was so light and yet the almond taste was very strong. My boyfriend got the goat cheese...I only liked the candied walnuts hahaha but I think he really enjoyed it. 

Our servers were really friendly and joked around with us a lot. They were very attentive as well. We left this place feeling extremely full and happy! My boyfriend still mentions how much he wants to come back!
author: Jenny M.

description: One of my new faves in the Marina.  Parking is difficult (of course its the Marina) so get here a bit early if your driving.  Back patio is spacious yet cozy.  Great wine list (the Petit Sirah was my favorite) and our server was patient and made great recommendations for us as we were in a group of 7 and wanted to share plates.  The scallops were tender and the risotto was savory (in the best way).  Definitely worth the visit!
author: Gabbi d.

description: Everything at Isa was beyond expectations. To drink we had happy hour wines at just $5 a glass! To eat we had the crab salad, calamari, sea bass, scallops, and mushrooms.  The crab salad was fresh, crisp - really delightful. The calamari was grilled to perfection and not chopped up too much like other places often do. The sea bass lightly wrapped in potato was inventive and delicious, and the scallops were succulent. The standout of the entire experience was the superb service. We were treated like kings. Everything came to the table quickly, and when plates were finished they left the table sometimes so magically we barely noticed. Really an exceptional dining experience for the price point.
author: Mark S.

description:
Came here on Thursday for Dine About Town.
After looking at the menu online for their normal prices I feel kind of ripped off, lol, since I probably wouldn't have normally gotten 2 appetizers/2 desserts.

REGARDLESS, the food was made really well and I thoroughly enjoyed everything from food to service. Here's my breakdown.

- Service: Got a call confirming my reservation earlier in the day, and was greeted promptly upon walking in. The lady who showed us to our seat gave us friendly conversation and made us feel comfortable! The server seemed a bit brusque and rough, but not unfriendly. The pace of the food was just right - had time to talk but never wondered about where my food was. Water was refilled from time to time and servers would check in on us :)

- Bread: hehe :) it was warm and soft on the inside/crispy on the outside! They refilled it when we finished without us having to ask.

- Crab salad; Crab wasn't seasoned enough and I didn't like the grapefruit  too much. The apples gave it a nice sweet touch though.

- Salmon carpaccio: YUM!! Fresh and good amount of salmon. The creme fraiche and whatever it came with complemented it perfectly :)

- Truffle risotto: YUM! The portion was bigger than I thought it would be and the mushrooms balanced it out perfectly texture and taste wise. It was done perfectly.

- Seared scallops: Perfect! The mashed potatoes it came with were also delicious as well as the sauce + asparagus.

- Semifreddo all'amaretto: The presentation looked super messy but it was gooooood. Sweet but not too sweet and def. got the taste of amaretto. The cookies that they came with were too hard for my taste, and forgettable.

- Creme brulee: It was good but not GREAT. Maybe I'm spoiled because I get to go to the Creme Brulee Cart near work but I did try it after I had a taste of my semifreddo so my taste buds were probably off too. Nice crispy crust and soft inside though!
author: Emily C.

description: I couldn't say anything worse. My husband and I came for the prix fixe New Year's Eve dinner and I didn't even get my entree. We had a 6 pm reservation, which should have been enough time for a palace of fine arts show at 8. By 7:15, I still didn't have my entree (though my husband had his). We ended up waking out. I wish we hadn't left any cash behind. The hostess was oblivious.
author: Rob S.

description:
Mmmmmmmmmm....  Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING on the menu is excellent.  

This is a French tapas-style restaurant, so order lots of dishes and share everything.  The food just melts in your mouth, like butter. Absolutely gourmet, you'll feel like you are spoiling yourself.  And you are, because everything is very pricey.  But if you're in the mood for decadence, this is the place to go.

Make sure you sample the following dishes: wild mushrooms, sea bass, lamb chops, crab salad, and anything else that looks good.  The dishes are all small, so you're supposed to try lots of things.

Perfect place for a special occasion, first date, or when your rich parents come to town and offer to buy you dinner.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation and were immediately seated in the patio area.  It was a chilly night but the patio area was closed off so the wind did not get us.  It was surprisingly comfortable!

They have happy hour that ends at 7pm.  A few of my friends arrived a little after 7pm but our waiter still allowed them to get their drinks at happy hour prices. What a great guy!

Some of us took advantage of the prix fixe menu, while some of us ordered off the regular menu.  I opted for the day's special which was the sea bass.  

Between the five of us, we shared:

Seabass
garlic mussels
butter salad
salmon carpaccio
foie gras
truffle risotto
angus flat iron steak
grapefruit granite
semifreddo amaretto

Everything was delicious!!!! Even the complimentary bread! They refilled it about 5 times! Our bread basket never went empty.  Parking in this area is really tough to find, but I would definitely come back here again!
author: Janet E.

description:
Quality ingredients, good atmosphere.

I love... 
*Where Isa's located. So close to the Marina, it's a gorgeous part of SF.
*Isa's atmosphere. Very light and relaxed. Lots of wood and openness
*The bread. Fresh. Delicious.
*The ingredients. You can tell every dish is made with care with the most quality stuff out there.
*Service. Each member of staff has something to do, and they do it well. Drinks never run low. Bread is always refilled. Questions are welcomed.
*Dessert. Yum.

Good, quality restaurant.
author: Trang B.

description:
Cute little restaurant in the Marina. The front area is a lounge/bar and the back area is the restaurant.

We came at 730p and got seated immediately. We tried the special of the day which is sea bass wrapped in thinly sliced potato and then grilled. It's soo delicious! It reminds me to the dish that they need to recreate in one of the Top Chef episode where Hung won. The baked goat cheese appetizer was just ok, but I just don't care about baked goat cheese in general. We also tried the lamb rack dish, which is not bad, but nothing special honestly.

Service was great. The waiter was friendly and he checked us now and then to make sure that we're happy with our food.
author: Novalina N.

description:
FOOD was good, not expensive. We ordered:-
Steamed Prince Edward island mussels
Angus Flat iron steak
Hudson valley grade A foie gras
Seared scallops
Flourless chocolate cake, vanilla bean gelato

SERVICE was bad:-
No one checked on our table.
They made us feel rushed.

I am very disappointed!!!!!
author: Mushroom K.

description:
Bookmarked this restaurant after reading several Yelp friends' reviews, I finally stopped in on a lazy weeknight. After reading in a local paper that the restaurant owner was retiring, I immediately made a reservation. When we entered, there was no one at the podium (6 pm reservation). Promptly, the bartender greeted us and gave us a choice of tables (patio dining room or inside) before we chose our window side table. The Dine About Menu includes most of the regular menu choices so we ordered the following: 
Appetizers 
1) Dungeness Crab Salad - Four lettuce wraps topped with fresh Dungeness Crab. This was refreshing with a citrus flavor and no mayonnaise. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=bRELcdLaqdw2WmsuTsEckQ) 
2) Alaskan Wild Prawns - Six perfectly grilled prawns in a sharp sauce. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=iZyR_i8z5ymAnq0cWz_7Uw) 
3) Lobster Broth - Don't be fooled by the name and expect lobster pieces as it is "broth" and flavored by the lobster. Great for cool SF evenings, there were two prawn pieces in a slightly spicy broth. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=hpdyEaor7_3B97Q24UlBGg) 
Entrees 
4) Seared Scallops - Four nicely seared scallops with four tender asparagus spears on a bed of mashed potatoes. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=dNMzJgYzn8Wsd70ZJXL-9Q) 
5) Truffle Risotto - Hearty bowl of risotto with a good mixture of wild mushrooms, topped with truffle shavings. Hearty and filling. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=dNMzJgYzn8Wsd70ZJXL-9Q) 
Desserts 
6) Grapefruit Granita - Made from fresh grapefruit juice, this icy dish was tart and flavorful. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=r1rUiadlALf_apjACfpO9g) 
7) Flourless Chocolate Cake - A chocolate cake is accompanied by a scoop of vanilla gelato, , a sweet contrast to the granita. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=z-G9B1Gt5sJLLeyUQan0Ag) 
Side 
8) Assorted Mushrooms - Being huge mushroom fans, this was a must that did not disappoint. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=kiEoe9fTn6j14M8TpCVnGQ) 

Though the bartender took our order to start, there was a smooth transition to our waiter who kindly described the dessert choices. Service was efficient as empty plates were quickly removed. Wanting to try a larger variety of dishes, we ordered more than we could eat and took home almost half of the risotto. Being early, we also ordered Happy Hour drinks (Mojito and Greyhound) for $5.00 each. It's a deceiving spot that does not stand out when you walk by. However, after you eat here, you'll soon learn that this is a mellow, hidden gem in the hip Marina.  As we left, the hostess told us that one of their most popular specials is the sea bass.  Guess we'll have to stop by again soon.... twist my arm!
author: Mike C.

description:
After hearing about Isa through friends, I finally decided to give it a try for our 2 year wedding anniversary.  It was my first time in the Marina district so it was pretty fun to walk around the area too.  

As soon as we were seated, the host came up to us to offer a choice whether to take the bonus 1000 pts for the OpenTable reservation OR order off their $28 weekday prix fixe menu.  They wouldn't allow for both.  I was a little stunned that they came and asked us.  To me, it was poor etiquette.  They even went as far as telling us that they would have to pay OpenTable if we got the 1000 pts so that was the reason why they wouldn't let us order off their prix-fixe menu.  Geez, talk about shady!  Since we didn't want to be restricted on the menu items, we opted for the 1000 pts instead.  Minus one star for this awkwardness.  

Our server was very friendly and helpful in giving us suggestions.  He reminded us that the dishes were meant to be shared.  For starters, we had the Yellowfin Tuna and Dungeness Crab Salad.  The tuna tasted like poke with chunks of tuna vs minced tuna like tartare.  I highly recommend the crab salad as it was very light and refreshing with the avocado, apple, and grapefruit.  

For the entrees, we tried their popular dish, Potato Wrapped Seabass as well as their Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast.  The fish was nicely cooked (not dried out) considering the fact that the outside had crispy potato chips.  The sauce had capers and was very flavorful with the tomato confit.  The duck was very juicy, also cooked medium rare, and I loved the sweet sauce that it came with.  Both dishes were EXCELLENT!

We ended the meal with a creme brulee.  FINALLY, a restaurant that serves the right size creme brulee!  It was a lot more appealing to the eye and my taste buds!  I've seen too many places that serve gigantic sizes.  Coffee was good and nice and hot.  Definitely a place worth trying!
author: Erica S.

description:
I was in a deep need to try some Foie Gras before the banned took into effect. Fellow foodie/yelp elite CeCe C. Her first foie gras experience, recommended that we all come here to try their Foie gras. Service here is is extremely friendly.

We got lucky and made it in time for their happy hour with our reservation. So, we took advantage of this perk and ordered the recommended wine and cocktails to accompanied our light dinner. We ordered three dishes and shared it among our group of three. First, of course, was the Foie gras we opted for the more traditional dish and had it with poached pear. The dish was done quite deliciously. Next up was the duck, the duckweed ordered was cooked up perfectly and the bacon element pushed this dish on a whole new level. Lastly, we ordered the veal sweetbread. Our waiter noted that the sweetbread is probably the most difficult and time consuming dish to make. We definitely see it in the dish. We absolutely love it, the sweetbread had none of the gamey odor and has the right amount of firmness. The potato mash in the sweetbread dish is was so good that we savory every single bit even when it was cold.

-----
+Pro: Delicious dishes made from scratch.
- Con: None!
\( ^,^)/ Overall: Delicious experience.
author: James N.

description:
GIVE IT UP FOR ISA !

Thanks to a friend who has similiar tastes and when she says something is good, it is GOOD. This place is GOOD.

We arrived on a busy Saturday night. Crowded, but nicely spaced out. We sat outside in the back. Definitely romantic with the string lights, the candles, and decor.

Took advantage of their Dine About Town menu. What a fantastic selection of first, second and third courses. I love that they don't hide the menu or pretend that it doesn't exist. Props.

Ordered the following:

(1) Steamed Prince Edwards Island Mussels - Garlic, white wine, parsley with grilled bread . . . need I say more.

(2) Northern Halibuta la plancha - Man oh man this is soooooo good. Super fresh in every way possible. The artichokes, tomato confit, etc. added a wonderful flavor to the entire dish. Well done. Bravo.

(3) Flourless chocolate cake - My least favorite of the three courses. Tasted more like a souffle than a typical dense chocolate cake. I like my chocolate cakes dense, not fluffy.

We also had the foie gras which was tasty, but a tad too sweet with the rhubarb and strawberry.

I would recommend their German reisling with the halibut and mussels ($36/bottle).

Our hailbut dishes arrived in a timely manner, but had to wait an additional 20+ minutes for a flat iron steak order. The staff took care of the situation by offering a free glass of wine and allowing us to choose desserts *outside* the Dine About Town menu.

A fantastic Marina restaurant; probably my favorite.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND the halibut and the German reisling!
author: Betty N.

description:
We made an impromptu visit and took advantage of the weekday prix fixe menu.  Initially we only wanted the $24 two course prix fixe and the tuna tartare (not on the prix fixe menu).  Well we changed our minds half way through dinner and decided to have desserts too.  Luis, our waiter, was very intuitive, without us asking, he brought the menu so we would pick the dessert that was on the prix fixe menu, thereby changing our order from the $24 two course to the $28 three course.  Essentially he saved us a few dollars.

The complimentary bread was so good.  We found out they serve Acme baguettes when we saw the truck pull up to make its delivery.

The tuna tartare has always been one of my favorites and it has been consistently good. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=xS48DI00tCc4Q34UBxlZ0g)

The 2 courses:
Grilled Local Calamari in honey spice, lemon zest & arugula.  The calamari was tender and not chewy.  The grilled tentacles had a nice smoky flavor and a crunchy bite to them. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=ZBQPRWKAuXPbASiFxpmqVg)

Grilled Yellowtail with olive oil, parsley, peppers, zucchini, artichoke, olives, and tomato confit.  Light in taste and very refreshing (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=pLnPHgl2Z76LopsFuXB1Wg)

For dessert we had decaf coffee and the Semifreddo alla Armaretto, which was vanilla ice cream mixed with Armaretto syrup.  The ice cream wasn't too sweet nor rich, and it had a crunchy bite from the frozen syrup.  A nice finish. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=BWWKvvpcmDumVttmuZ3L9A)

Our waiter was awesome.  He reassured us that even though Isa has a new owner, everything would remain the same.  Another great dinner at Isa.
author: Hannah C.

description:
EXCELLENT SERVICE

Let's put that one out there first, then let me slowly tell you why. 

The first time I was at Isa (which seemed a long time ago) left me a profound memory of the quality of the food. So last night for my second time, I decided to take my friends to try it. We arrived on time despite the terrible parking spree, and were seated promptly in a nice, corner table at the back heated patio. The host asked me if I ever been there, because he said he remembered me and waited on me that one time. Hearing that somehow made me felt more welcome.

Our waiter was very friendly, patient and knowledgeable. He explained everything in detail and was able to pick out a nice wine for us. For appetizers, we decided to try their crab salad, which was really fresh, by the way, and their sauteed prawns with spicy lobster sauce. Also pretty good. 

THEN,

One of my friends suddenly had a formidable headache, with unclear reason why, as she was perfectly fine fifteen minutes ago. I suspect it could be because she had wine with an empty stomach. Anyway, she felt nauseous and had to visit the bathroom a couple of times. I asked for some aspirin from the host and he kindly provided the pills. When my friend finally managed to drag herself out of the bathroom, she couldn't eat anything else even if she felt hungry. We decided to leave and take her home. That was merely through our appetizer round. But our thoughtful waiter understood and was capable to accommodate the situation so he gave us the bill. 

I told him we'll definitely be back. Soon.
author: Rika P.

description:
This is an amazing restaurant. While in town from Texas, friends took us here. From the moment we walked in the door, everyone was so accommodating and nice. The bartender even offered us his iPhone charger. 

They suggest sharing plates, and that's just was we did. And I would suggest sharing - that way you get to try all the deliciousness. The yellowfin tuna was amazing. The goat cheese dish was so delicious. The scallops were very tasty. And the rack of lamb was done to perfection. 

Also recommend the Number 7 cocktail. 

Wish I was closer to go back!
author: Tori R.

description:
I came with here with a fellow coworker and friend for Dine About Town. We were debating between here and Garcon as they both had the best DAT menus. She loves Isa so we came here. 

Here's a quick synopsis of the dishes:

Appetizers
Oysters - There were 6 and I was surprised they would offer this dish for DAT. The spicy orange mignonette was so good, I didn't even have to put Tabasco sauce on it, which I normally always do for fresh oysters. 

Dungeness Crab Salad - great presentation and it was my favorite appetizer of the night. 

Goat Cheese - it was a little disappointing. I would have liked this with some bread. It was just three slices of cheese with some garnishments. 

Entree
Truffle Risotto - oh so good. I could taste the fresh truffles in this dish. This is one of my favorite dishes to cook and Isa truly impressed me with their style. I didn't even sprinkle Tabasco on this dish which I normally do at home. 

Pan Roasted Range Chicken - Standout dish of the night. The crispy skin, moist texture and flavorful seasoning was just delicious. I normally would never order chicken dining out but I highly recommend it here. 

Flat Iron Steak - very tasty!

Desserts
We ordered the Semifreddo, Vanilla Bean Gelato and Creme Brulee. We all liked the Semifreddo best. 

I'll definitely be back for their regular menu.
author: Chi N.

description:
Dined here with a girlfriend during June's Dine About Town SF. Not only were we thoroughly impressed with the food (with the exception of one entree), the service was amazing. We felt very welcome from the minute we walked in. Our server was very personable and accomodating and made some great suggestions for our courses. 

We chose: 
- Dungeness Crab Salad: very light but tasty. I love when a salad tastes so clean, not overbearing with tons of dressing and toppings. 
- Maine Lobster Broth: amazing. My favorite from the whole night. I had ordered some fresh oysters because of their $1 each deal. The server recommended to put a few in my broth. Even better. My mouth is watering as I type this!
- Baked Laurel Chenel Goat Cheese: always love this combination- goat cheese, basil, pinenuts, and tomatoes. But somehow, when I make this at home, it doesn't taste this good!
- Grilled flat iron steak: perfectly cooked with a bit of pink in the middle, just like I like it. 
- Maple leaf duck breast:: this was ok. Maybe on its own, it would taste even better, but in comparison to everything else we had, this was our least favorite. 
- Semifreddo all' amaretto: loved the little cookie that accompanied this dessert. 

Overall, enjoyed our dinner and the company. Would definitely go here again, whether or not it was Dine About Town.
author: Margaret P.

description:
LOCATION & AMBIANCE: 3.5 STARS
tucked away in a side street in the marina is this little gem. i will start off by there is very little curb appeal, when you walk in the main dining seems quite narrow and small like you would expect most places in SF, the waitress began to sit us at a very awkward table near the window where we would both be on the same side, she began to ask if the patio was open.  we were then shown to the outside patio that was fully covered with string lights and headlamps, it felt very dive/bar oktoberfest but in a somewhat cute way? not my favorite style of restaurant but kinda cute and charming if you are into that kinda thing. 

SERVICE & STAFF: 4 STARS
well they were quick and attentive for sure i will give them that, but almost to the point of where i was feeling kinda rushed. my date and i were obviously spending and ordering as much food and drink as possible, however i still felt as if the staff was being rushed and just overwhelmed. the back patio which sat at least 10-12 different parties was only being handled by what seemed like 2 waiters and 1 busboy. they were basically zipping around and running in between tables, however still managed to keep my glass of water full and bring enough bread. i would of liked a little more engagement from the staff and some personal suggestions, however i won't knock them too hard because they were quick to service me. and check on everything.

FOOD: 4 STARS
for appetizers started with 
Dungeness crab salad:
not bad had a way better version of this at PICCO in LARKSPUR, however there was a lot of crab so that saved it.
foie gras w. strawberry rhubarb:
loved this a lot! FOIE IS BACK! and the strawberry was a nice touch of sweet and rich to go with the foie!!! this is a must try

for main course
Potato wrapped Seabass:
very interesting take, i thought it would be much more delicate but it was a huge chunk of fish wrapped in potato, which i thought was interesting and also quite delicious, however doesn't have much plate appeal.
Truffle risotto:
rich creamy and mushroomy, i would have liked to see less junk covering the plate however it was very well cooked and wasn't overly salty, its a pretty safe combination and they did it well.

for dessert
foie gras w. poached pear: 
well the wife didn't have enough foie so we ended with a foie dessert, and this was perfect because with our wine paring the foie and pear was much sweeter and not combined so it provided a great mix to close it out. i personally liked the strawberry version more but this is lighter and not so over bearing.
author: Thedips D.

description:
I love the place is small and cozy nice location
great food
author: A. M.

description:
Came here for dinner, ordered :

1. goat cheese appetizer which was delicious 
2. the crab salad appetizer which was ok 
3. the flank steak which was delicious 
4. the  crème brûlée which was fantastic!!

service is nice, and overall its a nice place to go for a date / friends
author: Yas G.

description:
I came here on a Saturday evening for a friend's birthday dinner. We had the flat iron steak, calamari, foie gras, grilled prawns, duckbreast, oysters, risotto and paella.

Each dish came at different times and our bread was refilled as soon as the last piece was taken. Overall the experience was enjoyable and I would return.
author: Candice H.

description: We spent two nights in SF this weekend and had the pleasure of enjoying dinner at Isa on Saturday night, thank to the good rating we discovered on Yelp and I have to say that it was one of the best meals I've ever had ever. The prawns were incredible with the perfect blend of tangy and spicy. My duck was sublime and my wife's Flat Iron Steak was simply delicious. We ended off dinner with Creme Brûlée which was spectacular. The next time we visit SF, Isa will be on top our places to visit. Loved every minute.
author: Brett D.

description:
Came by on a Saturday night with some friends, totally enjoy it. Especially like the fact that it's family style. Which means FEAST. It certainly doesn't feel like a French restaurant but more like a new american place. 

Decor: Rather old-school feel. You know, like those north beach places. But the food is worth it. 

Dishes:
1. Yellowfin Tuna: quite standard. Fresh fish. Good combination with the seaweed/avocado etc. 

2. Grilled Calamari: I like the fact that it's grilled dish. But the calamari was overcooked a tiny bit. 

3. Arugula salad: you can never go wrong with Arugula as long as they are fresh! Which is the case here. 

4. Rack of Lamb: good combination with the eggplants/zuccini. The lamb was flavorful with perfectly control of rare. 

5. Potato wrapped seabass: the fish was fresh and not overcooked. So it was good, but the seasoning side is rather weak and you came away feeling the fish was very fresh but that's about it. 

6. short rib: This is not on the menu but is by far my favorite of the night. It was slow cooked and to the degree that it's already super tender and fall right of the bone immediately. And super flavorful. 

memorable: the waiter we had was a super salesman. He can talk non-stop, and make everything sounds like you will be regretting for the rest of your life if you don't get them. Not to the degree of pushy thou, certainly a fun character to have for the table.
author: Fung S. O.

description:
This place is more of a date place over a group dinner place. I came here with a group of friends for a birthday dinner and made reservations for 7:45. We had to wait pass our reservation time but that is understandable for a Saturday night with a group of 10. 

They suggested we shared food like family style but that is kind of hard with a group of 10 so we ordered our own food. I ordered the sea bass and it was too salty on the outside and a little on the dried side for the sea bass itself. For the price they charge did not satisfy my taste buds.

Service wise, the waiters were very attentive but not on pushy side. Water and bread was refilled when needed without being asked. Service wise I will give them a 4 star.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
It all comes down to this...............

5/5 for ambiance
3.5/5 for food
3/5 for service

I decided to bring my guests from abroad here for dinner. I personally wasn't pleased by the experience, but my guests were extremely happy with it. So their smiles make it the whole night priceless. 

Ambiance is really nice, plus we were sitting at the patio. They offer a prix fixe menu $29.95 for 3-course which is very affordable! But the selections aren't that great. My least favorite is the Range Chicken.. the presentation was just NOT THERE, I felt like I was eating at some fast food joint for a second. 

However, I love the mussels appetizer and duck breast entree. Their sauce looks so light, yet so tasty! Halibut is okay, too much zucchini. Salmon cappachio is very fresh! Family style is another plus. 

Service is okay, good but not great. Bad service and lack of presentation makes me sad. But prior coming to the restaurant, I had good experience talking on the phone, so ok... another plus.
author: Marlis T.

description:
Love here! 
On a Saturday night, we reserved here via open table at 5pm on the day and got a table for 7:30pm. Lucky one. 

FOOD
1) Lobster broth -Sooo Goood! Rich lobster aroma and umami in the broth. We could ate more! 
2) Butter lettuce salad - Nicely dressed with the sauce. Blue cheese worked good as an accent. 
3) Mushroom risotto - Best risotto in bay area so far! I've been fed up with too rich too salty risotto recently, but this saved me to keep loving risotto! Superb richness and saltiness. 3-4? varieties of mushrooms in it and they created beautiful aroma. 
4) Lamb -Bit salty. But nicely grilled and good medium rare. 
5) Chicken - Bit strong for me but I know this is the French bistro flavor...  Side mashed potato was nice and creamy but too much with its rich sauce. 

DECOR / ATMOSPHERE
Busy but not too noisy. Clean wooden interior with nice modern accent. I love the cozy atmosphere.

PRICE
Decent. Don't remember the total...

This became my favorite and I would definitely come back here! This is a good place to bring friends if you like to have casual but nice decent dinner.
author: Heidi M.

description: Brilliant service . From the host to the busser, to the wait staff. Amazingly eclectic kind crew. Made our night
author: james p.

description: Actual score: 3.5 stars. Charming, friendly bistro atmosphere with tasty tapas/sharable plates and diverse wine selection. Highly recommend the goat cheese app, lamb chops and truffle spaghetti, which was light, al dente and delicious. Looking forward to going back to try a few other suggestions. The waitstaff and sommelier were very friendly, too--a plus in the marina.
author: Jill W.

description:
Don't skip the mushroom risotto.
Oysters were good.
Duck was good.
author: Juliette W.

description:
Went here for Dine About Town with the bf which is probably the best deal if you want the full food experience.

Why I love:
-the DESSERTS. the vanilla bean creme brulee and the semifreddo all' amaretto were the best part of the meal
-for dine about town, this restaurant gave a lot of choices for each course which surprised me because other participating restaurants only have a couple choices per course
-the food was of course really good. The salmon carpaccio was really yummy but the dungeness crab salad was ok. For the main course, I got the duck breast which was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor. My bf got seasonal fish which we probably won't get next time because there's better options
-their cocktails were really good and there were a lot of interesting mixes. They were decently strong and priced.
-excellent service esp. since they gave us free moscato for celebrating our anniversary (yay for free stuff)
-really cute patio area

What could be better:
-parking but that area in SF is always crazy so have to get lucky with parking
-price is the only thing stopping me from coming back, but that's expected at this kind of restaurant
author: Jessica H.

description:
Perfect date restaurant. Perfect large group dinner restaurant. Modern and gorgeous, the back patio provides for a seriously romantic ambiance. Tapas style food so it is best to come with a bigger group so you can try more.

My favorites:
- Foie gras: perfectly seared. Warm, creamy and comes paired with seasonal fruit and brioche. Heavenly.
- Truffle risotto: creamy with Parmesan and shittake mushrooms. Must share with someone because it can get heavy after a few bites.
- Maple leaf duck breast: slices of duck cooked medium rare in huckleberry sauce. 
- Seared scallops

Everything is good here!
author: Tina T.

description: Pretty decent food.....nothing extraordinary though.  Relaxing ambience plus outdoor patio is a bonus.
author: Wing C.

description:
Farewell foie (gras)! 

I love restaurants with converted-backyard dining areas... As I walked in, the front part of the bar/lounge area was dark and dim, very romantic and as I was led to the back, it was like being led into a secret garden filled with soft lights (just like how the movies portray it!). 

Service: Top notch. Our server, Dean, was the sweetest, cutest little Vietnamese man ever! It was nice to see someone so passionate about the food and the restaurant, especially stressing how all the staff work as a team. I swear, about 5 different people besides Dean helped us that night - either cleared the tables, brought wine, brought food, asked if we were doing ok, etc. Amazing.

Food: We received very good recommendations and EVERYTHING was exceptional. Sometimes you get one dish that wows you while the others don't. Not here. Each dish was pretty equal. We also made happy hour (til 7pm) so all wines and cocktails were $5.

-Seared Foie with pears and custard brioche: hope you all can try this once before the ban. It was amazing.

- Lobster broth: we were warned that this was prepared in the simplest way possible and that if we were looking for a heavier soup, this wasn't it. Ordered it anyway and loved it. Glad it wasn't heavy since we had ordered so many other dishes.

- Potato-Wrapped Seabass: salty potato paired with a relatively blander but very smooth fish. I would definitely order it again.

-Duck Breast: I thought I was eating beef - that's how tender, juicy and non-duck like it was.

Solid California-French fare that is definitely more wallet-friendly than the usual.
author: Liana L.

description:
I used to LOVE Isa when it was run by the original owners.  Now, I'll never go back.

I didn't even get to eat the food there Saturday night because A PIECE OF THEIR ROOF FELL ON MY HEAD.  After the incident, the owner, Sameera, blew it off and kept telling me it was "no big deal".  Instead of apologizing and making the situation better, she actually made it worse by trying to minimize the seriousness of the situation.  There are apparently pieces of the rain slats HELD ON BY BINDER CLIPS, that's cannot be up to code.
