Needless to say, we asked for the check and went to the restaurant next door. I still can't understand why a restaurant would treat a customer in such a way.
author: Candice K.

description: They were busy with restaurant week, so service was slow. The duck and steak were both very rare. The creme brulee was good but not amazing.
author: PJ L.

description: It's only a very few places where everything on the menu is just delicious. If you love seafood this is the spot, very fresh and delicious. Paella and mussels were the best!
author: Javeria M.

description:
Excellent food. Absolutely delicious. Friendly waitstaff, quaint atmosphere and delectable drinks. Price was on the higher side but not overpriced for what you get. The quality of the food was well worth it. 

Dishes:
1. Scallops - buttery, smooth, not tough
2. Mushroom risotto - well seasoned, creamy without being overly creamy, soft not soggy, nice bite not under cooked - Goldilocks of risottos - "JUST RIGHT"
3. Veal sweetbread - good, even for someone who doesn't eat sweetbread
4. Seabass - well cooked, no fishy smell, fresh, tasty sauce, perfect mashed potatoes
5. Pork chop (special) - yum. not too salty and not tough or dry
6. Mussels - sauce! oh the sauce! so good I practically drank the sauce out of the bowl

Drinks:
1. Chocolate champagne - tasted and smelled like liquid chocolate - very sweet but not heavy like a liqueur
2. Peach champagne - smelled like peach cobbler! tasty and sweet, not heavy like a liqueur
3. Dark muscato - dark muscato - never seen that before! It looked like port but tasted like a late harvest white wine. Very interesting and my taste buds thanked me.

Finally, the icing on the cake - our waiter! Friendly, upbeat, passionate and very enthusiastic about serving us. Seeing him and his genuine passion for his restaurant's food made me enjoy my meal all the more. 

Will 100% be returning.
author: Michelle S.

description: we came here for the SF restaurant week dinner. This restaurant is so packed that we only booked the table at 8pm. There are 9 of us so we pretty much ordered everything on the menu. The thing I liked most is the smoked salmon. The duck breast and risotto is pretty good too. I don't quite like the steak though. it's juicy but the sauce is a bit sour. The mussel and soup the just so so. I ordered brûlée as the dessert. A bit too sweet for me. I would say it's a good choice for restaurant week. But not sure about the rest of the time...
author: Vivian Y.

description:
Oh, wow! Absolutely everything we had was AMAZING! I love that it's family style and the pace of the meal was perfect. You would just be finishing up one dish and another one would be set down on the table. So many delicious dishes to sample! And they have happy hour from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. so we saved some money on our champagne :)

Here's what we ordered and my ratings:
Dungeness Crab Salad - a great starter
Maine lobster broth - I'm not big on sea food but everyone at my table loved this.
Foie Gras - You MUST order this! It was totally delicious and a HUGE portion!
Scallops - delicious!
Truffle Risotto -  definitely a must order as well
Rack of Lamb - was really good
Sweetbreads - I wasn't all that impressed. You can skip this one.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
My experience would qualify for a 3.5 stars.

I spent an inordinate amount of time obsessing about where to take my boyfriend for his birthday dinner; So much time was spent on Opentable, I'm surprised someone didn't mistake me as an employee of that company.

We shared the following:

Steamed Prince Edward island mussels: 4/5.  Fresh tasting mussels in a light, tasty wine sauce.

Truffle risotto with baby shiitake, hon shimiji mushroom & reggiano: 3/5.  The risotto was a tad overcooked, so it didn't have any bite.  It also happened to be a bit too salty, and didn't have enough richness to round it out.  Though it smelled delicious with the truffle oil wafting up to our noses, it was a bit underwhelming.
 
Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak with haricots verts, fingerling potatoes, moutarde verte & bordelaise sauce: 4/5.  Nice, flavorful flat iron steak with perfectly cooked haricots verts and fingerling potatoes.  The bordelaise sauce was what sold me on the dish.
 
Semifreddo all' amaretto: 3.5/5

The service was spectacular, as our waiter came by frequently to offer suggestions and ask how our dining experience was.  One of the things that marred our experience was the large, loud table seated near us, but that isn't something the restaurant has full control over.

My first experience a couple of years ago was so much better, that I thought it merited a second visit for a special occasion, but I wished I had selected another french restaurant for my boyfriend's birthday.  This may be a better place for a casual dinner.
author: Janet L.

description:
Came here with the family including our 2 year old for dinner. Was a bit nervous at first because the place is a nice Cal-French establishment and we have in the past felt uncomfortable at other fine dining restaurants when we have brought our daughter. Not the case here, we opted to sit in the heated covered patio in the back which I think is the better option. Noticed two other large families, one with a kid and one with a baby. Mind you our daughter knows how to behave herself and the other tables children did as well, don't expect a Johnny Rockets vibe with kids running around all over the place. 
The food is served in portions that are slightly larger than an appetizer and slightly smaller than a normal sized entree. They encourage sharing. My wife and I ordered 4 dishes plus a cheese plate which for us was plenty even giving our daughter bites along the way. However if you are a big eater 1 to 2 more dishes would probably equate to a heavy meal. You order everything up front and the chef brings things out as they are ready and in the order that makes the most sense as far as flavor progression. They have an excellent wine list however most things seemed to pair well with Pinot noir. 

Although everything was excellent the 2 dishes that really stood out were the potato crusted halibut, and the mushroom and truffle risotto, Both were outstanding. Bill was reasonable also considering the quality of the food served, we would defiantly come back. 
.
author: Natalie V.

description: My wife and I are always excited about Dine About Town and somehow, amidst all the restaurants, we always end up going back to Isa.  They have the best menu of all and their scallops are so amazing, a must try! And the salmon carpaccio never disappoints either!
author: Kevin L.

description:
1045 reviews, another one wont hurt right? 

came here last minute, made a reservation yelp and they had time slots open for us. the food wasn't bad it was good for the price and the foie gras was delish. the only thing is that the 1st time i came here and the 2nd time i came here and had foie gras the size if it was a huge difference. 1st time was pretty small a few bites and 2nd time it was pretty big, what's up with that Isa? 

other than that it's a good place to come to SHARE not to have a plate to yourself. if you do that you would probably not enjoy the experience.
author: Anita L.

description:
Came here for Dine About Town with my boyfriend.   

I chose this restaurant because they have a large selection for their DAT menu, unlike other places.   

Our reservation was on a Sunday night so it was super crowded.  Fortunately, we got seated right away at a very cramped table, so we requested for a switch to which they happily accommodated us.   The waiters were all really nice and helpful.  We got there 5 minutes before happy hours was over, but we didn't know.  Our waiter instantly told us that we still have a some time left and gave us a happy hours menu.  Auto +1 in my book.   :) 

What we ordered:

Appetizers:
Dungeness Crab Salad - The lettuce was fresh and the crab bits were yummy.  
Salmon Carpaccio - really really good.  the salmon were thinly sliced and melts in your mouth.   

Entrees: 
Scallops:  This review is a bit overdue so I don't remember what this was like.  However, I am quite sure I did not dislike it.  
Flat Iron Steak:  My bf got this and he said it was amazing.   

Desserts:  
Semifreddo:  It was very nice looking but I just didn't like the  cinnamon taste.  My bf thought it was yummy though.  
Chocolate Cake:  Bf ordered this and I tried it.  I thought it was better than the semifreddo.   

Overall, very good service and decent food for DAT price.  (prob not worth the regular prices in my book).   

Only thing I didn't like about this place was the parking, but I guess that's expected of SF.
author: Thuan T.

description:
Pros: Patio

Came here for an awesome DAT and also to sample their normal prix-fix menu. We were happily seated in the outside patio. With the giant lights and wooden exterior, I loved the mellow ambiance of this Marina spot. 

I was really impressed by the overall service and quality of ISA. Excellent ingredients prepared well, particularly demonstrated by the meats. Both the chicken and steak were very tender and flavorful. The chicken was actually very succulent. 

The mussels were also excellent and perfectly cooked. A few members of our party had not had them before, so we order them with frites and everyone really really enjoyed them.
author: Sue Y.

description:
My oh-so-kind girlfriend took me here a couple weekends ago to celebrate my starting a new job. Little did she know that this new job has much worse hours, and that I'll be seeing her less. Or maybe that's why she wanted to celebrate...

Perhaps it's best that she doesn't see this review, however, because Isa was slightly disappointing. The space is nice enough, albeit with something of a split personality -- the dark, wood-paneled, shee-shee front half, and then the covered patio in the back. Our soju-based drinks weren't bad -- a mojito for me, a Greyhound for her. The food is also very fairly priced, with an emphasis on seafood. But the food itself? Nothing spectacular. Bland sea bass, run-of-the-mill scallops, blah salad. Also, everything was a bit on the salty side.

That said, maybe we didn't order quite right, so I'd be open to another try.
author: Albert L.

description:
Atmosphere: A bit on the dressier side. 

F&B: French tapas--a newer concept to me and pretty tasty. The food's a bit pricey for the amount you get, but an overall good dining experience.

Service: Great service--knowledgeable servers that are just the right amount of attentive. Initially, we were seated inside, but a table opened up in the back covered patio. We jumped on it and it turned out to be a highlight of the meal :)

Location: 

**Tip: make a reservation and try to snag a table in the covered patio.
author: Phoebe P.

description:
"SEARED???" MORE LIKE "BURNT TURD!!!!!!" I AM FURIOUS!!!!!! 

HI, WOULD YOU LIKE SOME BURNT TURD? 
HUDSON VALLEY GRADE A FOIE GRAS w/ peaches & brioche w/ Peaches & Custard Brioche- GRADE A, REALLY?? (Please refer to the picture I've uploaded). This God awful thing came out looking like a piece of turd, not just any piece of turd BUT A BURNT PIECE OF TURD!! As a chef, how do you allow something like that to leave your kitchen?? I've never seen foie gras like this! It was NOT seared but more burnt, if it were seared the searing marks from the grill would be visible (it was non-exisitent in this case). BTW, I ate a HUGE piece of burnt foie gras and it was painful! Usually when you cut into foie gras, it should be a smooth transition from the time your knife cuts through the top to the bottom. BUT not with this foie gras, I felt like I was struggling to cut this into pieces. There was also this stringy rubber like consistency that I've NEVER seen in foie gras, it looked like the phlegm you spit out into a sink!! *BARF* 

HOW COULD I HAVE BEEN SO "BLAND"
GRILLED GOLDEN GATE NATURAL ANGUS FLAT IRON STEAK w/ haircots verts, fingerling potatoes, moutarde verte & bordelaise sauce- The flat iron steak was cooked medium rare, exactly what I asked for BUT the steak was extremely bland. I found myself trying to grab as much of the moutarde verte as I could to flavor this thing. Why didn't I use the bordelaise sauce? Oh, because it was overpoweringly salty and made the dish even more unappetizing. The fingerling potatoes were undercooked, it was tough cutting into it and when I bit into it, it was pretty darn raw. The haircots verts was the best thing on the dish because it had a snap to it when you bit into it and it was seasoned nicely. 

THERE'S ALWAYS ROOM FOR DESSERT
VANILLA CREME BRULEE- This was the best thing out of the entire meal, even then that's not saying much because the crust of the creme brulee was very very VERY thick (that's what she said). Usually when you have creme brulee, it's fairly easy to crack the surface by one top of your spoon. Well in this case it took both my friend and I 2-3 taps until the surface broke, we looked at each other confused and wondering is creme brulee suppose to be like this? If you're not careful eating this, you might just end up stabbing your mouth. Though the surface was tough, the inside was nice and creamy. 

SERVICE
I felt like they were a bit unorganized, we got our entrees while we were still working on our appetizers and we had to maneuver plates around just to make room. Also, utensils were taken away after my appetizer. When my entree was placed in front of me, I was looking for utensils and there were none so I had to ask for  fork and knife. -_-" Though I felt like the service was unorganized, they were very attentive and our waters were always refilled. 

CONCLUSION
The pros could NOT outweigh the cons. Initially I was going to give Isa two stars but after having a couple days to think about it, I realized that I was very upset at the fact that I was served BURNT TURD. THANKS FOR THAT CANCER CAUSING PIECE OF CRAP!
author: Heather C.

description:
Over 800+ reviews and 4 stars rating, why is this place so dead?  Reservation was at 7 but we arrived earlier than expected as we found parking right across the street.  Went in and it was only filled with 3 tables?  I had to do a double take to make sure I was at the right place!  We were immediately greeted and were seated with a table at the back.  

We were handed the menu and I was surprised to find out the happy hour specials were available at the table.  That's probably the first for me since most places usual do their specials at the bar. Bonus star for that!  Of course I started off with my usual, a glass of bubbly, while my friend ordered two rounds of red for him.  I checked out the menu and decided to do a la carte while he did the prix-fix menu. We've been advised that their dishes are served family style and we should not over order as their portions sizes are very generous.  They were not kidding at all!!  It's a good thing we didn't over order because I was full from my 3 glasses of bubblies and the warm acme bread before the entrée arrived.

The two of us shared the dishes and I was pleasantly surprised that everything was good and well executed.

Steam Prince Edward Island Mussels - not your typical creamed saucy mussels but they were still good
Pt. Reyes oysters with spicy mignonette - very sweet and fresh
Hudson valley Foie Gras - delish!  Melts in your mouth like butter, which I would describe as deadly!!
Braised short ribs with mashed potatoes and sautéed brussel sprouts - Special of the day and definitely worth ordering again
Semifreddo all'amaretto

I would definitely go back to Isa if I am in the area. Service was attentive and very personable.  This is a perfect date night place for last minute procrastinator or simply a nice meal on the weekday.
author: Amy L.

description:
Where do I start with Isa? It's by far my favorite non-wallet killing restaurant in the city, and the perfect place for a romantic date.

My first visit to Isa was on Valentine's Day, where my girlfriend and I shared a delicious 6 course prix-fixe meal. Each course offered a few choices, one of which was always a meat-free option, which is a major plus since my girlfriend is a pesceterian (only seafood). Everything, and I mean everything, was perfect. Since then Isa has been our go-to date spot, and it never fails to impress. 

The entire menu is great, but in my opinion some standouts are the scallops (best I've ever had, hands down), the baked goat cheese (like heaven spread on a slice of bread), the spaghetti with Himalayan truffle sauce, and the truffle risotto.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Food is 3 stars, but with all the mishaps, my experience here is 2 stars.

When I made reservations, I specifically requested an intimate table because it was for a birthday.  Or as intimate as it can be because I am aware this place can be loud.  We were taken to the back patio and was seated in the very front of the patio.  Next to the doorway.  Near the bathroom. Where everyone has to walk by.  Inches away from a party of 10 or so.  We might as well have been a part of that party because that's how close we were.  Not quite the intimate seating I had expected.  I look around and I see an empty table for 2 available.  I asked to change tables but a couple had just been seated there.  Shortly after, another table became available, so we switched to a table in the back.

It was dine about town, so for appetizers we had dungeness crab salad and mussels.  Crab salad was good, but it was so simple that I feel like I could make it myself.  Mussels were good too and I enjoyed dipping the complimentary bread into the broth.  The bread was really addictive. 

I added the foie gras since I've never really had foie gras before.  It's definitely not my thing and thank goodness because I would've been sad about the ban.  It didn't taste irony, which is good, but it was soooo soft and mushy.  Paired with the brioche and it was just soft and more softness.  I needed some texture.

For entrees, we had the duck breast and the flat iron steak.  The duck was alright, but it would've been better if the skin was crispy.  The sauce wasn't very spectacular.  We waited for a long time for the flat iron steak to come out.  They started clearing our table to get ready for dessert and that's when we said we haven't gotten the steak yet.  Turns out, they accidentally had given it to the guy next to us, even though he had eaten his entree already.  So, finally the steak comes out.  But there's mustard on it.  And we had asked for no mustard.  So we just didn't eat it.

For dessert, we chose the semifreddo and the vanilla gelato.  Again, no other word to describe them besides "good."  

Yeah, it was a good deal for a 3 course French restaurant, but I'd much rather have that money spent somewhere else because the food was just not memorable.
author: Kat E.

description:
Ambience
When you walk into the restaurant, you think its a small cafe with an open kitchen.  A few small tables on the right. Then when you walk further into the restaurant you will see more tables on the left, and when you walk further in, you walk into a expansive area, the backyard. The backyard has tables, a deck and heat lamps. The entire area is enclosed by a canopy and neighboring fence. It's unique and cozy. My special date and I sat at a table on the deck. Though many other parties were there, it was not noisy. We could hear each other speak clearly without effort. When we were seated, they immediately pour complimentary wine into our wine glasses. Nice! And so were the wines.

Food
It was Dine About Town, so we ordered a crab salad, mussels, iron plater steak, roast    duck from the set menu. My special companion drank a Number Seven cocktail of mixed fruits. Sometimes fruity cocktails can end up tasting like cough syrup, but not this time. The crab salad was made up of shredded crab and thin slices of pear all on top of romaine lettuce presented on a long thin plater.  The servings seem to be lacking or more to the point wanting more. The mussels had a nice seafood bisque sauce that's light and tasty.  Save the sauce for bread dipping. Yum! The roast duck was served sliced. It was not over cooked as many places do. It had a chewy texture just enough, but not annoying and distracting.

Service
The waiter was pleasant with a bit of a humorous sarcastic edge. It seemed as though it was part of the show. He was helpful, polite, and attentive. He gave us tips immediately. Many times, I would ask for the service staff for their advice on 
 menu items since they sampled the food.

Parking
Horrible, but we managed to find parking within a few minutes on Lombard St. probably because I brought my parking fairy.

Enjoy!  I did.
author: Wayne L.

description:
We had our reception this past weekend, the 30th of March, at Isa. We had an absolutely wonderful time.  

Sameera, the manager did a fantastic job helping myself and my wife coordinate the event in the weeks leading up to the event.  We had just under 50 guests and there were special requests for types of meals and allergies.   Sameera was very supportive and helped us work out all the kinks.

We had a special set up that we needed to have done before we got there from the ceremony which was all taken care of.  The transitions were very smooth, service was timed nicely the food was delicious and hot.  I got some very good responses from my family and guests who said it was some of the best food they've ever had at a reception. 

Overall a great great experience with only one kink around one of our guests not getting a part of his meal  Which Sameera made an attempt to work out with the guest during the reception... She then went above and beyond and gave us  credit to use towards a meal we could have after the event.

I would highly recommend Isa to anyone looking for a place to have an event or a wedding reception. We're so grateful for having our reception there this past weekend it made our special day all the more special.
author: Eric R.

description:
Amazing date night! Ambiance, service and food for the win!

We came here for dine about town. We had a reservation at 730 and we were promptly seated. I have to say, 3 oz martini glasses just don't do it for me. It actually annoys me. Have a sip and half of the drink is gone....

Moving on to food
mussels: broth was very well done, perfect flavors for the mussels.
crab salad: fresh, light and delightful
flat iron steak: can't go wrong with some steak!
scallops: the scallops were on the smaller side, but it was amazing!
grapefruit dessert: what everyone needs on a summer night. The most amazing little treat.
author: Emily T.

description: I've had four meals from this restaurant through delivery.... I'll start by saying it's some of the best food I've ever had living in San Francisco my entire life eating out almost every night... I almost hate to share this with you because I want to keep this restaurant to myself....
author: chris c.

description: Went here for Valentine's Day and had a great time with the wife. The cocktails were good along with the food. The atmosphere was nice, but the menu was a little confusing. I would try this place again.
author: William B.

description:
I heard through the grapevine that foie gras will be banned in California soon.  What better time to try it then now?

For $22 the waiter boasts you get a generous size; larger than any other establishment would dare to serve (my words, not his).  So with great gusto my BF and I ordered it and shared it among the rest of our party.  

It came out a glistening hunk of meaty organ surrounded in a (red) sauce and accompanied with a type of bread(?).  The waiter suggest some sort of wine (I don't remember the name) with a flourish.  I vouch for the wine because I am testy about eating liver of any kind.  God forbid I taste the pate in bahn mi!

I. DID. NOT. LIKE. IT.  

If this is what the French think of as fancy then I want to be a stinking, lowest class, loser who eats from the dollar menu @ McDonalds.

Okay, so enough about my personal triumph over liver.  It won, I lost.  The wine did NOT help.

We also got the spicy Tuna salad which I adored.  I could have eaten the whole thing by myself but, alas, I had to share.  It was wonderful and I insist everyone try it (unless you don't like raw fish).

About the entrees:  I ordered the Golden Gate (?) flat iron steak.  First of all, it is not golden, or even red, like the Golden Gate Bridge.  That's okay because I like steak anyways.

They had put this fancy schmancy wasabi bernaise sauce over the steak which rendered it inedible to me.  My BF liked it however, so I traded my non-tainted slices with his pure steak.  Oh yeah, the steak was sliced.

The sides that came with it were absolutely HEAVENLY!  I loved the fingerling potatoes, just crisp enough on the edges to make way for the salty, starchy insides.  And was that a type of balsamic reduction it was basking in?  Ah, delicious.  Truly foods for the gods.  The string beans were also good but that's because I have a special place in my heart for that particular vegetable.

For dessert I ordered the amaretto (almond) gelato.  It was a generous serving (1 1/2 scoops) with little amaretto cookies dotting the side.  Absolutely delicious.  It was easily the lightest, most airy ice cream I've ever had the chance to devour.  Everyone else ordered creme brulee which was good but nothing about it stood out.  I think I picked a good dessert choice (:

Anyways, this place is really, really expensive.  The waiter spent quite a good deal of time explaining to us how to order (which really means how to extract the most money out of us).  We wisely ordered what we wanted and most of us were overjoyed with the results.

I'd probably come here again if they lowered their prices (considering what they served).  It was also extremely crowded, as if they were trying to push as many tables as closely together as possible.  It was uncomfortable to be less than 3ft away from your neighboring diners.  They were extremely well staffed though.  Our food came out very quickly (though our waiter told us it'd be 30 minutes in between dishes) and everyone was very friendly and helpful.

I'd say, go here if you can afford it.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
What a delicious dinner. Party of five of us came for Dine-About-Town and they had their entire menu available for it, not just a few choices. The covered and heated outdoor seating brings an atmosphere that you don't often get in the city. The staff was knowledgeable about the food and the owner was walking around all night making sure everyone was satisfied. The only thing that I didn't like is that they have a small kitchen so when it is busy they don't bring everyone's food out at the same time. This wasn't an issue for us since we were all sharing from each others plates and wouldn't be an issue if you are not in a group.

The food was fantastic. We purposely avoided the Foie Gras because I heard they burn it to a crisp, and saw pictures of it on Yelp. What we did order was top notch. Highlights from the meal include:

Steamed PEI Mussels - some of the best I have ever had
Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese - hot, savory and delicious
Truffle Risotto - I am not a risotto fan and this was fantastic
Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast - a must order!

Appetizers are in the $10-15 range. Entrees are in the low $20s. They have a prix fix menu for $29.95 Sun-Thur if you want to save some money, but it does not include the duck breast. I will definitely be coming back to Isa.
author: Frank J.

description:
It's such a cute place but the wait is long even after you made a reservation.

Dungeness Crab Salad is so fresh and yummy! Arugula salad with touches of apple and mandarin makes it refreshing.

Maine Lobster broth is so flavorful.

The BEST thing was the truffle risotto with baby shitake, shimiji mushroom.. SO yummy! the rice was cooked perfectly with the mushroom flavors..yummo!

The rack of lamb is cook perfectly!!! so tender!!!!

The range chicken was ok... nothing too special

The duck was amazing too

As for dessert, def try their ice cream and flourless chocolate cake!

we will come back soon!

p.s. very good service!
author: Sophie L.

description: Romantic window view table and awesome food and service. Recommend the vegetable seabass!
author: Rach T.

description:
Their food is really good. I tried their seafood, their duck, their braised short rib, their mashed potatoes... Everything was a hit. The semifreddo all'amaretto was really tasty and the texture is very unique if you've never had semifreddo before - definitely worth a try.

Service was generally good, but something about the overall ambiance/front of the house gave me a weird vibe. I can't quite put my finger on it.

5* for Chef Luke Sung, 4* for Isa.


P.S. They have cool interactive menus/games at the bar!
author: Rachel Y.

description:
After spending 20 minutes circling the area in search of a parking space, I finally found a spot about 4 blocks from Isa. Not bad right? WRONG. Especially if you decided to wear 3.5 inch heel booties 'cause "it looks cute with your outfit." ESPECIALLY if you had to sprint 4 blocks in those same heels because you found parking 5 minutes before your reservation. A word to the wise, don't wear heels if you're driving to someplace with crappy parking...

Isa. I've never been a huge fan of French cuisine, namely because of the notoriously small portions. But wow, Isa filled my heart and my tummy. 


My BFF and I came here for the Dine About Town special. I had the salmon carpaccio, flat iron steak, and semifreddo amaretto, a glass of zinfandel, and a glass of really dry bubbly. I don't usually drink that much during a meal, but tonight we were being fancy, so why not go all out? My friend ordered mussels steamed in white wine, grilled fish (I think it was cod), and creme brulee.  

impressive: 
- salmon carpaccio: The salmon was very fresh! The capers, lemon, & crème fraiche were a nice touch. 

- angus flat iron steak: YUM. The steak was rather small, but it was cooked just the way I like my steak (medium-well). It was topped off with moutarde verte & an amazing bordelaise sauce. I believe moutarde verte is some sort of horseradish garnish because it tasted a little like wasabi. (I looked this up on Google, but only learned that "moutarde" is some sort of French profanity.)

- steamed mussels: I hate shellfish, but today I decided to give mussels another chance. Although I still don't like the texture of mussels in general, the flavor of these was good enough to make me overlook that. The sauce was buttery with an alcoholic kick to it. (I love alcohol in food.)

- semifreddo all' amaretto: Almond ice cream with 3 little almond biscuits. The ice cream was rich and creamy.



meh: 
- "seasonal fish": I don't remember what kind of fish this was, but it tasted like cod. The flavor was rather bland.



some observations:

- My best friend and I had a dinner reservation for 6:15pm, but for some reason it was pushed back to 6:30pm. She was not notified of this change. A 15 minute delay isn't a big deal, but it would've been nice to receive a heads up or something---just as a courtesy. 

- The servers are very friendly, but are clearly amateurs. Our main server left after taking our drink orders, just as I was about to tell him we were ready to order everything else. There were times when a server would awkwardly mosey on by our table with an inquisitive look; but just as quickly, he'd disappear without a word.

We were served our food without proper descriptions. The server brought our mussels and happily announced our "mushrooms are ready". He also set down our tiny mussel-forks and said he'd bring us more "spoons." I found this pretty endearing because of the server's confidence. English was obviously not his forte, so I can't give him crap for butchering the food names. However, a different server brought our other dishes without telling us what they were. Not cool. 

When we finished our main course, another server came and began rolling up the brown paper place mats before asking us to move our glasses. That would've been a liquidy disaster, had we not moved our 2 glasses of water, 2 glasses of bubbly, and my glass of red away in time. 


Overall, the food is pricey, but worth a try. Service is not exactly professional, but a smile & proper manners are often enough for me. 

Oh yeah, expect to have a fun time looking for parking.
author: Lillian D.

description:
Waiter SO great. Put up with my imaginary friend and all. ;-). Love him (waiter, not friend). 

2 course per person suggested,  which was too much. All courses amazing. Particularly loved the salads, scallops, halibut. Boss loved frois gras, but I have a new commitment to restrain from duck livers going forward. Veg-heads loved crab salad (pescatarians) and spaghetti for veggies. Zuchinni had chicken stalk but can request w/o. 

Other guests loved the lamb and duck. 

Too much food. Yummy and rich and no one wants to take a bus after that and since I took BART from East Bay, took a cab home...!  Hard to get to from BART if you don't like buses.  Drive and save the hassle.

Food great and rich. 80$ per person. 

Wine good. Staff SO great. 

Overall a good deal for colleagues and or friends. No need to ruin greatness with the muni when all you need really is a quick nap!
author: Stacey C.

description: Wow. What can I say? This dining experience was great. It was high end service in an ambient, casual setting. My hubby and I came here for our ten year dating anniversary and it couldn't have been more perfect! I highly recommend and we will definitely be returning customers.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Had a great dinner at Isa today. This place was full and even though we had a reservation we had to wait about 25 minutes to order drinks. This was the down part and also i found it a little to noisy. These are the reasons i gavd them 4 stars. 
We loved the food though! Crab salad, mussels , rack of lamb and scallops were delicoius. I added it to my favorites restaurants list. I will definately go back and tell my friends about it. Thank you
author: Lana G.

description:
This place is amazing.  I've been three times, and have been delighted by something different on each occasion.  The oysters, foie gras, sea bass, and steak are a must-try at some point.

The food is absolutely perfect, and the ambience makes for one of the best date spots or group dinner settings in the city.  The lighting in the back area is a perfect soft orange glow, the noise is a warm but well-controlled hum, and tables have just enough to be comfortable while still having that small-gem restaurant feel (i.e., Frances).
author: Howie L.

description:
Came here for Dine About Town with some friends, we were seated outside in the covered patio. The ambiance is great, it was a lively environment (not super dimly lit and hush quiet). The only downside is that we were sitting along the "wall" and the rain was dripping down onto the backs of our jackets. :( Service was great though, waiter was friendly, and they were absolutely fantastic(!) about refilling water and bread. 

Okay onto food, first of all - the bread was fresh and still warm when it arrives on our table. Great texture and so good, I think we ate a couple of baskets of that alone. :)

Appetizers
-Steamed mussels: this was a sizable portion of mussels in a light tomato sauce. It was seasoned well and the mussels were tender. 
-Crab salad: crab and fruit on a butter lettuce. The presentation was fantastic, the taste is sort of what it sounds like. Not bad. 
-Salmon carpaccio: I don't have a lot of experience with salmon, but I tried it and it definitely tasted fresh and had a good texture.  
-Goat cheese: maybe we're not huge goat cheese fans, but this one didn't go well with our group. It was just very strong. Maybe it grows on you?

Entree
-Seared scallops: scallops were definitely good and well cooked. I would only recommend this dish if you like brussel sprouts though (because you get a ton!), but the plus side is there is real bacon on top :D
-Mushroom risotto: this was delicious, very rich but not super dense. I think it also had truffle in it, yummy!
Seasonal fish: ours was the petra sole. This came out great, it had that perfect flaky texture. 
-Duck breast: I am neutral on this, the meat was tender (but my opinion is slightly biased since I don't like duck that much).

Dessert
-Creme brulee: this came out in a relatively deeper dish, and had a thick shell of caramelized sugar on top that for some of us was pretty burnt. I personally don't mind that burnt taste and I like when the shell is thicker, but it depends on if you like it that way. the creme itself was really smooth and in the middle in terms of light or heavy. 
-Vanilla gelato: can't go wrong with ice cream! :)
-Amaretto semifreddo: not a huge fan, but it was interesting to see what a semifreddo was (like a semi frozen custard).

Overall great dining experience!
author: Linda L.

description:
My friends and I came here on Thursday for Dine About Town. I received a call the day of by a very friendly and polite garçon to verify my reservations which was nice. Even though I had reservations, my friends and I still had to wait ten minutes for our seats, but it was understandable since the restaurant seemed to be extremely busy. Between the three of us plus two more who were there for good company and wine, we had a great time with wonderful food and awesome service. We ordered:

-crab salad: I wasn't a big fan of the crab salad because it wasn't seasoned well and the presentation made it look sparse however the butter lettuce cups and apples it was served with were very fresh.
-steamed mussels: this was meant to be an appetizer dish, but it came in an entree sized portion, which was a pleasant surprise. The wine reduction sauce it came with was delicious with the bread and the mussels tasted fresh and cooked just right.
-maple leaf farm duck breast: it was cooked a tasty medium rare with a side of a goat cheese and arugula salad. The duck was extremely moist and delicious, the texture and seasonings made it taste almost like I was having steak. Yum
-Herb roasted chicken: I usually don't order chicken when there's other meatier options on the menu, but my friend did so I just had to try it. The chicken took longer to arrive at our table than the rest of the food, but it was well worth the wait. The chicken was delicious with its herb seasonings and very moist.
-foie gras: this was hands down the BEST part of the meal. It was perfectly seared and served with a perfectly toasted piece of bread. It was MELT IN YOUR MOUTH SPECTACULAR!
-creme brûlée: my friend ordered and I had a bite to try. It wasn't the best creme brûlée I've had, but it was pretty good.
-semifreddo all'ameretto: I really like the semifreddo here. It was tasty, light, and came with some cookies to provide a textural difference in the dish. 

All in all, the food was delicious paired with great company and a lively ambiance gave this restaurant five stars! Even if Dine About Town isn't available, I would definitely recommend this place to my friends!
author: Rosanna N.

description:
ISA!! this review is regarding their dine about town menu, which i usually stay away from b/c most restaurants don't do it very well. they have so many people come in that they can't make all of them well. BUT not Isa. we had a party of about 12 and they managed us perfectly. Dean, our waiter, was super helpful and friendly. Some of my friends found him a bit pushy and trying to upsell too much but I think it's how you take his comments. anyways to the food, we ordered: 

appetizers: 
- crab salad - this was good and refreshing! and they actually had crab. plating was pretty too
- mussels - good but just your average mussels
- salmon carpaccio - didn't taste it but friends raved about this one

entree: OMG all were hits, which usually never happens 
- truffle RISOTTO - wow i love risotto and this was the BEST risotto i've had. there's no meat but the mushrooms and truffle oil was enough as seasoning
- scallops - about 4 i believe and cooked perfectly
- seasonal fish (halibut) - wow amazing. crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. exactly how i love my fish! 
- duck breast - yumyum tenderness and sauce was perfect

dessert - nothing to rave about.. just average
- creme brulee
- amaretto
author: Jen S.

description:
I was here last night for an early b'day dinner w/ the fam. OMG, it was great!

An awesome, pre-fixe dinner menu for a 3-course meal for $29.95!! What a bargain for what you get! For a French restaurant, they're very generous in their portion size!! This menu is only good between Sunday - Thursday, so if you go on a Friday and want this, you're out of luck! ;)

This was what I had:
1) Appetizer: Steamed Prince Edward island mussels w/ garlic, white wine, parsley (comes with bread)
2) Entree: Rocky Jr Range chicken w/ fresh herbs under crispy skin, haricot verte, mashed potatoes & jus de poulet (Yummy!!)
3) Choice of dessert or cheese: Grapefruit Granite Grapefruit juice over crushed ice (Very refreshing!)

Since my bro purposely mentioned it was my b'day to our waiter, I was given a complimentary glass of dessert wine to go with my dessert. Now, that's call good customer service!!

We brought a bottle of wine to share: a 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon by Mario Bazan. Tasted very good!     

The only downside was the noise level, where we sat in the back. 

I'd definitely go back sometime!!
author: Annette L.

description:
Party of 4. 

But wait, I came here with 14 people and we had no idea how inappropriate a group of our size was for this restaurant. Understandably most restaurants in SF on a Friday night will have challenges with such a big party, but Isa's stands out as particularly ill-suited for dealing with more than 4 people per table.

In explaining the ordering process (1 starter, 1 entree per dinner suggested), our waiter noted that all dishes would come out as ready from the kitchen...eluding to a situation where we were preparing ourselves for a full on fight to ensure we at least got a bite of the dish we ordered. The anxiety and anticipation of the process, apparently due to a very small kitchen, had us uncomfortable and somewhat bemoaning the forthcoming meal. Most concerning: we had three people with dietary constraints: 1 vegan, 1 allergic to acids & vinegar, 1 fish eating but otherwise vegetarian. And this is a heavy on the meat (especially bacon even on the vegetables) kind of place.

Food comes out in fits and starts, and floods the table in random places. In spite of the harriedness of everything, everyone seemed to have plenty of food. In fact, we ended up with way too much food and had two large to-go bags for a couple of guests. The bad thing about this way of serving (especially with a large group) is that it's hard to ensure people get enough of the dish they really wanted, and truly tricky for those with dietary limitations. The other challenge was the lack of pacing: we went from 0 to 100 in terms of waiting for food for a (sigh) while, and then it felt like a contest to see how many plates the multiple waitstaff could bring and place in the course of 30 minutes. Ambiance it was not.

Overall the food was not bad, and the wine list is fine (no hard alcohol), but the experience in general left me with no desire to return on a more intimate scale. Funny side note: our waiter told us over and over again how their "process" of random service from the kitchen is tried and true for 10 years, as if to convince himself it would all work out for us.

The best: we all had enough to eat. No blood was shed over the few veggie items ordered. Heat lamps were on for most of the experience, helping the "rustic" dining space (drafty, cramped, super loud) feel more comfortable. This was a company dinner, so also was happy that the tab was not on me.

The worst: waitstaff that consistently leaned over me multiple times to pour someones water, drafty room (I was lodged into the end of the table right by the wall), hard to hear conversation across the table, and food that didn't sate me enough to get over my discomfort.

Pricey for what it is, and not sure I would call this French cuisine, with the exception of the foie gras (which I of course don't eat as I'm the pesky fish eating vegetarian), and not really a place I would go across town to experience again.

Slight update to this review (and coming very late on my part). That's why I'm increasing the star by one....
After I posted this the manager reached out to me to personally apologize for the less than stellar experience, and wanted to see if there was any way to make it up to me/my party. Though this doesn't change the food, or serving process that makes large party entertaining less than ideal - it's clear that the intentions are good, and that they want their guests to enjoy their time here.
author: Margaret K.

description:
Been here twice. The food here is amazing, but the portions are pretty small. The service here is the best of the best. Every 5 minutes or so, a friendly waiter would stop by our table to see how we are doing. 

I highly recommend the Dungeness Crab Salad. It's sooooo good!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Isa is a nice little neighborhood gem in the Marina.  Modern/ romantic atmosphere (and patio!) attentive, non snooty service and a diverse, shareable menu.  

We didn't have a reservation but only waited at the bar for 20 minutes on a Friday around 7pm.

It was explained to us that dishes would come out in a coursed fashion, from lightest to heaviest dish but I saw scallops and my husband saw flat iron steak so that's what we ordered.  We didn't really follow the sharing instructions other than a yummy goat cheese appetizer, but everything was delicious and we plan to go back and "follow the rules"!
author: Kim U.

description:
Had dinner here this evening with our 4 year old.

She had the potato and leek soup and rather enjoyed the bread. I think if you have an open-minded kid who's willing to try new things, finding something on the menu at Isa will not be a problem despite them not having a designated kid's menu.

We had the oysters - pure perfection, no metallic taste, immaculately fresh and just as we tend to prefer them. Having had them once before on a prior visit, were weren't disappointed this time either.

We also had the  calamari, potato wrapped sea-bass and sweetbreads (our daughter really enjoyed the sweetbreads in particular but had a little taste of everything). 

Service was amazing and the 'happy hour' menu was a pleasant surprise.

I've been to Isa once before sans child, but now I will be all the more happy to go back.
author: Tasha S.

description: Husband and I went here for a date night during restaurant week. **We did not have a reservation.. oops on our end!! Anyways we walked in and were greeted immediately.. They didn't have any available tables at the time but were going to try and fit us in between reservations which was a okay with us. After a 3 minute wait there was a table available however we only had 1 hour and 45 minutes to eat which I'm like cool!! Everything we ordered was FABULOUS!!! My absolute favorite (and i don't eat raw fish) the TUNA! like i would've just ordered a bunch of that had i known how delicious it would be!! second best was the arugula salad. Our waiter Domingo? was very attentive to not only us but everyone else in the restaurant as well.. all the staff were constantly making rounds refilling drinks and making sure the customers were taken care of, but not to the point where its like get out of my face!! we didn't have any kind of negative anything from anyone there it was really quite nice!!
author: Aubree M.

description:
Overall, this was a great meal (of many in SF!) - everything was cooked extremely well, to the right temperatures, well seasoned, the flavor profiles were thoughtful and tasty.  I think the concept was a little on the confusing side - it was meant as a family style place, but as you can see from the pictures, the sizes were very large making sharing pretty difficult.

Foie was well cooked, huckleberry gave off a nice tart flavor, bread very fluffy and the poached pears a nice sweetness.  As you can probably guess, there were a few too many pieces of pears.

A big fan of tuna tartare and this was a particularly good version.  I enjoyed the largely chopped, fresh tuna at the perfect temperature, cold, but not so ice cold with good heat and a nice avocado moose.

This was a well cooked piece of fish (Halibut), rich butter poach flavor, moist fish with crispy thin potato "skin" that was a good touch with mix of nice acid and sweet red pepper confit.

The duck was overcooked unfortunately. Duck should never get to this color.  However, it was such good produce that it was still pretty enjoyable.
author: Adrian K.

description:
My wife and I went there to say our farewell to foie gras. The environment, table setting and the serving made it look like a casual dining place, but the service there were fine restaurant standard. The foie gras were a little disappointing compare to the ones we had in fifth floor or xyz. We also ordered the seared scallop and risotto, which were delicious! The duck breast was cooked a bit too raw. We can barely cut through with a knife.

Overall, this is an affordable place to enjoy a nice weekend gathering with friends.
author: king w.

description: Jonathan provided some of the best service I've had in awhile. He did a great job pairing wines for us with each course and overall just made it a great experience. The scallops  and lamb were great, though the sea-bass was a bit over cooked.
author: Jay P.

description:
I came here for the first time with a group of people to celebrate my birthday and it was the best decision. In fact, I found out about and decided to come here because of YELP!

There was 7 of us and since the food is shared, which I wasn't aware of, we ended up getting about 12-13 plates.

We had such a pleasant experience and the staff was very friendly. And of course, the food was absolutely wonderful. Plus it l came out extremely fast. Every bite was like getting closer and closer to nirvana.

Anything you get on that menu, you are bound to enjoy and there are things on there that I've never eaten in my life until that point. This place is a gem and I definitely plan on going back.
author: Kathryn B.

description:
We came here a few months ago for our first of our monthly foie dinners.  We were escorted through the seemingly small restaurant out back to a large covered patio area.  The seats near the walls were quite breezy so we strategically placed the boys on the outskirts and sat comfortably under the heat lamp.

Our server was quite friendly and really helped us figure out how to navigate the menu, we chose a lot of family style dishes and devoured most everything presented in front of us.

*only glitch in the evening came when the d*bags at the table next to us decided they were too hot and turned off the only heat source to our table, we exchanged a few words but when you're a d*bag I guess you don't hear anything so after we turned the heat back on, they again turned it off.  It would have been nice if the restaurant took care of the situation instead of me having to say anything.

Also, their credit card system is super slow so it took forever for us to get our final bill.

So my rating is probably more a 3.5 stars since it ended on not such a good note.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
My husband and I came here for our Anniversary.   Since we were bringing our dog with us, we had to pick a restaurant that offers outdoor dining.  After searching on Yelp with so many great reviews, I picked ISA.

The food here is just AMAZING.  We started off with corn soup and grilled Calamari.  They were SO GOOD.  The corn soup is incredibly flavorful.  

Then for the main entree, I had the potato wrapped sea bass.  Boy!  I have never had such a delicious dish.  I thought those crispy part that wrapped the sea bass were bacons.  It was so crispy and yummy.  They are actually potatoes.
My husband had the pan roasted range chicken, they were really good.  But I like my seabass better.  :)  We had our dish "family style', meaning we shared everything we ordered.

Since the portion were big, after soup , appetizer and main dishes, we didn't have room for desserts.  Maybe next time, we will skip the  appetizer, and try out their desserts.

The service is EXCELLENT.  The staff was so attentive.  Definitely will come back.

PS.  I took a look at their patio dining area at the back, it is so cute.  Maybe next time when I am not bringing my dog, I will try to dine in their patio area.
author: Cookie L.

description:
I came here with my family for Dine About Town. We came here on a Tuesday night and parking was hard to find. We had reservations for 6:30 and it was starting to get packed. We were led right to our seats in the back. It was very cozy though slightly packed to fit five people in a small table.

With the Dine About Town menu there is a free glass of red or white wine, always a plus. And I loved the fact that their Dine About Town menu isn't so restrictive to only a few items. The servers were very attentive and answered any questions we had throughly. There was even one server who recognized my dad from when he was head chef at another restaurant over 10 years ago. 

Their bread is pretty good and great for dipping in the sauces of the mussels.

For the appetizers since we had five people, we ordered the raw oysters, the dungeness crab salad, and three plates of mussels. We should have listened to other yelpers..It was a LOT of mussels. We loved the sauce in the mussels and also dipped the bread in the sauce. I am not really a fan of raw oysters but even I had to admit that the oysters were good. I also liked the dungeness crab salad, though my parents did not. I liked the hint of apple flavor in the salad. I only wish there was more dungeness crab in the salad instead of those tiny bits. 

We also got a salad, two steaks, the salmon, and the scallops. I liked the rich flavor of the fruits in the salad. The salmon was a little salty for me, but very flavorful and was most definitely not dry. The scallops they had were pretty large in size and they did not skim on the amount given to us. My all time favorite was the steak. It was cooked perfectly and I loved the sauce.

For dessert, we got the sorbet and the creme brulee. The sorbet was tart with just enogh sweetness. The creme brulee was not bad.

I would love to return some time and try out other things from their menu. Be warned, parking is most definitely not easy around here.
author: Jay L.

description: I went to ISA a few times for DAT, and there is a reason I keep going back there.  Food was great, and i also love the ambiance here...
author: IceSnow N.

description:
I just went back to Isa last night... and remembered why it is one of my favorite restaurants in town.  

The scallops are the best in San Francisco.  In fact, all of their Seafood is delicious.  My friend ordered the mussels and the Halibut and I ended up stealing a few bites over the course of the meal... wowzers.  :)

Glad to have been back to Isa -- I'll be back soon.
author: Andrew K.

description: If I could give 10 stars, I would! Everything on their menu is exceptional. Mushroom risotto on their prix fix is a must-try! Service and interior decor are exceptional. Great to gather with your family for that special occasion or impress your out-of-state friend visiting over the weekend. Two thumbs up!
author: Tatyana P.

description:
I don't remember much about my evening in this lovely romantic restaurant other than I cleaned off an entire plate of mushroom risotto.  

It was SO GOOD... Rice butter mushrooms cheese.  I wanted more more more.

Do I look fat?  Tell me the truth.
author: Sandy T.

description:
THE BEST RESTAURANT IN SF!!
My husband and I found it because I work around the corner. I yelped* dinner when I first got the job and it was the highest rated in the area...
We have been back once a week, every week since and have a family dinner planned there in a couple of weeks. ISA has never disappointed us- it's extremely consistent every time and the service is impeccable!

Our musts:
Oysters
Flank Steak
Scallops- GET THESE EVERY TIME! THEY ARE THE ABSOLUTE BEST.
Calamari
$5 HAPPY HOUR WINES!!!!

We are normally stuffed full of good food and happy for under $60. That normally does not happen in this city...

Call them if opentable says they are full. They normally can squeeze you in and it's worth it!!!! So good.
author: Katie P.

description:
I took my parents here last month when they were visiting from out of town. The restaurant came highly recommended from several friends so I figured I'd give it a shot. The food itself was very good (the duck was great, Dungeness crab salad was refreshing, and the few desserts we had were all spectacular). The service and atmosphere, however, were terrible. The wait staff was rude and short with us. I was embarrassed to bring my extremely classy and proper parents to a restaurant that would disrespect my father. For example, they asked to take our coats when we sat (nice touch) but when we requested our coats at the end of the meal we were dismissively told to "get them ourselves" from a coat rack by the door. The food is supposedly served in such a manner that facilitates group dining, but I think that is more of an excuse to allow them the freedom to bring whatever is ready when it's ready rather than coordinating your meals. Three of our meals were served at the same time and were completely finished before the fourth even arrived. We had to ask more than once for the last meal in our party to be delivered and they kept assuring us it was on it's way. Talk about awkward for the person trying to quickly eat an overpriced slice of duck while everyone else at the table is already finished! After we were done, the waiter came by every minute or two to see if we had paid the bill. After making us wait for so long for a meal they couldn't wait to get us out quicker! He actually picked up the tab more than once to see if a credit card had been slipped in. This was the action that really rubbed me the wrong way. 

Although I enjoyed the food, the dining experience as a whole was extremely unenjoyable. I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing or classier evening. For the price and quality of the food I think there are much better choices that can provide a more enjoyable experience.
author: Victoria W.

description: From the service, to the food, to the atmosphere..Maybe the best restaurant experience of my life. This is now my favorite place!
author: Boris S.

description: This is a very nice restaurant, a small family style restaurant. The whole ambiance was amazing. We started with wine which was good and then we had Portobello Risotto which was very delicious. The creme brulee was one of the best that I have eaten. Definitely recommend it for dinner.
author: Swati G.

description:
We came here for my mom's birthday and we heard good things about this place.

As we sat down, we ordered some drinks since it was still happy hour until 7PM (all "cocktails" and wines were $5).

They weren't really cocktails as they are made with soju, but I got the number 7.  Blackberries, soju and something else I can't remember.  It was pretty good, but the blackberry pulp made it really hard to drink it out of a straw.  I also had the mojito which was pretty good.

As we were waiting for the rest of our party and trying to decide what we wanted to get, my sister-in-law asked one of the waiters if he recommended to chicken or the duck.

The waiter gave us this long winded explanation which came off way to strong.  I was already turned off of this place after he started talking.  I felt he was basically talking down upon us that we didn't know how to eat French food.  He said "I can't tell you because you need to tell me what you are eating throughout the dinner, its not a simple question"

He went on for another 5 minutes basically talking about how developed his pallet is and how you need to build the meal upon itself.  He then ended it with "I actually wouldn't get the duck or the chicken at all"

All we asked was a simple question, chicken or duck, not your life story dude.

After his long winded explanation, another waiter came by and almost did the same exact thing but was a lot nicer about it.  He listed to what we were thinking of getting and then he made his suggestions, but said there are no wrong choices.

We started with the arugula salad.  Was pretty standard, didn't wow me too much.

Foie Gras - very excellent, very tender and moist and just melted in your mouth.  The piece was huge also.

Goat Cheese - was a standard sizzling, melted goat cheese, although too strong for my taste

Seabass - Was a very excellent seabass.  It had a nice crispiness on the outside and juicy tenderness on the inside.  No huge fishy flavor either.

Duck Breast - Was the best dish in my opinion.  The duck was juicy and  cooked rare just how I like it.  It also came with a side arugula salad with beets which was very good.

Chicken - Chicken was super tender and moist inside, with a slightly delicate but crisp skin.

Overall the meal was good.  The busing staff was very attentive filling our water and making sure we had plenty of bread.

I'd have to say that I would have given the place 4 stars if it wasn't for the waiter that really left us sour.
author: Kameron K.

description: Excellent food! The waiter was a bit pretentious as in most restaurants in the Marina, but the service was overall decent. A little pricy, but you get what you pay for. Will definitely be back.
author: Arturo V.

description:
Although on the pricier side, splitting it family style with a couple of other people makes it a little more affordable. Each dish is ~$22. We had the duck, lamb, and steak. Everything was delicious, the meal was laid out nicely and the portions were perfect for four people. The dessert was also delicious. The semifreddo al amaretto was perfectly creamy (a little heavy for one person, but great for sharing) and since i love vanilla bean--the gelato was perfect. 

I think of anything, the best part about this restaurant is the service. The waitstaff was incredibly attentive, my glass was never empty once, and each time we finished the basket of bread, it was promptly replaced with another. I'd definitely come here again.
author: Alice W.

description:
I wish that I can bring Isa's bread everywhere with me so that when people ask me why I don't eat bread and I always say "because I only like them FRESH and perfectly made.....", I can whip it out of my pocket to present an example and say "like THIS". The bread is actually from Bakers of Paris, which I Google-d upon arriving home to see if there was any way that I can get my hands on a supply without driving all the way to SF. Not really, but at least they do sell to the public at SF Farmers Market.

The food here was really excellent, mainly because of the freshness of the ingredients - all the vegetables served tasted as if nothing was picked more than a day before serving. The freshness GREATLY contributed to the quality of the food here. 

Seared scallops - cooked perfectly. Only minor complain here is that there were some minor grit still on them. Corn was cut fresh off the cob, fava beans were fresh off their pods, cherry tomatoes were sweet. Truffle sauce made a nice touch pulling everything together.

Pan roasted chicken - my friend swears by this and it is indeed awesome. It's perfected roasted and sized perfectly too. Love the tasty herbs (I tasted thyme)hiding behind the crispy skin of the chicken.

Wild prawns - this is crazy good - was my favorite dish. The prawns weren't repeatedly frozen - they were really fresh and the parsley, garlic and lemon saute sauce was just amazing. 

Flat iron steak - could not give this a fair review because we ordered a lot of food just for two and this came as the last dish. The steak did not blow me away but cooked as I ordered. Not sure if I like the sauce on it though - too strong and "mustard-y."

We sat at the bar and was entertained by the friendliest bartender who knew his food facts..always a plus!

All in all, great experience at Isa, and would definitely return.

KPI (Key Performance Indicator) ratings (1-5, 5 - best):
Quality: 4
Delivery/Service: 5
Cost: 3
author: Dorene S.

description:
Isa is one of my favorite restaurants in the city! And It's a great place for any occasion. The food is delicious, there's a great wine selection, and the staff is knowledgeable and attentive. I recommend the potato wrapped seabass and seared scallops - you won't be disappointed! 
They have a great happy hour too for wine!
author: Amy S.

description:
Dine About Town was an excellent way  to experience Isa on a budget before committing to the regular priced dinner. 
3 courses for $34.95 - Good options on the DAT menu

Parking: Good thing I left my house an hour earlier than i needed to because it took me 30 minutes to find parking...the parking situation there is ridiculous. bleh.

Impression: I think the setting of this place was meant to be romantic but it was way too crowded and loud for that. With dimly lit candles on each table, large mirrors and a giant canopy in the back area with heat lamps - this place is definitely romantic on a quite night.

Food (2 orders on the DAT menu and a side order of oysters):
-Half dozen oysters
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=0yzVBzekxRemh72OgQenzQ
Taste: fresh. too bad they don't have a selection of oysters to choose from...  half dozen for $12.

-Tuna avocado tartar
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=0kK0iRdEbx04DMAo_HHUoA
Taste: tartar is always a safe bet. tasty components and sauce. it's hard to mess this dish up.

-Salmon Carpaccio 
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=97lqqcqx9ZMe-b8ntBT6RQ
Taste: cured salmon, with creme fraiche, eggs and capers. good app.

-Seared Scallops
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=ADZv0EHqH7SqKas2RLYaOw
Taste: scallops were overcooked so it was a little rough (a big no-no in my opinion). creamy mashed potatoes - it went well with the sauce. 

Lobster Bouillabaisse with seared halibut, calamari and clams.
Photo:http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=cmp08dFzuT7R7D5dvgjyMg
Taste: Halibut was overcooked! Once again rough on the out and inside. =(. The clams and calamari were really salty. the broth was heavily seasoned as well. So if you put two salty components together, it'll equal to super salty. i know it could be a great dish if they could tone the spice down on one of the components for a more balanced dish.

Dessert:
-Creme Brulee
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=eFDlbubxC2-NkI3nBX-5_Q
Taste: Oh, i am so glad the portions are small here! it had a thick, THICK layer of torched sugar (which i LOVE) over the custard.

-Flourless Chocolate cake with Vanilla Bean Ice cream
Photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=nsgYZ7-Qq2sXG4O0HbPiUw
Taste: VERY good! not too sweet and complimented well with the creamy ice cream. love the texture of the cake. 

Drinks: 
Lemon Drop - way too sweet.
House Cab

Bill (tips not included): $107

Overall,  3.5 stars to be exact. This place is kind of a commercialized french resto. the dishes are safe and not very innovative. the entrees were a little too salty. i prefer a little more subtly. The cooks/chefs are probably smokers. Cooks/chefs that smoke tend to over season their dishes since their palates are more desensitize to flavors (something i've noticed).
author: Rebecca L.

description: I've always been a big fan of Isa, although I hadn't been back in a while.  I finally came back here with friends recently and everything lived up to the memory.  We ordered oysters (delicious), mussels (great!), salmon carpaccio (mmm...), ox tail with polenta, potato rapped seabass, and 2 orders of foie gras.  Yes 2 orders!  Well foie is soon to be banned so it's a must have before July first.  The service was excellent like always.  All the food was great.  The biggest issue is probably parking in the marina, which completely blows.  =(
author: Tiffany C.

description:
And to think I almost turned this place down because I'm a slight food snob and don't really like French food. What the heck was I thinking!!!!

Isa is located in the heart of the Marina.  Other than horrible parking and traffic which can be expected there's nothing bad about anything in the Marina except the tons of calories you will be putting on.  

Isa was no different.  I had to arrange a dinner for my team and thought we've never gone to the Marina to eat.  Of course good ole faithful Yelp bought me to Isa.  Many thanks to Yelp :)

We were greeted by the lovely and warm hostess who took us to our seats in the back.  The cool thing about sitting in the back is, if you notice it's almost like you're sitting outside. The Isa owners get tons of kudos for this.  Very innovative to have an outside shelter making it as if your inside or vice versa.

The menu had so many things to choose from that picking just one seemed bias.  So of course, it was music to my ears and my stomach started playing a classical piece by Bethoven when the waiter said we can order family style.  

We literally ordered a couple of everything.  After first embarrassment hit me with how much food was coming to our table and how fast the waiters were on their job with the recovering of the plates, waters and OMG...BREAD AND BUTTER but shortly after the sea bass, the halibut, the prawns, the goat cheese, the calamari hit my mouth who cared about embarrassment.  

My team also loved the wine which of course I know nothing about.

4 hours later...YIKES...was it nearly 10pm and we got there at 6pm and we have work in the morning??? We were soooo stuffed that we couldn't even utter the words dessert!!!

Fortunately for us, eating on the company dime never tasted better so...WAITER FOR DESSERT WE'D LIKE...

Please...don't walk pass this place...you're doing yourself a real injustice.

Thanks Isa :)
author: Sandra S.

description: Came here for dine about town and was blown away by their portion size. For some reason during the week of dine about town they only serve off their DAT menu, which from a financial point of view doesn't really make sense since I'm sure there are people who would pay more to eat off the regular menu but I'm not the owner so I'll move right along. For appetizers we ordered the mussels and salmon carpaccio. The plate of mussels was HUGE and easily served three people. The salmon carpaccio came in thick slices and was delicious. The steak entree was juicy and tasty. For dessert I had creme brulee which didn't disappoint either. All in all, every course was on point which I can't say is true for many restaurants. Will return!
author: Queena T.

description:
I just love this place. Absolutely love this place.

Great atmosphere in the back room.

Food is simply exceptional...

Crab Salad is excellent, sea bass was great, risotto was exceptional, scallops were amazing...

Everything was excellent...one of my go-to places!
author: Jeff R.

description:
This place is great for a group of people. They are sharing plates. Everything we ordered was superb. 

- arugala salad
- yellowfin tuna
-seared scallop
-truffle risotto (AWESOME!!)
-seabass
-chicken
-flourless chocolate cake (pretty good for having no flour)

Split all this with four hungry ladies, and it was more then plenty!!
author: Cnn F.

description:
Had a very delicious dinner here for a friend's 25th birthday. I'm pretty much a fan of everything from the decor, the service, and most especially, the food. I really like the outdoorsy-feel of the back room and all the flora & fauna they used to liven up the place.

We had THE most talkative waiter of all time. He's an old asian guy who basically gave us a lecture about the menu from the get-go. It was kind of annoying at first but we ended up loving the guy. He's hilarious and will tell you EVERYTHING about all the dishes, the origin of the recipes, the high quality ingredients, etc. This guy deserves a raise. Seriously. He seems to love his job and does a great job as well.

Our group dines family style and ordered practically everything: scallops, calamari, foie gras, crab salad, lamb, roasted chicken, and so much more. I stuck with the roasted chicken - it's an amazing dish with a hearty portion of meat, mashed potatoes and veggies. See pics for details.
author: Jenny T.

description: I enjoyed my dinner at Isa tremendously. They only lose one star due to noise -- it was extremely loud in there it was really hard to hear my friend. Were I in another painfully hip establishment, I might have expected the noise, but given Isa's atmosphere and layout and French food, the noise was pretty unexpected. All that said, the food was divine, the service was great, the prices reasonable, and the decor was lovely (I just recommend some fabric curtains or something to absorb sound). I went on a Saturday night for dinner, and I didn't get a chance to see the back patio, so I look forward to going back and seeing what it's like out there. But do beware, you are in the Marina when you walk out the door.
author: Sara C.

description:
Great ambience. definitely get a table in the back patio. Friendly service. 
my favorites from the menu:
potato wrapped sea bass, side of wild mushrooms, goat cheese appetizer.
author: Behnam R.

description:
Summary: Not top 10 in SF, but definitely a good meal!

We went last night for Dine About Town (3 courses for $35). On a preliminary review of their website, one can see that they normally offer a prix fixe (3-course meal) for $30. Yes, the Dine About Town has more options, and Yes, they offer a free glass of wine (a red of their choosing) with the Dine About Town menu - however somehow I felt slightly jipped (buyer beware: Flora in Oakland is also pulling this same trick for Oakland's restaurant week).

Moving on to the important stuff, though...

F O O D
- The butter lettuce salad (blue cheese, pears, walnuts) was a solid salad. Flavors held well together, sizeable portion.
- I heard the crab salad with grapefruit was fantastic as well.
- I ordered the scallops with mashed potatoes, bacon, and brussel sprouts in truffle sauce. With ingredients like that - how could expectations NOT be sky-high? Unfortunately, it fell a little flat. Brussel sprouts at firefly are much better. Scallops seemed to be in that weird spot between seared and cooked which, at least for me, was not a happy medium.
- I heard the duck was great - except that it came a little on the rare side (even when asked to be cooked medium).
- We both thoroughly enjoyed the semifreddo all'amaretto for dessert. It's a large portion, and is extremely well done (perhaps I'm just a sucker for semifreddo, though).

S E R V I C E
Fantastic. Really. The waiter was friendly, knowledgeable, attentive.

We'll likely return at some point, it was an enjoyable meal - however this wouldn't be my go-to spot for a special occasion or for a visitor from out-of-town who only has 2-3 days to taste SF.
author: Helen D.

description: My friend and I had the most delightful experience at Isa's. Great service -- the waiter spent time telling us about the entrees and making sure we would like the wine pairing. The food was melt-in-your-mouth exquisite. Everything from the Salmon Carpaccio and warm Goat Cheese with basil and pine nuts, to the Flat-Iron Steak and Fresh Fish entree. Everything was delightful. I highly recommend you check it out!
author: Joanne F.

description:
Dine About Town SF 2011 | Post #1

Thank goodness dine about town is right around my graduation and birthday... you know, even more reason to celebrate at all these nice restaurants without actually having to pay an arm and a leg for said meal.  Anyhow, my first stop during this DAT adventure was at Isa.  

Found parking a few blocks away and upon entering, was asked whether we wanted to sit in the front section or the back.  The front is covered, and the decor is very wine-bar ish, whereas the back is more like a patio (still covered), but I think it's more romantic.  Having not eaten much throughout the day prior to the meal, I practically dove in to the basket of bread as soon as it touched our table.  The bread was HEAVENLY.  Delicious sliced french bread with softened butter and a sprinkle of salt on top.  I think I filled up too much on the bread... but it was so good it doesn't really matter.

The nice thing about Isa's menu was its extensive DAT menu.  At a lot of other places, you only get 1- maybe 2 options to choose from, but at Isa, each course had at least 5-6 options.  Obviously, to maximize my dining pleasure, the boy and I ordered different things, so we can get a better sense of what the restaurant has to offer.

First Course: ORGANIC SALMON CARPACCIO & STEAMED MUSSELS (salmon was sliced a little too thick for us, but otherwise, the appetizers were portioned and seasoned deliciously)

Second Course: GRILLED FLAT IRON STEAK & DUCK BREAST W/ BACON (mmmmmmm nom nom nom nom. need i say more?)

Third Course: GRAPEFRUIT GRANITE & CREME BRULEE (the creme brulee was the. best. ever. i could have gone without the grapefruit granite, but boyfriend liked his very much)

Service was fabulous.  He was kind, courteous, and kept refilling my water.  Excellent date night venue. "Isa" pleasure to dine here, for sure!
author: Karen T.

description:
I've lived in the area and been coming to Isa for nearly 12 years and only remember favorable visits.  However, my last visit on Saturday, Jan 10th may have been my last.  We were a group of 4 girls celebrating a birthday.  The service was sub-par to begin with and when we found what looked like plastic in our calamari dish and pointed it out to the staff, they acted like this was no big deal.   They explained it was cartilage that must not have been removed when the calamari was cleaned.   Okay, that's better than plastic, but still not something to expect when dining out.

Our next dish (paella) also included calamari and once again more cartilage was found.  At this point we were all disgusted and had no desire to eat anything further.  Our waiter was not the least bit apologetic, nor was the female manager that walked by.  

I have been eating calamari in restaurants for decades and never had this happen, least of all twice in one meal.

If you go to Isa, just stay away from the calamari and don't expect service that accompanies their prices.
author: Amanda S.

description:
My sister and I happened to be staying overnight in the Marina district and love good food. Based on previous reviews we chose Isa, and we were not disappointed. The menu recommended that couples share two appetizers and two entrees.
Every dish was fabulous; however it was too much food for the two of us. We were way overstuffed, but loved every minute of it. We had the salmon carpaccio, the mussels, the seafood of the day (which was halibut) and the sea bass. Everything was incredibly tasty!
