Definitely order the flat iron steak medium rare because it'll melt in your mouth. The moutarde verte & bordelaise sauce was so good that my friend sopped it up with her bread. YUM. For DAT, this restaurant is a good place to go.

SERVICE (1/5)
Now on to the review for one of the busiest times at Isa-- DAT week.  Perhaps it was an off day, but my DAT service experience at Isa wasn't very good and well below the standards of any successful, conscientious business establishment in the Bay Area.  

My boyfriend and I ordered the flat iron steak as our main course. The downside about this review is that because the restaurant was so busy during DAT, the clean up of our table was terrible.  Imagine tossing our silverware onto our plates and then SPLASHING steaks of red wine sauce all over my DRESS and my bf's DRESS SHIRT. Now that's really disappointing and totally unnecessary. In the wait staff's haste, they were negligent and careless, causing us an inconvenient trip to the dry cleaners and an uneasy feeling during the dinner.

To top it off, the waiter dropped glassware underneath on the floor next to our table and shards of glass scattered all over the floor, directly underneath our feet and onto my legs and my bf's dress pants and shoes. Sure, mistakes happen. But when you don't come back to clean up the mess after 10 minutes, then it's shame on you. Leaving broken glass underneath our feet made for a very uncomfortable and stressful dining experience. There was no apologies and even our neighbors shook their heads in disbelief (after pointing out the stains on my boyfriend's shirt in shock (yes, we have witnesses!)). 

Isa also ran out of its flourless chocolate cake, which is very unfortunate.  I'm a firm believer that successful restaurants should not run out of popular food items on a Saturday evening (one of the busiest days of the week for restaurants!). To top if off, I had asked our waiter beforehand if the flourless chocolate cakes would be available, as we were celebrating two of my friends' birthdays and I was sure that these cakes were going to be ordered. Our waiter said, "Of course they will be available! This is Isa!  We will have everything on the menu." Imagine our great disappointment when the owner (Semera) said that they ran out. Very, very disappointing. 

I am certain that the details outlined in this review are "outliers" and below Isa's standards. However, I don't think it should have ever happened or there were mitigating factors (e.g., not being sloppy, quickly cleaning up broken glass underneath customer's feet, even saying "sorry" would have helped) that would have helped the evening be more pleasant. 

Chef Luke Sung would be greatly disturbed and frustrated to learn that his culinary dishes have been compromised by poor service at Isa.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Great neighborhood French place in the Marina. We sat at the high top tables in the front, so I didn't get to see the back, but the fact that they have patio seating is awesome. The decor and atmosphere is nice with a dim elegance to it.

- Salmon Tartare: okay, i've had fresher salmon at japanese restaurants
- Scallops: mouthwateringly DELICIOUS! We were fighting over the last piece and the asparagus & mashed potatoes were very good as well
- Rack of Lamb: good, but not as tasty as it looked
- Mushroom Risotto: pretty good with a nice variety of mushrooms

Service was okay and attentive enough. Lots of great eats in the Marina and Isa is another one to try if you're in the area!
author: Linda C.

description:
Amazing gluten-free food! We loved the asparagus soup as well as the salmon carpaccio appetizers. And the flat iron steak and the potato-covered fish entrees were exceptional as well. Finally, the goat cheese with honey and walnuts was a great ending to a great meal. Great service too.

My only regret is that they did not have gluten-free bread :(
author: Christian B.

description:
Amazing place. Love the outside patio seating with heated lamps. Food is great. 

1. Crab salad: so fresh and tasty!
2. Loved the sea bass. Potato wrap was crispy and light. Yummy
3. Risotto with truffle was delicious. Not as thick and heavy as expected - great dish. 

Would def come back for party or date : )
author: V W.

description: The DAT menu here is a great value. This restaurant was constantly busy for the time we were there, so I would recommend making reservations. The maine lobster broth and potato leek soup were mundane, I wasn't blown away. The $1/oyster was a good deal, but they're on the smaller side and there are bits of broken off shells in the oysters. The star of the evening was the scallops with brussel sprouts and bacon mashed potatoes. The scallops were amazing and the brussel sprouts were well-seasoned. I enjoyed the service here but felt a bit rushed due to DAT. This is a good date place and I'd come back.
author: Kristina N.

description:
I have been here several time and have not been dissapointed yet. The first time, I took my fiancee here for his birthday and we had the best service and excellent food! We went on a Friday night and it was very quiet inside and romantic.The second time we went was on a Saturday and it was extremely loud and noisy and croweded but the food was still awesome.

RESTAURANT: The restaurant itself is beautifully lit with candles that bounce off the dark wood interior. Great ambiance-dark enough to set the mood but not too dark that you can't see what you are eating. The front room is packed with tales so you sit pretty close to everyone around you. They have both high top and low tables. THere is a back room as well but the time that I have gone we have alwasy been seated in the front room. They have a bar that is located right next to the kitchen so you can watch the chefs preparing the food.

FOOD: I have had both their Chef pre-fix menu as well as just a single main course. The pre-fix menu was really an awesome deal and you had several selections to choose from. I couldn't decided between the  mussles and the halibut so we went with the pre fix menu so i could get both and my fiancee got the calamri and flat iron steak. The portions are still very good size but I love getting a variey of items. Their mussles are delcicuous. I have also had the potatoe crusted halibut which is amazing! I would highly reccomend  it. The crab salad with grape fruit seems to be a very popular dish as well. You get large chunks of jump lump crab meat along with grape fruit sections and argula. delicous.

SERVICE: I thought out server was very nice from the start and was very attentive but not obtrusive. Our water was alwasy full, bread always replenished and since we ordered a bottle of wine, he always made sure our glasses were never empty

Overall: Great food and service and I will defintley go back here again
author: Whitney S.

description:
Second time around:

Food was good, but not fantastic. Standout of the night goes to the Rocky jr Pan Roasted Chicken-- only a few dry bits (but it was white meat... so what can you expect) but overall very flavorful and tender. Best part of the dish was sopping up all the meat juice with crusty bread! MMM

Slightly annoyed by the fact that the restaurant's "suggestion" of ordering family style is more of an edict which is enforced by the timing/execution of the dishes. If we hadn't ordered family style, people would definitely have gone hungry, as most of the things came out one at a time. That said, we didn't have nearly as long waits as some Yelpers have mentioned, which was nice (although sometimes hectic, when there were too many plates on our table).

OVERALL: Doubtful that I'll be returning. The entire meal seemed overpriced (but can happen when you order family style at a resto that doesn't actually price things in a family style kind of way) and not really worth it to me.
author: Susanna W.

description:
This place is awesome for parties!  I've been to ISA twice now and every time I was here, there were 3+ birthday parties going on.  It's cozy.  Waiters are super friendly. Dishes are served family style.  So it's just a very jovial atmosphere.

In terms of food, My favorite is the truffle risotto with baby shiitake (I drool even just thinking about it!). For appetizers, go for the dungeness crab salad and the yellowfin tuna.  For main dish, try the seared scallops and foie gras.  I also wouldn't miss the flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean gelato for dessert!  

This place is a blast!
author: Rosa L.

description:
Isa is a fantastic place to go for a group dinner. Very solid mix of food and service.
Everything is meant to be shared and they have a lot of things on the menu.
The Baked Goat cheese is one of my faves. Creamy goat cheese complimented with earthy pesto and toasted pinenuts.

The Mussels are fresh and the steak very juicy.
The allstar on their menu has to be the spaghetti though.
At a glance, it looks like a plane Jane. But a twirl of this delicious pasta will change your life!
Creamy, flavorful and just the right amount of sweet, tart tomato sauce.

Absolutely outstanding and reliable neighborhood joint!
author: Lianne Z.

description:
We heard great things about Isa, so on a recent trip to San Francisco, my spouse decided that this would be a great place to host a mini family reunion (7 people). She snagged a coveted 7 pm reservation - which was ideal since some of our guests were driving over 2 hours to meet us. We called the restaurant the day before to confirm the reservation and they clearly stated that we HAD to be there by 7 pm since they were very busy that night and would not hold the table if our party was late (they did not define "late") so we all busted our butts to be there promptly at 7 pm. When we arrived, we were told that our table would be ready shortly - they were setting up four two-tops in the cozy front of the restaurant, by the window with a street view. We watched them set it up. We waited. Then the unthinkable happened... a couple at the bar came up to the host (a friend???) and asked if they could sit up front instead of in the enclosed patio. The restaurant is tiny and I was standing no more than 3 feet away when the conversation took place. The little host tapped a few buttons on his screen (seriously, you would have thought he was flying the Starship Enterprise by all the industrious pecking he was performing). And much to my horror, he started dismantling the tables and seated the couple in the front... when I enquired why they were taking our table apart, the little host exclaimed that he thought we'd be "happier in the back room." Another 20 minutes slide by and we were still standing in the tiny doorway, waiting, waiting, waiting... It reminded me of a doctor's appointment where they insist that you show up on time, but the doctor never sees you on time... a bit pretentious, to say the least. At 7:40, we were finally escorted to the back patio where we were crammed into a six-top with a seventh chair sticking out into the aisle. Not ideal, and certainly not the quaint/charming venue we were led to expect. And the food? Meh - at best. And I would NEVER characterize this restaurant as "French" - the only French thing about it was the snooty host. I had the braised short ribs. The flavor was dull and tires - and they were so fatty that I couldn't even get through a third of it. My wife had the fish (halibut?) and it was dry as a bone. Sigh. The rest of the party picked at their dinner with the only winner of the bunch my brother-in-law, who ordered the chicken. He seemed very happy with it. But then again, it was chicken. 
To sum up - a mediocre meal with pretentious attitude equals an undeserved reputation. And with all of the amazing dining choices available in the city, we will not be visiting Isa any time soon on our coveted trips to San Francisco. Isa simply wasted one of our precious evenings in our favorite city.
PS - we had a great dinner at Boulevard for 12 people the next night and it was a solid TEN.
author: Scott G.

description:
After seeing all the great reviews on Yelp, I was dying to try this place out for dinner DAT. At Isa, they only provide the DAT menu during DAT and I appreciate that they focus on making DAT their priority so that the DAT food is on par with their normal offerings. I hate it when restaurants skimp because they feel like they're offering discounted fare, one of my major pet peeves while dining out. While Isa does serve French food, I felt like it was more like French food with a Chinese twist since a few of their dishes reminded me of traditional Chinese cuisine.

Their dishes are also served family/tapas style, so you get a taste of everything. 

Bread and Butter. NOMS.

Dungeness Crab Salad with Avocado, Apple, Grapefruit and Tarragon. 1st course from prix fixe. This was pretty good, nice and fresh! I am definitely a fan! I liked the combination of the savory crab with sweet apple, creamy avocado and tangy grapefruit. Lots of textures and tastes in on one plate!

Sauteed Sea of Cortez Wild Prawns with Parsley, Garlic and Lemon. 1st course from prix fixe. I thought this was good, but not symbolic of traditional French cuisine. To me, it tasted more like a Chinese dish I'm familiar. It was still nommy though!

Loch Duart Salmon Carpaccio with Lemon, Creme Fraiche, Cucumber, Egg, Capers and Crostini. 1st course from prix fixe. I love me some raw fish so I thought this was pretty bomb! The fish was also super fresh and tasty! NOMS!

Seared Scallops with Butternut Squash, Sweet Potatoes, Spinach, Bacon and Truffle Sauce. 2nd course from prix fixe. This was pretty good, but it also reminded me of a Chinese dish. As a result, I found the scallops to be a bit overcooked and not really "seared." Even though I'm not a huge fan of the squash and sweet potatoes I still found it delicious! 

Grilled Golden Gate Angus Flat Iron Steak with Zucchini, Polenta, Verte and Bordelaise Sauce. 2nd course from prix fixe. I found the steak to be rare on the inside, but a bit overcooked on the outside. So it was a weird chewy and soft, tender combination. I think I prefer my steak a bit less cooked on the outside as well. The polenta and the zucchini was really good! The polenta was nice and creamy, cooked to perfection! The sauce was also very delicious. 

Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast with Huckleberry Sauce, Red Cabbage and Hashbrown. 2nd course from prix fixe. The duck breast was pretty bomb. I liked how it was a bit pink and it went really well with the sweet and tangy huckleberry sauce! I didn't really have any red cabbage because I'm not a fan of it. The hashbrown was pretty good! I definitely liked the sauce a lot and I had a lot of duck with it. NOMS.

Vanilla Bean Gelato with Biscotti. 3rd course from prix fixe. The gelato was pretty good, nice and creamy goodness! The biscotti was alright, but it might just be due to the fact that I'm not really a fan of biscotti. 

Semifreddo Al' Amaretto. 3rd course from prix fixe. I love me some good amaretto so I thought it was pretty good. NOMS. I'd definitely eat this again. It was nice and creamy deliciousness! I loves it, the nommy almondy flavor was not lost on my palate!
author: Constance C.

description: Salty and greasy lamb.  Salty and greasy potato wrapped bass.  They say everything is served 'family style'. That means they add a big spoon to the dish.  For 24 dollar entrees I expected more.  Why is everyone giving this place 5 and 4 stars? Won't be back with my girlfriend.
author: Robert N.

description:
Last night my date brought us to Isa for a very delicious dinner and although the food really did hit the spot, I have to dock two stars because I'm not too fond with the table arrangements. 

Some may call it "nice, intimate, or cozy" and I will say "Yeah, that's true- If you like to get cozy and intimate with the other tables!" There are no privacy between your own party, the tables are seated so close to each other that you can practically hear the next tables' conversations and smell their food. Not exaggerating, but I think there were just about a 1foot distance between each tables. Shoot, they should have just made our entire section a party of 12! 

Also, I didn't like the fact that we were interrupted a couple of times by our neighbors, whom were just asking us about the dishes we ordered. It made me feel a bit uncomfortable to converse with my date. However, after a couple glasses of Merlot, I felt the annoyance subside and I was more accepting with the "intimacy" we shared with everyone else. 

Not that I've explained myself for the deduction of 2 stars, I will now praise them for their food. 

For starters: 
Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio- Raw (and bland) salmon drizzled over with a lemon cream sauce and topped with herbs, capers and cucumbers. This was our least favorite of all because the salmon didn't have the flavor that a great piece of raw salmon should have. 

Yellowfin tuna- Their version of tuna tartare. Cubed tuna marinated with soy sauce and sriracha, topped with seaweed and sesame seeds over a bed of guacamole and greens. One of my favorite dishes of the night! 

For entrees: 
Hudson valley grade A foie gras- seared and paired with a huckleberry sauce and poached pears. Amazing! The foie gras was perfectly cooked and it melts divinely in the mouth. 

Seared scallops- served with butternut squash, sweet potatoes, spinach, bacon & truffle sauce. Not the big fan of scallops but the flavors were astounding. 

I regret it now, but we opted out on dessert. We were too full. 

So there we have it. Great food but horrible seating arrangements = 3 star experience.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I had a Monday day off and jumped to the change to try the two course Prix fix which the Prix fix is only offered Monday to Thursday.

We ordered two Loch Duart salmon tar tare which included the crème fraiche, capers and lemon juice over crostini.

The second course was a Grilled Natural Flat iron steak with the cognac-green peppercorn sauce and potatoes, and my wife ordered the grilled Yellowtail with artichoke hearts, zucchini and Patty pans squash.   http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pattypan_squash

After the two courses I was quite satisfied and felt this was a great deal for only $24 a person.
author: Brandon W.

description: Love the back patio ambiance, the fresh menu, and attentive service. Isa is a go-to dinner spot for me. They have some great GF options also. Nice!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Ate here on Saturday with a friend for the Dine About Town promotion.  I'd eaten here once before (many years ago), and the vibe this town was much more intense, noisy, crowded, etc.  The service is warm but very spotty (had to ask for bread, then had to ask for butter, waited quite a while for water refills, etc).  The food was very very good though.  Both apps were delicious, as were both entrees.  The desserts were acceptable ---- good but hardly memorable.

This is what we ate:

-  Organic Loch Duart Salmon Carpaccio with lemon, crème fraiche, cucumber, egg, capers & crostini  (one of the best carpaccio I've ever eaten --- very well balanced and a very good portion

-  Steamed Prince Edward Island Mussels with garlic, white wine, parsley & grilled bread (very good, huge portion --- could have been an entree portion in fact, but not an unusual preparation)

-  Truffle Risotto with baby shiitake, hon shimiji mushroom & reggiano   --- really really perfectly prepared...!!!

-  Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast, a green (perhaps raw kale?)  & wild huckleberry sauce  (duck was moist and came out a perfect medium-rare, the portion size was really generous, the sauce was delicious, but the green needed to be braised a little bit as it was too tough)

-  Vanilla Bean Crème Brulée  (good but not memorable)

-  Semifreddo All' Amaretto (good but not memorable)

One of the BEST thing was having animated conversations with the two tables next to ours.  We had a terrific time comparing dishes (BTW the couple to my right claimed the Fois Gras was the BEST SHE'D EVER EATEN).  And the couple to my left gave us many great restaurant recommendations --- had to tear off some of the butcher-block table paper covering to write them down on!

Was disappointed that the DAT promotion was just a tiny tiny discount off of their regular prices.  On the other hand, what that REALLY MEANS that means their regular prices are quite affordable!!!!!!!
author: Lana C.

description:
After checking out different restaurants on Bastille day, my family finally decided on Isa for my brother's birthday dinner.

Their prix fixe option of 3 courses for $30 is a good deal in my opinion.  For the appetizers, my family had the salmon carpaccio, arugula salad, and the steamed mussels. The carpaccio was so-so, but the arugala salad had a nice vinaigrette paired with the apples and beets.  The mussels were great with the wine sauce.

For the entree, we ordered the flat iron steak, duck breast, and ling cod.  All of the entrees had big portions and were delicious, but the steak was definitely the favorite.

And finally for dessert we had the grapefruit granite and semifreddo amaretto.  The grapefruit was a bit too sour , but the semifreddo had a nice creamy almond flavor.

Sitting in the back patio was definitely a cool experience and the waiters were friendly and constantly kept on refilling the water glasses and bread bowl.  I'd definitely come back again, but probably only for the prix fixe.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I came here twice and both times weren't a great experience. Food was OK and portions are decent for the money, but service there are obviously NOT anywhere near priority. 

First time I came here was with a friend to try this place out. We went during non-busy hour and the restaurant was pretty empty as we were seated two tables down from a couple. At first I ignored the carefree attitude the waiter presented when my friend and i ordered our food, however throughout our meal, i noticed the waiter didn't bother checking up on us or refilling our water AT ALL, but he was tending to the couple next to us every so often. I completely don't understand the reason for such bad service!

I decided to come here the second time to give this place another chance with two other friends. We came on a Friday night, so it was pretty busy, the service was still better than my first encounter until the dessert part. The waitress got my order wrong and was going to charge me for whatever she gave me, which was more than my original order. Luckily the manager, at least I think she was, stepped in and apologize for their mistake and corrected it-which I appreciate.

Sorry, but I don't think I will go back again...
author: Am Y.

description: A must visit - I'll cut to the chase - honoring our reservation despite being extremely busy, awesome food, fantastic professional friendly & cordial Luis, our five-star waiter, were the real ingredients that helped to enssure us the five-star celebration we were there for.  We had a wonderful time.
author: Kean S.

description:
Came here for dine about town. First of all, service was GREAT! Even though the place was crowded, the waiter would come around every 10 minutes or so and ask if we needed anything/ refilled our bread basket (we had like 6 baskets of the delicious bread). 

The food, for the price, I would probably give 3 stars. 
- Potato leek soup: surprisingly delicious and the perfect temperature. It was delicious with the bread. 
- Yellowfin tuna: this was also really really good. So many blocks of delicious sashimi mixed with avocado and spicy mayo. I would definitely order again
- Dungeness crab salad: This was just okay but nothing special
- Braised short rib: Loved this! It was insanely tender, fell right off the bone. The mashed potato was also really creamy and good
- Duck Breast: Did not like this at all. Tasted raw. Slices were too thick for my liking. Roast duck, in my opinion, is 10000x better. I usually love arugula, but the arugula that came with this was super salty and bitter. 
- Semifreddo all amaretto: I didn't really like this. The cookies that came with it were really hard/ didn't taste that fresh
- Aged goat cheese with honey and walnuts: Not a huge cheese fan so I didn't like this either.

Conflicted about my review here, because while I loved some dishes, I really didn't like others. The service was fantastic though!
author: Christina L.

description: We were a group that has assembled from around the country. Isa was recommended as since restaurant where our group could enjoy good wine and great food. After sitting outside on the patio and ordering 10-12 plates I couldn't agree more. Dean was an excellent server. The food was delicious. Try the Yellowfin, Scallops or Rack of Lamb.
author: Kris M.

description:
Great food, Awesome service! 
Def try the foi gra .. I also loved the iron steak.

Just went again this weekend to try their dine about town menu - I should say I wasn't impressed at all. Downgrading to 3 stars.
The lobster bisque was watery, and the petral sole fish had a bad taste. The scallops were really good though.
author: Shirin E.

description:
I am between 3-4.
Fodd was good, but not phenomenal.
We had goat cheese, oysters, foie gras. the scallops and fish.
I've had better.
SERVICE -Great!
A bit rushed though, but I m guessing its because we were there for Dine About town. So like main course came before we even finished app.
author: Anna B.

description:
My wife and I have walked by Isa hundreds of times over the last 6 years, never going in.  Part of the reason is we have a 5 year old and it felt more like a date place.  

Finally on a date last week, we happened in after a show, lured by the $5 wine and $5 appetizer special for happy hour (nightly, even Saturday when we went).

We had perhaps the best overall dining experience we have had in the Marina.   We have been to just about every top restaurant in town, and while sure, some will wow with over the top creations, Isa thrives on more simple but interesting food.   Everything was delicious, but what made the night was the attentive service.

Our server was outstanding, and you could tell he really loved the restaurant and food and wine.  And Oscar, who helped our server (busing, bread, water) was perhaps one of the happiest, most enjoyable people we have come across working at a restaurant.  

Bronzino was the fish of the day, and we shared that and 3 appetizers.

We will be back.  This is what dining out should be - enjoyable, relaxing and delicious.
author: michael d.

description:
Ok, my man and I came here on a whim 2 nights ago.  We wanted to take a drive to SF and try something new.  Anyway, we settled for French and narrowed it down to Isa.  

We picked Isa due to the ratings/review and the prix fixe menu.  Well, we got there no prob and parked in front on a Tuesday night.  Got seated promptly at the corner, side by side to each other (thank goodness were small coz it's a tight squeeze).  The decor is chic and the darkwood 
floor Is lovely.  They offer $25 for 2 courses or $28 for 3.   I got the mussels to start with which were awesome (I'm goin back just for those) The broth was amazing and the mussels were cooked perfectly.  My entree was the Truffle Rissotto which was great as well.  My BF got the grilled calamari (he liked it, i didn't) and flat iron steak.  Not much selection on the drinks but ok by me since I just like water with my meal.  Plus I needed room for coffee and dessert which was the amaretto ice cream we shared.

Overall, great tasting food.  Place is quaint.  Minus 1 star because of the snooty waiter but at least he's equally snooty to all.
author: Gem A.

description:
I've been wanting to try Isa for awhile now and finally got the opportunity to dine here with a group of 12 for NYE. Isa was offering a special 5 course tasting menu for $59 and had vegetarian options listed for each of the courses so I was already excited. 

The restaurant itself is very "cozy" - we were seated towards the back annex which was pretty cold even though they had heat lamps on. They seemed to pack as many people in as possible for the NYE rush, I felt a little bit like a sardine in a can. Talk about claustrophobia. Upon being seated we were immediately greeted with some bread and better (meh) and a cold glass of complimentary champagne. Our server was very nice and took our groups entire order at once. 

The dishes started coming out slowly. It's always awkward being one of the first ones to get your dish while you wait patiently for the rest of the party to get their dishes. I wish the kitchen would wait to serve the group together rather than sending dishes out randomly. Further, throughout the night the kitchen did not send out dishes in order of how we ordered. Some people were eating their third course while others had been served their fourth course (and would later receive their third course). 

To further complicate things, they didn't even wait for you to finish your course before they brought your next course. It was not uncommon for some people in our party to have no food while others in our party had two dishes, one that they were eating and the other that was standing (and getting cold) by. The 5 courses were very filling though none were particularly noteworthy. My favorite dish of the night was the flourless chocolate cake dessert which was warm and freshly baked and accompanied with a vanilla gelato.

The food here was simply OK here, the wait service was pretty good, and the kitchen just seemed like a disorganized mess. When the meal was over and we were ready to pay, we were notified that they would only accept 2 credit cards for the entire party. This would've been useful information for them to share with me one of the three times they called me beforehand to confirm the reservation or to see if we wanted to place our order in ahead of time to "help out the kitchen". Therefore it was a little complicated to figure the bill out (who carries cash these days anyway?) but with a few runs to the ATM and the help of the manager who broke some of the 20s, we were able to get the job done.

Tip:
*I wouldn't recommend Isa for groups larger than 6

Bottom line, this isn't traditional French cooking by any means but more of a non-French chef's take on French cuisine.
author: H T.

description:
Awesome service, but I'm not too sure whether I should call it a 'french' restaurant.

The appetizers come with the $34 package dinner meal is very delicious!
The main course is however only so-so when it comes to taste. Perhaps I was expecting more than that!

Dessert is also not bad.

They did charge me $18 when I bring my own bottle of wine, but I mean are you serious!? Your menu of drinks don't even cost $18.  That's not fair and people just want to have their own preferred alcohol

About $85 for a 2-persons dinner meal (tips and tax included).  I think it's OK for a french restaurant, but I seriously don't think any of their meals are french except the appetizers.

At the dress code, it said "dressy", but everyone around us is only dressing up casually.  

But I do like the guy who takes call for reservation. Initially I asked for 8:00pm but they said no more spot for me. Then I asked again whether I can be on the waiting list. He said yes, and 30 mins later he actually call me back and told me there's now an opening for table of 2. I'm very impressed by his eagerness helping the customer! Thumbs up for that!

Overall it's not bad and considerably cheaper than other 'french' restaurants in the area. Food is ok but I think I'm having an usual higher expectation when it comes to taste on food.
author: Sam X.

description:
Probably one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Whatever is on the menu, it sure has it going on. The food has always been very tasty and cooked just right.

I am a big fan of the calamari and the foie gras. Brioche and foie gras, I am in eating heaven. I haven't had the experience of it being burnt as other Yelper's have stated. 

To top it all off, the outdoor patio is divine. It is so pretty and cozy out there. It is definitely worth the wait. It is the perfect place for a date. Well, at least a date with me. yehahaa
author: Tawny A.

description:
This is my second time here and most likely the last time. We Don't get me wrong, the food was delicious. I'm a fair person so if you are reading this, this review is NOT for the food. It's more how we were treated. 
The reason for the 1 star you ask? Well, let me explain. First, we had a party of 9 and ordered just about everything on the menu. We ordered the spaghetti dish on accident and when it was brought out, we told our waiter that it was our fault we didn't mean to order the spaghetti. Our waiter was nice enough to exchange it for the Risotto. Few minutes later our waiter asked us if we want to box up the spaghetti or else it would be thrown away. We said okay and he said he will have to charge us for it. He didn't mention we were going to be charged til we asked him. Granted it was our fault we ordered the wrong dish..but you would think at a place like this and seeing how our bill was $631, they can comp us spaghetti that cost them $10 to make. Second, soon as we finished our dessert, the waiter in so many words asked us to leave because there was another party waiting for us. I get that, we overstayed our welcome, but we were not at the table talking for 30 mins. We just finished dessert about 5-10 mins and they started to ask us to leave. The final problem we had with this place is that they counted our money wrong when we paid the bill. 5 of us at the table counted the money and we were told we were $4 short. This caused some confusion because the 5 of us counted. So this prompt one of us to go up to cashier and ask her how we were short. The cashier said we are not short we are over thirty cents. Wait? We were just told by another person we were short $4. 
Very unorganized. As others said on Yelp, service was incredibly rushed and horrible!!!  If you are looking for a place to get together with your friends for dinner and conversation, don't come here. This is a place where you eat and leave. Don't even think about staying and conversating.
author: Kiwi T.

description:
I love the atmosphere at Isa. It is perfect for a romantic night out or a group dinner. It's not hoity toity like some French restaurants but the food is just as amazing. The staff is awesome too! 

We got the foie gras (of course -- after all the great reviews!) and it did not disappoint. We also got the lobster broth, scallops (with truffle!), and pork chops (special of the night). My fav were the lobster broth and scallops :)

- Annie
author: Annie C.

description:
Homey, cozy, and friendly place to dine. My bf brought us here on our one year anniversary and I'm glad he did. We showed up early for our reservations because parking was at our mercy in that busy part of the Marina on a sunday evening. We checked in with our waitress and off we were to our seats on the patio floor. 

We opted for two prix fix menus and also wanted to get additional appetizers off the regular menu. BIG MISTAKE. The host did let us know as soon as we got seated that Isa portions are to be shared. All we did was nod our heads in acknowledgment but in one ear and out the other it went! 

From the prix fix menu we ordered : Yellowfin tuna with spicy sri racha (very faint taste of spiciness), Salmon carpaccio with capers and creme fraiche (pretty bland and texture wasn't too impressive), grilled angus flat iron steak with green beans and fingerling potatoes (good but very BORING. I personally would not order steak if it's the only steak option on the entire menu but bf wanted to get this. Nothing too special about this dish but the potatoes were very nicely seasoned and crispy, like a chip), truffle risotto was SOO delicious! The creaminess of the risotto mixed with the subtle sweetness of the shitake mushrooms was a perfect balance and nicely topped off with the saltiness of the reggiano cheese. Mmm..definitely coming back again for this wonderful treat. We ordered the seared foie gras (why not? as long as the establishment offers it) the portion was HUGE. Anywhere you go, it usually comes in a small palm sized (if even) piece of it and you're always left wanting more. Not this time! This time was different. We could not even finish it, sadly to say, and had to be done with it because of its richness. We also ordered the mussels which we both thought was just ehh. The broth was a bit too salty and I, personally am not a huge fan of the mollusk, am very picky when it comes to ordering mussels. 

So onto the dessert. After all that richness of the foie gras, I craved..no, needed something citrus-y and light. We had the grapefruit shaved ice with a drizzle of vermouth (yum and did the trick) and the creamy mascarpone with fresh fruit and huckleberry trifle (I LOVE mascarpone cheese on anything and the whole thing was kinda like a modernly constructed cheesecake). 

No, of course we didn't finish everything! We barely touched the steak because I wanted to save room for dessert and I wanted the risotto for lunch the next day. We were stuffed beyond stuffed. The bill came out to be about $120 with tax and tip. I think we could've gotten away with just one prix fix dinner and two options off the regular menu. Trust them when they tell you everything is meant to be shared!
author: Elaine L.

description:
My friends and I decided to go to Isa for Dine About Town. Man oh man, talk about Top 10 favorite restaurants. From ambiance to service, and we will get to food... this place is HOT. 

Let's start off by saying, we had to wait almost an hour to be seated that particular evening. There were multiple parties all waiting to be seated when we arrived for our reservation. Apparently someone overbooked that night. 

The restaurant is a family style eating and so you can imagine, parties can take their time eating like this. Good wine, large plates, a lot of conversation.. you get the picture. Diners can spend up to 2 hours at their table. 

So you ask, I had to wait that long to be seated, even with a reservation, and you still give it 5 stars? Say it with me now... "Yes! The food is that damn good."

The waiter was charming and made a lot of great suggestions. The decor was fresh and quirky. I love love loved it.

Here is what we ordered: From the Prix Fix Menu, there were 3 of us and we could all order 1 item a piece. Since it was family style, we all ate real well that night. What a fantastic deal.

Starters:

Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio, Steamed Prince Edward island mussels, and Dungeness Crab Salad

Entrees:

Truffle Risotto, Seared Scallops, and Duck Breast

Dessert:

Semifreddo All'Amaretto, Vanilla Bean Gelato, and Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee

The best part though? The Foie Gras. It wasn't on the Dine About Town menu but the hostess suggested it to us when she came to our table to apologize again for the long wait. Hands down delicious. My friends enjoyed some great wine pairings with their meals as well. 

We all appreciated the food and service so much, and honestly, once the meal started, we weren't even thinking about how long we waited to be seated. How great is that?I took tons of pictures and shared them with everyone I could like I was a proud mama.
author: Payal P.

description:
You know those types who really don't know food who try to wow you with what they ordered at "So and so,' restaurant for too much $$$$; well, fortunately, there is Isa restaurant - the antidote to the pretentious 5 star dining experience. One could actually develop a palate eating at a restaurant like this so be sure to bring your kids so they aren't at risk of becoming future fake foodies. 

From the moment we stepped into the etherial semi-outdoor dining area (don't worry, it is heated and very clean!), I was overcome by what seemed to be black truffle 'land-mines,' exploding throughout the restaurant and into my nose. Our waiter was a bit 'involved,' in explaining the intricacies of the menu, but his sweet personality really shone through - he was passionate, and that's always fine by me because I am too! Besides, when is the last time you had service that actually and obviously cared about you as a person, I was taken back.

On to the food: Pt Reyes Oysters with a light spicy mignonette The seared scallops were perfectly cooked (slightly raw in center, and perfectly opaque). The salad was rather un-mentionable; bleu and walnuts with a mild vinegratte, really the plain-jane of the affair. The signature Pancetta wrapped bass was absolutely delightful - in a rich olive oil and red pepper/ caper sauce which complemented the light notes of the fish while not overpowering the flavor, nor sogging the perfectly crisp pancetta. The star of the show was the black truffle and fungi risotto- the best I've ever had, and we have all had good risotto here in epicurian Mecca (SF)! The perfect looseness of the rice fused brilliantly with the combo of Princely Parmigiano-Reggiano, Morelles, Black Truffle...and I did die, and am risen. Great gellato with lemon biscotti too. 

Our waiter made a point to mention to us that, amongst fine diners in SF, Isa Restaurant is their 'home base,' for regularly, exceptional cuisine! I am a convert. You know a restaurant is good when you leave full, but your soul is still hungry! Thank you Isa Restaurant. 

PS Sunday is Prix Fix day - Appatizer, Entree, and Dessert for about $30/p!
author: Zizzle f.

description: We had a birthday dinner at Isa and it was a blast.  Our waiter was entertaining and very helpful.  The scallops were to die for!
author: Raechel P.

description:
A small little gem in the marina..even on a cold night, sitting on the patio seemed cozy...

My absolute favorite and star of the show were the seared scallops with lightly sauteed spinach, diced root veggies, truffle oil and smoky bacon to set it all off, deeelicious! The oysters were fresh, and the mignonette had a little kick to it. The lobster broth with prawns is packed full of concentrated lobster flavors. The prawns added just enough sweetness to the briny broth. The Gamma by the glass was an excellent pairing for all the seafood dishes. Truffle and mushroom risotto was also a little taste of heaven..how can you go wrong with wild baby mushrooms and a light overtone of tartuffo paired with creamy perfectly cooked rissotto? Although stuffed, I did manage to taste the flat iron steak which was tender and delicious. To finish off with a pear and mascarpone trifle topped with huckleberry sauce i would say is the perfect end to a happy meal :)

Not a lot of parking, and the food comes out very quickly. The staff were all very helpful and attentive. Overall a surpisingly kick-ass meal.
author: Sara F.

description:
Very solid food and service at this Marina institution (practically). It's refreshing to visit a long standing establishment and get away from new openings with potential service and food issues.

They have a huge back patio to accommodate more guests when the cozy front room fills up.

We had oysters (very fresh), yellowtail tuna crudo, prawns (excellent), shortribs (delicious) and Brussel sprouts. 

In contrast to the shortribs at 25 Lusk, Isa's were perfectly braised till juicy and beefy, served with delicious mashed potatoes, broccolini and tender carrots.

Service and wine were awesome.

If you want a solid dining experience without the worries of new and trendy, Isa is your spot.
author: Derrick V.

description: We had a really nice dinner there on the Saturday night solstice. Will definitely return.
author: Ed r.

description:
Came here last minute on a Sunday late afternoon for an early dinner. No issues with getting a table although I think we were lucky and my friend knew the owner. 

Small dining area in the front of the restaurant but it extends to a covered and heated outdoor area in the back. Lovely and comfortable.

Great food choices and the $29 - 3 course option was awesome. Highly recommend the goat cheese or arugula salad for appetizers. The halibut was delicious as well. There were 2 cheese options for dessert. Only need to get one. Two is just too much cheese. 

Didn't get a chance to pay attention to the wine list as we had already gone to a New Zealand wine tasting earlier in the day. 

Would definitely go back.
author: Heather L.

description: Isa restaurant met all my expectations, the food is very tasty -organic and healthy, the service at a high level, I recommend to everyone
author: Mary H.

description:
This place was awesome, we love all the dishes we ordered from the Dine About Town menu. The staff are very nice and friendly. The price is about $35 each person, it's totally worthy for the good quality food. However, the desserts didn't surprise me at all, it was just average. But I will definitely go back again!

Some dishes that I would recommend:

 Dungeness Crab Salad 

Foie Gras (CA will ban it  at the end of June)

Seared Scallops

Spaghetti (it's simple, but delicious!)

Steamed mussels
author: Faye X.

description: We came for the Dine About Town promotion and definitely were not disappointed. The food is delicious and the portions adequate. Dine About Town made this place definitely worth trying and the food made it worth coming back to try more things. The short ribs were tender and fell right off the bone. The scallops were seasoned and cooked perfectly. The waiter also recommended a delicious glass of red wine to complement the great meal. Definitely worth coming back!
author: 偉文 W.

description:
Very Disappointed!!!!

Made a reservation for my son's 21st birthday. They never said anything about having a very limited "Dine Around Town" menu. Only about 50% of the menu online was available. Wine list is AWEFUL!!!!!!
author: Tom L.

description: Oh my goodness I've got nothing but love for Isa. We ordered a little of everything and were impressed. You can sit out back any time of year.
author: C. S.

description:
Offers a dim romantic setting indoors (which is completely empty at 7pm), and a covered outdoors patio setting in the back with rustic lanterns & patio chairs. But a patio is a patio particularly if you're sitting on plastic weave.. so it really brings down the quality of atmosphere one would expect from a $$$ restaurant. Crying baby at the adjacent table didn't help. PPL, LEAVE YOUR KIDS AT HOME! Great service though - the waiter graciously replaced a horribly vinegary 08 South African Sauvignon Blanc with a mediocre 07 Vin De Pays D'Oc Chardonnay.

++ | Seared Dayboat Scallops |
Isa's one saving grace. GREAT truffled jus de poulet w/potato puree paired with nimble asparagus (even if its out of season) & perfectly cooked scallops. But it's all about the truffled potato.

++ | Table Butter |
Yah, the bread & butter stood out more than some of the other dishes here. Idk what they use, but it's creamy and good w/toasty baguette. Sprinkle some salt over for taste.

-- Dungeness Crab Salad
I can make this at home. Top a butter lettuce cup w/avocado, grapefruit, a bit of apple, & finish with meat from a steamed crab. Salt/Pepper to taste. Done! Tarragon dressing is practically non-existant in terms of taste.

-- Sea of Cortez Gulf Prawns
Overcooked with dry edges. Very standard flavoring that you can again make at home. Wide thin strips lemon peel, galic, EVOO.

-- Maple Leaf Duck Breast
Tastes uncannily like thanksgiving ham.  The Maple/Bacon flavor overpowers the practically raw duck which was over a boring bed of spinach sprinkled with currents, pine nuts, & bacon bits.

To play it safe you can try the Bouillabaisse; decent base, good fish, medium "other"  seafood.

Good but forgettable dinner for 3 w/wine: $115
author: Christina J.

description: Aggressively mediocre. Nothing was terrible, but we certainly wouldn't call anything good, either. There's way better food in virtually every restaurant in the marina. Don't bother. No wonder they had so many open reservations... Oh and if they call themselves a French restaurant, that means then I'm an astronaut because I've looked at the night sky.
author: Ali W.

description: Isa is one of my favorite restaurants in SF. My husband and I love this place. The service is excellent, the food is amazing! Every single dish that we tried at Isa is delicious. Our favorites are: arugula salad, main lobster broth, baked Laura Chenel goat cheese, truffle risotto, potato wrapped sea bass, and roasted rack of lamb. I highly recommend Isa!
author: Victoria Y.

description: Overpriced food, awkward service and the ambiance of a dilapidated greenhouse. I'm not sure how this place has such high reviews, but my experience barely creeped into one-star territory. As a side note the food is not French, but rather some strange French-Continental-Americana fusion, that's about as well as I can describe it. To be fair the Marina is generally deprived of interesting and tasty food, but this place is still awful even compared to the neighborhood standard.
author: Alex L.

description: All in all amazing experience. Best braided short rib I've ever had... and I own a cow! Staff was friendly prompt and amazing. I sat at the bar and they recommended a delicious white wine. I can't wait to go back!
author: Bonnie N.

description:
Went for Dine about Town and ordered the following:

1 Apetizer: Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese
2 Apetizer: Steamed Prince Edward island mussels
3 Entree: Northern Halibut a la Plancha
4 Entree: Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast
5 Dessert: Grapefruit Granite
6 Dessert: Semifreddo all' amaretto

Isa is absolutely amazing! great ambiance, good service, and delicious food!  I loved the Goat cheese apetizer, super creamy with a hint of basil - absolutely divine.  The Mussels were amazing too, the broth is what made it totally zesty.  I thought the entrees were good too, though not amazing.  I highly recommend the semifreddo all'amaretto desert, its basically ice cream mixed with cookies (they also give you a biscotti), very amazing and topped the meal off right!
author: Heather Y.

description:
Went there for Down About Town with a bunch of friends. We collectively decided on it because their prix fixe had good selection from their regular menu, not a watered-down version like many other participating restaurants.

The friend made the reservation arrived annoyed, said she got calls from the maitre d 3pm and 6:30pm to make sure we were still coming. She understood that it was restaurant week and they were definitely packed but calling twice to confirm the reservation?

They wouldn't seat us until everyone arrived, so a couple of them parked illegally so we can get seated before they gave our table away then left to park.

Once we were seated, things started to look up from there. While the server recommended sharing the plates, none of us were doing it because they all looked so good. We did trade bites tho.

The crab salad was light and refreshing, salmon carpaccio was also very good. 

For the entree, all of the ones we ordered were good. I especially liked the steak and the duck breast. Both cooked to tender medium rare and the moutarde verte sauce really added to the steak. My friend who ordered her duck well done didn't like how it was still a bit pink. The roast chicken ordered by another friend was a bit dry.

As for dessert, the flourless chocolate cake was really good. It was light and fluffy, more like a souffle and after tasting it, i regret not ordering it. My Semifreddo all' amaretto was pretty good and almondy but the grapefruit granite was not too exciting (snowcorn with real grapefruit juice).

Our server was very friendly and attentive, even tho the place was busy.
author: Cindy B.

description:
I was SO excited to try Isa - it's been on my list for months, ever since Dine About Town in January. The food was good to excellent, but the service left something to be desired. 

DRINKS  - Given that they don't have a full liquor license, I was really impressed by Isa's cocktail menu. We didn't like the Number Seven, probably because of the champagne, but the Lemon Drop was great. My boyfriend was also drunk after about 3 sips.... We later ordered the McIntyre Pinot Noir for the table, which was delicious.

SERVICE -- The hostess in the front was a delight. Our waiter I'm only giving Isa 4 stars. He was an older Asian man who talked to us like we were idiots, wouldn't stop talking, and seemed fairly oblivious to what we actually wanted (i.e. a wine recommendation, but no food recommendations, and for him to stop talking). He was completely irritating, and we didn't need him to walk us through every single menu item.

FOOD - We were *strongly* encouraged to order one item from the top half of the menu and one item from the bottom half of the menu per person. We actually ordered 5 and 5 dishes for the 6 of us, which was the perfect amount of food (maybe just a little too much). The waiter warned us, on repeat, that the chef was a proponent of "something called family style" and that he recommended we plan on sharing everything, which we did. 

Salmon Carpaccio - incredibly well done, delicate, and flavorful. Just perfect. 

Arugula Salad - Great proportions of all the ingredients and very fresh with a light dressing. 

Truffle Risotto - probably my favorite dish of the night. Perfectly infused with a great combination of rice and mushrooms. 

Roasted Rack of Lamb - a little gamey, even though our waiter promised it wouldn't be, but otherwise delicious. Not easy to share, but still good. 

Duck Breast - definitely interesting, but not my favorite. 

Not particularly memorable but still good: Yellowfin Tuna, Butter Lettuce Salad, Grilled Local Calamari, Seared Scallops, and the Flat Iron Steak. 

SUMMARY - The food was mostly outstanding, and if I were able to request a different server, I'd be back here in a heartbeat. Yum.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
My boyfriend took me out here for a belated Valentine's day celebration. It definitely lived up to the evening with its romantic ambiance and decor, great service, and delicious food. 

We made it just in time for the happy hour and got two glasses of wine for such an affordable price (can't remember, maybe $4/glass). After, we ordered the truffle risotto and potato wrapped sea bass. Both were just full of flavor. The risotto is probably one of the best yet I have tried (and I love truffle risotto...and have tried a lot). When I bit into the sea bass, I first tasted the crispy thin potato skin and then had the perfectly cooked sea bass. Everything was great. The only thing complaint, I wish I had more.
author: Tif L.

description:
I was very skeptical about Isa because it sounded trendy and like the typical "up-scale" restaurant in the city when I checked it out online before going there (chosen by my friends), however I was highly impressed! There were a variety of choices to choose from and all at decent princes.

The foie gras was delicious and nicely seared, and I have to say - a generous serving considering the price of the dish. I also highly recommend the lamb chops and filet..wow yum!

I'm already looking forward to going back, especially perhaps on a weekday because Monday-Thursday they have a prix fixe at $24 p.p. for 2 dishes! Great deal =)
author: Veronica S.

description:
Been to Isa over 6 times with my husband. We usually really like it, especially the Foie Gras, but the last time we were here, instead of being seated in the back like we usually are, they seated us in the very front of the restaurant. It seemed like the "reject area", seeing as how we were seated next to some very overweight, very loud, and apparently incestuous mother & son. Gross. We also got the worst server in the restaurant.. the FRENCH SERVER. This man should get tips TAKEN OUT of his paycheck. From where we were sitting we could SEE the specials board outside of Isa, but the server didn't inform us OR the gross people next to us about the specials. Really terrible service. 
Also, the Indian woman who seated us, was extremely rude and invasive.. don't breathe on my food, THANKS.
author: Kat S.

description:
Nice atmosphere. Attentive, smiling staff. Tasty dishes. It doesn't get 4 stars because the prices are a bit high for the quality of the cooking, which was good but not innovative.

We had an arugula salad and a warm goat cheese appetizer. They were exactly as expected and tasty. The halibut main course was done well, although my home-cooked halibut is just as good. The truffle risotto was flavorful but too salty. 

Isa is a good place to go for dependably tasty standards if you want to show off your pocketbook a little bit.
author: Greg T.

description:
The bartender, a Scottish and Japanese gal, was working the bar all by herself, but gave everyone equal attention.  She poured us our whites: Pinot Grigio and Riesling.  Excellent selection of wines by the glass.  We were waiting to be seated, and were starving, so we asked for bread and butter, she brought out a basket of toasty baguettes, plates and napkins.  Very nice.  

15 minutes after our 9:30pm reservation we were seated in the back room.  Liked the energy of the restaurant, but I felt like I was dining in a backyard with a sheet thrown over it.  No view, nothing, a concrete wall on one side and a brick one on the other.  Seating was cramped and we were at the walkway, so it was a bit distracting.  

Our Croat waiter was friendly and really joined with our playful banter.  The bread guy refilled our baguettes with the quickness, basically the service was spotless, but the food was not as amazing as I anticipated.  

Spicy Tuna Tartare $12
Big portion, smooth, buttery, but just a tiny bit of heat.  More heat please. The bottom layer of guac was fantastic.  

Dungeoness Crab salad $12
Mediocre, didn't like the massive amounts of sliced apples, which totally overpowered the less than sweet crab.  

Diver Scallops $16.50
Four dinky overcooked scallops.  Tasty, but a little chewy.

Flat Iron Steak $17.50
6 small pieces of thinly sliced beef.  Came along with herb infused butter and two fingerling potatoes.  A solid dish.  

Flourless chocolate cake $7.00
When the cake is dry and lifeless, no amount of gelato will save it.  

A return visit would be probable, based on the energy, but I would not request it for the food and ambiance.  I get excited about really good food, Isa does not warrant that my blood pressure rising.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I came here for Mother's Day since my mom wanted French and they had an awesome deal- $42 prix fixe menu, free glass of wine, and a $25 gift certificate. 

Quality and taste of food was definitely up to par. This is a family style restaurant, where each dish comes out as soon as it is cooked and ready (and of course, shared).

We ordered:

-Dungeness Crab salad: Our table's favorite. It was served with fresh crab, avocado, and mix of fruits. Super fresh and delicious.
-Yellowfin Tuna: My ultimate favorite of the night. It was served with avocado and the combination was euphoric. 
-Duck breast: Tender, flavorful accompanied by a savory sauce
-Rack of lamb: Tender and seasoned well. My mom's favorite of the night.
-Seared Scallops: Cooked very well and was delicious. It was finished in a split second.
-Flat iron steak: Table's least favorite. It wasn't bad nor was it good. 

For the amount and quality of food we had, it was worth the price. There is also warm, toasted French bread which was filling and tasty alone. Our server was also accommodating and respectful. Oddly, he served the salads after the main dishes, and so he offered free wine/coffee/tea for that little mistake.  

There is a front and back section of the restaurant  that look completely different from one another. I suggest seating in the back as it was much cozier, brighter, and illuminated with decorative lights. It didn't have an actual rooftop and was more of a fancy tent like structure. The front section is too dark and bit bland in setting. 

With my $25 gift certificate (that my mom insisted I have) I am excited to go back!
author: Denise W.

description:
We sat in the back out in the dark and romantic patio area. Our waitress was friendly and made excellent wine recommendations. It was date night, so as per usz. we drank a lot. Even dessert wine as I recall. So I totally can't remember what I ate. But I know prior to the dessert wine I was quite impressed with the food. 

I really liked the atmosphere, all cozy and romantic-like.   It was so charming I totally forgot I was in the Marina!
author: Nikki M.

description:
Count 'em- one, two, three, four, (dot dot dot), & skip straight to eleven. Eleven courses and six glasses of wine later, shared between four lovely ladies, on a random Wednesday night is just pure greatness. 

Who does that? 

Apparently Isa in the Marina does, and might I add, does it exceptionally well. With a wonderful 3 course pre-fixe menu @$29 (available Monday through Thursday) and signature cocktails/delicious wine on special @$5 before 7pm (daily), who can even compare?

Service was stupendous (thank you Luis), ambiance was beautiful (if on a date,romantically dim), & the food was simply amazing. Yes, all eleven courses were delectable. 

The food, oh the delicious food, was shared by us all:
*yellowfin tuna w/ seaweed, avocado, sriracha, & toasted sesame
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?userid=Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ
*heirloom tomato salad w/ feta cheese & arugula
*squiggly grilled calamari w/ beans & arugula
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=clNDbtE4xuMD7xhp-DfkxQ
*steamed mussels w/ white wine, garlic, onions, & parsley
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=Gq9zyJ5aSBiyxjzp1op3Tw
*foie gras w/ peaches & custard brioche
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=jAkKchKhMBcYSXIxxXBy_Q
*natural angus flat iron steak topped w/ a hint of cream sauce, zucchini & uhh-mazing potatoes
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=lOBx0C0wYcOS1DrPb0Jy2A
*fresh halibut with chunky red beets
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=_eEcIEjcbeITedGSYJnNBA
*truffle risotto w/ shiitake & mushrooms
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=hrMrLlneNSEHF-c_8yhIug
*blue cheese w/ grapes
*aged cheese, drizzle of honey, & caramelized walnuts
*semifreddo all amaretto
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=vwwpdEhR-CzuAJO5fVPCAw

Full yet?

Bottom line: Perfect spot for dining. You can't go wrong here- wonderful group of gals, nice wine & cocktail list, delicious entree choices, lovely ambiance, and personable service. I loved it.

Thank you to my sweet friend, Hannah C., for recommending this spot for dinner. I understand now why it's one of your faves.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QINiEjMRGA7pKfvhPQtfBg?select=ns8yEtZB8u9unpqCVea2Ag

Run anyone?
author: Joy A.

description:
This review is for Isa's Dine About Town Menu...

I have never seen this many choices on a DAT Menu!  4 options for the first course, 6 options for the second course and 4 options for dessert.  My party was a party of three so we tried as much as we could.  Overall the experience was delicious! 

First Course recommendations:
-Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese with pesto, tomato & pine nuts. This dish is divine! Get wild and spread it over the house bread...
-Simply sauteed Sea of Cortez wild prawns with parsley, garlic & lemon. AMAZING.  A dish I would certainly come back for. 
-Dungeness crab salad with avocado, apple & grapefruit. This salad is refreshing!

Second Course recommendations: 
-Seared scallops topped with bacon, served with butternut squash, sweet potatoes and spinach. There is something really cute about this dish and the bacon adds a fun/strong taste. 
-Grilled golden date natural angus flat iron steak served with zucchini and polenta. I love how rare the steak comes out and I surprisingly really enjoyed the polenta.

Dessert recommendation: 
We tried three desserts but the easy winner was the flour-less chocolate cake with vanilla bean gelatto. A wonderful pairing, both equally amazing!  I would come back for this alone. 

DATs, in general, are tricky but this one was worth it!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Girls night out on the town.

There were six of us that night so we were able to try a lot of different items on the menu. Here's what stood out to me:

Maple Leaf Farm Duck Breast
I've never had duck and was feeling adventurous.  I really enjoyed it.  The sweetness from the sauce and the beets were a nice compliment to the meat.

The Pan Roasted Rocky Jr. Range Chicken
Plain and simple comfort food at it's best.  From the mashed potatoes to the fresh vegetables served on the side this dish tasted like something my mom would make on Sunday.  I was surprised to find such a for lack of a better word "snuggly"  dish on the menu.   The chicken fell off the bone, just lovely.

Steamed Prince Edward Island Mussels
This was a table favorite.  The broth was full of flavor and the mussels were tender and tasty.  It's served with a side of crusty bread for soaking up the brothy goodness and the bottom of the bowl.

Sea of Cortez Wild Prawns
Sauteed prawns in garlic and lemon.  How can you go wrong?  The prawns were garlicy and juicy.  The two orders of this were gone in a flash.

We ended out meal with mascarpone and berries.  It was described to us as a deconstructed cheese cake.  A light refreshing little dessert.  The natural sweetness of the berries was just enough to satisfy the sweet tooth.

We had a great time eating and catching up on this and that.  Our server was full of personality and very helpful when describing items on the menu.  We had a few challenges getting the attention of the wait staff.  There wasn't a lot of checking in and flagging people down became a task.  

The interior is dark and romantic looking.  The close proximity of the tables kind of decreases the intimacy level though.  The people at the next table can literally reach over and take the salt off your table.  We caught the tail end of a couple have a pretty nasty argument. Yikes!

I wouldn't come here if I was in a rush to be somewhere else.  Sometimes you just want to see where the night takes you.  In the company of friends and good food what could be better?
author: Jo H.

description:
There is a certain level of comfort you get when you know a restaurant aspires to have the service, quality, and level of excellence that you expect and receive from a good michelin rated restaurant. 

It's an experience, and whenever you want to find a diamond in the rough, a bib gourmand is like the little brother who still doesn't quite get it yet, but sure has potential. Cafe Gibraltar was much like that.

The excitement ended the moment I asked for a prix fixe course swap off the a la carte menu. A moment of confusion that apparently ruffled our server's feathers, we were then given the prix fixe menu and the server went on to make sure we knew that if we did not order a la carte we would lose 1000 points off the open table reservation. At this point it's amusing that changing menus could cause a slight ruckus. A bit abrasive but no big deal, we were excited to try the dishes.

The menu choices on a 5 point rating system. 
1 = Eek! Methinks not. 5= Woohoo! As good as it gets!

They don't deserve any preparation details as the dishes were about as plain as they sound. 


Me
- Lobster soup, 2.5
.........A bit watered down, but decent taste. The lobster was a bit rubbery and lacked flavor, but the broth was pretty good.

- Steak, 1
..........I love steak. It's pretty hard to give me a steak I don't care to continue eating, however Isa was up for the challenge and they delivered. I ordered a medium steak, which was served a bit raw with a dash of rubbery in the middle. 

 At first I was trying to be nice after glancing at my dinner buddies' plates and noticing how weird the halibut looked lying on a bed of bleeding beets and noticed that my $7 lack table from Ikea had more personality than the chicken before me...

 Then I tasted the red rubber steak I just shared with them and realized that culinary altruism is a curse in a chefless diner. In fairness, the flavors weren't horribly lacking, it was just the preparation. I'm not sure which is a bigger fail, preparation or flavors?

Dining Buddy #1
- Calamari, 3
..........These were pretty decent, they taste better when combined with the peas they are served with. They were cooked well, and overall were what you would expect calamari to be. 

- Chicken & Mashed Potatoes, 3
..........The skin was crispy, the juices were good, and they served alot of mashed potatoes, however Applebee's garlic mashed potatoes are better and I would have traded their chicken for our homecooked lemon pepper chicken in a second. Sidenote: Jean George's makes a killer parmesan crusted lemon chicken. 

Dining Buddy #2
- Mussels, 2
Tasted like Mussels.

- Halibut, 1
..........My dining buddy was likewise mutually unimpressed with the courses so far, so it should have been no surprise when she stepped outside midmeal for a cigarette after taking a bite of her halibut.

As we all know, a cigarette break mid-course in a restaurant with excellent food would likely taint your taste buds and break the flow of the tasting. With a meal that is so engaging you wouldn't want to step outside. At this point we knew we lost her, so I tasted the tail end of the halibut (typically the tastiest part in my opinion).

 I tasted an underlying taint of frozen/unfrozen but slightly expired and cooked halibut. It had that slight aftertaste of expiration that I recognize from my former fraternization days of old smelly beer battered tilapia from the fridge in a house full of boys.

___

The Service, 0
..........I'll spare all the details, but to sum it up - the server was rude, really rude. His solution to our halibut problem was to remove the prix fixe and charge a la carte sans the halibut. Weird! Then when we said we still wanted the prix fixe desert he became abrasive and muttered about how unbelievable it was. 

All this over a halibut that was clearly expired, but that the server became indignant and rude was clearly the mark of a restaurant that is not on it's way to receiving a star. 

The food ok/subpar, the service worse than Chili's Bar & Grill, but mostly it's the food that won't bring me back. If I had a bad server at Jean George's (and that would never happen), but if I did... I'd still go back for the food. Unfortunately the bad service was bad enough to turn a bland food experience into a horrible one.
author: Roxy G.

description:
Great place to take a date.  Romantic yet affordable and intimate yet not too stuffy.  The food was quite tasty.  Nothing really wowed me but it was pretty solid.  Definitely good enough to make a return trip. 

Definitely worth mentioning is the patio area and the seating in the front of the restaurant.  It's definitely more rocking in the back if you are looking for a scene.
author: Roger H.

description:
This was my first time eating at Isa. I ordered from the prix fixe menu, while my daughter ordered a la carte. We were there early, so happy hour was in effect, (until 7) which was an added bonus
The staff was friendly and efficient. They checked on us often.
Not a seafood lover, I ordered the arugula salad and the herbed chicken with mashed potatoes and string beans and then had the amaretto dessert. Everything was yummy, although they were a tiny bit heavy handed with the salt. 
My daughter had the crab salad, which she said was spectacular. She also had the scallops which she said were so delicious they would have made Gordon Ramsey very happy. 
Even though I live an hour away from San Francisco, I will definitely go back to Isa  and recommend it to other diners.
author: Gayle P.

description:
I've used yelp for 7+ years. This is my first review.... it obviously takes a lot to ruin my dining experience, but my evening at Isa was so bad- I finally felt inclined to contribute.

This is exactly what I would expect from the Marina- over priced, superficial, and run of the mill- definitely not worth it. Try Garson, or The Claude Cafe if you want a better French/Cal cuisine... 

Lets be real- prix fixe  & family style are two different things. As is delivering food in courses- vs delivering food after all the guests finish their orders. One of the main dishes we ordered, the chicken from the prix fixe, (keep in mind there were 7 of us who all did prix fixe meals), came out when the rest of us had been patiently waiting for the server to clear our plates so we could order dessert.  Not ideal. And when we mentioned we'd just rather have it to go, the server reminded us it wasn't his fault the way things come out. In stead of blame shifting- try apologizing. We spent over $100 on dinner for 2, and I'm still pretty hungry... 

I've had quite a few dining experiences in SF....this was by far the worst.
author: SF_diner S.

description: One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had in this city. My whole group ordered from the prix fixe menu for dinner, assuming we could still get served at the same time and bypass the "family-style" ordering of the main menu. The rest of the group was served their entree, except for me. After 15 minutes, I politely asked about the status of my order. Was told "the chicken will arrive later" and was chastised for not understanding their "family style" concept. Getting my dinner late and being humiliated in front of the whole party? Worthless.
author: Padraic W.

description:
foie gras. foie gras. foie gras. foie gras. foie gras. foie gras. foie gras. foie gras.

That's all you really need to order here... foie gras!!!

F O I E  G R A S 
- Hudson valley grade A foie gras with yellow peaches & custard brioche! Amazing!!!!!!! My first bite into the foie gras was magical. It melted like butter in my mouth. The fats just dissolved nicely with the bread and peaches! After enjoying this appetizers, all the appetizers weren't quite as appetizing and had put all the others to shame... haha But I'm glad we had this towards the end of our first course. I just wished the foie gras was precut or that we had something better than a butter knife. ($19)

S A L M O N  C A R P A C C I O
- Organic Loch Duart salmon carpaccio with lemon, crème fraiche, cucumber, egg, capers, onion, parsley (and was a bit overpowering) & crostini ($12)

C A L A M A R I
- Unlike your usual breaded and deep fried calamari, this was cooked whole and had a smoked flavor to it! Grilled local calamari with honey spice, flageolet beans, lemon zest & arugula ($10.50)

D U C K 
- Maple leaf farm duck breast with beets, chèvre, arugula & wild huckleberry sauce. Had it medium rare, but found it to be just a tad bit tough to cut into and slightly dry. ($19)

F L A T  I R O N  S T E A K
- Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak with green beans, potatoes, moutarde verte & bordelaise sauce (almost like a potato salad taste). Seared for easier eat-ability. ($20)

M A R S C A P O N E
- Creamy marscapone with fresh strawberries and huckleberry trifle. We saw the table next to us order it, so we ordered it too! haha ($6)

A M A R E T T O
- Semifreddo all' amaretto. It sounded intriguing, so we ordered it and devoured it! It was delicious and quite a unique dessert ($6)

P I N O T A G E
- 2008, Ernst & Co, South Africa ($8.50)

Minus 1 star for the tables being too close together. I felt like I was going to knock something over at the other table. Oh and while trying to eat my salmon carpaccio, my crostini broke and flew to the other table. It was quite embarrassing. Also, it was quite warm inside! The lighting is dim inside, but the one that was by our table felt like it was shining on my forehead! 

HAPPY SF CHEFS 2010!!  3-course for $35 What a great deal!
author: CeCe C.

description:
Isa takes me back to my European days of road tripping through France with my parents when I was younger. My dad would always splurge on food and wine and not hesitate to take us kids along to the fancy places. The running joke in the family was that before I could even read, I'd point at an item on the menu insisting that I wanted it for dinner and of course it never failed to be the most expensive dish. Back then I would stare at grown-up couples all dressed up out on date night and I couldn't wait to be one of them. 

I've come twice to Isa, each time feeling like one of those couples now that I am grown up and have found someone to share my love of food with. On our first visit we were seated at one of the snug little tables by the window, very close to two other tables, but yet we felt like we were in our own little world. The place is filled with conversation, laughter and noises from the kitchen, nonetheless you lose yourself in twosomeness here. The second time we opted to sit at the bar, our menus barely legible under the small, tinted lamp that is bolted on the bar. The waiters are once again attentive, but know when to just let you enjoy yourselves. 

The Maine Lobster Broth is divine and the Tomales Bay Pt Reyes oysters are fresh fresh fresh with a nice spicy orange mignonette. 

For the main courses, we had the Maple Leaf Duck Breast and the Natural Angus Flat Iron Steak the first time we came here. The duck was heavenly accompanied by beets, chèvre and arugula. The steak was cooked medium rare to perfection. 
On our second trip, I opted for the Dutch Valley Veal Sweetbreads with mushroom fricassee, mash potato and potato rosti. The sweetbreads were juicy, tender and melted on my tongue. The selection of mushrooms made my heart jump with joy. I devoured this dish. My boyfriend opted for the special of the day, butter fish with a brown butter sauce served over haricot verts and artichoke hearts. Neither one of us talked while we ate, we simply inhaled the food, the atmosphere and our wine. 

À bientôt, Isa!
author: Anna R.

description:
The hubs and I procrastinated on making a reservation for a babysitter night and so I decided to come back to Isa and, again, the food did not disappoint. And the service was much better. Every single plate was amazing - oysters, potato wrapped sea bass, tuna tartare and most of all the amazing short ribs. So tender and so bad for the waist line.

One way to improve: Our food came out so quickly we were slurping down food as our waiter was clearing the table. When you're paying a sitter 20 bones an hour, you kind of want to eat European-slow-as-molasses style.
author: Christina K.

description:
Amazing food!  Amazing service!  Amazing atmosphere!  

Nice casual place to eat with your gal pals, friends, or just a nice dinner for the two of you.

Must-have:
- seared scallops: these are amazing!  perfectly cooked!  tender! and the truffle taste is yum-o!  and the mashed potatoes is also yummily delicious too with all that flavor from the scallop and truffles!

Good to try:
- oysters: good
- dungeness crab salad: fine
- mussels: could be better flavored and more tender, but still pretty good.
- fish: a little too soft for my liking
- truffle risotto: good, but not enough going on.  needs more ingredients and something to give it a kick.
- duck breast: ok, but nothing too special or spectacular
- creme brulee: good but nothing spectacular
- chocolate flourless cake: good 
- semifreddo all' amaretto: good but nothing special. just ice cream or gelato. forget.

Overall:
food: good
service: good
price: pricey
atmosphere: fun and lively
