After enjoying our apps and entrees so very much, we had to continue on to dessert. The hubs was being good and although we almost talked him into the grapefruit granite, he abstained and so we ordered two desserts instead of three. Both arrived at the same time, the first was a vanilla bean crème brulée which was sublime. The next was a vanilla bean gelato with biscotti and espresso, also fantastic. 

I cannot wait to come back here, it was just a phenomenal experience.
author: Trip C.

description:
Great restaurant for the price.  I don't think it's the best restaurant, but for for price vs quality ratio...it's damn good.  Our table shared everything.  

Course 1: Salmon capraccio, goat cheese, and calamari
Course 2: Chicken, Steak, Mushroom Risotto.

The flavors we're all very spot on.  I felt like Isa tries to present you with the flavor of the ingredients, rather than create flavors.  This ultimately works, and makes the experience very enjoyable.
author: Lawrence C.

description: I think I found a new favorite restaurant!  Went here yesterday for NYE dinner and had their 4 course fixed menu.  Ambiance was great, service was great, though we felt a bit rushed. The lobster broth was good but a bit watered down for my taste.  The sea scallops and braised beef were amazing however! Looking forward to coming back!
author: Sebastian R.

description: Ate here only once and the food is good but not great.  I wouldn't suggest eating here after 8 PM because the kitchen will rush you if you have a 9 PM reservation.  The server told us they do this and sure enough it happened!  Our courses were stacking up on the table before we had a chance to sample them...    I guess they want to go home...  lol
author: Brent V.

description:
Second visit after a year. Seems like they have changed their owners but they emphasized they retained all staff. Oh well ,all I know and care is the food did not retain their qualities :(

We really like the atmosphere especially the area in the back. They used to have an outdoor tent but now they completely insulated the area. Works with me. I don't mind. 

So we went ahead with the 3-course fixed menu of the day. Somewhat around $30/ person. They ran out of what they had on the 3-course menu for appetizers. So we got to order the a-la-carte appetizers for no additional price. We had the tuna carpaccio, exactly what we ordered a year ago. It was as good as it used to be. We also ordered the yellowfin tuna. Raw yellowfin tuna to be eaten with toast. Pretty good for the appetizers. 

For entrees, we had a risotto and the angus flat iron steak. These are just so so...... I would even say the risotto was.... ew.

Desserts were hooorible! We had the grapefruit granite and semifreddo all amaretto. Absolutely no plating and/or presentation. Tasted very weird as well. The quality of the desserts totally cheapened the place. Very disappointed.  

Oh, we also ordered drinks: a Mojito and some red wine. Red wine is fine bc obviously its what you chose off the wine list. The Mojito was disappointing.....  Weird glass size for that type of drink, but that's fine. It tasted so bad that I barely drank any.....

In conclusion, the $30 3-course is a good deal. Absolutely great atmosphere for friends gathering, dates, whatsoever. Very nice staff.  But, considering the quality of the food........ there are really many other options out there, unfortunately.
author: RB B.

description:
First of, I found parking in the Marina on a Friday night right around the corner of Isa. Win!

I visited with a small group of friends. I had made reservations through Yelp and Open Table for 830p. We got there a little bit early and got seated right at 830p. So far, so good. Win! Win!

Food and experience=Win! Win! Win!

The restaurant is beautifully decorated. We got seated in the back area that was tent-like. 

I get nervous now trusting yelp reviews because of my last experience but the menu for Isa was so enticing, we had to go try it. I'm so glad we did.

The service was friendly but not intrusive. Perfect. I'm a big bread person and I loved that someone came to re-fill our bread basket so often.

To start, we ordered the lobster soup, which had pieces of shrimp in them. Very yummy. Not too fishy. Very flavorful. Good start to the meal. We had the crab salad and the lemon garlic sauteed prawns. They both were simple but tasty. We also tried the Potato Wrapped Sea Bass and a short-rib with mashed potato dish (one of their specials). Both were SO good. I definitely recommend the sea bass. And the meat dish was melt-in-your-mouth Good.

I would love to come back just so I could try other things on the menu. There were so many things, it was hard to pick!
author: Lisa G.

description: Classy place and classy waiters. Went here on a non busy day.  All i can say is that they serve small, excellent quality meals.  I would recommend this for special occasions.
author: Denise C.

description:
I ate here during the Dine About Town weeks and it was great. It was a fixed three course menu for $35. I had the scallop entree and it was awesome... And the dinner came with a free glass of wine! Service was nice also. 
   A great location to take a date. I will definitely be back in the future!
author: Montana G.

description:
Most definitely a fan.  This is almost like tapas styled French food.  Yummy!!

What we had-
Baked goat cheese - this was super yummy, it is like a baked version of caprese salad with super soft goat cheese and tomato paste.  i will be trying to make this at home because it is so yummy!
grade a foie gras - this is like a must here, it was cooked to perfection, enuff said
rack of lamb - I like mine medium and this was super tender and juicy, fan!
iron skirt steak - okay, this I could've done without, not bad, but not much above average

On portions, the menu suggest 2 dishes per person, I think prob 3 + dessert is just fine, for us, the skirt steak was definite way past full and stuffed in, hehe =)

enjoyyy
author: Li Y.

description: Came here for my besties birthday party and loved every moment.  We had the goat cheese plate, salmon sashimi, tuna tartare, truffle risotto and flank steak... D-LISH!  Ambiance was great so was our server.  Definitely recommend for a small group or intimate dinner with the significant other.
author: Fatemeh K.

description:
isa is a restaurant that somehow fits between casual and upscale. everything from the service (which felt a bit rushed and overly energetic and lacked refinement) to the food (advertised as family style for sharing) to the decor (dark woods and nice inside but more festive on the patio) to the dress code (most people were pretty casual) to the pricing (reasonable for the portion size and quality) makes this restaurant perfect for larger groups of family and/or friends rather than a romantic date.

the lobster broth was good but i personally would have liked it to be creamier and closer to a bisque that i'm more accustomed to.  tuna tartare was generous with the amount of tuna and the guacamole combination was delicious but the seaweed was unnecessarily distracting.  tried the short rib special which was moist and delicious.  the truffle risotto is as advertised with ample buttery taste and perfect consistency.  for dessert, the flourless chocolate cake was underwhelming and pretty much tasted like a hot and dry brownie.

all in all, worth a visit if you have a bunch of friends and crave properly buttery french-american cuisine without breaking the bank.
author: Sherman L.

description: Try to come in a BIG group. The bigger the better! The dishes are meant to be served family style. The more people there are, the more things everyone gets to try. Everytime I eat here, I just fall in love more and more. Most of their stuff here tastes really good! The paper wrapped butterfish was the only thing I couldn't get myself to like.
author: Tina S.

description:
I like the fact that the restaurant serves one dish at the time, so it is perfect for sharing and taking the time to fully enjoy the meal.  

bread is toasty and warm, and being refilled throughout.  So if you are a bread addict, you will sure get enough.

Calamari: chewy, fresh, and tasty.
Foie gras: Grade A, delicious with the peach and brioche, hella fat enough!
Sole: pan fried, tasted fresh, it would be better if it is simply steamed with the sauce.
Iron flat steak: very flavorful and perfectly cooked, the little potato was yummy.
Desserts: slightly below my expectation
Semifreddo all' amaretto, which is almond ice cream (very icy) with biscotti and Creamy mascarpone with with fresh fruit & huckleberry trifle, which is creamy with a lay of peach and cake, socked in vinegar, topped with dry blueberry and sauce.  

waiters were attentive.  However, our 3rd refilled bread never came back,  I figured i had enough so didn't ask for it again...
author: Bei K.

description:
This was one of the best meals I've had in quite a while. My friend and I shared a prix fixe meal ($28 for 3 courses) and another entree, and it was more than enough food. They even had pinotage (a South African wine), which I haven't been able to find anywhere so far in SF! I just got back from South Africa, and am hooked on pinotage, so this was an extra few brownie points for Isa. 

The heirloom tomato salad was delicious, but there were so many more exotic starters that I would recommend trying something else if you're adventurous. We shared the duck and the rigatoni for entrees; I'm not the biggest duck fan, but even I can say it was delicious. The rigatoni with truffles was the perfect combination of flavors, and the truffles were unbelievable! We finished with the aged goat cheese with honey and candied nuts, which was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

Aside from the food, the ambiance was cozy and romantic, and it was crowded, but not overly packed. We got a table as a walk-in on a Tuesday night, but make sure to go before 8ish because it started looking like a wait by then. The waiter wasn't friendly, but he wasn't rude - did his job and did it well, so works for me. Great place, great food. I'm surprised I haven't been all over Isa long ago!
author: Megan S.

description: I do not like to spend a lot of money for dinner in a restaurant but if you do not mind this is a great place where anything you order will be delicious. Service is good except for the water glasses but maybe that is due to the drought.
author: joe g.

description: It's a special date for my boyfriend and I. Really enjoyed the place, wonderful service, and absolutely delicious food! We had scallop and butter fish as entrée. Mussel as appetizer (steamed, so a little fishy) def come back soon!
author: Fanny Z.

description:
Tonight was the last night for the SF 2011 Restaurant Week. It was a perfect night:  starting from the exceptional SF weather, to the time ISA accepted our reservation, finding parking around the corner, having a very pleasant waiter named Dean waiting on us, a spectacular menu and choices, a fabulous patio setting, and finally the meal itself.

The waiter said the restaurant recommends sharing -- good! This way we get to taste more.

The foie gras was definitely the best ever. Succulent, perfectly cooked, amazing sides that enhanced its flavor. It was an OMG dish. My partner and I thought that if this is an indication of what to expect next, then we're in for a truly fabulous treat.

Dungeness crab salad with avocado, grapefruit, apple and tarragon. Very light dressing, wonderful mix, very generous serving of perfectly seasoned crab. 

We had two second courses, and it was a tie as to which one was the better one. 

The flat iron steak was perfectly cooked (medium rare). The special menu said the steak was served with moutarde verte and bordelaise sauce. Truly amazing flavors. I'm actually glad they sliced the steak so that it was easy to share. We were literally lapping up the sauce with every bite. So scrumptious.

The duck breast with what appeared to be currant sauce was exceptional. And yes, we lapped up that sauce, too.

For dessert, we had creme brulee with the crispiest caramelized sugar top. Really creamy, and not too sweet. Wonderful.

Easily one of the best dinners we've had without having to drive to Yountville. As a matter of fact, I totally agree with San Francisco Chronicle's review that this place should be as difficult to get into as the French Laundry. But I'm glad they don't.  We'll be back!

http://articles.sfgate.com/2000-10-22/entertainment/17664513_1_chez-nous-isa-diners
author: Pacita D.

description:
SUPER DELICIOUS PLACE.

I have to knock off one star because my gf and I were seated at the most "romantic" table in the restaurant, when in fact, it was the smallest table I've ever sat at. Our server tried to play it off by saying it was his favorite spot, but seriously, we sat at a table that barely fit two full size plates on it.

Anyways, the food was exceptional.

Mussels - steamed in a tasty, aromatic garlic sauce. If you're into shellfish, this is a must-try.

Foie Gras - BOMB. It comes with a cooked pear, and super soft, dense bread.

Flat Iron Steak - Good, but I'd try something else next time.

As a suggestion, if it's just you and a date, make reservations for 3, and then just say the third person didn't show up. Trust! You don't want to sit at the "romantic" table...
author: Patrick P.

description: My wife and I ordered the prawns as appetizer.  Seabass and Scallops as entree.   The food was okay, not very impressive.
author: Perry L.

description:
Isa, oh Isa.  You definitely stole my heart this past Thursday.  Haven't had a whole lot of French food in SF, but ISA definitely offers the best French cuisine I've had in the city!  The ambiance paired with the delectable dishes are AMAZING.  Parking is a headache, but remember that it's the marina/cow hollow. There's an intimate seating area inside for smaller parties of two and past the open kitchen is a larger "outdoor" but covered seating area with heated lamps for larger groups 3+.

Our servers were all very knowledgeable, friendly, and all kinds of diverse.  I really wasn't expecting that at a French restaurant but I was quite impressed.  Another great thing is we didn't know it until after we were leaving the restaurant, but the world-renowned chef was actually serving our dishes and clearing the table just like any other staff member!  

We ordered soooo much and it was all delicious.  
- Tomales Bay Oysters with spicy orange mignonette: I usually pass on oysters, but these were flavorful, not too fishy, and the mignonette was pretty insanely good
- Maine Lobster broth: rich and thin soup base from lobster with tiger prawns. sooooo good for soup on a slightly chilly evening
- Hudson Valley Grade A Foie Gras: gizzard lovers, you will love it!  This is the first time I've had Foie Gras and it was gamy, but good and extremely rich.  They give you a good sized duck liver too. That combined with the custard brioche (so buttery) made my heart stop for a second and I decided to go easy on the high cholesterol stuff.  Good but needs to be shared with others in small portions!
- Season Fish was tasty and cooked to perfection on top of vegetables. A hint of bell peppers and other vegetable flavor seeped into the fish, which we all enjoyed.
- Seared scallops were my favorite dish by far.

I don't remember everything else, but the wine list was extensive, food was perfection, and the service is terrific!  I must save up before returning here.
author: Dee H.

description:
It was our first date night since having our baby boy over 6 months ago.  My husband asked me to choose a nice restaurant so I decided on Isa because I remember the food was delicious years ago when Luke Sung, the original owner used to own the restaurant.  So the day comes and I'm excited to taste the yummy food again.  We ordered the lobster broth, dungeness crab salad, scallops, wild prawns, potato wrapped seabass and roasted rack of lamb.    The lobster broth was so salty that I only had a couple sips. The dungeness crab salad was ok since the ingredients tasted fresh but there was barely any dressing. My husband said the scallops were still raw in the middle.  The prawns were definitely not fresh and tasted mushy. The seabass was way overcooked. My husband said the lamb was disgusting and chewy....to the point where he had to spit it out!  I want to add that my husband will eat just about anything, so for him to spit something out, that says a lot to me!! 

The worst part was.....this may be TMI but my tummy started to feel funny and I had to use the restroom before we were even done with the meal! We sure as hell didn't stay for dessert!! 

What a way to ruin our first date night.  I don't know who's in the kitchen "cooking" the food but they should look for new jobs cause they suck at it!

We will never patron this "restaurant" again.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
THE DRAW:
*Festive, tented outdoor patio and romantic interior offer two types of ambiance
*Happy hour before 7pm: $5 Soju cocktails or wine
*Decently affordable French food (Prix fix for $29, minimum of 2)
*Great service

SERVICE:
Dean, our server, gave us SO much context and background information for the restaurant, along with advice on how to eat each dish. He was passionate and amazingly friendly. The host was also very helpful, well spoken, and considerate, opening the door for us as we walked out. If only someone would have cleared away our dishes more quickly, the service would have been perfect.

THE FOOD: $100.36 (including 2 cocktails)
* Foie gras and wine pairing - 4/5 - The foie and custard brioche were amazing, even though the huckleberries slightly overpowered the foie and the mango was hard to identify (We debated whether there was papaya mixed in). The wine pairing was an amazing, sweet and savory white.
* Garlic prawns - 1/5 - Very tasty garlic butter parsley combo, but there was a dark, short, curly hair (...) in our food and unidentifiable hard granules larger than sand that almost broke my teeth.
* Seared scallops - 5/5 - You wouldn't think cherry tomatoes, fava beans, and corn could be that tasty, but this was my favorite dish. Perhaps it was the truffle sauce.
*Grapefruit granite - 4/5 - A coarsely textured, tangy granite. Refreshing for your palette, but not as amazing as:
* Semifreddo all' amaretto - 5/5 - Dean described this dish as "almond gelato" but it is so much more than that! Amazingly fluffy and creamy, with soft cookie bits adding to the texture and flavor. Plus, almond cookies and mint as garnish. I was scraping the plate on this one.

TIPS:
*On a date? Isa is in the heart of the Marina. Take a walk under the romantic Palace of Fine Arts.
*Foie gras lives! Isa has a Foie Gras Fan Club mailing list based on the premise that there may be a loophole in the law banning Foie Gras (effective 7/1/12). The idea is that the ban is on foie gras sold and bought in CA, and they order theirs from NY, so they may be able to have some sort of foie gras event in the future. Stay tuned.
*Update: In light of the new Word of the Week in Time Magazine (7-30-12), I just had to say: Perhaps Isa will become a "Duckeasy"--A restaurant that clandestinely serves foie. Wouldn't that be neat?!


OVERALL:
Go, and go again. Just don't get the shrimp.
author: Fawn B.

description: Went there a year ago after much anticipation and was horribly disappointed.  The change in ownership/management was definitely reflected in the food.  How unfortunate.
author: Jeannie L.

description: AMAZING food...too bad I didn't have a better date :)
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
Dine about town Menu

first course:  Prince Edwards Mussels
Huge 20 pieces of Mussels with Garlic bread and tomato broth, 
better to share with a friend or two

second course: Halibut with artichokes,
a wise choice for me, with 20 mussels already down my stomach
i don't have any rooms for something heavy. or else i will pick flat iron
steak.

dessert: Vanilla creme bruee, not much special.

not bad, only paid $13 includes tips for my $34.95 Prix-fix meal, has a $25 popsugar coupon.
author: Thomas L.

description:
WHAT a pleasant surprise!!!  I wavered between 4 and 5 stars, and just went with a 5 since it was such a great experience.  Three of us for girls night out, wanting great food and somewhere quiet enough to chat and get caught up.  

- Food excellent.  
- Service excellent.  
- Timing perfect.  

Loved the waiter, he walked us through the menu, using fantastic adjectives like "sparkling, wonderful, delicious."  He was clearly passionate about this food!  He also providee clear advice around what the best way to order would be, how the food would timed, etc.  

- Grilled Calamari:  Fantastic.  Very flavorful and perfectly cooked.
- Grilled Goat Cheese:  Unbelievable.  Creamy, warm, explosion of flavor.
- Seared Scallops:  Great.  Fava beans were a great partner to the perfectly cooked and seasoned scallops. 
- Chicken and potatoes:  Basic but delish.  Whipped potatoes were excellent (and I am an EXPERT at mashed potatoes!!)

It's not my favorite neighborhood but is a good middle ground for me in Pacific and friends in the City and Marin.  Parking was actually not terrible on a Friday night on Lombard.  

Overall, I can't wait to go back with my man.
author: amy b.

description: Everything I tried was good. Flat iron steak, truffle risotto, and potato wrapped seabass. And the Semifreddo All' Amaretto was a delicious dessert as well.
author: Sam S.

description:
Came here with girlfriends during dine-about-town. 
They have a nice back area with Chrismas lights(extra point) and enough heating lamps that could actually keep me warm when I was eating (extra point). They were hosting a mini wedding banquet before our reservation, very cute!
The food was good. It's been a while but i still remember we had mussels and their duck dish. I would love to go back and try their Foie Gras! 
Another restuarnt I would love to go back =) Success!
author: angeline s.

description:
This place actually wasn't that memorable, but wasn't bad either. I just didn't walk away thinking it was the best meal I've ever had. I got the steak. It was tasty and well done but nothing unique.

The ambiance is cute though!
author: Shirin M.

description: I took my boyfriend here last Saturday for his birthday and was so pleasantly surprised! We were sat in the back in kind of the "outdoor" area which is super charming especially on a date. Delicious food and excellent service! It was our favorite part of our trip!
author: Shell E.

description: Had a fantastic dinner at Isa.  We were seated in the back enclosed patio, which would make a good date spot with the dim lighting and fresh air.  Went through several dishes with my dining companions, with the standouts being the crab salad and Semifreddo all' amaretto for dessert.  I'd happily come back!
author: Jonathan D.

description: Had such a fantastic dinner here with a group of friends! We sat in the back patio room which was so charming. We ordered a bunch of plates to share, my favorites being the scallops and the pan roasted chicken (shockingly delicious... usually don't order chicken when I'm out to eat, but it was phenomenal) and the baked goat cheese. Already planning my next trip with my two best friends who will be visiting later this month.
author: J F.

description: So I'd like to add that the very next day, Sameera, from Isa called me back to see how I was personally doing. They also apologized for the bad timing of the food and to assure me that they only get the freshest produce. I definitely understand that, but sometimes there might have been a slip in quality somewhere along the way. They asked if there was anything that they could do for me and I said I didn't really expect anything, but they assured me that if and when I come to Isa to dine that they would take care of me. It was nice that they value the reputation of their restaurant to call customers and follow up and I thought that shows great quality of service. This is why I increased the rating of my review.
author: Kathy B.

description: I decided to go here for Dine About Town because of there menu. The host and server were both helpful and kind. I also liked the ambiance at Isa. I ordered the six oysters for the appetizers. The spicy orange mignonette was excellent with the oysters. I ordered the flat iron steak for the entree. Medium rare is the way to go. The meat was tender and juicy. I went with the creme brulee for dessert. Overall, I would recommend this place and would come back to try their regular menu.
author: Tim N.

description:
I came here try their menu for Dine About Town. I was disappointed that the items on the Dine About Town menu were the ONLY ones available for the night :( I wanted to try their rack of lamb but was told they didn't have it.

Out of all the Dine About Town menus listed, this restaurant was the most appealing from all of the varieties. French food combined with seafood = heaven.

Came with a group of 5 and were seated in the outdoor patio without even a request for it :) The ambiance of the back patio was really cute: had perfect lighting and additional lights to surround the area-- perfect to take a date to without being super duper fancy.

We ordered family style:
- Potato Leek Soup: Ehhh... took 2 sips of this and didn't want it anymore. But I guess I'm just not used to bland, watery soup.
- Salmon Carpaccio: This tasted funny and fishy to me for some reason...and I LOVE salmon. I wouldn't recommend getting this.
- Yellowfin Tuna: SO much better than the salmon. The spicy sauce and seasoning to this tartare-like dish was a perfect complimentary to the tuna itself. It's definitely something I'm going to be craving in the future.
- Steamed Mussels: this was delicious-- the mussels were super soft, juicy, and not chewy at all. They practically melted in my mouth within one bite.
-Spaghetti w/ truffle: this was pretty good, and was still good the next day. I've never had spaghetti with truffle before so this was new and tasty.
-Flat Iron Steak: was NOT cooked to perfection because we asked for rare and it came out a little over medium rare. The flavor of the steak was good, but I've definitely had better elsewhere.
-Duck breast: delicious and tender! medium rare came out to be perfect.

Overall, 4 stars for cute ambiance, decent pricing, and certain outstanding menu items-- I would definitely come back for the yellowfin tuna and to try the rack of lamb!
author: Kim D.

description:
At times, gathering a group of friends for dinner is like panning for gold. You take a large scoop of them, and depending on work schedules and obligations they begin to sift out. However, what you're left with is pure gold.

Last night our considerably downsized group visited Isa for Dine About Town, and enjoyed the intricacies of a well thought out menu, some heavy pours, and as always, colorful conversation.

Isa is a gorgeous space with a sleek, modern front, and a wonderland for a back patio. Seated in the back, we immediately forgot that the sky was wet, and felt transported to a warm spring night on a vineyard.

Our server was fantastic. He was so giddy, and jovial, that it sounded like his voice was balancing on a medicine ball. His thoughts just couldn't keep up with his mouth.

One of the main reasons I chose Isa for DAT, was the amount of options they presented for each course. Many restaurants have a fixed 3 course for DAT, but Isa really gave you the freedom to choose.

Started with the Steamed Prince Edward mussels in a garlic white wine broth. The mussels held enough texture to keep the sea, but melted in the garlic broth. A heavy portion, the mountain of black shells were a delight.

Moving on, the Petrale sole in lemon butter was gentle and comforting. Surrounded with soft baby greens and topped with diced tomatoes and peppers, the dish was a concoction of simple magic.

Ending it all, I dived into a generous slab of Bucherondin de chevre drizzled with star anise honey and walnuts. Succulent, rich, it was the perfect note to sum up the meal.

Isa is a wonderful combination of soothing ambiance, a daringly rich menu, and a staff that fire lights the room. 

Chef Luke has something great here, and it'd be a shame to miss it.
author: Mike K.

description:
their appetizers are pretty good :D
worth to try!!
author: Liang C.

description:
U know...I just realized that I am not a Fine Dining type of girl. Now don't get me wrong..I like it but not enough to go out and pay for it myself even if its like once in a blue moon type of thing. My definition of Fine Dining is "$$$ + Little food". I kid u not...dollar signs and pictures of small portion of food literally pops up in my brain! hahhahhahha :) 

So for me to like ISA must mean that I did not pay for it or it was really really good food that deserve 4 stars! well lucky me it was both of those things! The two times that I ate at ISA I did not pay and the food was always very good. The first time I went there I was on a date and my date ate less than me (not a good sign). We shared a salad, risotto, duck breast and creme brulee. The portions were small for me but apparently my date is full already (darn it!) I guess we're not getting anymore food :( The second time I went there, I only remembered eating spicy tuna crudo, the scallop and flourless chocolate cake. It was all very yummy but once again I go home feeling hungry. 

Overall, I love the atmosphere of this place. I liked the fact that they have a back patio that is very cozy and romantic :) If you are prepared to spend a good amount of money for the "many" food that you're gonna eat then this place is for you. hahhahha...well if you eat anywhere like me then you will def spend ALOT more money regardless! maybe I can score another date to eat here for free...just kidding! I'm not that mean...LOL! u would love the food here so try it out folks...u won't regret it :)
author: Rika K.

description:
Mmmmmm! I haven't had French food in awhile and after the wait at the restaurant we had intended on going to was too long, we went to Isa instead.  I'm glad we did

Order:
Asparagus soup for 2 - so light and delicious!  Not overwhelmingly asparagus-y, and the lemon-olive oil adds a great depth of flavor

Risotto - I f-ing love risotto, especially on cold gray evening like the night we went.  Lots of mushrooms and flavor, though it was a bit more oily than I would have liked

Duck breast - Yum!!  I love duck and this dish confirmed again why I love duck.  The huckleberry sauce was subtle and matched with the duck perfectly without overwhelming it.  The accompanying salad w/ goat cheese and beets made me actually like beets.  

The bread basket is also fantastic!  The crust is nice and crusty, and then reveals a delicious soft inside.  I ate too many pieces but it was perfect for soaking up the remaining bit of asparagus soup and some of the huckleberry sauce.  I think it's not "proper etiquette" to do so, but we sat in the corner so nobody saw =)

Service was attentive but not overly so, which I liked. I think Isa would be a great date place or dinner place to catch up with friends.  I'd definitely come back.
author: Naoko M.

description:
Pros - Great Ambiance and drinks are decent.
Cons - Slow service and food is very salty. Being a french restaurant one would expect less oily food or atleast good oils. Nope! not this restaurant. If you want a good dining experience, go to Bistro Aix on the same street. You'll be treated well!
author: Nupur B.

description:
Monday, 7:30PM. 

Our host was friendly and seated our group promptly. We're already off to a great start.

After talking to a staff member, Isa was named after the owner's first daughter, Isabel. I thought that was interesting and cool, especially since I spent 5-10 minutes trying to figure out what the heck "Isa" meant in French. Go straight to the source next time!

Anyway, they were able to accommodate our group of 8. This doesn't sound unreasonable but they get props for this because the restaurant is clearly made for couples or groups of 6 and lower. 

Grub [5 stars]:
*Family style dishes, we were encouraged to share all our plates and we did
*As described by our waiter, "Isa's serves French cuisine with Asian inspirations"...a-men to that brotha, whatever it was, it was hella good!
*Sauces hit the palette nice, meats were succulent, and the combination of flavors made me yearn for more!
*Free bread was nice and toasty...
*Desserts charmed those even without sweet teeth...SO GOOD!

Service [4.5 stars]:
*Our waiter, Dean, was the man! He was responsive, knew all the answers to our questions (including stuff not related to the food but stuff about the establishment, where the food came from...) and continued the 'accommodating' theme.
*Other waiters/servers that worked on our table wasn't so responsive though - the food lagged, some of the entrees/dishes weren't timed properly so we could all eat
*They replenished our water/bread too sparingly, coulda' been quicker and more responsive
*I'm cutting them some slack here only because the food was ridiculously good, the place was crazy busy...though I'm penalizing them because of how much it cost (if it's that pricey, you better bring your 'A' game foo!)

Other [4 stars]:
*Decor was amorous: dimmed lighting, dark walls, and a combination of candlelit/electric lighting
*We were seated outdoors - temperature was comfortable despite having that SF-breeze outside of the 'tent'
*Chairs were uncomfortable - they're the 'woody' kinda with weaves in the center of the actual seat and in the back portion for support

Final Call:
Although our group of 8 forked over $400+ for food, it was well worth it because it was a celebration AND the food/service was amazing. Already saving up for my next trip here!

********************
Stuffed my face in:

*Maine lobster broth
     *Matter of taste: lobster soups have always had too much of the 'sea' flavor infused in the broth so I wasn't that much of a fan; if you're a fan of lobster though, you should try this

*Spicy tuna crudo
     -I actually don't like raw fish but this dish was ridiculously good
     +Tuna does not overwhelm the rest of the flavors; the seaweed and nori does a good job balancing the tuna
     +Avocado was interesting here because it served as a medium but didn't distract from the seaweed or tuna

*Dungeness crab salad
     +Crab is yummy and this appetizer delivered!
     +Meat was fresh and the fruits on the side were a nice touch
     +Dressing was not too oily or overwhelming

*Baked Laural Chenel goat cheese
     +Cheese connoisseurs will appreciate the bold flavor
     +Pine nuts were prepared just right, not too hard and chewy enough

*Simply sautèed Sea of Cortez gulf prawns 
     +ORGASMIC: prawns full of juice n' flavor (for someone who doesn't particularly enjoy garlic, this was f'ing good)
     *The potato looking thingies on the side were lemon peels =)
     +These prawns are so good, they rival those of Shen Hua's lemon peppered shrimp!

*Seared dayboat scallops
     ++This is how scallops should be prepared: grilled surface, tender/juicy meat...if it sounds mouth-watering, it's because IT IS!

*Pan roasted rocky Jr. range chicken
     +chicken was full of flavor
     +mash potatoes were creamy n' good (I usually like the chunkier kind)!

*Grilled creekstone natural flat iron steak
     * had my well-done though the chef recommends medium-rare
     *Whichever way, they were both delicious
     +The cognac-green peppercorn demi-glace tastes like the pesto sauce used in the Brazilian Café (in Berkeley) and is yummy!

*Vanilla bean crème brûlée
     +Crispy, candy-esque surface
     +Creamy, custard-y inside (WOW!)

*Flourless chocolate cake
     +Fluffy, really potent chocolate (not in a dark chocolate way but dayum, this ain't your run-o'-da-mill-Hershey's
     +Came with vanilla bean gelato - nice touch!
author: Chuck N.

description: Awesome place to have a nice dinner.  Prices are very reasonable.  Food is delicous!  Service is great and ambience is quite nice.  Been here quite a few times and every time is incredible.  Not going to pay michelin prices but the quality of the food is outstanding.  Highly recommend this place if you're looking for great food that isn't going to break your bank.
author: Steve B.

description: I loved the place and the food. I stayed in the patio, which I thought was really nice and relaxing. They had $5 wine and cocktails for happy hour. I had the 4 course dinner and I loved the soup, scallops and most especially the ahi tuna.
author: jessica r.

description:
This is more of a 3.5 stars kinda review. Came here for DAT 2011 with a party of 5 (*cue the Bodeans*).

Have to say, customer service was pretty good. My water glass and bread basket were always full and while I didn't feel like the waiter was super knowledgeable about the menu, he was at least present and trying (aka: A for effort).

Food was a little meh for me. Crab salad, Flank Steak and Flourless Chocolate. Standouts included the steak (cooked perfectly - so difficult to find a Medium steak nowadays) and the polenta. That being said - the crab was a little salty and the cake was good not great.

On a busy Sunday night during DAT, the tented space in the back is deafening. Like I couldn't hear the couple in front of me. Another annoying bit is that even though they warned us that dishes would come out a different times, one person received her entree *and ate it all* before we even received our entrees. I understand staggered cook times but really?

On the whole, I doubt I'll be back - less that it Isa was bad, more that it was meh in a city full of spectacular.
author: Kori S.

description: Really good food here and out waiter was so wonderful (both in personality and service)!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Shirley B.

description: I came here with a big party about 12 people. It took 45 minutes for my food to come. Literally. There was about 2-3 other people whos food took a long time to come also. But i was last. My food came 10 minutes after the last person finished eating. The server gave me a small glass of desert wine for free. Whoopie!
author: Edward S.

description: I have only dined at the bar, but with a great happy hour and delicious food, I remain a fan.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Had an early dinner with my hubby here last night and we loved it.  

They have happy hour 7days/wk before 7pm...   Most things on menu $5.  I had a couple of soju cocktails: mojito and lemon drops... yumm...  and hubby had a glass of red wine.

We started off with the
arugula salad - very good.  I need to remember to integrate arugula in my salad repertoire more.  It was accompanied with fennel, apples, and manadarin slices.    good light vinaigrette.

dungeness crab salad - yummm... generous on the crab.  Waiter told us they prepare the crab themselves.  very moist and full of flavor on top of avocado, and butter lettuces.  

grilled calamari - good change from fried.  but hubby thought it was going to be fried.  good flavors though.

hudson valley foie gras - divine.  I just had this very happy satisfied look on my face.  We paired it with this yummy sweetish wine.  It was a very generous portion and what perfection.

seafood paella - Very tasty...  I want to try to replicate when I get home.  I also thought all the shellfish was perfectly cooked... just right.  delish...

spaghetti - I wasn't sure about this, but loved it.  I've always had truffle in oil but not in the actual pasta...  very flavorful and tasty with the basil and shaved parmesan.  

We finished off with the grapefruit sorbet and the amaretto cakelike ice cream.   Hubby and I made sure to finishe the sorbet before the ice cream... 

Will definitely come back.   We loved the service... waitstaff were all very diligent, constantly changing our plates after each dish shared.   

We had the 3 course prix fixe and the additional appetizers and drinks all for about $120.  not bad for a birthday dinner.   

They even put a candle on my ice cream!!!  And my favorite waiter came and sang... accent and all.   WE LIKED!
author: Regi K.

description:
I had my 30th birthday dinner here a couple months ago. I spoke to the owner beforehand- he was very sweet and helped me put together a preset dinner menu. My reservation was for 8:30pm. My party even arrived early, however we were told that the previous party was running late so we were not seated until more than 30 mins after my reservation time- after 9pm!!  We were already on a tight schedule as we had somewhere else to go after dinner, so due to dinner starting so late, it also made us late to our second venue for the evening. I have never waited so long to be seated with a reservation, and I was honestly very shocked, esp being a party of 16 ppl! 

2nd setback of the evening- I was told that my corkage fee would be waived if I purchased equal bottles of wines from the restaurant (which I did), however when the bill came, I was still charged for corkage. Eventually they took it off after I mentioned it. 

Minus those 2 issues, the food was absolutely AMAZING and the service was great. I think everyone thoroughly enjoyed everything on the menu. 

The owners were very gracious and even sent a follow up email after my dinner. The food is definitely worth coming back for, however the fact that we had to wait so long and were not compensated for it makes me think twice.
author: Wendy H.

description: My husband & I had a delightful evening at Isa.  We sat in the back "tented" room, which had a lovely ambiance.  We were pleased with the three course meal--it was an excellent value.  The food selections were varied, and were the same size servings & selection as the regular menu.  The wait staff were attentive and personable.  When we return to San Francisco, we would definitely return!
author: Michele H.

description: As one of my personal favorites, Isa consistently pleases me with their excellent food and continuously considerate service. From the mushroom risotto to the semifreddo, I can't express my absolute pleasure in giving this restaurant a solid score.
author: Aaron G.

description:
We came here for my dads 63rd Birthday.  Be sure to request a table in their intimate back covered patio.   It's been awhile since I was last here, but it still lives up to being one of my favorite restaurants in the Marina.  I'd probably come more often if parking wasn't soo hard and the fact that I have to drive all the way across town to get here.  

The $29 three course menu has perfect sizing portions.  Both my father & husband agreed that they have one of the best mussel dishes in town.  No meal would be complete without adding the seared foie gras to my order

$5 mixed soju drinks & wine by the glass before 7PM.
author: Stacey L.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  I came here for a birthday dinner and did things right.  We got the Tomales Bay Oysters, Seared Scallops, Potato Wrapped Seabass, Truffle Risotto, and Sweetbreads.  

Oysters - came with an orange mignonette.   Talk about a great but unexpected combination.  Note to self - while the mignonette was awesome on the oysters, don't try dipping bread in it.  Totally tasted like Orange Soda!

Seared Scallops - would totally get them again.  Delicious and perfectly cooked.

Potato Wrapped Seabass - hands down favorite!  The potato slices were well seasoned and perfectly CRISPY even though they wrapped the moist and tender seabass.  

Truffle Risotto - good but not amazing.  I could pass on this next time.

Sweetbreads - to be honest, meh.  

Overall, I can't wait to come back to Isa, even if it's just for a plate of the seabass.  :P
author: Yeelo N.

description: Overall nice experience and the covered patio felt comfortable. Nice selection of International Wines, and Potato wrapped Sea Bass was delish. I'd go back again.
author: LL Cool G.

description:
We got in around 5:30 on a Sunday and just walked in.  Seated in the window, we were in the dark, romantic side of the restaurant.  I was told by our server that before 7:00, we could get any a glass of wine on the menu for $5.00!  After a glass of Zin,  I walked to the back and found a well lit tented in patio,  lovely, and filling up quickly.   What an absolute deal on the prefix menu.  Three beautifully prepared dishes for $29.95!  I began with the butter lettuce salad, pears, pecans, and Pt. Reyes blue cheese.  Delicious.  Next, filet of sole, artichokes, tomatoes, squash, and olives.  Terrific.  I ordered off the prefix for the semi  Freddo all'Amaretto , oh so good!!!

Hubby started with the calamari, served with beans and greens.  Tender and great. He then had the  flat iron steak, wonderfully prepared with potatoes, green beans, in a bordelaise sauce

I now know why this restaurant has such rave reviews!  Excellent!  Next time I'm making reservations for the patio room!
author: Rose J.

description:
OMG.. hella good! 

came here for girls night out.. and what a great choice! We came here with a couple bottles of wine because their bottles are on the expensive side.. so we just paid the corkage fee of $25 (not bad). We wanted to try everything so we decided to order different dishes so that we could share and try more. great idea! i remember everything tasting amazing.. but the dishes that stood out were the scallops, salmon appetizer,and the risotto.

service was also amazing.. we were fortunate to get an awesome server who was very energetic and fun. 

great location as well.. if youre planning on going to a couple bars after.. youll be in the middle of them all! 

i will come back to this amazing restaurant.. hopefully soon =)
author: michele l.

description:
The steamed mussels are to die for !!!!!!! it comes in the best white wine sauce ever, I can
just drink it. Everything else I can say is average, that you can order anywhere else, I got the
strip steak, nothing special, but still good.

On a side note, if you come here, DO NOT get the "romantic seat" we were seated here bc no
other seats were available, and basically you & your date will be sitting in a 2x4 cramped corner. booo
author: Evelyn S.

description:
Fancy dinners are awesome, especially if your being treated by friendly company.

Foie Gras- Tried it for the first time, I guess it was good for enlarged duck liver, but I don't think I would ever order it again. Just not my style of food.
Ironflat Steak- Pretty good
Rack of Lamb- this was amazingly good, the meat was very red and soft
Seabass- Like what everyone else said, very delicious
Heirloom Mushrooms- pretty good
goat cheese- very pungent and cheesy, good if you like it that way
Tuna dish- made with avocado, this was one of my favorite appetizers of the night
Vanilla ice cream gelato: pleasantly flavorful and good

Overall, a great place to eat and share food if you have the $$ to spend.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Every time I come here I feel like they outdo themselves. 

The first time we came we had the oysters with tobiko. Insane pairing, perfect contrast. Last night we had the foie gras with peaches -- again, perfect pairing, and they both just melted into each other. 

French and inventive, not in a snarky gastro way but in a heartwarming and delicious way. I don't usually venture out of the Mission for food, but now Nopa, Namu, and Isa are on my "cabworthy" list.
author: sha h.

description:
I'm actually kind of sad to have to say this, but I had dinner there last night for my best friend's birthday and we were all really saddened by the poor service and how it hindered our special night.

Our waiter seemed bothered doing his job.  When asking his help in selecting a bottle of wine, his response was "how much do you want to pay?"...well, that wasn't a thought for us, we wanted help selecting a nice wine as we'd asked.  Then when we got the wine, he slammed it down on our table.

He didn't bother explaining the restaurant style with the small plates to my friends and just seemed irritated all around.  Shortly after receiving our wine, we never saw him again.

I ordered the goat cheese in the pre-fix to start, but there was no bread, and no waiter.  Someone else came by later w the entrees, and he was very nice, but seemed like he had a lot going on.  I enjoyed his kindness but I still can't say the service was up to par.  

Finally, two of the dessert selections (and of course, the ones we wanted) they were out of.  The creme brulee was an incredible substitute, but for a Thursday night I don't understand how they could have run out of so many of the desserts.

I do like this restaurant quite a bit.  I think if they just worked these little kinks out everything would have been great.
author: Romea M.

description:
I love Isa. One of the few places anymore that you can get great classic French cuisine. Their food is outstanding, to the point where it's difficult to make a recommendation because it was all so good. If I had to pick one, it would be the foie gras (every other restaurant does it terrine style, but theirs is served hot). The wine list is great as well, and there are plenty of different varietals to pair with the food, or drink by itself.

The service that we had was also great. We were in a fairly large group of 8 people and the servers never missed a beat. The staff was also very knowledgeable about the menu and were able to make recommendations when we asked.

Lastly, the restaurant itself is gorgeous. Really nice lighting and design made it perfect for anything from a large group to a small romantic dinner.

I would definitely come here again.
author: Ben B.

description: Had a fantastic experience here for my birthday.  Our server, Domingo, was very attentive and had a fun personality making our experience even better.  The food was delicious - the yellowfin tuna tartar was to die for and so were the scallops.  The braised short rib was so tender it melted in your mouth.  Will definitely come back!
author: Gina M.

description:
EVERY dish we ordered was top notch - and for a group f 16 people, that's quite difficult to do. 

Each dish had it's own, perfect flavor.  Some of the more memorable ones included the sashimi dish (some of the freshest fish I've had), the steak and the duck (both of which was juicy, tender, and dropped off the bone the minute your knife touches the meat).

The staff was great at accommodating our large group and getting all the dishes out from the kitchen and onto our plates quickly and without a fuss.

However, the one caveat was the price - I think a good chunk of our check was to help pay for the rent.  Yes, I know this is San Francisco, and especially in this area, everything is just a little more expensive; it was just a bit more than I had expected. Aside from that, amazing!
author: Bernadette C.

description: Excellent Quality of food. Server was knowledgeable about every dish. Kitchen was accommodating to my request for expedited service so that I would have time to catch my flight. Good size portions. Recommendation for 2 is two small plates and 2 main plates. That will give you room for dessert. We had the lamb and scallops. Kind of wish they used sea scallops but the bay scallops were definitely cooked to perfection. Lamb was the same as well. Price point I think was great for the quality. Relatively intimate. Sunday night dinner seems like the place to be. We didn't drink alcohol that night but I think all in would be about $65 per person if you did.
author: Corey C.

description:
Strengths: The foie gras was good, but when have you had foie gras that wasn't good?  We needed a second serving of pound cake though and when we asked for it, the server seemed annoyed.

Weaknesses:  This restaurant is way to cramped and understaffed.  Many times we needed things that the bussers could not attend to and we had to wait and wave down our server.  I was okay with this since for the most part the staff was gracious.  However, at the end of our meal the server told us it was rude of US to wave at her.  HELLO??? It is rude for you to not be attentive when you charge such prices!  

Opportunities:  More servers and less bussers, or perhaps less RUDE servers.  More table space.

Threats:  I'd eat at Ace Wasabi across the street.  Food is good and at least I wouldn't be humiliated.

Total:  $225 for four people.  No tip.  Really.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Great place and great food.   I recommend sitting in the back (patio), if there is space.  The patio is heated and covered as you can see from the photos.

The staff is friendly.   If you are a fan of Malbec wines, the Keating they have on the list is amazing.
author: Aus B.

description: It's a very nice place to have a gourmet dinner, not the typical frozen fast food. It's healthy, very tasty and have a great service. Prices are ok. You have to visit this place!!
author: Hector A.

description:
If I were just rating the flourless chocolate cake with vanilla gelato, it'd be 5 stars.  The cake just melts in your mouth with every bite and is very similar to souffle texture versus traditional cake.  It has a perfect hint of sweetness and goes so well with the vanilla bean gelato.  Okay, I'm ready for to go back for a second round...yum!

The rest of the meal I'd rate 3.5 stars.  I was dining with 3 girlfriends so we were able to try pretty much everything on the DAT menu since they serve the dishes family style.  The most memorable for me would be the salmon carpaccio and the seared scallops which was cooked perfectly.  

Overall the food was a little too oily/buttery for my taste.  You know how you get a film of oil around your mouth after eating at a Chinese restaurant?  That was how I felt after we finished the entrees.  Still, the food was tasty and we finished everything but the duck which was a little gamey for us. 

Service was excellent and as other Yelpers have noted, street parking can be difficult.
author: Szu H.

description:
I found out about Isa through Dine About Town, and went with the bf to mark our one year on Friday. Of course calling ahead for reservations was a must because it was the first night of DAT so the place was a zoo.

It did take about 15mins for us to get seated, but afterward, everything was perfect. We had a nice table for two away from the entrance, so it wasn't so loud. We chose items from the fixed menu to share: potato and leek soup, mussels, flat iron steak, truffle & mushroom risotto, and grapefruit granite. (Wow, that's the first time I think I've ever been able to list of EVERY part of my meal!)

Anyway, the food was remarkable. The soup had good flavor but wasn't thick; the mussels were hands down the best I've ever had; the risotto with truffles was light but exotic (and I've never had truffles before so that was fun); the steak was tender; the grapefruit granite (which they describe as home-made sorbet) was the perfect ending. 

Seriously delicious food, and even though the place was beyond packed, I couldn't complain about the service.

Twas a very memorable anniversary indeed.
author: Emilia S.

description:
My friends gave up on coming to Isa's, until I came along and told them they were going here last weekend.  Why did they give up?  They spent almost an hour trying to find parking. 


Now it's my friends first time actually making it to an opentable reservation and it was also dine about town.

Food was delicious.  I'm sitting here thinking about it wishing I could go back for more.  The crab salad was refreshing, the scallop (w bacon) was good, but the best part was the Maple leaf farm duck breast with red cabbage, potato gallete & wild huckleberry sauce...my mouth is watering from thinking about it.

Parking: There's a few parking lots a block or two away, I took a taxi here, it was definitely a lot more convenient.

Service: Service was really good and attentive, apparently he liked everything on the menu, but recommended the crab salad as one of the must have items.  I do like it when there's good recommendations. 

This restaurant is now on my favorites list.
author: Omar L.

description:
4.5 stars.  

I came here tonight with Betty W. and another good friend for a thoughtful end-of-year dinner.  It's been a while since I've had a nice dinner in a nice place, and this was a great way to end the year.

A coupla initial notes:
+ There's a prix fixe menu, 2 or 3 courses for $24 or $28, but as our server recommends: food here is best enjoyed family-style.  He's right.  Tapas is the way to go.  
+ All drinks are $5 for Happy Hour, which is Mon - Thurs before 7pm.  We were lucky and ordered our drinks at 6:59pm.  PHEW!  
+ Parking is very difficult and annoying in the Marina.  Be prepared.
+ You can dress up or dress down at this place, which I like.  No need to bust out your finest suits and dresses, but a nice top/skirt combo or dress would be appropriate for ladies.  

The (very long) deets of the eats:
+ Bread: Delicious and, as other Yelpers have noted, endless!  I think I must've eaten 4 or 5 pieces.  It's crunchy and soft, just very good all-around bread.  4.5/5
+ Dungeness crab salad: A generous portion of crab, with avocado, various leafy greens, apple (or was it pear?).  Light, appetizing, a great starter.  Best part: I very much appreciated the generous amount of crab in the dish.  4.5/5
+ Maine lobster broth: VERY flavorful, each spoonful is packed full of seafood fragrance.  It's simply a broth without anything else in it, and it is strong and savory.  I really enjoyed it, although I would question getting it again because it's not very substantial.  If you like seafood flavor though, get this. 4/5
+ Foie gras: Damn, this was delicious.  Fatty, fragrant, HUGE piece, and the berry sauce and brioche were perfect complements. A highlight of our meal. 5/5
+ Veal sweetbreads: This was my favorite dish.  Also, whoever decided to call "various animal organs" sweetbreads deserves a prize; what a sneaky way to make animal parts sound appetizing.  And really, appetizing it was!  The sweetbreads (Am I saying it right? Just call it sweetbreads?) tasted like tender chicken, and on top of the gravy, mashed potatoes, and mushroom fricassee (fancy term for any stewed dish with meat and gravy), it was an amazing combination of ingredients, flavors, and textures.  Not to mention, the portion was very generous. Get it. 5/5
+ Duck breast: I loved the salad that came alongside this dish, which included bacon bits.  The duck, however, was mediocre.  It was cooked medium, though we asked for medium-rare, and maybe it was because we had this right after the amazing sweetbreads, but it was just alright.  I'd skip it next time. 3.5/5
+ Flourless chocolate cake with vanilla gelato: I am not a dessert person. I am not a chocolate person.  I did not particularly care for this item. My foodmates, who ARE dessert and chocolate people, also didn't think too highly of this dish, so I don't think it's just me. 3/5. 

I was worried that a tapas-style meal = not enough food, but their portions are decently-sized and, for some dishes, pretty big.  For the three of us, five dishes left us filled and satisfied, without being too stuffed.  Plus, I think the endless bread helped too.

Food also came quickly, and great timing with each new dish coming at a good rate after the one before.  Servers were just the right amount of attentive and helpful.

The food, overall, was very delicious and I really did enjoy every dish.  The final bill, for three drinks and five dishes and a dessert, came out to $112 after tax.  

Definitely a nicer and more expensive option for dinner, but worth it for a special occasion because the ambiance is cozy and nice (candles, dark lighting, etc.), service is fine, and most importantly, the food hits the spot.  A great meal to end the year.
author: Vivian C.

description:
UPDATE: I received a nice note from Sameera, who Yelp lists as the owner, apologizing for my experience and offering her assistance the next time I visit. I probably won't be back because I live 2,000 miles away, but if I were local I would take her up on it. I'm adding a star for the follow-up and because the stomach really liked Isa, even if the back and eardrums didn't.

-------------

How does a Beard award winning chef create a restaurant where I did not enjoy my meal? Come to Isa and find out firsthand.

The food is very good, if not quite at a Michelin level. Most of our dishes featured exceedingly fresh seafood. I found a few of the dishes oversalted, though happily for a French-inspired menu they were not too buttery. Isa makes very good use of very fresh ingredients, even if no dish stuck out as exceptional or unique.

My problem was the seating in the patio area, which is a disaster. I could hardly hear the person next to me, and for others at the table I did not even know if they were speaking. This covered patio amplified every comment, laugh, clink, and baby's cry into a painful cacophony. The chairs are perhaps the least comfortable patio furniture I have ever sat in, and I had to stand up several times because the seat was so bad. At first a heat lamp was broiling me, then later another guest turned it down and I found myself chilly.

Isa bills itself as a shared-plates restaurant. For the uninitiated, "tapas" is Spanish for "food that is served to the table, but is inconvenient for sharing". Sure enough, Isa entrees are entrees and will mostly be destroyed by serving a portion to everyone at the table. To be fair, I've seen worse -- and this is more a personal peeve than a knock on Isa for following the tapas trend.

Bottom line: Eat in the restaurant and have a four- or five-star experience. Eat outside and take your chances. And I suggest you share appetizers only, and choose your own entree.
author: Stephen F.

description:
A meal WORTH the gym trip!
 
Heirloom Tomatoes with feta cheese, arugula, basil & balsamic
 
Maine lobster broth with tiger prawns, tomato, celery & tarragon

Hudson valley grade A foie gras with peaches & brioche.

Potato wrapped Seabass with capers, fresno peppers, parsley, tomato confit, brown butter & lemon juice.

Dessert if you dare.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Came to Isa again with my parents before the holidays... another awesome meal. We all shared small plates but everything was delicious.

Especially liked the truffled spaghetti. It was one of the best spaghetti's I've ever had! Tomato and hints of truffles throughout. Also a huge fan of the scallops, foie gras and goat cheese, basil, tomato dish served bubbling.

Love this little taste of France right in the Marina. On a nice night the patio is wonderful, they turn the heaters on.
author: Sarah A.

description: Amazing everything. Cute garden area. Best chicken we've ever had in our lives. Literally. Salmon and lamb was delicious too. Could have skipped the shrimp but it was still delicious, just not as amazing as everything else. Staff was super friendly and helpful as well. Also, food came out perfectly timed from the kitchen. The almond gelato was a great end to a great meal. Highly recommended!
author: Michael M.

description:
Happy hour until 7pm everyday? No wonder why our reservations were at 5:15pm!  I got the "Number Seven" drink, which doesn't convey at all what it really is.  It's a soju cocktail with blackberries, ginger and some lemon.  I can't tell you how much I like drinks that have fresh ingredients.  It's like an alcoholic dessert more than a beverage.

Happy Hour kept us pretty busy as we waited for laggards of the birthday group and the extra amount of time it takes to prepare food for a party of 16.  Honestly, I don't think it took that long for the food. It's either that, or the Number Seven talking.  But it was evident that this restaurant is pretty good for groups as there was another big party going on in the patio.  And even though it was cold this weekend and reported to snow, the covered patio was kept mostly warm with heat lamps.  

Crab salad - delicious!

Scallops - not a big fan of scallop dishes, since they usually come with veggies and a bit of scallops and it was certainly the case here. 

Paella - delicious!

Truffle Risotto - pretty good.

Mushrooms appetizer - it was a plate full of mushrooms that somehow got passed to me.  They were delicious!

Foie gras - My favorite of the night.  

Flat iron steak - not a fan, but the side of polenta was pretty good.

Calamari - not a fan.



This will probably be my dinner next time: Three orders foie gras + paella + crab salad.
author: Erica D.

description:
I am not from this area but ate there based on reviews.  It is a very small place and I am glad we made reservations even though it was a Thursday night because there was a wait.  

The description says it is a seafood restaurant, but they didn't have very many seafood items.  They served the food at different times as it was finished instead of all at once and I did not like this.  I felt like I was snacking through the entire dinner instead of eating a meal.  

The food was presented very well and was very good.  The portions were small but filling.  I would recommend this place if you aren't looking for a big meal, but just want to sit around and talk to friends while you eat.
author: Doug V.

description:
I can't say enough good things about this place, or about Sachio.He is a truly masterful sushi chef. His creations are absolute perfection. It's some of the best sushi and sashimi i have ever had.

As for other items on the menu, they're pretty tasty too!
I had the parchment wrapped butterfish, and was totally wowed. It was moist and flavorful. The mussels were also very good.

They have a prix fixe menu that's great deal, and is always available.
I haven't had dessert either time I was here. I was too full of fish!

It's a cute little spot, and they manage to keep the back dining area warm. The first time i was seated there, i was concerned it might be a problem.Luckily it wasn't.

I'll definitely be back again before Sachio's time there is over. As well as many more times in the future.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Update: A manager sent me an email that was polite, but they did confirm that large parties will take three hours.

They offered this as an explanation for how long it took to eat there. I personally feel three hours is verging on unreasonable, but they informed me this is normal for them.

Take from this what you will, but larger parties be informed you are looking at three hours.
author: Natalie J.

description:
I went here last night for a friend's birthday. She had been raving about Isa so we of course had to go. We ordered a ton of food and used the Village Vines discount so it saved us a lot. Between the four of us we got the salmon carpaccio (AMAZING), the butter lettuce salad (good), the scallops (the best part of the meal in my opinion), the calamari (don't eat it, but my friends said it was great), and the steak (good, but doesn't compare to the scallops). 

The best part to me, however, was our server. He was good spirited even with 4 ravenous girls. He even gave the birthday girl a free glass of wine and a dessert.! That made it really special and was above and beyond.

I will definitely come back, especially as it is so close to me!
author: Emily K.

description:
it has taken me over a decade to finally walk in the door and plop my butt into a chair. so glad I did.  each dish was perfectly cooked, in particular, the sweetbreads were so buttery delicious,that I am STILL drooly. wine list is short but sweet. service attentive but not obnoxious, and atmosphere is super romantic. if you snag a table off to the side, that is. 

warning: these 'small dishes' are not very small, so while at first glance the prices seem kinda high, in reality they're practically giving food away as only the truly starving will be able to manage more than 2 dishes.
author: Sasha R.

description:
I love eating small plates and this was the perfect spot for French tapas!  

We ordered to share amongst two people:
-Dungeness crab salad:  Fresh crab meat with a mixture of lettuce, avocado, apple, and grapefruit...Loved it!  So refreshing and healthy.
-Grilled local calamari:  One of the best dishes on the menu. If you love calamari, you need to try this one!
-Steamed mussels:  It wasn't extraordinary, but still good.  This is a big serving, so it's best to share this one.
-Seared scallops:  I love scallops, and this dish was so flavorful!  Another one of my favorites here.
-Flat iron steak:  This dish was the least of my likings.  Maybe I was too full when it came out, but I didn't like the meat too much.
-Vanilla Bean gelato with biscotti:  Great gelato, biscotti was really hard.

I also had the lemon drop (a bit too sweet, not enough tang) and the Greyhound cocktail (too strong for me).  I wish they had more variety of cocktails on the menu.

Overall, great food, great service, great company.  I would definitely come back to try the other dishes here.  I can't wait to be back in SF!
author: Vanessa V.

description: Came here to ring in the New Year last night and it was definitely a good choice by my fiancee.  $69 for four courses, I ordered the butter lettuce salad, salmon carpaccio, rack of lamb and gelato.  My fiancee ordered lobster broth, oysters, scallops and semifreddo.  They were all very good and portions were generous aside from the rack of lamb.  Service was good, attentative.  They provided party favors and free champagne which really completed the night.  Only downside is the courses didn't all come out as accordingly but who cares it's NYE.  We're definitely coming back to Isa.
author: Pierre L.

description: Great food, exceptional ambience and service (though slightly loud).
author: Alok P.

description:
*Warning before doing DAT here*  I highly recommend Isa but coming for DAT is not worth it unless you take advantage of their free wine.  They normally have a $30 prix fix menu on Sunday-Thursdays with pretty much all the same offered dishes.

I took off a star (sorry!) not because of anything terrible, but because I wasn't really wowed by any aspect during my most recent visit.  I still stand by my first review but I have 3 things to add:

1) Looks like they don't have a liquor license here.  They only have a very limited list of unimaginative soju cocktails.

2) They also insist that you share your food here.  Like REALLY REALLY insist.  I'm guessing this way there's less pressure to have your food come out all at the same time.

3) To add to my recommended dishes from my first review, the salmon carpaccio with the crostini was excellent.  The duck breast entree also gives you more duck than what most restaurants will serve.

The atmosphere is still great, and they seem really accommodating for larger groups.  I'd still recommend this for a nice birthday venue if you're planning to go out in the Marina afterwards, but buy cocktails somewhere else.
author: S L.

description:
Went here on a date after wine tasting and oh my god it was delicious! I was a bit put off by the prices but my date wasn't and he paid so once i was able to get passed that it was pretty incredible!

We had the baked goat cheese as an appetizer and it was oh so good! 

For dinner we split the duck and the scallops. Normally I don't like duck or scallops but I loved them from this place! It was sooo good!

The atmosphere was also very good. The servers and hostess were all really nice and it was just a great place. The only reason I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is that I really could never afford to go to a place like this on my own dollar.
author: Lauren V.

description: One of my friends friend dining with us recommended Isa and I have to say that it was a excellent recommendation.  Typically with all of the French food encounters I've had in the past I was led to believe I wasn't much of a fan.  But Isa proved me wrong!  Since this place is rated $$$ I expected teeny tiny dishes, but they were actually decently proportioned.  Not too little and not too much.  There was five of us girls dining and I would say the only complaint that I have is our waiter told us their recommendation is for each person to choose a appetizer and a main dish which we followed and was left with too much food.  Not that it's much of a complaint since they were all delicious. :)  I would recommend the crab salad, and squid as they were both really good appetizers.  Bon Appetite!
author: Brenda L.

description:
Isa's weekday prix fixe is a steal. The quality is high and it's great for sharing small plates. It's uber convenient as it's just a few blocks from my apartment so it's a good go-to. Love love eating on the back patio which is adorable.

Favorites that stick out on the menu here include the bouillabaisse and the flat iron steak.
author: Brianna H.

description:
Isa made Valentine's Day special with pink and champagne colored balloons attached to each chair. We sat in the adorable back patio and greeted by an equally adorable yet knowledgeable waiter who kept offering us alcohol even though we told him we don't drink.

"Are you sure you don't want to see the wine list???" he says, ending the question with a grin each time.

I know it's Valentine's Day and he probably thought he'd be doing us a favor by getting at least one of us tipsy enough to wanna leave the restaurant right after our Semifreddo and end the night with a bang -- if you know what I mean -- but coffee for me will be just fine, thanks. 

Overall, (in an Asian accent) Isa berry good restaurant! As much as I try to avoid hanging out in the Marina, Isa might be worth the trip back.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Isa is a warm, charming little place in the Marina. We went there the night after we went to Fifth Floor. Our tab @ Isa was half of what the tab @ Fifth Floor was, and we liked Isa so much more.

food = 4 stars
service = 4 stars
ambiance = 4 stars
location = 4 stars
price = 3 stars

We went to Isa as part of Dine About Town. So, the menu was abbreviated. That said, everything that we had was really good. We had the arugula salad, seared scallops, baked laura chenel goat cheese, truffle risotto, and the vanilla bean gelato and grapefruit granite for desert. All very good.

The hostess was very pleasant and charming. The wait staff was attentive. I had the impression that our waiter was forcing himself to exude some personality, LOL. But, he did what he could.

The restaurant is in a nice part of the neighborhood, half a block off of Chestnut. It'd be nice if it was further off of Lombard, but it was far enough away that traffic noise was a non-issue. We went on a Sunday evening and were able to find street parking within three blocks of the restaurant.

Isa was a great find for us. We'll definitely go back.
author: Steve R.

description:
By far the best wild mushroom risotto I've ever had. The covered back patio is perfect for a date all year, and the bar up front is a nice place after work to wind down with someone over a glass of wine. 

Back to the food- I think many of their items are overpriced for what you get. I didn't love the calamari, but like I said, I have a habit of trying wild mushroom risotto wherever they serve it and this one is amazing so it's good enough for me to keep coming back. Service was good, not a fan of walking by the open kitchen to get to the bathrooms. 

Then again... wild. mushroom. risotto.
author: Ashley T.

description:
We came for dine about town and ordered different dishes and shared. 

Good food, comes out extremely fast. almost too fast for our own good. when we asked if dessert can be halted for 10 min, they said, its already on its way, and literally 5 seconds later, he reaches around the counter and puts it in front of us.

Everything had good flavor to it. 
prawns were huge. duck had a fair amt of fat to give more flavor. crab salad was a ok size with decent amt of crab.

the dessert (amaretto) was a bit disappointing out of all the dishes. the flowerless chocolate cake was decent, but didn't have any gooey chocolate at the bottom.

2nd time i've been here, i would come again , but would pair down what i order.
author: Justin L.

description: I loved this place! Although each dish was small, they were delicious. The presentation was very beautiful. I really enjoyed the dinner.
author: Pooky C.

description: Possibly the best restaurant one can hope for.  All the 20-some dishes are executed to perfection.  The Seabass, Lamb, Crab Salad, Bread, Drinks, and even the Brussle Sprouts are to die for.  Trust me on this.  GO there.  I love it and I eat a lot.
author: Jordan S.

description:
This is a cute spot that has some nice wine and decent food. It stands up to the test of time in the Marina and to all the pretentious snobs opinions without becoming like that itself. 
The dishes are more fusion than a specific style and the atmosphere is very laid back. It is a nice place to unwind and they have some great happy hour and deals through out the week.
author: Natasha M.

description: What a great restaurant!  It was by far the best place we ate during our trip to Napa Valley and San Francisco.  The food was served tapas style and the food was fantastic.  Service was great as well!   There are so many restaurants available in the area but you will not go wrong with eating at Isa.
author: Joseph S.

description:
Love it when restaurants offer a prix fixe - I like to try a little bit of everything, and it usually is the best way to do it!

Came here on a whim, in search of happy hour specials.  The music and atmosphere are what drew eventually drew us in as the preference over other spots in the area.  Kind of a weird thing to note, but the acoustics seem to be really great here - at first I thought there was a live jazz group or something inside.

Wasn't at all impressed with the "back patio."  It was as much a patio as the garden center at Home Depot. Completely enclosed with heat lamps, it smelled weird, was kind of cheesily decorated, and was certainly not what we had in mind when the offered it.

We ordered one 2 course prix fixe and one 3 course.  The portions are so generous here I would actually recommend just doing 2 courses a piece!  We split everything: the calamari (delicious), and mussels (delicious), the yellowtail (delicious), the herb-stuffed chicken (delicious, says the bf), and topped it all off with the cookies (mmmmm delicious!).  Pair that with 2 happy hour cocktails at 5 bux a piece, and we were absolutely stuffed.

The bread was also outstanding.  I saw the long baguettes resting in a wire rack near the kitchen, which resulted in crusty, warm, super-scrumptious bread.

All in all, we had a great experience.  I'd recommend to others, and will likely be back ourselves.  Cheers!
author: Allison B.

description:
How can this place have 610 reviews and be completely empty?  Do people try this place once and move on to bigger and better things?  Maybe they just couldn't find it?  I didn't see it right away amidst all the scaffolding and loudly decorated windows of nearby eateries.  It really is  a shame.

My friend took me here for my birthday dinner.  It was 5:30 on a Monday night, so I wasn't surprised the place was completely empty.  Sadly, the place was just as empty when we left the restaurant around 7 pm.  Don't get me wrong, people pay good money for private dining, so I really shouldn't complain.

Isa is a tiny French/Continental restaurant tucked away in the heart of Cow Hollow.  It's a narrow space with a few small tables and a patio in the back.  The decor accentuates the romantic aspect (read: cozy, simple and dark).
