Unfortunately, I didn't do the ordering so I didn't read the menu and I'm just speculating about the exact descriptions.  Proteins are accurate though, so order with confidence.

The only so-so dishes I'd say, were the two appetizers we had - a tuna tartar with crostini, some kind of sauteed shrimp, and the halibut.  I could have gone without.  We had plenty of food otherwise.  

I have to say that we came to surprise a friend that had just gotten engaged, and her fiance had arranged for us to  be seated by 9pm with two bottles of champagne and appetizers ready for their arrival.  Unfortunately, we got bumped to 9:15 because another party came in, and we weren't at the table by the time the couple arrived.  So... kind of an anti-climatic surprise.  Normally it wouldn't really be a big deal, but this was our friend's one chance to do it.  An engagement - Come on!  That just kind of sucked that it didn't work out like he planned.  However, they definitely were gracious about their mistake and comped one of our bottles of champagne and an appetizer.  Exactly what I would expect from a professional establishment.  A beautiful night.
author: Virginia L.

description: This place is super expensive.  Get ready to put down some hard cold cash.  If you can afford it, the food is good.  The scallop here is as good as it gets.  The lobster soup is meh.  The steak is also meh.  The fish is not bad not great.
author: Byron L.

description: Not a big fan of French food, but their short ribs are great, and I would go back for it !
author: Monica R B.

description: I love this place! Great if you like to share food. The back area is a hidden gem. Makes you feel like your outside in a garden with lights (but allows you to stay warm in SF's cold nights) :) The food is always delicious. You really can't go wrong...
author: Katherine L.

description: Good food, nice ambiance in the back, good service.  Nothing to complain about - as yelp's rating indicate...it's A-OK!!!!!!!!!!
author: Alina B.

description:
My friend Vicky already post a wonderful review with Isa.

What's the difference between 4 star and 5 star restaurant - great service!

I recommend Duck and Prawn (appetizer), truely amazing!

Our server was great, so was the host, and busboy!
author: Alice L.

description:
Pricey, but worth it. We did the dine about town prix-fixe.  If you ever find yourself in the Marina wanting a good meal try this: 

Crab salad - fresh crab, mango and avocado with vinaigrette on butter leaf lettuce 
Baked Goat cheese with pine nuts, basil and tomato 
Asparagus with Parmesan and fava beans 
Yellow Tail - cooked to perfection 
Flour less chocolate cake with a side of vanilla ice cream 
Creme brulee 

Solter brut rose

I ate a lot and it was all excellent!  

The service is outstanding!
author: Corey V.

description:
***Update***

Quick update, Isa actually contacted me and indicated that when 1,000 point OpenTable reservations are made, one of the webpages on OpenTable indicates that promotion "cannot be combined with any other promotion" (so happy hour being another promotion).

Owner was extremely friendly and cordial, so really appreciate that.

From our view, it was not very clearly indicated, and we obviously missed the notification. But we could have probably also asked upfront as well..

Bottom-line, great food, nice dining experience, and just a small mis-communication at the end (and we used Yelp as an outlet for our frustration, for better or worse).

Also, bottom-line #2, really nice owners for Isa!! (bumped up one star for this)

***end of update***

Similar to a post below, "everything was going really well until the end"...

We went to Isa on our Friday "date night" and the ambiance, food, parking (yes, we found a spot right away in the Marina!), was all great.

We especially enjoyed to Potato + Leek soup and entrees were very high quality as well (Sea Bass + Risotto).

So, overall, another great SF restaurant...EXCEPT...

We had booked through a 1,000 point open table reservation (so yes, we ate dinner at 5:30pm, we like to go out early).. We ordered a bunch of "happy hour" drinks, as many signs indicated happy hour is in effect... 

However, when the bill came, we were told we can not have the happy hour prices, since we booked through the special open table offer... We also heard the table next to us try and order happy hour drinks, but ran into other "exceptions"..

Anyways, the $$ difference was only a few bucks, but somehow left a poor "taste" in our mouths. (after such an excellent dinner!)

So, in effect, a 5 star rating drops to 3 stars for poor customer service.
author: Amit S.

description:
Like other Yelpers, I came here with several friends for DAT.  I wasn't WOW-ed by their food; I'd say that the salmon carpaccio and truffle risotto that I had from the DAT menu were good enough to give this place 3.5 stars.  What really ticked me off was the fact that they lost my reservation.  I had called 4 days in advance to change my reservation from 7 to 10 people and the hostess that I spoke to said, "Umm, yeah sure, that should be fine."  I should HAVE asked for the name of that hostess because sure enough, when someone else from Isa called me the night before to confirm, they apparently hadn't received an update to my RSVP and told me that they wouldn't be able to accomodate 10 people at 6:00 pm.  WTF???  Seriously?  You're gonna tell me this the day before, when all the other DAT restaurants are completely booked by this time???  Mind boggling.

I had to beg/convince the confirming hostess to fit us in somehow because I wasn't about to look for another restaurant at the last minute.  In the end, she had to push what was initially a 6:00 pm reservation to 5:30 pm, which is a wee bit early for a night out on the town.  So this debacle took away a half star.

I took away another half star because the foie gras was half good, half bad.  We got what looked like two pieces in our order: one was perfect and the other one was tough and tasted like . . . well, liver.  Bleck!

Luckily the company of our good friends made up for the dining disparities.  

Oh and Isa - PLEASE don't harass me like you harassed the other Yelpers who gave you negative reviews.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Hey Isa,

How's it going? I'm on an anniversary dinner with my girlfriend and afterward we are going to the Palace of Fine Arts to see Fleet Foxes so we are looking to have a pretty special night, cool? cool. 

The grilled flank stank and petrale sole were both fantastic. As starters the arugula salad was light and airy while the salmon tartar was great in its flavorful simplicity. 

What's for dessert? How about you serve our flourless chocolate cake to the wrong table. 

Not a problem, but can you follow it up with flippant apology and saying "what else can we do?" and "it will take 15 minutes to make another one" 

Hmm....Let's finish it off with a digestif of overcharging us for our wine. 

We were able to get the wine reduced to the actual listed price...the waiter and manager were remarkably aloof and unsympathetic. 

The waiter actually got into a pissing contest with my girlfriend after she noted she had waited tables for 5 years, he said, "Well, I've waited tables for seven," to which, my lady, one of the most considerate people I've ever met, was frustratingly forced to reply:

"Well, YOU SUCK!" 

FAIL ISA. EPIC FAIL.
author: Gabe b.

description: The food was good. However the waiter and the manager kept trying to get me to cancel our reservation so they didn't have to pay a commission to Opent Table. When you book at this restaurant with OT they do not allow you to order from the Happy Hour Menu or the Prefix. They put up 1000 pt tables then limit you on what you can order. After dinner the manager then checked to see if everything was ok and when we said no they tried to buy us a glass of wine. If they had just not started out with trying to make a buck off OT they would have gotten more $$. I would not recommend this restaurant because if they are having such hard times they should have a better attitude.
author: David N.

description:
Came here for Dine About Town on 1/28/12 with my boyfriend for a date in the city (: We both ordered different dishes and shared everything so that we could experience everything! We were seated in the covered patio in the back. There were heating lamps, but it was still a bit chilly, so I kept my coat on for most of the meal. Waiters promptly brought out the (slightly toasted!) bread and promptly replaced it as soon as it was empty.

First course: I had the Dungeness Crab Salad and it was SO good! All the flavors were well-balanced and fit together so well! My boyfriend got the Salmon Carpaccio. I had a bit of this, but I'm not a big fan of raw fish, so I didn't enjoy it quite as much. He loved how fresh it tasted though!

Second course: I had the Seared Scallops. This probably had to be my favorite dish of the night. The scallops were so delicious and tender and I wish there were more than 4 pieces! The potatoes and brussel sprouts that came with it were good too, and the sauce with the truffle oil was amazing. We were scooping up the sauce with the bread so that we could savor it more. My boyfriend got the duck breast, cooked to medium-rare. This was my first time having duck that wasn't prepared asian-style, but I wasn't disappointed! I never knew that duck could be so tender and work with these other flavors!

Third course: I got the Semifreddo all'Amaretto, which was basically like a frozen almond custard with cookie bits in it. DELICIOUS! My boyfriend got the Grapefruit Granite, which I personally did not like (but only because I don't like grapefruit). He's a huge fan of grapefruit though, so he totally loved it.

We each ordered a drink with our meal. Boyfriend got the Zinfandel to pair with the duck breast. I normally don't like the strong taste of red wine, but I had a sip and it was pretty good! Very smooth (: I ordered the Number Seven soju cocktail. Was good, and finished off the meal nicely.

Waiters were attentive and prompt! Overall, enjoyed my experience here and the overall ambiance was perfect! I'm excited to come back to try their full menu one day.
author: Sharlene C.

description: eaten here many times, but the last two visits have been awful. Food is excellent - but the good part of the experience stops there. Menu proudly says "family style, share plates,food comes out when it is cooked" What this means is that when your small table is filled with the small plates that you stupidly thought were the first course, after five minutes the waiter arrives with the large plates you stupidly thought were the main course. Even tho your small plates are still piled hi with food, the waiter wants to remove them to move you on. Send the large plates  back, but know that they will just be kept warm, congealing, until your wisely get rid of your small plates. And, the large plates will arrive literally in under 60 seconds after the waiters have snatched your finally empty small plates. This lovely approach removes any need for the kitchen and waiters to try to time courses. In well under an hour, you can be in and out with this approach - just don't imagine that you have dined.
author: Henry A.

description:
Seriously foie gras on the menu?
Almost left but was with business partners who had ordered drinks already.

Overall after the meal:
rude service partially cold dish & server inattentive
too bad they could of made up for foie gras on the menu but I'll never go back.
author: Ann F.

description:
Food 4 stars.

Get the Dungeness Crab Salad- its delicious.  The duck and risotto is also great.  

So why three stars? I think the waiter is a total spaz.  First of all, he kept going under our table to do things.  Was he looking up our skirts? We don't know.... we just thought that was creepy.

Service was also slow... it took us two hours to get out of there but we only ordered 1 appetizer and 2 entrees. We were also starving and food took an hour or so to come out.  Drinks took at least 15 minutes!  They also messed up our second order of drinks (we blame it on the waiter) and made our mojitos too sweet.

That said, it was delicious so if you have time and get a different waiter- its totally yum!
author: Sloane R.

description:
Went there with a big party (12 or so) and think that was the only thing wrong with the experience...smaller parties (2 to 4) would be awesome since the big group kinda takes away from the environment.

We were sat in the back covered patio which totally made me feel removed from the typical marina dining experience. 
Highlights were the Heirloom tomato salad (So good!!), Grilled local calamari, wild prawns (ok, others loved them), Seared Scallops (great dish), Flat iron steak and rack of lamb!

For sure I will be coming back! Great dining experience!
author: Kevin B.

description:
This restaurant can do no wrong. Everything that comes out of Isa's kitchen is spectacular. 

It's hard to say what my favorite dish is -- maybe the warm goat cheese or the scallops, or the fish, or the crab salad... yum. 

Just do yourself a favor and come eat here, you won't be disappointed. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but it's very much worth it and they have a prix fix menu M-Th that's actually pretty reasonable (I think it's something like $28 for three courses)
author: Megan B.

description: Awesome. Covered patio in the back had great ambiance. Their baked goat cheese was the best I've ever had. Potato wrapped seabass is a must. Our server was a little slow, but I figure it was just a slow night. I'd definitely go back.
author: Mark M.

description: the food deserves 5 starts, but the service 3. we asked for the dessert menu 3 times, But they gave us the note before the dessert.
author: Adina B.

description:
The food was excellent and the setting was a lot of fun.  Loved the prix fix menu and the large dining room in the back was really  lively.  

I would probably skip the salmon carpaccio; it was a euphemism for smoked salmon.
author: Jade S.

description:
better late than never..

i missed the last few dine about towns and haven't seen my friend in a long time and we wanted to catch up.. so what better way to do that than over dinner during dine about town.. killing two birds with one stone!

here's what we ordered
-dungeness crab salad.. it was good but a little too citrus-y for me
-sea of cortez wild prawns.. this was really yummy and wanted more!
-maple leaf duck breast.. was ok.. not much to say about it
-angus flat iron steak.. was ok too.. it was served with polenta and im not a polenta fan at all but this was so soft that i didnt mind a bite or two.. the end pieces of steak were a bit chewy though
-creme brulee-best ever bc the sugar was soo thick.. the thickest i've ever had.. love that crunch

ok so im a huge sweets person so when the decision is up to me to pick restaurants i pick places that have desserts i want to try.. i picked isa bc i wanted to try their flourless choc cake but when it came time to order dessert they ran out of it! imagine my disappoint.. the whole reason i had dinner here was to try it! =(

one thing i didnt expect was that the whole meal was served family style and each dish was brought out one at a time.. ate one app then brought the other out.. so on.. never had dinner that way before

isa has a 3 course prefix sun-thurs for $29.. i'd give this place another shot to try their other dishes and prefix.. just hope they dont run out of the choc cake when i do!
author: Raquel T.

description:
I have had some of the best food that I have eaten in San Francisco when I ate here recently as part of the Dine About Town promotion.  Although the restaurant is classified as a French restaurant, I found the seafood options to be utterly outstanding.  I came as one of a party of four and sampled a wide variety of options that they offered as part of the Dine About Town promotion.  We were seated in the back patio area which was nice and bright (I detest dim restaurants).  Noise was not a problem in the area.  I have eaten at over ten restaurants that have participated in the DAT event, and Isa offers the widest selection of choices.  Many restaurants give just two options for each of the appetizer, entree, and dessert options (and some don't even give you a choice!) but there were more than four choices for each of the categories, which was great for our group size.

Overall, the food was very flavorful, portions were generous, and simply delicious.  I really enjoyed the seared scallops, mussels, and dungeness crab salad.  The skirt steak was great as well and cooked to perfection at medium rare.  

The restaurant did fall short, in my opinion, with the duck in huckleberry sauce in that it was just too salty and I could not taste the huckleberries.  I am a huge duck fan, and was really looking forward to the dish, given the excellent quality of the food that we have been served thus far.  The beets on the side were wonderful and saved the dish, however.  

The desserts, too were very disappointing, but it could have been the selection that was offered the day.  The grapefruit granite was average at best, and the other desserts including the cheese offering just wasn't that tasty.

Service was good and friendly.  Because it was a busy night, the management kindly asked us if we could leave a little early, which was reasonable because we arrived a little late and they offered to compensate us with free wine at our next visit.  I look forward to coming back, and looking at their website, it looks like they routinely have a $28 pre-fixe menu.  

Overall, I had a spectacular dining experience, and if the desserts just had not fallen short, I would have given them a 5 * rating.
author: Bowdoin S.

description:
My fiancée took me to Isa last week for my birthday, what a treat!  From the wine to the food to the service, everything was excellent.  

Environment: We sat in the front room which seemed to be a bit quieter and more romantic than the back room (at least the night we were there).  It's also pretty dark with small lights throughout which added nicely to the romantic part.  The only downside is the proximity of the tables to each-other, they are pretty close. 

Wine: We started off the night with a nice bottle of the 2007 Humanitas Cabernet Franc.  While I love my wine, my palette is still immature (I hope it always stays that way, I enjoy most wines I have), but this wine was perfect for the night.  The wine list isn't that large and most bottles will run you about $45 or more.

Food: My fiancée and I did the Prix Fixe menu.  She got the steamed mussels and halibut, I got the calamari and flat-iron steak.  She seemed to really enjoy the mussels and the flat-iron steak was very good.  Additionally, the portions were pretty good sized. 

Service:  The service was excellent.  We pretty much had three different people serving us the whole time with bread, beverages, and food.  Our bread never ran out and our drinks were consistently poured throughout the night. 

Overall I was very happy with the night and would definitely go again!
author: Dustin P.

description:
yum yum yum! came here on a saturday night with a 530 PM savored.com reservation to get 30% off our bill, but we were 15 minutes late and they have a strict policy of being on time to honor the discount. they were nice about it and comp'd our dessert and drinks though, which was definitely a nice gesture!

we ordered: 
salmon carpaccio - light and flavorful, not too salty, and the bits of hard boiled egg on top sound like a strange combination but it goes really well!

tuna avocado tartare - hard to go wrong with fresh ingredients. very tasty but didn't stand out, at least compared with the other dishes

mussels - i don't eat shellfish but i'm more than happy to soak up the broth with some crusty bread. or even drink it up with a spoon, which i did. my friends said it was tasty and judging by the broth alone, this dish is a must order item! they give a generous portion too!

butterfish - special of the day, came wrapped in parchment paper and assortment of mushrooms. i just wish the portion was bigger

flat-iron steak - we ordered it medium rare and it was cooked to perfection - tender, flavorful, juicy. at $22, this is really good value. the dish came with two sides - fingerling potatoes and haricot vers/string beans, which was a good balance to the carnivore-heavy plate. the fingerling potatoes could have used more flavor though.

truffle risotto - i dont' normally like mushrooms, and even tho this dish had a lot of mushrooms in it, i still ate my fair share. i never pass up cheesy-carbo deliciousness, especially when it's cooked this well!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
We did the Dine Around Town - free glass of red wine! great deal

Really big variety.  All great.
App- we had the goat cheese which was a SUPER great spread on the bread.  the Crab salad was fresh but weak on taste

Meal - the flat iron steak was prepared so delicious, the potatoes it came with were great and the green beans were also killer.  the duck was good but not as great as the steak.  it came with bacon which helped :)

dessert - the creme brulee was perfect

great time and the back seating area is so wonderful.  best atmosphere is in the back
author: Lúcia C.

description:
still good after all these years. slight misses here and there but the experience still is a solid 4 stars. 
started with a grilled local calamari and pinto beans. good flavor and texture. the mussels in white wine and garlic were tasty too. the highlight of the evening was the bouillabaisse - a french fish and shellfish stew.
temperature texture and flavor all very nice. the broth took hours to simmer. pieces of local calamari, clams, mussels, and a piece of grilled bass came out in an iron pot. wow!
the disappointment of the evening was the flank steak. served colder than a steak should. obviously this plate was not heated nor was the plate served right after it was cooked. it must have sat waiting for the server to pick it up.
2 dishes for $24 = good prix fixe option.
add $4 and you have a dessert.
author: Jeff W.

description: It didnt blow me away but the service was awesome. I thought I made a reservation for Friday 830, but it turned out i did it for thursday 830. but when we got there the hostess lady was super duper nice about it and tried to accomodate us, and reminded us every 30 minutes that we waited that she did not forget about is. The food is just new american. it was ok but it wasnt like OMG I NEED TO GO BACK. id go back and try other stuff though. around 34 per person. we didnt eat that much. but it was a good amount for me.. i doont know if the guys were full or not
author: Cindy L.

description:
I haven't yelped much in SF because what's the point of adding another review to the 500 already?... unless it's AMAZING!!!!

Straight away the restaurant was right up our alley. We just moved from Washington DC where tapas got really trendy via Jose Andres, and the concept had migrated to a lot of Latino and Bistro-style restaurants... some of which were our favorites in DC.

But, Holy Toledo (speaking of virgin Yelp territory), the food was freaking awesome!

We ate:
crab salad
seafood risotto
scallops
yellowtail
duck
rack of lamb
flourless chocolate cake
vanilla bean creme brulee

It was all so darn tasty! Even little things were nice -- like the risotto was cooked just right... just that nice, slight crunch/texture to it, but moist and flavorful. And, the duck has this little layer of hash browns on the bottom which soaked up the juices and was the most amazing hash browns I've ever had. I have nothing bad to say about the food.

Our only error was eating the yellowtail and duck simultaneously... The duck was simply overpowered the fish and I think it wiped out the taste of the yellowtail completely... should have eated the fish first.
author: Derrick L.

description: Scallops are amazing. So yummy.  Everything was delicious. Can't wait to go back again.  The steak was cooked to perfection. The service was good.  Parking can be a pain but it's the Marina, to be expected.
author: Cia C.

description:
We had gone to Isa once before, and had a great experience.  Great food, great atmosphere, no issues.  But the last visit was SO bad, that I will never be returning to this restaurant again.  Here's the story:

We had a few friends in town for dinner, and he had heard about the restaurant so we decided to go.  He was very excited about the potato wrapped seabass all day, and so obviously ordered it for dinner.  After about 45 minutes, 3 of the 4 of us had received our meal, but he had not yet.  When he still did not have his dinner 20 minutes later, I finally waved down the waiter to ask about the status.  He went to check on it, returning saying "I'm very sorry, I thought I put the order in, but I apparently didn't."  This was obviously frustrating, but we simply asked that he put the order in now, and we would share the other entrees until his arrived.  He then tells us "it's TOO LATE, the kitchen won't take the order any longer."  After a long conversation about how ridiculous it was that a patron wasn't going to receive any dinner because of a mistake by the restaurant, I was able to get the manager over.  He continually offered me a bottle of champagne, which I continuously replied "no thank you, my friend would like to eat dinner, not drink it."  The manager was extremely rude, and refused to do anything about the situation.

Never have I been so amazed at the LACK of customer service and the major fact that my friend NEVER WAS SERVED HIS DINNER!  

The food may be good, but you actually have to receive it for this place to get any stars from me.
author: Danny K.

description:
It's French with a twist.
Don't be pissed.
It was amazing.
Enough to make me sing.

A touch of seaweed knocked me off my feet
Adding the perfect amount of sweet
To the Sushi-grade Tuna
I wish it had hit my palate soona
It laid seductively atop the bed of wasabi and avacado
Reminiscing, I only want mo'.

My favorite entree was the duck breast
It could be my last meal before you put me to rest
The tender meat and the sweet glaze.
Life were all but a haze.
Toss in a little savory bacon.
It could be the meal I want when I awaken.
author: Joe Z.

description:
Loved it!  Dining here was like dining at Tavern on the Green, but MUCH better because the food was impeccable, and duh - it's in San Francisco.

The eats:
- organic arugula salad
- dungeness crab salad
- steamed mussels
- crushed truffle risotto
- vanilla crème brulée

I went here with my sisters, one of them being preggo, and there was PLENTY of food to go around given that this is a "small plate" resto.  The ingredients were high quality, and ALL of our dishes were delicious.  And the vanilla crème brulée is one of the best I've ever had - crusty top, and still warm inside.  The service was friendly, and it's just really cute overall.  I would suggest this place for a romantic dinner or an intimate meal to catch up with people you love.  Isa very good!
author: Kira K.

description:
Isa captured my heart and my taste buds last night, and I definitely hope to go back! 

Isa has a dimly lit, romantic yet modern setting, so it's very good for romantic dates. Our waiter was the most adorable, friendly and gracious man, and we loved his attentive yet not overbearing service. The raw tuna set on avocado and herbs from the first prix fixe menu was OUTSTANDING. We ordered 4 dishes and took a lot of food home and couldn't even fit in dessert. (Definitely going back to try dessert). 

The wine we selected was excellent, as well, and even though we closed down the place, we were never rushed out or made to feel we were in the way. The large floor heaters kept us warm and cozy, which was appropriate for this romantic restaurant. 

For two people who ordered 4 plates, 2 glasses of wine but no dessert, our bill came out to $102 + $20 tip. Not cheap, but well worth it at Isa.
author: Larissa M.

description:
I came here twice in one week's time.... and both times I was happy... :) 

The first time I went.. we had the following: (I don't remember the exact names..)
Flat Iron Steak- cooked just right.. med. rare and tasty
Duck Breast- goood.... :P- I always love duck.
Rack of Lamb- delish.. but the eggplant side was a little to oily for me
Salmon Tartare- plain and boring to me...
Creme Brulee- YUM.. I LOVE the burnt sugar toppings and this one was SUPER thick..so it was sooOOoO good to me haha

The second time we went...
Day Boat Scallops- It looks better than it tastes (not that it tasted bad.. but my eyes deceived my tastebuds.. a little)
Lamb...again :)

my friend didn't like the 2 course with the fish.. I don't know what it was... nor did she like the butter lettuce dressing....

I'll come again.. but next time i'm gonna try some of the other stuff... if you dont eat a lot.. a Lg plate or two sm. plates is more than enough for one person.
author: Kristina L.

description:
The bottom line: Up there food, with down there prices (m-th). 24 entrée & appetizer. Service is nice, but not traditional.


Isa has a great ambiance, especially the outdoor patio which is heated, and it looks as if it opens up during hot days. The staff is very friendly, but they don't quite serve dishes the traditional way, which is to time things and make sure you're not overwhelmed. The other thing, not to be an a-hole, but I had to really focus in on what my waiter was saying. I know he can't help the accent, but the idea at that point would be to slow down then. None the less he gave us great service. 

As far as the food it was excellent except for my Foie Gras. They had this blueberry sauce and blueberries on top. There was pear balls and the traditional piece of toast. They offered to pair the course with a sweet, almost desert like wine. It paired well together, but the dish itself didn't work out. The blueberries were overpowering and reminded me of getting blueberry pancakes. If they had put a glaze of some sort and greens, pears were ok, toast was great. The foie gras itself was cooked to perfection though, and it was a nice big fat piece. The rest of the dishes were great ! I had the short ribs and I will be adding it to my list of "in search of the best short ribs".
author: Steven C.

description:
I just wrote a long review for another place so i'm gonna keep this short. 

LOVE Isa.  Love love love.  

Things you HAVE to order:  Mussels, Risotto, Seabass.  Things you don't have to order but also YUM, their bread.  Add butter, sprinkle a little salt...yumm.  I'm very sad they don't have foie gras anymore.  I even called them to see if they'll make foie gras if i bring in the foie gras..unfortunately they won't.  *sniff*

Service, waiters, owner, cooks...all super friendly.  Even my 1 year old kid got a lot of sweet attention there.
author: T Y.

description: The owner called me days later wanting to rectify the situation. Since I live in souther n ca and t s my son who lives in the bay area,  she was to get in touch with him and was " going to make it up to him."  Well, 11 months later, no one as heard from her again.  Reminds me of the first time we went , a bad taste in my mouth!
author: Andrea N.

description: Enjoyed their 4 course Valentine's Pre-Set Menu. Not one course disappointed. The oysters were fresh and yummy, (& I don't normally eat oysters!) Everything else was done as the chef envisioned, and the delivery on the plate was awesome. Was actually happy to be sat in what I considered one of the two best places in the restaurant to be sat. (they are both up front, the first is the window table, the other is the one closest to the kitchen which has a lot of room for taller people who need room) I would definitely go back!
author: Ben M.

description:
ISA 
Incredible 
Scrumptious 
Amazing 

Some of the best scallops Ive ever had! The chicken combined with mashed potatoes just melts in your mouth. I love the low alcohol proof vodka, makes it easy to drink cosmos on a school night. Ambiance is perfect. The backyard is secluded and romantic, with enough heat radiating from the lamps to keep you warm even during the winter. The restaurant was packed even on a Monday! I can't wait to come back and sample their prix fix menu. 

This is a great referral restaurant, I haven't heard one person dislike this place. It has a dish that can satisfy any taste.
author: Heather S.

description:
Had a great dinner here with a friend. Sat in the back and we shared the Asparagus Soup and Goat Cheese as well as the halibut and the flat iron steak.

Everything was delicious and affordable!
author: Rachel G.

description:
We came here for DAT, like most of the other people who have posted recently. When we got there, there was a lot of people because there were a couple big groups, so the staff was pretty busy and not available. When we finally got seated (our reservation was for 9pm and we got seated at 9:20, even though we arrived at 8:50), the server came fast and the food arrived quickly. Our server wasn't the friendliest person ever, but everyone else was very nice and accommodating, so overall the service was very good. 

We ordered the tuna and the salmon for our first course, both of which were very good. 

For our second course, we ordered the flat steak and the duck. The steak was a little salty as were the potatoes that came with it. The duck was absolutely amazing and was served on a bed of spinach. 

For dessert, we ordered the creme brulee and the vanilla gelato with espresso poured over the top. The creme brulee had a thick, hard layer of sugar, which I'm not a big fan of, because I prefer it thinner. The gelato with espresso tasted just as you'd expect it to, but I enjoyed it. 

Overall, it was a great experience and well worth the price for DAT
author: Briandrea S.

description:
I visited Isa last night with a friend for her birthday, I had been there a few times in the past, but she had not. She is not very adventurous when it comes to food, so I figured this would be a good place to start to helo her discover new things.

we sat at the coxy table for 2 in the front of the restuarant right by the window, it was quite fun, however it was quite warm, some AC would have been nice. The waiter seemed to be in his own little world, I ordered Ice T and half way through the glass, he comes and takes it saying it looked weak and had better Ice T, well when he brought it the new glass didnt look or taste any different. When I asked for a refill, I never got a refill, he just kept bringing me a glass of ice to add to it, wtf.

We ordered the following and shared all meals.
butter lettuce salad
lobster broth
jumbo prawns
Alaskan Halibut
Rocky Chicken
and
Flat iron steak
The food was a 5 star, and the service was somewhere between a 3 and 4 star, but I would go back again..
author: Andrew Y.

description: I used to love eating here.  However, after having a horrible experience, I won't go back.  Our waiter brought the wrong dish.  After telling him I ordered a different soup - not the one he brought me (and the whole table had heard me, as well), the guy actually DISAGREED with me and told me I had ordered the soup he brought me.  Unbelievable.  Rude, unprofessional, and yes you did bring me the wrong soup.  Ruined the whole dinner for me.  I will never go back again.
author: Michelle C.

description:
We love this place and have been many times. Infact, I threw a party for 10 there once and had an excellent time. They have an indoor space that has a lot of outdoor lighting which makes the atmosphere really charming. 

Food (share the small plates, so you can try more dishes):
1) Highly recommend: the lobster bisque - frothy, full of lobster flavor and nice chunky pieces of meat. 
2) Salmon tartare - freshens up your palate for all the other goods things to come
3) Organic roasted chicken
4) Roasted duck
5) Fois grois with sweet reduction sauce (with plump raisins)
6) Mushroom risotto - great technique, comes out perfect every time
author: Emily L.

description:
Classic french cuisine of family style entrees made to share.  I came here with a gf for a birthday dinner.  I was surprised to find that the head chef is Chinese and named the restaurant after his daughter Isabella.  Decor and food reminds me of Acote in Oakland another french cuisine restaurant with (family style dishes).

The restaurant looked small from the front room but our group of 10 people easily fit in the back patio area for dinner.  With the headcover and heated lamps the patio area was quite comfy.  The service was great and I would recommend this place again for large parties.

ON to the main event..

Drinks: Nice selection of wine and soju mixed drinks.  I tried the apple soju cocktail and it it was pleasing.. not quite like an apple martini but similar flavor.

Food:
1. Oysters on a half shell - served with arragon-shallot mignonette sauce (3 stars I prefer the ones at hog island oyster or slanted door)

2. Scallops-  with asparagus, potato purée & truffle jus de poulet (5 stars- perfectly seared and nice pairing of items to please the pallet) 

3. Sea of Cortez Prawns- with lemon, garlic & olive oil (3 stars- it's a good filler but a little pricey in my opinion for a bed of prawns)

4. Honey spiced local calamari- flageolet beans, wild arugula & lemon, and olives (4 stars- the beans and olives was a nice complement to the lemon marinated calamari.

5. Flat iron steak with potato dauphinoise & cognac-green peppercorn demi-glace (5 stars- we ordered medium rare but the steak came out pretty bloody which I didn't mind since the steak was perfectly seasoned and tender to taste.  I also enjoyed the green demi-glace pairing, reminded me of some of the flatiron steaks I've had in paris with a similiar sauce paring... some of the other people on our dinner table were a little grossed out by all the blood so they would order medium next go around.  I would ask for a steak knife if you intend to cut the slices further.

Dessert:
Vanilla bean crème brulée (5 stars- not to sweet and not to bland.  Just perfect!)

Total Damage to the Wallet: $46/person (food and drinks including service and donation for the bday girl.)
author: Cathy L.

description: I decided to visit Isa after reading the rave reviews on yelp. IT WAS AMAZING! The ambiance is understated and charming, the staff is friendly and efficient. Now the best part...the food is phenomenal! Go there now and order the Yellowfin tuna with sriracha, avocado and nori appetizer. I haven't had a dish like this since I left LA and we all know LA owns raw fish. Follow up with the Potato wrapped Sea Bass. When they say "Cal French" these two dishes really sum it up. I shared both dishes and followed up with a vanilla bean creme brulee and espresso. I don't think it's possible  to be disappointed if you chose to visit Isa. I will be back and I will definitely bring more people here to share in this delicious place!
author: AnnaMarie J.

description: We went back to ISA with a group of friends, and it was still amazing! Everyone in the group loved it. The owner came out and talked to us, and was very friendly. Food tasted so great and we had the chance to try more things on the menu. Our favorites were the yellow fin tuna tartare appetizer, potato-wrapped seabass, calamari and paella, and the duck breast.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Awesome place. Made a booking via open table, and we were 10 mins late. As we arrived, our table was still waiting for us nestled in a private little nook for 2 in the window which was quite cosy and private.  The food was amazing- the waiter recommended the Foie gras- it was my first time trying and will be back for me. SENSATIONAL!!! The duck, DIVINE! 

Cannot wait to go back to this little gem!
author: Mr F.

description: their food is excellent but they are in small portion. In a group of 4 & we ordered 1 prefixed menu(3 courses), 2 entrees & 1 additional appetizer. Their Loch Duart salmon carpaccio appetizer was delicious! Very flavorful & fresh salmon. The grilled calamari was not bad but I personally prefer the deep fried ones with light batter. Their potato wrapped sea bass was also great! the potato gives a nice crunch & flavor to the fish. The seared scallops was alright, had better scallops in other places, but the mashed potato that comes with it was delicious - right amount of butter without over powering then the corn sweetness brings you back from the butter taste. The seasonal fish-halibut was light & fresh. Make use of the bread (delicious french bread too) for big eaters! the service was great, our server keep refilling bread for us and explained everything well and clear.
author: Vikee L.

description: I haven't been here in a few years, but it's still great. An amazing Dine About Town menu that even includes a glass of wine Sunday through Thursday. Definitely go here before June 15th!!!!
author: m t.

description: Every 8 weeks I'm in San Francisco, and each time I eat dinner at Isa!!!  My mouth waters, just thinking about their food.  My very favorite is on the Prix Fix menu:  The free range chicken (rosemary under the skin) with mashed potatoes... and the butter lettuce salad with blue cheese, pears, and candied walnuts.  Try it... you will not be sorry.  What an enjoyable, delectable place to dine.  It's a must-try for anyone looking to have a totally delicious meal.  I enjoy eating in the front section... quite a classy ambience, but those interested in a heated patio option won't be disappointed in that choice either.  I'm looking forward to January 31, 2012... my next scheduled trip to the City!
author: G L.

description:
The food was excellent; the ambiance much warmer and casual than expected. I'm pretty intimidated by upscale places, but a friendly staff and some chatty groups nearby made it a very comfortable experience. I was slightly miffed that we were pushed into a strange side table, when a lot of the corner tables were open, and I have to dock a star for that. The restaurant is composed of two sections proper: there is a patio in the back, warmed by heat lamps and decorated with glowing string lights, as well as a front area with a classic San Francisco look.

We did the dine about town special, and got a total of 6 dishes: mussels, leek and potato soup, lobster bouillabaisse with petrale sole, grilled yellowtail, grapefruit granite, and semifreddo all' amaretto.

Clams were really savory and leek and potato soup and a nice twist to it. The yellowtail was well done, but I wasn't blown away by it like I expected to be. 

The lobster bouillabaisse really blew me away. There were little, crunchy slices of fresh bread on the side with just a little cheese; when dipped in the pernod, tomato, and pepper broth, they blended into something magical and indescribable. Savory? Aromatic? Ambrosial, even. The petrale sole fell apart in my mouth into delicious buttery chunks. I will not forget this dish.

The desserts were a nice change of taste: the grapefruit granite, icy and fruity, and the semifreddo all' amaretto, crunchy and sweet.

I'll definitely be back, but with more friends so we can try out many many dishes :)
author: Daniel C.

description:
This place is crazy delicious and the service has always been excellent.

I'd love to give it 5 stars but as a fan since they've opened, I can't because their menu rarely changes. The chef is talented, yes, but I just wish he'd innovate more frequently.
author: Girl B.

description:
The back patio at Isa is really amazing! It's completely enclosed but you still get the feeling of being exposed. They have heat lamps so it's a comfortable temperature. It's perfect for a group dinner as you can comfortably fit 6-8 people at one table.

My friends and I mainly ate family style and a few of us had entrees. Everything was very good! Some standout items were the calamari, mussels and foie gras. If you are looking for more of an entree rather than a small plate, try the flat iron steak. It's a healthy portion and cooked perfectly!!

Since it's mainly small plates the bill adds up quick. Expect to spend $50+ per person, more if you go heavy on the wine.

I really liked Isa and am not typically a fan of places in the Marina. The food is really good though so I'd like to go back. The service leaves a lot to be desired. The staff has serious attitude which can really ruin your dining experience. After reading the yelp reviews, I was prepared for it since this seems to be an ongoing characteristic of Isa. One of my friends entree came out after everyone else had finished their dinner and the server could have cared less. No apology, no offer to remove it from the bill or comp a dessert. Had the service not been so snotty, I would happily give 5 stars.
author: Kandace K.

description:
Kinda mixed feelings about this place. Went for the Dine About Town (DAT) last weekend. Excited to try french food, but didn't realize it was 'french-american' 

So despite that confusion on my part our party of 6 enjoyed our dinner in the covered patio area. It was kinda crowded with lots of tables squished in the patio. 

The only thing that stood out was the fois gras - duck liver. So supposedly the duck is forced fed with a tube stuck down its throat inorder to enlarge its liver. Inhumane? Yes. Tastes good? Absolutely, but super greasy! Please share it with 3-4 ppl at least, 1 -2 bites per person is enough. I tried it once in my life, and that is enough.

What we ordered for the DAT:
-The leek and potato soup was soooo watery! Bland bland bland.
-The flank steak with sliced potatoes; my brother said it was bland. He's a chef and went to culinary school. I thought it was ok, but just ok. I think its the best bang for your buck through for the DAT.
- The sole was pretty good, just underseasoned. A bit of salt would of helped.
- Bread is crispy and yummy with butter and table salt. 
- Salmon carpaccio appetizer is pretty good, pretty much like sashimi.
- chicken dish was sooo dry! 
- Truffle risotto was not to die for at all. It was nothing special. I would order the steak if I had to do it again. 

Our waiter was very informative..maybe too informative. Emphasized the 'greatness" of their food dishes and how everything should be ordered family style. 2 dishes per person to be shared. The dishes are good enough for one person , of course you want to have taste tests with all the dishes. 

One last thing: 5-7pm happy hour drinks $5 wine and liquor. The lemon drop is pretty good - i love my lemon drops!

Would I go again for DAT? No...
author: Mary M.

description: I and my guests had a great time. The goat cheese appetizer was the star of the show. We had to wait longer than expected to be seated and the seating arrangement was quite tight. Minus those missteps, this could have been a 5 star dining experience.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I came here twice. The first time I came here was to visit my friend in SF. She picked this place and heard it was really good. The place has indoor/ outdoor. We sat outside. The menu was new to me, so I didn't know what to pick. I had the Truffle risotto. It was very tasty. I loved it.

I recently went back again to have dinner and my boyfriend and his friends. It was their first time there. We all had the Prix Fix menu. It was a pretty good selection. We wanted to try various items so we different items for our 1st course. We had leek & potato soup, Grilled Honey Spiced Local Calamari, and Steamed Prince Edward island mussels. They were all very yummy and tasty. I really liked their calamari.

2nd course we had Pan roasted rocky Jr. Range chicken and Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak. I really liked the chicken. it was very different, but in a good way. We also finished two bottles of wine. It was a great combination of good food & wine.

Will definitely come again to try the other dishes.
author: Jenny L.

description: The clam and mussel appetizer was delicious. Using the bread to sop up the juices and sauce afterwards is the best way to finish that dish. The oyster appetizer was perfect! I thought the orange mignonette would be so strange with the oysters, but it was actually really good. The flank steak, duck breast and truffle risotto are all delicious entrees but my favorite was definitely the duck breast.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Isa was beyond my expectations.  Great French food without the usual French menu prices.  The wine list was diverse and reasonably priced too.  We got a bottle of the 2003 McKinlay Pinot Noir for $34, which is an amazing deal considering it costs $40 at a wine store (if you can find it).

I recommend: 

Simply sauteéd Sea of cortez wild prawns
Hudson valley grade A foie gras
Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak
author: Matt S.

description: I just tasted their mushroom risotto at Flovor of SFand their oysters with specialty sauce.  I love their mushroom risotto!!  Very flaborful and fine even at the event.  I'm sure they would taste even better at the restaurant.  I'm planning to check them out soon.
author: Gina W.

description:
I'm usually not into any kind of asian fusion cuisine, but this place really changed my mind. We had almost one of everything on the menu and every single thing was really really good. My favorite was the garlic shrimp, grilled skirt steak and truffle risotto. YUM!!

And extra points for having me and Eugy's favorite Pinot Noir - Domaine Serene, Yamhill Cuvee, Willamette Valley, Oregon, $66. Wonderful! 

Thanks to Omar and Lori for a lovely evening!!
author: Jen D.

description:
Happy Birthday RACHELLE! Thanks for choosing a fantastic restaurant.

Love the food, Love the service, Love the atmosphere. 

Share the yellow fin tuna, crab salad, duck, steak, short rib, and scallop.
author: K L.

description: I've been to this place three or more times.  I love the food!  I always order flat iron steak, which is so delicious!  Each time, I had a different experience about their service, from really great one to a little below average one.  This is the reason that one star is missing, but I will come back for their great food.  I will update my review later.
author: M Y.

description:
Oh Isa, you are so delicious! So why do you have to go and ruin that with the wait? 

We had reservations at 8:30pm and were throwing my friend's goodbye party for HBS at 10:00pm, and went here for dinner before (3 couples). To our dismay, not only was our table not ready on time, but they took over an hour to seat us! It was literally a joke - they gave us free wine but considering the circumstances... this put everyone on edge due to our tight time line. 

The manager/owner was incredibly sweet, and it was right after Union Street Fair... but COME ON, an hour plus? I think this was the first time that's ever happened to me. So we said we needed to be out of there by 10, and that totally didn't happen. However... the food was great. Almost good enough to distract us from the fact that we were running late for our own party, but not quite. 

I had: 
Dungeness Crab Salad - Large portion 
Roasted Rack of Lamb - AMAZING 

Notable items from my friend's meals: 
Great Oysters 
Seared Scallops 
Truffle Risotto - Would come back for this! 

And there I go... saying I'll come back despite the atrocious wait. So it must be pretty good. Just please... next time have our table ready when we've made a reservation! 

WAIT - 1 star 
FOOD - 4 stars
author: Emily H.

description: Great food, great ambience, great service.  Perfect! Next time, I will have the duck to myself and won't share with anyone.  The flourless cake is heaven.
author: Jen Z.

description: Great food, excellent service....I will definitely come back next time I'm in the city. The waiters were friendly, knowledgable, and everything came out quick. There wasn't a single dish that wasn't tasty. Sea Bass and risotto were my favorites. Dessert was also tasty. Sitting outside in the patio was quite lovely.
author: L.inda B.

description: I've been here twice. Once for an anniversary dinner and last night.  The dinner a year or so ago I remember being amazing.  Great food, wine, service, etc.  Last night we were seated and informed the menu was family style which I didn't remember.  We ordered (2 of us) the yellowfin tuna, prawns, and the potato wrapped seabass to share.  The tuna and seabass were amazing but next time, I'll order a salad and the seabass for myself since we both left hungry.  The waiter had a severe case of ADD but I'll forgive him since I'm in the same boat.  We ordered a martini and it tasted like water.  Well...I realized they only serve have beer and wine so the martini was made with soju which is does say on the menu but saw after the fact. Sad martini. I had one, two, three glasses of the Mohua, Sauvignon Blanc which was delish. I'll definitely be back.
author: Ms. Ashley A.

description: I absolutely love Isa. To be fair, the cuisine is more French American fusion, you won't find escargot or cassoulet. But what they do offer is a very reasonable special. For $30, you get an appetizer, entree and dessert. I had the mussels in white wine sauce, the flounder (my memory is a bit hazy), and a grapefruit granit to finish. My favorite part (other than the house bread) was the white wine mussels. The flavor was amazing! I like my seafood with extra wine and Isa made it perfectly. Afterwards I recommended this restaurant to a few different friends. I can't wait to go back.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
4 stars for the food. But I give an extra star for their honest & friendly staff!

7 of us had dinner on Saturday night and my boyfriend left an iphone at the restaurant. Somehow they were able to trace back to one of our friends who made the reservation (via opentable) and called my friend that they found a phone that probably belonged to us. My boyfriend even didn't know he left his phone behind until the restaurant called our friend! I was very surprised that they would go for the extra mile to return the phone - most of the place just waited for you to pick it up...

I love the family style - it allows us to taste all the delicious dishes. The spicy tuna, foie gras, and duck breasts are exceptional. The spicy tuna is not really spicy (just a kick to it); but it was a very refreshing starter. The foie gras is just, fabulous. Not only it's cooked properly, I was surprised by the serving size on the plate. =D 

Duck breasts is my best surprise - I just love every bite of from that plate! We also had other large plates, including the Bouillabaisse, rack of lamb, and beef short ribs (daily special). The Bouillabaisse was flavorful - the broth was perfect to dip the bread! We ordered 2 duck breasts and 2 rack of lamb (but with one cooked in medium and one in medium rare since one of our friend is pregnant). And they did it! The meat was cooked accordingly. The beef short ribs was no surprise (it's the typical beef short ribs raised in red wine). They tasted delicious but not enough to shock me :P

I had the lemon drop soju cocktail - it was pretty good!! The only thing I have to pick on is the sugar rim - it could have done better. However, the cocktail was yummy! 

The only disappointment is the dessert menu. The dessert menu served at Isa is simple and straightforward. I only wish to see more offerings though! 

I like how the restaurant has extended its dining room into a covered backyard. I feel like we are tucked away in the heart of a city. I'm sure I will visit there again!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Best restaurant we've tried in San Francisco since moving to the area.

Mussels & Salmon appetizers were great, and the Halibut was amazing.

Only thing better than the food was the service.

Just go.

(PS fixed price menu had a good selection, and was only $30 pp.)
author: Dan P.

description:
Came here for Dine About with my old roomies for catch up...

When I walked into the place it looked really SMALL but there is actually a heated patio area in the back

I saw the Dine About menu and was very sad because they didnt have the items that were listed on the website (such as the duck) which i was really looking forward to trying. 

My roommates and I each ordered a different appetizer and the portions were all actually REALLY big and definetely enough to share. The carpaccio was absolutely DELICIOUS but it was one of hte smaller appetizers. We also had the calamari which i thought tasted burnt in my opinion and mussels which were nothing really special.

I also go the steak and when it came out pre-sliced I thought SWEET less work. But it did not make up for the taste of it. The only thing I could taste the whole time was PEPPER. That steak was on pepper overload, I could definetely make better steak at home. My roommate also go the lobster broth which basically tasted like beans to me personally. 

The desserts were so so also, nothing to brag about also.

Overall I would say my experience here was okay, maybe if I had tried something not on the Dine About menu I would have more to go on about but its not a place I would die to go back to.
author: Annie L.

description: This place is amazing. The food is some of the best I've ever had. I had the flat iron steak and had the creme brulee. Highly recommended :)
author: Brian C.

description:
I had been wanting to go to Isa for so long now, and since they had a DAT menu a few friends and I decided to make it a date. From reading other reviews, I expected the plates to be really small and unfilling and was surprised to be pleaseantly stuffed by the time we finished our entrees. it's a good thing dessert was included in the meal because I otherwise would have passed, and it was so so delicious I'm happy I didn't. 

A few of the items we ordered that were delicious: 
- Salmon Carpaccio
- Baked chennel goat cheese
- the bouillabaisse 
- flat iron steak
- the Semifreddo 

The only downside is that we had multiple servers coming to our table, which I suppose isn't a bad thing but it was a little distracting. I guess i'm just used to having one server/table. 

Also, the back patio creates such a nice setting! Def. reccomend for a nice night out with the significant other or group of friends.
author: Natalie J.

description:
I came here for a friends birthday a bout 2 weeks ago and so well.......let me tell you about my experience here at Isa on a cold Saturday night.

I actually got there kind of late but was lucky enough to find a corner space on Lombard. I turned off my engine, opened my door, looked to my left........o yeah hot chicks. I smiled to them and they smiled back and off I went. I crossed the street and I was just around the corner from Isa when I saw a few friends standing outside just chatting. I walked up to to them and threw out my multiple affiliated gang signs informing them that I have arrived. Our reservations were supposed to be at 7:30 but we didn't get seated till 8ish which kind of sucked because I was hungry and I was pretty damn close to getting me a hot dog next door. But luckily, the hot dog place next door charged 8 bucks for a hot dog........I am NOT that hungry.............not for a hot dog that's going to cost me 8 bucks at least.

Our waiter was a pretty cool guy and he was really helpful with our orders and he kept bringing us bread which is awesome because I love bread+butter. The food took a while but it was well worth the wait because most of the plates we ordered were delicious. I ordered the goat cheese and the chicken but I also tried most of my friends stuff that they ordered. I didn't really remember what the hell i ate but all of the dishes tasted fantastic. I took a bite of the goat cheese I had ordered and........"wat the heck did i just ordered, pleh"! (Okay I should of mentioned that I have never eaten goat cheese before until tonight.) I saw the bread, then I saw the goat cheese and a light bulb popped into my head. 

"If Joey from Friends eat so much, how come he didn't get really fat"? 

That's not it. 

"Goat cheese and bread......awesome".

I spread the goat cheese into my bread, took a bite and it was amazing. The goat cheese just matched the bread perfectly and it was like heaven in my mouth. I then tried the goat cheese by itself and it tasted wonderful this time, much much better then last time. I am a fan of goat cheese now, woohoo. Goats, better watch out because I am after your chee..........wait, that doesn't sound right and I don't think goat cheese comes from the Goat itself, whatever. Next was the chicken and it was just pure awesomeness. The chicken was not dry at all and had a full and juicy flavor to it. The mash potatoes was also amazing and it was creamy and had a perfect blend of flavors.

Overall, this place is a wonderful place to dine at and I would come back here again. The price wasn't that bad either and it came out to $40 per person for so much food and so much FREAKING BREAD+BUTTER. I took 1 star away because of our reservations being delayed. I also wasn't too fond in sitting what looked like someone's backyard. You can see the fence and it looks like a wild forest is about to break through that fence and attack every customer in there.
author: Will C.

description:
Eh...wasn't too impressed with the food.  I did like the calamari though, and the quaint, outside back area was super cute.  I guess my problem with this place was the service, or lack thereof.  It pretty much messed up my thoughts on anything else.

I did have a nice time with my friends though, despite having to wait for our orders and drinks.
author: Jennifer H.

description: 3-course prixe fixe for $29. Order anything and it is amazing! Each dish left me speechless. Imagine that! We even ordered off the regular menu for the must have foie gras. Everything was amazingly yummy. Between 4 girls and glasses of wine, we shared 11 plates total. I fell in love with French cuisine when I met ISA! Love love love.. Cannot wait to be back!
author: Anne T.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.   I always get stuck ordering too many plates because everything looks and tastes so damn good.   The hamachi, scallops, potato leek soup are my favorites.   I usually avoid the big meaty plates here so I can order more small plates.   Six is plenty for two people to eat in a night. 

I want to say that this place will get you laid, or at least it has gotten me laid in the past, but last night it didn't.     I blame myself, not you Isa.
author: Beau G.

description:
i havent been back for 5 years and its as good as i remember,

got the fois gras excellent
scallops were ok
shrimp ok
steak was excellent
duck was good
everyone liked the gelato.

service is on top of there game

i would come back, good for dates...
author: DOM d.

description:
I find myself wishing I could write a separate review for the food, the service and the ambiance, but I can't, so I will have to explain myself.  

The service was good, more like 4 stars.  We had what was supposed to be a party of 7 turn into a party of 8 long after we had all sat down and they were more than happy to squeeze in another seat at the table.  I felt a little bad for the couple sitting at the table next to us, but they were too busy making out to even notice.  Our waiter was very attentive and did his best considering how busy it was.  We did have some lag time on a few drink/food orders, but overall we were happily served.  

The ambiance is 5 stars!  We sat out under the tent and it had a very warm and comfortable feeling.  Very romantic lighting, seems like a great date place :)

The food was the most unfortunate part; nothing really made me fall in love, it was all just ish.  Was it awful?  No.  But it wasn't great either.  For the price we paid I expected more.  We had a big group so we were fortunate to try quite a few dishes:

Tomales Bay Pt. Reyes Oysters (my favorite dish of the night)
Heirloom Tomato Salad
Dungeness Crab Salad
Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese
Steamed Prince Edward island mussels (I did NOT like this one bit)
Northern Halibuta la Plancha
Rigatoni
Truffle Risotto 
Rack of Lamb 
Angus Flat Iron Steak (was not impressed)

With all the other fantastic options in the city I highly doubt I will be going back, but at the same time there are far worse places so if someone asked me to go, I would oblige.
author: Wonky L.

description:
When I received this email:

"Starting January 14th until March 27th, every Monday to Thursday, Former Chef Sachio San from the famous "Kabuto Restaurant" will be our guest chef at Isa.  We all missed  him since he's left San Francisco more than a year ago.... Please come and celebrate his wonderful art of sushi with us at Isa's Dining Room.  Reserve your table now and request for the sushi menu during booking.
 
From all of us here at Isa, we wish everyone a healthy, happy, and prosperous year to come!
 
Best Wishes,
Luke and Kitty"

from Isa on Dec 27, 2007, I was so excited and immediately booked a reservation for Monday, Jan 14, 2008, Kojima-san's first night at Isa.

I've eaten at Isa twice before, so I wanted to concentrate on Kojima-san's sushi only.

From the "Relaxation Plate" section of "Sachio San's [sic] Menu", my friend and I each had the "Carpaccio" of sliced tuna with apple yolk vinaigrette, $12. It also came with pieces of pink grapefruit. Very nice, loved the tuna. Then from the "Nigiri sushi & Sashimi (one piece), I ordered 2 pieces of toro, $5.50 each, 2 pieces of sunazuri [yellowtail belly], $3.75 each, whose texture was marbled with thin lines of fat, and 1 piece of uni, $3.50. My friend had the same, except he substituted kanpachi, 3.75, for the uni. The toro and sunazuri were extremely buttery, and I loved them. The uni was just as good as it had been at Kabuto. I had wanted to order the sayori [pencil fish, aka a hemiramph, aka a halfbeak, aka needle fish], $3.75, but they were out [I had 8PM reservations!]. Everything was delicious, umai is the only word for it. Having ordered $34 worth of food, we decided to save room for dessert, though really, I could've eaten more sushi, but decided portion control was a good idea, and good for my wallet as well! During my meal, I had a Daiginjyo sake [50~60%; no more than 50% of the original size of the grain remains], an "Osakayacyobei hyogu" [Osakaya Choubei hyogu] - "Japan, light & fruity, full bodied [sic] with a rich taste", glass for $11. For dessert, I had a grapefruit granite [French for granita] for $5.50. This was a nice complement to the grapefruit I had earlier in the carpaccio, and it was very flavorful, clean, and refreshing. So total was $39.50 plus an $11 drink. Enjoy Kojima-san's return while you can!
author: Hao L.

description:
We visited during the Dine About Town event.

We had the crab salad and raw oysters for the first course and the duck breast and seasonal fish for entrees. Everything was simply delicious and so so fresh. The vanilla bean creme brûlée and vanilla gelato were so good. The creme brûlée was crackly and the gelato was super creamy!

The service at Isa was amazing. We were seated quickly and the wait staff checked in on us often. Furthermore, we witnessed a couple who had lost their table due to lateness, getting an apology from the manager.  It was a great thing to see.
author: Annie L.

description:
So I'm looking at the website for Isa so I can refer to the dishes we ate on Saturday, and I see a picture of Executive Chef Luke Sung flash through. He is CUTE! Haaay! What yo' name be is? What star sign you at? Luke, I am yo' daddy! 

Apparently, Executive Chef Luke Sung is "talented beyond his years." In what ways, aside from culinarily, one can only imagine. 

Okay, now that all sexual innuendo has been released, let us get down to the nittay grittay. The restaurant itself.

Reservations for 8:15 pm, half our party arrived around 8:25 - they didn't even blink. Nice. Sat the PROMPT half (ahem) at around 8:30, and when everyone was finally accounted for, we ordered around 9 pm. Meanwhile, there's yummy house bread (2 baskets for 5 people!) (yes, 2.5 of us were prompt, and 2.5 were tardy) (it is possible) with super smooth creamy butter on the side. Also, they sat us "outside" which is basically inside but with this heavy burlap canvas tent encasing us "inside" and they had those fire towers that give off A TON of heat. It was burning my neck so I asked the waiter to please turn it down, and he totally did. That was so nice. Thanks lover!

Here are the dishes we ordered:

      Dungeness Crab Salad
      13

This is TINY. Like a tumor in a baby tiny. Like a roll of Scotch tape tiny. But it was GOOD. The crab meat were plump and juicy and the grapefruit/avocado bed the crab was laid in was velvety rich and creamy. WAY TOO SMALL FOR $13 THOUGH. 

      Maine Lobster Broth
      6.5

We didn't order this but hot dang if I could not smell it the whole time from my neighbors' tables tantalyzingly teasing me with its curly scents of seafood and spice.

      Prince Edward Island Black Mussels
      9.5

Nothing special - basically like every other bowl of mussels at every other small plates place I have ever been to. TIP: DIP YOUR HOUSE BREAD IN THE SAUCE. IT'S HECKA GOOD! It's like eating a crumbly, wheaty mussel! Except it fills you up!

      Seared Dayboat Scallops
      15.5

This was so good. It was so good I'm going to bring out the Korean and say it was SOH good! The scallops were fat and flavorful although the potato puree was basically average, which is understandable as the scallops are the main act. BUT only four scallops, no matter how big, should NEVER ever ever be $15.50. Like, ever. Unless Executive Chef Luke Sung is hand-feeding it to me.

      Saffron Paella 
      13

This paella made want to shout! Throw my hands up and shout! Kick my heels back and shout! Take my pants off and shout! I am a HUGE fan of paella, and Madonna strike me dead (and a pose) if this paella wasn't done right! It was covered on top with what I can only call a THICK CRUST of assorted seafood. It was like me and my gay roommates when we used to do Facial Nights! and smear thick smotherings of seaweed and coal gook all over our faces. Except in this case, the paella is my face and the prawns, mussels, calamari, peas & red peppers is my mask! Yum to the CORE. 

      Shitake & Oyster Mushroom Risotto
      13.5

This was the homely, pale, sun-starved step-sister of the paella. Bland and way too creamy. I could hardly stand it!

      Pan Roasted Chicken
      15

The crispy skin was incredible - BUT crispy chicken skin is GOOD anywhere. KFC, Popeye's, my mama's, etc. That's why it's called CRISPY. Because CRISPY is a thesaurus word for GOOD. I knows! The meat itself was a little too tough for the fact that it was $15.00 for like 1/4 of a tiny chicken. I swear, fancy schmancy restaurants never do a good job with chicken. Why? I don't know - maybe they just can't go the simple route. Executive Chef Luke Sung probably flips through an issue of Real Simple while at the checkout stand and is completely boggled out of his mind.

      Maple Leaf Duck Breast
      16

I can't even begin to describe the nastiness of this dish. In fact, let me instead let Beyonce and co. sum it up: "You nasty, you trashy! You classless, girl! You sleazy, you freaky!" I mean I don't know anything about no fancy place but is duck supposed to be raw the way it was? It was G.R.O.S.S., y'all. I tried to eat the cooked outer edge but the texture was like chewing on 3-day old gum you found under your BART seat - flavorless, tough, and utterly disgusting. I am sorry, Executive Chef Luke Sung, dreamlover of mine, but duck should not be raw!?!?!? Right??!?!? As a consolation, I think some girl in our group liked it, but really, it wasn't for me or basically everyone else in our party.

The worst part was that the raw duck was the last dish to come, so it was like going to a really awesome club where they played great music all night, and then end with a medley of Creed songs, starting with Arms With Open. WTH? Exactly! 

Executive Chef Luke Sung gets 5 stars. The good food gets 5 stars, minus 1.5 for the pricey price, and 1 star for the nasty raw duck = 3.5 stars
author: Joshua L.

description:
Review 335 and I didn't even know this place existed till graduation!

My roommate graduated law school, so her amazing family took her extended family (thats us) to a delightful dinner at Isa.

Everything was fresh and tasty, and Dean the server tried to sell us on everything.  Even interrupted the graduates speech to offer us dessert.  Now thats service  :\

We had reservations in the back...which if you don't like looking sallow and jaundiced, Id recommend not eating there.  It was beautiful, warm and very very yellow.  When we left, the place was packed, so a reservation might be the way to go.

My rule of thumb whenever I go out...always get the Scallops.  Didn't fail here.
author: Lauren F.

description:
I had a lovely time here at Isa with a bunch of juiced doctors getting their holiday party on.  It's just nice to see them all in their non-doctor-civilian clothing, unintimidating, trying to crack jokes and doing white elephant gift exchange.

I fondly remember the duck breast, the halibut, and the mushrooms.  I liked all of it.   

( | )
author: Grace M.

description:
Food was great, but two detrimental factors forced me to drop few stars:

1) Table for five (reserved three days in advance) was, I swear, a table for three.  All of us had to squeeeeeze into a small space against a wall.

2) A minute after signing the check, the waiter literally told us to get out because another party is waiting.  We were only there for 1.5 hrs.

Side note -- they recommend to eat as "family style", but what that really means is they can't time their appetizers and entrees to serve at the same time.  We ended up ordering our own appetizer and entree, but it wasn't really a problem as long as some of us wait few minutes for other plates to arrive.

Anyhow, have a second thought if you have a party of more than 2.
author: Mami T.

description:
I agree with Michelle L. when she gave Isa 4 stars for the food and 1 bonus star for the service. 

I was there on a Wednesday night and had the pleasure of being served by Dean. From the moment that we sat down, Dean was the most genuine, helpful, friendly, exceptional server that I may have ever had. No joke. He was a large contributing factor to our pleasant experience. Since neither of us had been before, he guided us through the menu, the experience and the wine list. He helped us choose a rather nice Pinot Noir as he suggested it complements many of the flavors on the menu.

We tried the goat cheese, the flank iron steak, the spaghetti and a side of asparagus. The food was really tasty. You honestly can't go wrong with the goat cheese: baked to perfection with tomatoes, basil and pine nuts. The steak was topped with an herbed butter and served with haricot verts and small potatoes. Delish! The asparagus was cooked just right with shaves of parmegiano. The spaghetti was my least favorite of the dishes, but only because it was a bit forgettable. I can't tell you exactly what flavors were melded into the sauce, however, i still remember thinking it was still solid as it hit my lips.

We skipped dessert as we were stuffed, yet we weren't pressured to leave or hurry up. I'd recommend sitting out on the back patio. You'd never know it was out there by walking into the place, but it's warm, cozy and sets the scene for what is sure to be a great evening. I will be back very soon!
author: Jenny S.

description:
Let's get one thing straight.  Small plates are for sissies.  I really hate small plates.  I would bet a large pizza at North Beach Pizza that when you go to Isa it is because the ladeez suggested it or you are a ladee yourself.  Men do not like small plates because they're...well...small.  It's not a meal.  Guys do not need tasting menus, they need meals.  So, Isa started off on the wrong foot for me.  However, the food, what little there is of it, is excellent, so Isa redeemed itself.

Our waiter was excellent.  He looked like a younger and thinner Rob Thomas.  This made me nervous because my girlfriend loves Rob Thomas...maybe more than she loves me.  He was very helpful with both menu selections and the wine selection.  (In stark contrast was a ridiculous phony on the wait staff.  He greeted what I can only assume was a regular customer by saying, "So good to see you again.  You look beautiful."  She didn't look beautiful.  I won't say what she looked like.  This type of kissy face pandering should be punished by repeated shots to the ding dong.)

We went for a variety of starvation sized plates.  The goat cheese was excellent.  The hamachi was also very good.  I really, really enjoyed the risotto.  The butter fish was good.  Everyone else at the table was having orgasmic fits over how buttery it tasted.  I was a little more in control.  

Like almost every other small plates restaurant, Isa is overpriced, but they can justify the price by the quality of the food.
author: Chris I.

description:
Date/Time:  Friday - 7:45pm
Occasion:  Dinner with the BFF homies
Party of:  Four
Location:  Location a little discreet.  Actual restaurant a little small but opens up to a covered back "patio" with heat lamps.  
Ordered: Maine lobster broth, Avocado crab salad, Mussels, Seared Hudson Valley foie gras, Seared scallops, Seafood paella, Spaghettini, Flat iron steak, Local mushrooms, and Brussel sprouts
Total incl gratuity: ~$190.00

For our extremely overdue get together, the besties and I decided to try Isa for some yummy-goodness.  I wasn't quite sure what to think as I had received some mixed reviews but I was pleasantly surprised!

We came in with a big appetite and went a little overboard in ordering.  We figured as a tapas place, we could easily finish all of our dishes however each dish turned out a little larger than we expected.  The lobster infused broth was nice starter - light and herby with two chunks of shellfish.  The avocado salad was crisp, refreshing, and contained generous portions of fresh crab meat - delish!  I nibbled on the mussels a bit - nothing special but I concede...it's likely because my attention was focused on the hudson valley foie gras that was delivered at the same time.  Wow.  I was pretty blown away by that dish.  It was rich, buttery, and perfectly delicate.  It paired well with the toasted brioche and fresh huckleberry.  The price point was great as well! This dish is a MUST order.  The girls and I fancied the scallops.  The mashed potato puree was nicely whipped and was a savory complement to the scallops and asparagus.  My girlfriends loved the seafood paella.  I, unfortunately, am not a fan of paella.  By the time our sides (mushrooms and brussel sprouts) and steak arrived, we were all pretty stuffed.  I really had to channel my inner t-rex to finish the flat iron.  We ordered the steak medium rare and it was very tender and nicely flavored with the chimchurri sauce.  Of our orders, I certainly recommend the foie gras, scallops, spaghettini, and flat iron steak.  

When our bill arrived, we were all shocked at the incredible value.  Ten dishes plus gratuity...less than $200.  Service was quick and friendly.  All in all, I really liked the vibe of this place and genuinely enjoyed the food. A winner!
author: Jess C.

description:
