My favorite restaurant in San Francisco. When dining here, always request a table in the back patio with heat lamps and Christmas tree lights. It's a wonderful restaurant for romantic dates, family celebrations, and girl's dinner out. You can't beat the family style tapas and the delicious desserts. When I have friends from out of town, I always bring them here for a nice dinner and taste of SF.

Favorites:
* Butter Lettuce Salad
* Main Lobster Broth with tarragon
* Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese
* Potato Wrapped Sea Bass
* Seared Duck Breast
* Truffled Risotto
author: Josephine L.

description:
Ok this place deserves another half star and the only reason why I do not give it 5 stars is because the hostesses and one of the waiters just didn't look like they were having a good time. A couple of them walked around the whole night with a really sour expression...LEARN HOW TO SMILE!

The food is excellent! I came with 3 other people and we pretty much ordered 3/4 of the menu. It is served family style and the plates are fairly small so ordering a lot of different things works out very well. The meat dishes are a little bigger so I would only order a couple (1 for every 2 or 3 people). 

We started out in the back patio, which was SO NICE and really pretty but very cold. It is a tented off patio with heat lamps but our server kept turning ours off after we had turned it on so we ended up moving inside. I am so glad we moved because we ended up with a much nicer waiter (Jonathan). He was very attentive but not overkill.
author: Jen S.

description:
Came here for my monthly dinner with the boss and co-workers and it was nice. We practically had everything but a few things on the menu so I'm not going to go down the line of what we ordered. Everything that we ate was good, but not remarkable. Nothing I'd rave over or even remember too much. 

Our server was very polite, but had extreme body odor but was amusing. We sat on the outside patio on the back and it was extremely cramped. The outdoor heater was right next to me and I constantly had to move it further and further away because I could just not sit down or move. 

Ok place, nothing exciting. I'd come back here if I was in the neighborhood and couldn'td decide where else to eat.
author: Calvin L.

description:
Why the 2 stars?  Let's see, reservation was for 8:45pm for 7 guests on a Saturday - didn't get seated until 9:40pm.  Our hostess was stressed out and NEVER took the initiative to touch base with us.  We were left in the blind - I kept having to ask her every 15 minutes or so.  She didn't even bother offering us a glass of wine or cocktail so we sat outside in the cold just waiting and waiting and waiting.....

Food is 4 stars.  Our server wanted to make money so he kept insisting that we each order two plates to share.  What?  You want us to order a total of 14 plates????  Uhhhh...each plate ranges from 14 - 25.  Nah.

Service was OK.  Our server forgot to take a bath that day or that week.  The smell was so offensive that it made our friends gagged and have to turn their heads and cover their noses each time he approached the table.  Yuck.  What a horrible eating experience!

Parking can be a NIGHTMARE!
author: Veritas V.

description:
San Francisco has no shortage of restaurants that serve top-notch food so it really takes something extra to stand apart from the crowd.  Sure, Isa serves some of the best ceviche in the country, sure they can cook butterfish to perfection, but it is the extra little details that move Isa into the 5-star realm.

The outside patio really adds a lot to the atmosphere.  In an area where many restaurants try to cram as many seats as possible in impossibly tight quarters, it is refreshing to have such a wide open space.  

The waitstaff functioned as a cohesive unit and they genuinely seemed to take pride in their art.  Despite being full to capacity, the server promptly came over and took his time while he introduced himself and the menu. You could actually sense his enthusiasm and excitement for the quality of the food.  Just before the point where it started so seem that he would be overwhelmed with the crowd, the busser would appear and assist with the order. 

Finally, to seal the deal, the provided a great little birthday experience.  Not only did they bring out a complimentary flourless chocolate cake and fresh vanilla bean ice cream, but they included some free Icewine which happens to be our favorite type of  after dinner wine.
author: adam b.

description: I've been wanting to try Isa for awhile now and finally had a chance last Friday night. The restaurant has a good "date night" vibe with lots of candles and dim lighting. Our server was very friendly and nice and didn't rush the meal at all. My favorite thing I tried was the mushroom risotto with truffle oil...ah.maz.ing.
author: Gina C.

description: Very cozy place with a nice atmosphere. Our waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu and provided good service. We ordered six courses, all of which were delicious. Except the foie gras, which probably tasted as it should, but after I learned what it was, I was felt a little bit ill. The waiter offered a delicious wine paring, but failed to note that the tiny glass was an additional nine dollars. The sea bass was excellent. Overall, good place, but I probably won't go back unless I somehow find myself single and find it necessary to woo.
author: Eric V.

description: Isa is consistently good and a great place to take out-of-towners to. The staples and must-trys are the dungeness crab salad, seabass, clam spaghetti, scallops, and grilled octopus. For larger groups, sit in the back under the tent and heated lamps - very cozy and gives a casual but classy feel. And for some reason, the wine flows like water here! The only downside is that it can get a bit pricey.
author: Chihee K.

description: Fabulous is the word!!  Starting from the seating process to the food and service was great. We were a group of 4, celebrating a friend's birthday. Our server was Dave and he recommended the Seabass and Yellowfin Tuna which we ended up ordering. In addition to that we ordered the Calamari, Spaghetti, Truffle Risotto, and the Range Chicken. My personal fav was the Seabass, Tuna and Risotto. But then again, anything truffle infused is almost always delicious. We also ordered the Creme Brulee and Flourless Chocolate Cake for desert. Our server Dave was supper friendly and attentive. If possible, sit in the back. The ambiance is much better over there than in the front.
author: G A.

description:
Very good food.
Outside patio is only good if the weather is warm.

Inside is slightly cramped, the wine list is lacking.

Small plates are great.
author: Mark B.

description:
Took my mom there for her b-day, and we had a wonderful time. The 3 of us ordered the green salad with Point Reyes blue cheese and pears, jamon serrano (the most generous portion of jamon serrano I've had in the states)  seafood paella, steak, seared scallops and potato crusted halibut; we left stuffed! 

The highlight of the meal was definitely the halibut, which was delicious- seriously, go get some NOW. The seafood paella was a miss, a very small portion with an -eh?- ok taste. Skip the paella. It just didn't stand up to the other great dishes. 

Overall the food was excellent, the service was great and the ambiance in the patio was interesting (we went at 7:30, and since it's daylight till 9, the whole room had an eerie yellowish glow which was a bit weird, but after a few drinks it won't matter). Place gets crowded, make sure you have reservations!
author: Lucia R.

description:
My friend recommended this place for fish, and she was def right!
I took my little sis here when she came out to visit me.  We both really liked her halibut, but the butterfish was phenominal!  It was steamed in this paper bag thing with truffles . . . . I'm def going back for that butterfish, especially now that I live 4 blocks away.
author: Ali G.

description: This place is fabulous. The waiters are great and the food is even better. I have never had a bad or displeasing dish here, and I've tried almost everything on the menu (no joke). They are great at suggesting things you may like and if you sign up for their news/website they send you free drink or dessert coupons in your email for your anniversary or birthday!
author: Camille R.

description: I loved the decor.  The seating in the front seemed nice, dark and cozy, but we were seated in the back/outside.  I was worried that I'd get cold, but the heaters kept me warm all night! Along with my cosmo at $5 happy hour until 7pm.  It was the only drink that sounded good on the drink menu .. all the other soju drinks were too citrusy for me.  I've been craving lamb for the longest time and finally satisfied my craving.  I'll admit that I've had better lamb elsewhere, but it was still tasty here especially with the sauteed vegetables!! I also tried the hanger steak ... DELICIOUS~!! I'll definitely be back, but unsure if I'll have the lamb next time.
author: Jen P.

description:
Make sure to sit outside. It has lights and a canopy, it is so romantic. Good for a date. The food was scrumptious, esp. the risotto. 

The down side:Our waitress was a little snooty.
author: Jessica S.

description:
We enjoyed our meal there last night.

The lobster broth with shrimp was very tasty. The crab salad was also yummy. To me, it went better with the grapefruit's tartness than the mango's sweetness. But, it was good to have the option on the plate.

I had the baked butterfish and my wife had the seared scallops. Both were solid. I think the scallops were slightly better. Get those.

The semifreddo and flourless chocolate cake dishes were both pretty good. I liked the gelato with the cake more than the cake itself.

In all, it's a great choice. The only drawback is the noise. It's a bit small in some areas and the volume can often get a bit loud.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Thanks to other yelpers, I decided to try Isa with a group of friends. This place was amazing!

Food/Quality: 
The food was excellent. The baked laura chenel goat cheese was warm and creamy. The steak and potatoes had a lot of flavor. Even the chicken was great. It was moist and flavorful rather than dry and overcooked. The risotto with mushrooms had just the right mix of cheese added. Our group decided to try several of the desserts and every one of them was memorable. 

Service: 
The server was friendly and recommended a couple items on the menu that were a big hit with our group. The service in general was attentive in that our drinks were filled promptly and even the candle in the middle of the table was replaced as burned down.

Atmosphere: 
The back area was was loud and full of other diners hopefully enjoying their food as much as our group. The lights hanging around provided a festive atmosphere.

Value:
The prices seemed fairly reasonable, especially when ordering tapas and sharing with a group of people.

Overall this is a place I am looking forward to returning to. I suggest going with a group of people so you have a chance to sample more of the flavorful dishes.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Last night birthday dinner for my son was a complete 10! From the warm greeting from Jonathan, who acted as both host and server to the perfect meal!
We opted for prix fix menu, an incredible deal at $29.95 per person, was flawless. The service is family style so we each picked a different starter and then main course and got to share everything! We had salmon carpaccio, fresh and flavorful, Prince Edward mussels, fresh as can be with a delicious light garlicky onion and tomato broth, and an Arugula salad with fennel and shaved Parmesan cheese with a light lemony, olive oil dressing.. For entrees, we ordered fresh petrale sole on a bed of perfectly roasted artichokes and tomatoes, a truffle mushroom risotto, that had us begging for more, and a delicious steak dish with tarragon sauce with string bens and perfectly roasted potato wedges!!! For dessert we opted for the cheese selections as it was a French meal... Again, Point Reyes  blue with a sweet lovely currant sauce, a slice of Chèvre with honey and toast points.  Since it was my sons birthday, or wonderful server, Jonathan brought out a flour less chocolate cake complete with vanilla ice cream and a candle!!! We could not have enjoyed the evening more.  Can't wait to go back!!
author: Judi S.

description:
Came for the dine about town and loved it.  Tuna tartar appetizer was yummy.  Steak main was perfectly cooked, and creme brulee finished up the pre-fix wonderfully.  Wine prices were also fair and tasty.

Service was ok.  We were seated promptly and servers were decently attentive but not quite as welcoming as I would have expected from a local eatery.

All in all will definitely be returning.
author: Lev E.

description: This is the perfect place for a cute date, fantastic food, and good wine.  Happy hour until 7pm let's you sip wine with your pinky up for a very reasonable price ($5/glass!).  The food was delicious and my only regret is not coming with a larger party so we could try more of it.  The waiter recommended ordering for the table and sharing, which proved to be an excellent suggestion.  My favorite dish the potato wrapped sea bass.  I'll definitely be going again.
author: Jarica S.

description: We went there for an early Sat dinner in October. The food was just so so. We ordered Risotto, Lamb, Mussels & Oysters. Services was ok. We ordered a side order of a plain butter Spaghetti for our kid. They charged us the same price as the main entree which we agreed on when we placed our order. For dessert  we had Gelato & Creme brulee  & both tasted ok. Maybe because of the high rating at Yelp I was expecting too much.
author: Kundera N.

description: i love sitting outside in the festival of lights and enjoying a bowl of potato leek soup- yum! one of the best places in the marina. that is why it's still there. unlike a lot of places that close after being there for 1 year.... or less.
author: Susan L.

description:
There are many dishes that you must try.  

Baked Laura Chenel goat cheese - I used to hate goat cheese, but this dish converted me.  I now love goat cheese
Hudson valley grade A foie gras - yummy and so tender
Shellfish risotto - just ok
Seared dayboat scallops - good, but not to die for
Maple leaf duck breast - just ok

For some reason I don't see the tuna tartar on the menu anymore.  If they have the tuna tartar, you must try it.

You have to make a reservation usually for this place.  You definitely want to try to get a table in the back.  So pretty with the night lights around.  Inside the restaurant is nice, but much better ambiance in the back.
author: Annie S.

description: I loved it here!  I celebrated my birthday here.  The prices were nice and portions were just right to be shared by all.  This is French with quality and at good prices.  I enjoyed the service here.  Although I've dreamed of eating at other fine restaurants in this city, this is one secret that people should know about.  I had good times there and saved a whole lot too.
author: Daphne A.

description:
Let's face it -- I'm at a point in my life where birthdays aren't about celebrating being one year older -- it's more about drinking enough to forget just how old I'm getting and trying to find ways avoid it. [I'm being melodramatic but I'm old so bear with me] So why not begin the night at one of my favorite SF restaurants where my last coherent memory of my XXth year would be of some really good eats.

Heels clicking, dresses swishing, me and the other girls I had in tow marched our way to the back patio. With an 8:30 reservation for 10, I was expecting at least a 15 minute wait but that wasn't the case...it's like they knew my old bones needed to be seated right away.

Our waiter was attentive and courteous, explaining the dining experience we should expect, the specials and assuring us that everything on the menu was quite delicious (with old age comes wisdom, so I knew he wasn't a liar). We spoiled ourselves  with multiple orders of Dungeness crab salad, grilled calamari, lobster broth, tuna tartare, scallops, the short rib special, the hamachi special, steak, risotto and last but definitely not least...the DUCK.

Oh...the duck.

...I could eat the duck for days on end. Perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned, covered in fresh huckleberry sauce with a perfect salad of beets, arugula and chevre. Supplemented with soju Greyhounds, perfectly PERFECT. 

Just when I thought the duck couldn't get any better, it proved to have age-defying powers -- as soon as the first bite of duck went down, the table behind us wished me a happy 18th...yes, EIGHTEENTH (teehee) birthday. I officially needed a fake ID at this point to finish my next round of drinks. Pleased to be back in my teens again, it only got better -- as I polished off the last few bites, a sweeet (SO sweet) elderly couple stopped by the table to wish me a happy ...16th...yes, SIXTEENTH birthday.

Oh, magically delicious duck, how I love you.

Dinner ended with a flourless chocolate cake, candles, a glass of dessert wine (courtesy of Isa) and a back patio remix of 'Happy Birthday' featuring the owner's son from upstairs  :)

Isa (and the duck) never lets me down and proves time and time again why it's a tried and true favorite. Not only did I get some fantastically good eats but my last memory of my XXth year is of being Sweet Sixteen!
author: Chelle Y.

description: First time last night and we will be back again and again. Our dining experience was incredible. Service was impeccable, the food otherworldly, and the ambiance warm and relaxing. We had mojitos, butter lettuce salad, potato leek soup, baked goat cheese, mushroom risotto, pan-fried chicken, and the chocolate flourless cake. Everything, and I mean everything, was fantastic! And, to boot, it didn't cost an arm and a leg. Highly recommend.
author: Ramona H.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat. Every time I've been here, the service and food has been amazing. The back covered patio is full of atmosphere, fun yet intimate with romantic string lighting to enhance the immaculate presentation of the food. My only problem about this place is that everything is so good, I can never decide what to order. But my go-to's are: oysters, dungeness crab salad, FOIE GRAS, seared scallops, rack of lamb, and the duck...oh heck, who am I kidding, EVERYTHING is good here! Just close your eyes and point to something, it's guaranteed to be perfection!
author: Kristina L.

description: Pretty damn good spot in Marina. Had dinner w a few friends and overall was very happy with the meal. Loved the spaghetti plate. Super fresh and tasty. All the plates are smaller plates you can share. Ambiance is very nice and back patio is a great spot to sit, if you get a chance.
author: A.J. S.

description:
this is a review based on my 6/12/10 visit.  it may have been a while ago, but it seems as if i was there yesterday; it was that good!!!

wine for $5/glass during happy hour from 5-7:30 pm.  

we opted for the regular menu rather than the "dine about town" prix fix.

the person who we ordered from, an asian fellow, was charismatic, amusing, and very informative.  he really seemed to enjoy what he was doing. he gave us several recommendations, most of which we ordered.  here goes...

--DUNGENESS CRAB SALAD - crab and salad are crab and salad, but the citrus dressing was so nice; light and refreshing,  it's a great start to a great dinner. 
--BAKED LAURA CHENEL GOAT CHEESE - i forgot. :(
--SOME MUSHROOM DISH - a bunch of different mushrooms sauteed. nothing fancy. 
--STEAMED PRINCE EDWARD ISLAND MUSSLES - so simple, yet so good. the actual mussel was quite large.   
--HUDSON VALLEY GRADE A FOIE GRAS - omg...it just melted in my mouth.  the peaches added to a perfect sweetness to the foie gras. try smearing some on the seared scallops.  it's soooo nice.  
--SEARED SCALLOPS - very simple and basic. try smearing some foie gras on it. u'll be delightfully surprised.  
--MAPLE LEAF FARM DUCK BREAST - perfectly cooked.  the huckleberry sauce added a nice and tasty touch. 
--POTATO WRAPPED SEABASS - nice presentation, but taste was uninspiring . the seabass was a tad dry. i wouldn't get this again.
--SOUFFLE/ICE CREAM (i think) -  a perfect ending to a great meal.  we had just one since we were stuffed. remember it takes at least 15 min for baking. 

pricing was very reasonable for the quality of food, hence the 5-stars. 

gripes we encountered - every dish came out way too fast; the table quickly overcrowded. it seemed as if we were rushed to finish.  perhaps they wanted customers to finish quicker due to the increased diners for  "dine about town".
author: Brian L.

description: Isa is an excellent place to eat.  Great service and great food.  I had the crab salad as an appetizer and the crab had great flavor.  I usually don't eat much salad but this one blew me away.  For my main meal I had the steak.  I ordered it medium and it came out perfectly.  The steak was moist and perfect.  Whenever I return to San Francisco, I won't be hesitant to come back.
author: Brandon L.

description:
This is a pretty small restaurant serving French tapas.  The dishes are not that innovative - typical French faire but quality is not bad.  The place feels more like a wine-bar than what you would expect a tapas restaurant to be. I thought the sauteed gulf prawns and steak were great. The foie gras with custard brioche was incredible.  We were a bit disappointed with the asparagus soup - not enough flavor and punch. 

The price is reasonable and the service was friendly and casual. I seating feels a bit too crowded. The vibe and atmosphere is great, people all looked like they're having a relaxing time.  I parked my car at the Wells Fargo bank's parking lot - they charge a flat fee at night for general use.
author: Jay T.

description:
Isa definitely has great food.  I was actually supposed to take my friend to Bistro Aix, but forgot the cross street, and ended up here instead.  

Although we didn't have reservations and all the tables were booked up, we got a space at the bar.  The place is really nice, and at first looks, the size of the place can be deceiving, but if you look further into the room, it stretches all the way down.  The food here is excellent.  A mix between mediterranean and american, it doesn't really fall into any specific category.  There is a 3 course prix fix menu, as well as an a la carte menu.  I felt that the prix fix menu almost filtered out everything and just left the top of the list on their menu.  And for under $30, it's a steal. 

The only complaint I had from this dinner was the wait we had to endure for our food.  We arrived at around 7, but it wasn't until 8 that we finally got our appetizers, then 8:20 for our main course, and finally 9:50 for dessert.  Usually, it wouldn't have been too bad, but we had somewhere to go at 9!!  Our waitress was very kind and apologetic and didn't put our wines on the bill due to the lag, and explained the kitchen is still recovering from VDay.  She tried to keep things pleasant and chatted with us during the wait.  She asked us where we were rushing to, and embarrassed to tell her that we wanted to rush back to catch Grey's Anatomy (such a teaser episode!!), I told her we had a movie to catch.

I give this place 4 stars....3 stars for the wait, but overall 4 stars because our waitress was very nice and professional about the situation.
author: Tadd L.

description:
Love this place.  Still retains the fabulous dining experience I had a few years ago.  One of the great things about this place is that THEY ARE NOT STINGY WITH THE FOIE GRAS.  (with wild huckleberries, port & vanilla custard brioche) I hate when you go to a nice place and they give you a pebble of a piece, where you only think it tastes good because half the time it's the anticipation, the other half it's pure imagination.  This place will give you a fat piece where you think they musta stuff this duck like f__.   Approximately the size of your fore finger and index finger combined.

In fact, I think it's one of the few places that still serve it - wasn't there a city ban on it?  Well, shhhhhhh if it is.

They served the foie gras with a menu-paired wine - it was more of a dessert wine (Uroulat Jurancon 2001) than anything, but it pair well.  Or maybe it was just really really good dessert wine.  Not sure.

The roasted skate (with tomato, zucchini, potato, basil & extra virgin olive oil) was your typical white fish, but it was definitely light and flaky.  Full of flavor I might add.  And again, not stingy with the portions.  I would say 2 solid fillets.  Lightly grilled and tasty.

Lastly the Shitake & Oyster Mushroom Risotto was solid.   Flaked with parmesan reggiano, it was rather overpowering, but it was because the parmesan was perfect.  It almost took over the dish, but for your risotto with cheese lovers, this would be it.  Great consistency and buttery.

By the glass, the 2003 Chardonnay, St. Clement was crisp and perfect, the 2004 Pinot Grigio, Kris was ok - tasted a bit stale, but maybe it was just me.

Overall, the 'tapas' are awesome.  Three tapas for two is plenty.  I have heard the mussels and steak are good, but you're on your own there.

Enjoy.

Bathroom - clean and above average.  Serviceable.
author: Isaac L.

description:
A hidden gem in the Marina for sure! I can't count how many times I've eaten across the street at Ace Wasabi's and I never saw this place! Wow, so now I've been there twice and both times loved everything. Service was fantastic, everything I've tasted from here was delish and I can't wait to go back. It's the kind of place that's great to bring out of town guests or to go with a small group so you can order tons of things to all try since they're all small plates.

Just love this place.
author: Diane S.

description:
I went here for a birthday dinner without having any prior knowledge about the restaurant other than it was in a convenient location for me...

The food was absolutely incredible!  From the yellow fin tuna sashimi to the foie gras, each dish continued to get more and more delicious.  

The setting was great as well- really loved sitting in the back with all the christmas lights hanging from the ceilings.  The service was great- a little over the top at times, but it kept our group laughing the whole time.  We spent almost 3 hours there enjoying ourselves and I couldn't have asked for a happier birthday dinner!
author: Holly B.

description:
So I went to a birthday dinner at Isa last night, already excited about going to a restaurant that is named after me! 
I liked the ambience the moment I walked in. The service was excellent, the wine fabulous and then - OH MY GOD!!! THIS WAS THE BEST FOOD I EVER HAD! And I have been to a lot of fancy restaurants around the world. This was a totally new experience. The sushi was not comparable to any sushi I had in my life, the fish was delicious, the scallops...mmmmmmhhhhh and the lamb..yammiiiieeeehhhh!!!
If that had been my last supper on earth, I would have been delighted to die...
author: Isabel S.

description: we wanted a table outside and forgot to reserve ahead of time- but they were so accommodating and sat us outside with wine until our table was ready.  AMAZING food and the great service continued through dinner.
author: Raymond M.

description:
"Order 2 dishes each" we were told by the waiter.It was alot of food! Gluttons that we are, we totally finished everything.I have to say everything was amazing! By far one of the best placesI have been to in SF. The red Spanish wine complimented everything perfectly. My faves were the Scallops and the braised short ribs.
Dont forget to leave room for dessert, the chocolate flourless cake was to die for.
Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm I want to go back NOW!
author: Pooja S.

description:
We're East Bay folk but definitely will find a way to make it back to Isa.

We had an event at the Palace of Fine Arts to attend so needed a Marina restaurant beforehand. We originally thought of Bistro Aix but since they are closed during renovations picked Isa (and are glad we did).

Our reservation was early on a Saturday (6:00 pm) so we probably avoided  some of the crowds and service chaos that have been noted in earlier reviews.

Service was great. Our waiter was both attentive and engaged - he let us know the things he really thought we'd enjoy (including steering us to a wine other than our original selection that was absolutely outstanding).

Between the two of us, we ordered the goat cheese, the dungeness crab salad, the calamari, the scallops and the short ribs. Delish.

If I had to rank everything, I'd say the scallops were the best - prepared with brussel sprouts, bacon and mashed potatoes. The short ribs were second. The goat cheese third (I can't stop thinking of the pine nuts and tomatoes on top of the warmed cheese).

We loved this place and will definitely be back again.
author: Chris N.

description:
i will give it a 3.5 if i could.

we ordered the yellowfin tuna, maple leaf duck breast for me, and 3 course dinner for my bf where he got the grilled calamari, flat iron steak and the gelato.

the tuna is 4 stars, calamari and steak both 3.5 stars but i am disappointed at the duck :(

service is very good, free bread very good :)
author: Danielle A.

description:
The date and I were kindly escorted to the back seating tent arena -- a gorgeous set up where the tables aren't spaced too close together, the lighting is romantic, all with a bit of a rustic feel to it. Mind you, I have been dying to try this place, given the outstanding reviews that abound here. So perhaps I was anticipating food-gasms, and well, hence the three stars. 

The kumamoto oysters were delicious, tuna tartare was melt-in your mouth delicious, but not better than my last at Pearl Oyster Bar in Oakland. Next we ordered the Lamb shank with mashed potatoes and veggies-- again, tender and succulent but not divine. The potato wrapped sea bass was flaking and buttery, but the spuds were a bit undercooked. 
Lastly, dessert was a flourless chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream....umm..ok-- but I didn't walk away feeling like there was a dish that rocked my world-- a definitive staple that I could rave about to my friends...
author: NaNa M.

description:
Mmm... French Tapas + Steiner Street = possibly the best food in the neighborhood. Great food, great atmosphere, great for big gropu dinners. 

Just make a reservation...
author: Mike G.

description:
Hooray, 100th review!

Hooray for SF Restaurant Week!  Hooray for Isa!

The only reason why I got to go to this place is because of Restaurant Week.  Otherwise, I would never be able to afford this place.  It took me forever to decide which place to try out of the long list of participating restaurants.  I was sold by this place's menu.  Boy, was I glad I came here out!  This place is great!  Five stars for everything!

After a long day of walking around SF and before a Giants game, Isa was just what I needed.  The host was incredibly nice, the atmosphere, intimate and cozy, the back patio, covered and heated, was an extremely nice touch.  Happy Hour drink specials were very reasonable.  But that's not the best part.  The best part was the server.  If only I could remember his name.  He was a little Filipino man with an accent, but so knowledgeable and friendly.  He was probably the best waiter ever next to Molly from Maestros in Beverly Hills.  He knew how to describe the food, and you could tell, he was totally in love with the menu.  He could recommend wines and drinks, whatever you'd like.  He could really sell anything and was very accommodating, especially with the inexperienced.  He knew how to carry a conversation and was very attentive, without being overbearing.  He had the nicest smile and explained everything thoroughly.  He really made the experience five stars.

Oh, and the food.  He was absolutely right about the food.  We tried the foie gras, perfectly cooked.  Duck, crab salad, salmon carpaccio.  Everything impeccable and served family style.  So tasty, so fresh, and so well-prepared.  The chef is really some sort of genius.  He is a young man, with a lot of talent.  This is really one of the best dining experiences in town.  If I could give this place more stars, I would give them 5 to 16 more in a heartbeat.

I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to have a great dining experience with a little extra pocket money hanging around.  But honestly, it is definitely worth the price here.  Next chance I get, I am going to go back and visit my favorite SF server.
author: Nina P.

description: My husband and I came here for a dinner during holidays. This place is so small that we almost missed it when we got there. As we as we arrived we were greeted by the on-site manager. We booked a table so we were seated very quickly. It was decorated very nice inside and great for the holidays. The food was not "French" in my opinion. But it tasted amazing. I guess it's all that matters. The service was fast and people working there were very courteous. The only complaint would be that the place is so small that the tables were very close to each other. When I got out I had to be very careful as I was afraid my butt might knock over the wine on the next table. btw I'm small Asian female. That also means I can hear the conversations on the next table too! So my husband and I were playing our phones to avoid talking too much the whole night. So if you want to take your date there and have a lot words to say, people on the next table can almost hear everything.....
author: Bob H.

description: Great environment for a group party.  Great food, great service.  The ambiance is fun.  I brought a small group here.  One of the couples is new to SF and they loved Isa.  In one of the best food cities in the world, I say that 4 stars is quite good.  I would reserve a 5 star rating for something that completely blows me away.
author: Conrad H.

description: This place is pretty cute at night. Good dinner menu.
author: Willa M.

description: Isa is-a so good:) Loved the Yellowfin tuna tartare to start, dungeness crab salad was superb, foie gras- rich like it should be, calamari: not the best I have had but average, sole: ahh ok, flank steak: awesome.  Had a work dinner here and they were very friendly, accomadating and quick to serve the food.  Was very pleasantly surprised with the food here.  Will definitely come again.
author: nicole s.

description:
Much to my dismay I'm finding myself in Marina eateries more often than I'd like to admit. Let's just get something out of the way first:

I'm an opentable junkie. It's gotten so bad that I just don't make reservations at restaurants unless they're on open table (that's not to say I won't go to restaurants that aren't opentable-enabled, I just won't be the one making the reservations). So I constantly scour the opentable "just added" list for new restaurants I haven't tried yet, and Isa came up. I went to Yelp and it seemed you Yelpers really liked it (four and a half stars!), so off I went.

Firstly, I love the seperation between the front bar area and the back room. Both have distinctly different atmospheres perfectly befitting their purposes. The front area feels like a bar bistro, whereas the back area feels like a countryside chalet.

The service is utterly perfect. No beverage went empty for a moment. No plate remained on the table longer than necessary. Every course was served precisely on time and in its place within the context of the meal. Spices, herbs, and sauces were all utterly and impeccably executed. The wine list felt a bit short , but the selections were ideal for the courses, so I really can't complain here either. 

Some advice on dining here: Because the food is served family style and the portions differ significantly among dishes, I recommend hearing out your server's suggestions for course groupings in order to ensure there's a structure to the meal and that everyone is satisfactorily full at its conclusion.
author: Tal K.

description:
DANG IT! Another restaurant that's taken me too long to discover! This place was great. I probably should have written this review a little closer to my visit - but here's what I remember. GREAT prices (during the week with the Prix Fixe deal) - AMAZING food - INCREDIBLE atmosphere - GREAT service! Just go here...mmkay? I was here with a good friend, but man - this is such a perfect setting for a first date.  I'm a sucker for anything outside. Drinking, eating, lounging. Granted, this is sort of a faux-outside area as it's heated and covered - it's great. Even inside was nice. But coming here, I'd definitely want to sit on the patio. It's a much larger space than you'd think from the outside, or even walking past the bar inside.

On a first visit make sure you go sometime during the week and take advantage of their Prix Fixe menu. We had the truffled spaghetti (don't come here and skip that - you'll regret it if you do), the butter lettuce and endive salad (incredible), heirloom tomatoes (I hate tomatoes - so I didn't have that...but my friend enjoyed it), baked butterfish (not bad - I'd give it 3 or 4 stars) and the scallops (it wasn't on the Prix Fixe menu - but we had to have them. Glad we did - SO WORTH IT!)

Plenty of food. Great wine. Good price. Great atmosphere - 5 stars for that alone. Go here. Just do it. You'll love it.
author: Eli S.

description:
Ambience is amazing.  It has a very adorable patio in the back with heat lamps.  Great place for a date.  Great service.  

Seared Dayboat Scallops:  Delicious, goes well with the grilled asparagus. (4 stars)
Truffled Risotto with mushroom fricasse & reggiano: Very flavorful, but bathed in butter. (3 stars)
Salmon Tartare: Creamy, but needed a bit more salt. (2 stars)
Maple Leaf Duck Breast : Not impressive (2 stars)
author: Tiffany T.

description:
My reviews are based on quality for the price comparisons.  

Day Scallops( pricy): well cooked.  However, the bed of pasta was mushy and overcooked by a long shot.  Truffle was a decent accompaniment but overall plain.  

Bread w/ Salmon!!!: bla, plain, nothing really behind it

Duck: reduction sauce was lacking muster once again.  Duck was not juicy but rather leathery.  Sauce was just there and did not marry into the meal whatsoever.

Wines: red selection by the glass was work by obvious amateur who bought off Wine Spectators best buys list or something.  Vascos for a Bordeaux selection at a restaurant that holds itself out to be cusine was not impressive. 

Wow, I can't believe this place has received only positive reviews.
author: Susan K.

description:
What to say, what to say...

Went there with someone I care for very much...had an AMAZING dinner...great wine and it was very romantic. 

The food was outstanding...the service was just OK but I liked it because they weren't in my face every five mins while I was chewing asking if my meal was tasty! 

I would recommend this to anyone looking for a not so pricey place to impress someone you care about :0) 

Case in point: after sitting down to eat with our wine my date said "wow, you have such a knack for finding great little spots like this" 

Thanks yelp!
author: Ashley L.

description:
Yummmmmmmmmmm... isa gooood restaurant. Isa like that tucked away local Chinese food place that you love, you know, the one with the fantastic cuisine and the funny dcor. Isa goooood. Isa bit small, there is a back patio with Christmas tree lights and mismatched furniture and the walls look like they are covered in shower curtains. Isa-kay though, the service is goooood and the main highlight, THE FOOD!! 
Deliciously green asparagus soup and the sauted mushrooms -isa good combination! The flank steak was a bit chewy, but the wasabi sauce gave it a kick. My favorite was the scallop dish -over fluffy mashed potatoes and asparagus. After a bottle of wine, I couldn't refuse the flourless chocolate cake with the vanilla bean ice-cream was the perfect finish to a nice meal.
author: Rada I.

description: What a great place to go to for a date (the ambience is so cute)! The only thing is, I enjoyed the food more than my husband did. For our appetizers, we ordered a cheese plate and an arugula salad. The salad didn't taste too good, but the cheese was stellar! I kept on asking for more bread just so that I could eat more of the cheese.. but then again even without the bread the cheese was still good! I had the truffle mushroom risotto as my main course and my husband had the steak. That risotto melted in my mouth.. yumm! My husband enjoyed his steak very much too! Then came time for dessert.. I suggested for my husband to get the cheese plate, but he wanted to get the semifreddo like me. I loved it, but he didn't. Why didn't he listen to me in the first place? Our server was nice.. but when my husband made reservations ahead of time telling them that it was my birthday there was no candle on my dessert. I know it was a small mistake.. but I know some people like to feel extra special on their birthday! I would return.. but I don't think it would be with my husband...
author: Mertani G.

description:
Went here last week with the ladies.. Great setting inside.. nice dark kinda romantic setting.. I was a big fan of all the mirrors the open kitchen and the heated back patio.. 

We sat in the one cute romantic table inside! Brought our own wine and paid a $18 corkage fee.. kinda pricey but well it is the marina! I have the seafood risotto and it was to die for.. so good.. the portions are small but they load you up with tons of bread so you do get full it is just well mostly carbs! HAHA. 

My grip would have to be that we made a reservation via opentable and then had to wait 20 mins.. you should never have to wait on a reservation well more than five minutes. 

I think it is worth trying!
author: Samantha R.

description:
Isa was fancy, and was a great place to if what you are looking for is a very dimly lit, slow-ish service, and fair portions.  The food was tasty and very tastefully plated.  

Recommended dishes: crushed truffle risotto (cheesy, but the mushrooms were perfect), baked sablefish (baked in paper... moist and tasty), rocky jr. range chicken (very crisp and delicious with potatoes)

Consider this perhaps somewhere you'd like to go after work with friends or co-workers for a drink and some bites to mull over the latest gossip or just chat in a cozy and inviting (but not quiet) atmosphere.  Initially five stars (minus one for prices, noise level and for service as it was a bit slow since we had to flag waiters down several times for various simple requests --i.e. iced water).
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Went to Isa a few weeks ago with several friends and was a big fan of their food.  We ordered a bottle of champagne and a bottle of white to accompany our food.  We had the chicken, sides of zucchini, potato wrapped sea bass, and two tartares.  Everything was great and we left feeling extremely stuffed.  The service was quick (almost too a fault where you feel you have to rush).  

My irritation about this place is that, while I appreciate to hear what "most people" do, it doesn't mean I'm going to make the same decisions.  Our waiter must have told us 4-5 times that everyone should get an appetizer and an entree.  Again, I appreciate the opinion but I don't appreciate that after we made our orders (5-7 dishes for a table of 5,) the waiter thought he should warn us about how hungry we'll be when we leave.  It was a little rude, a little overbearing and left a sour taste in my mouth.  It almost seemed as though the fact that we didn't do everything as the waiter requested resulted in less attention/poor service.  

This is not to say we hated the place, since the food and atmosphere are great, but the waiter definitely put a damper on the meal since he was so pushy.  He ended the night with saying "I bet you're still hungry."  I can be playful with the best of them, but I didn't want to play with him, I wanted to slap him.

Go for the food, the ambiance and PLEASE order what you want.  We sat next to a couple who ordered one appetizer and one entree and I kept thinking that they would glance over at our group and think "They ordered a lot of food, what suckers" haha.
author: Erin C.

description:
Seared Foie Gras with brioche!

Potato wrapped Sea Bass!

Some espresso dessert ice cream like thingy!
author: b s.

description: Four of us came for dinner last Oct and it was a perfect dining experience. We arrived 5 mins from the end of the Happy Hour on a Saturday and the waiter not only gave us the happy hour prices on our 1st glasses of wine but also,gave us happy hour prices for our 2nd glass too!What a wise way to ensure that we will order that 2nd glass!And the wine was good!And he immediately asked if we were going to eat "family style" and then,proceeded to bring out our food in that order. So, we had the starters first with the salads coming out first,then the appetisers with seafood/meat-all two by two. Then,the main dishes were brought out with the seafood dishes first and the heavier sweetbreads and pork dishes later on - also two by two. We all loved all the dishes so will definately recommend it to all!
author: Renuka V.

description:
I've been to quite a few tapa places in the city and Isa definitely wins. 
I was here with a few girlfriends a few months back and we ordered A LOT of food. Everything turned out great! 

I'm not a fan of goat cheese but this place changed my mind. It was tasty and delicious and melts in your mouth! 

This is also the restaurant that introduced me to Russian River pinot noirs. Whatever they had there was probably one of the best reasonably priced wines I've had and complimented the tapas perfectly. 

The back patio is nicely decorated with dim lighting. Only down side is the slow service.
author: Nattie X.

description:
The tuna crudo, ceviche, local calamari and petite syrah are awesome!  Cool little spot, nice ambiance.  

Service is great and cool patio in the back.
author: Abel A.

description: Came for DAT with a group of friends, the atmosphere was great, the backyard patio setting was really nice and well laid out. Great wine list as well. Multiple dishes were ordered, I remember liking the Laura Goat Cheese, the Arguella salad, and my order of the duck breast. That was hands down the best. The flat-iron steak was so so and the fish was above average. I would go back again, but it is on the pricey side and I would probably rather spend my money on Luella or Town Hall or Spruce. But I'm reviewing this pretty much on the DAT deal and price.
author: mehul p.

description:
Oh my... next time I skip appetizers and main course and just order three of those flowerless chocolate cakes.
No, I will again have the mussels and flat iron steak and THEN three orders of the flowerless chocolate cakes.
Wait a minute, I should definitely try some other items on the menu as well... you'll see me here again soon!
PS. They now have a chef over from Japan for a couple of weeks. The spicy tuna roll is excellent!
author: Timmy T.

description:
This was so so so yummy!

I went with two others and we got:

* crab salad
* heirloom tomato salad
* baked goat cheese
* seared scallops
* roasted rack of lamb
* flat iron steak

nothing disappointed at all. And our server was a delight, explaining each dish to us and bringing a good energy to our meal. I will say though at times it felt like he was trying to sell us more - pushed dessert on us, encouraged us to get a side vegetable (even though the above amount of food was more than enough), encouraged more wine, etc. but when we said no, he nodded and left without condescension. 

I also enjoyed that it was delicious food, high quality ingredients, without a stuffy atmosphere. It felt very casual despite how good the food was. I like a place that doesn't feel like it needs to get more uptight as its food gets better. 

I will definitely be returning to try more.
author: Rachel D.

description: Loved the tapas style of service. Food was excellent as was the service. Wine selections were good but considering everything else..could have been better. Almost a 5 star evening.
author: Carol M.

description:
This place was marginally above average.

Service was definitely lacking.  The people at the front door were not very friendly.  Our server was sub par too. I was disappointed in the wine list too. I thought it was limited.  Flip side is that the wines by the bottle weren't that expensive.

We had the following dishes:
Calamari - tasty  and cooked right
Shellfish risotto - a little too cheezy
Mussels - great sauce and cooked right
Brussel Sprouts - delicious!
Rack of Lamb - over done
Cod or Halibut (can't remember)

Overall this place was average to slightly above average.  Would I recommend it...that's the question...i'm not sure.
author: Michelle H.

description:
If it's one thing i enjoy doing on my free time, it's giving a restaurant review from a night of dining out. 

Isa, to my surprise is very decent. Though parking was not the best I somehow got pretty lucky that evening. 

As I made my way into the restaurant I was beginning to set the mood for a very elegant setting. We were seated in the back lodge patio area. It was ambient and cozy. It seems the patio is where people prefer to sit. Seated almost immediately we were the earlier bunch arriving just shy of the dinner crowd on a monday night. it was packed by 7:30 that evening. 

I started off with the Washington Oysters. At $11 per half a dozen they were tiny! however, i do love the sauce! the bread and butter, compliment of the house was nice to keep us from starving while we wait. The food came out at different times and it was explained on the menu as to why. So I was forgiving on that because I dont mind if the chef spent a little more time to make the plate perfect. Afterall, it's not fast food. I wouldn't call this place fine dining either but it definitely has an attraction to people with some shiny jewelry and an older crowd. I dont mind the bling haha. 

Anyway, lot's of older asian people there. however, it is still well mixed. let's conitnue with the dishes. we started with the Prix Fixe menu, which i highly recommend for your buck! plus all drinks are $5 before 7pm during happy hour, even wine. Im disappointed that the wine list per glass weren't the best. I didnt want to spend a load on a bottle. Im sure the list is better for the bottles. 

Anyway, for my plate, i enjoyed it with a glass of merlot. after one glass i dont think i'd have another because i couldnt enjoy it anymore. I had the Prix Fixe dinner and started with the Lemon Dill Cured Salmon. It was different and very good. I just dont prefer my salmon cut into little cubes. But it was topped on fennel, radish, cucumber, and lemon mustard dressing. it paired very well together. My second course was the Grilled Natural Flat Iron Steak with layers of potato dauphinoise & cognac-green peppercorn demi- glace. it was very good since im not a big potato person. We shared dessert and the Semifreddo and Creme Brulee was very rewarding.

My friend had a Prix Fixe menu as well. She started off with Steamed Mussels in white wine with garlic, shallots, grilled bread & parsley. And that was really good. She ordered the Pasta with Clams. She didnt really care for it so i dont know if thats any good. I cant say since i didnt taste it. 

Another friend of mines started off with the Spicy Tuna as appetizers which was topped on avacado and something else. it was really good and different. The spicy tuna is also cut into cubes but the quality was perfect. She had scallops with brussel sprouts and they were very flavorful. I'd recommend that dish as well. She didnt do the prix fixe menu and instead chose a la carte and ended up paying more for her dinner. 

Overall, try the place out. Bring a date because it's nice and cozy. Semi-Casual dressing though it's not required. I had a great deal and my waiter was awesome enough to bring us some after dinner dessert drinks which was nice.
author: Lina P.

description: Isa is one of my top 10 restaurants for the past couple of years.  I was just there last night and haven't been their for 4 months.  I don't know what happened but I wasn't so impressed anymore.  Veal sweetbread looked like Kung Pao chicken.  Horrible horrible seabass.  It was tough and rough and tasteless.  I don't know where they got that seabass from.  It was worst than leftovers.  Steak ordered as rare was still tough and chewy.  Duck breast was OK.  Foie gras was OK.  Quail was delicious.  Chicken was awesome.  I wanted to order another chicken but they ran out.  Chicken and Quail was the best.  Before, all the food was good, now its getting weaker and also the menu hasn't changed.
author: Kevin L.

description: Marina is not really my favorite place for food, usually it's great for lunch or brunch but not dinner.  However, this place is an exception.  The food is great, the atmosphere can be romantic or social depending what you want, the back yard is under a tent with lots of plants.  While the food is entre style, you can share and that is what most people do.  This is not only a new trend but lets you try different things and not commit to one thing on the menu.
author: Inga W.

description:
i've probably walked up and down chestnut 100x and never noticed this gem (on steiner).  went here for a birthday dinner with 2 friends and had a great time.

faves: baked butterfish, mushroom risotto.  our server was exceptionally nice and the back patio was a fun little spot.

the only snafu in the evening was the incompetent reservation girl from the afternoon who didn't write down my reservation.  however, the dinner hostess was somewhat accommodating and got us a table after 15 minutes of waiting.
author: Priscilla T.

description:
Definitely not the the best restaurant I've ever been to. Not even close. 

This restaurant came overly recommended to me by a colleague. When we went we were very excited because we liked the feel of the restaurant (minus it's Marina location). We were seated immediately. Bonus.

But as the food haphazardly came out with random timing. Cooked appetizers with Raw seafood, which didn't even bother us cause we were starving. We were really disappointed. 

The food to sum it up was way overdone. You ever been to a restaurant where you get your food like raw oysters and the Chef is trying so hard to make something different and new tasting that you don't even know what you are eating? The flavors are so overwhelming that you can't taste what you are eating. That would sum it up. 

oyster mignet was overkill. Spicy tuna crudo 10 different flavors overkill. Baked Chevre basil pesto tomato pine nuts... overkill. Both the tuna and the chevre rich flavors could have been diffused by something crunchy and starchy. Crackers crostinis?

Flat iron steak covered in sauce. Cooked perfectly and then drowned in brown sauce. Potatoes made me get on that treadmill the next day with so much cream.

Medium to normal price tags. Much much smaller portions. 

San Francisco has so much more to offer.
author: john m.

description: Went to Isa's to celebrate a birthday with a party of 10.  We had a one year old with us.  We asked if they had a kid's menu, and our server said no, but would work with us.  He ended up bringing us a small bowl of spaghetti noodles w/ a little butter and parmesan cheese. Since I was hosting this large party, I paid the bill without closely looking at the details.  I was charged $19.00 for this small bowl of plain noodles.  After dropping nearly $500,  you would think they would comp  this or at most charge us $10, but $19.00????  Really???? At least they could have served us the sphaghetti sauce with truffle oil on the side!  Also, another thing that left a bad taste in our mouth was that our server told us the tip was included on our bill, which is to be expected for a large party.  But on my bill under "tip" was 0.00- so i asked my server if in fact the tip was included, since it said "0".  He said it was.  After getting home and looking at my bill, I noticed a charge of $73.00 under the beverage section and it was marked "open item".  So our server put the bill under beverage which means I had to pay tax and tip on the tip!!!!  Please be sure to look over your bill before paying.... shady things can happen.  I called and spoke to the manager about the incident, and she did offer to give me a credit the next time I'm there.... but I'm not sure there will be another time.
author: Irene W.

description:
The steak is awesome!!! ask for mash potato instead of the baked potato.
My bf liked the salmon tartar.
What we didn't like were the music. They played some salsa which did not match with the romantic feel that we were both looking for.
author: Tu N.

description:
Overall, definitely impressed with both the service and the food at Isa.  My friend and I were running late (stupid MUNI), so we called the restaurant to let them know.  When we showed up 20 minutes past our reservation time, we had to wait ~10-15 minutes.  You know what?  We were late first, so completely reasonable to have us wait.  Not to mention, the hostess kept reassuring us that she hadn't forgotten about us.  About 10 minutes into the wait, she offered us a free drink on the house.  Even though we were seated before it arrived, she still brought us each a glass of champagne.  VERY classy.  Then, we had cheeriest waiter ever - thoroughly enjoyed him.  

So, on to the important part, the food:
Asparagus soup - it was light and delicious.  less asparagus-y than i thought it would be, but that was a good thing.
Goat Cheese - my favorite thing on the menu.  it was absolutely delicious.  I could probably eat this all day, but then I would easily gain 10 lbs a week, so probably not a good idea
Truffle risotto - very well balanced between the mushrooms and the risotto.  Often risotto can get too creamy and heavy, but the chef here does a great job.
Brussel sprouts - Could have used a bit more browning, but otherwise not bad.

They apparently also have a prix fixe menu Sun - Thurs, so that might be interesting to try, especially since the chef will cater it to my vegetarian needs.
author: Olivia T.

description: Some of the most amazing food I've ever had. Luckily I was there with a big group and we shared all our dishes so I got to sample extensively from their menu. My favorites were the duck, the steak, and the sole. Our waiter Raul was awesome as well!
author: Madeline M.

description:
This is by far my favorite French restaurant.  The atmosphere and the food.. oh my.  I first came to this restaurant with my aunt and her friends.  The food was so awesome, I always wanted to return.  However, we forgot the name.  Then a few year passed (literally), our friend took us to a French restaurant and it was Isa!  I was so happy when I walked through the door and recognize the restaurant!  One must come with a few friends because you simply cannot eat everything on your own.  If everyone orders something different, you have a good spread of samples.  
Appetizers: Loved the Dungeness Crab Salad, Butter ' laitues ' salad, and Hudson valley grade A foie gras (there is always a threat of banning such tasty treat, so I have to have it)
Dishes to share: Seared scallops, Truffle risotto, Grilled golden gate natural angus flat iron steak, Northern Halibut a la plancha, and Roasted rack of lamb
Dessert: Buche Au Luit De Chèvre- aged goat / france, Flourless chocolate cake, vanilla bean gelato
Most excellent meal though there is a price tag to go with it.
author: Marilyn Y.

description:
I recently visited Isa with some friends.

we were seated in the covered patio area in the back, the decor was okay(it was patio furniture).  The restaurant got pretty packed that night but it didn't get too noisy where we could not have a pleasant coversation as we dined.

the waitress recommended we order about two dishes per person to share... we followed her advice and tried a alittle bit of everything...

Loch Duart salmon tartare
Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese
Spicy tuna crudo
WIld mushroom risotto
Maple leaf duck breast
Grilled creekstone natural flat iron steak
and a special Halibut dish

the standouts were the baked goat cheese, the duck breast and the risotto.  super delicious. 

dessert were pretty standard:
Flourless chocolate cake with vanilla bean gelato
Grapefruit granite
Vanilla bean crème brulée 
Semifreddo all' amaretto

i definitely would liked to try Isa again.  I want to have the foie gras next time i am here.
author: JR M.

description: Delightfully delicious!  I eat here as often as possible... Almost every month.  The chef  is wonderful, down to the last detail.  The staff is courteous and friendly.
author: Lisa B.

description:
A friend of mine decided to treat me to dinner to celebrate her good quarter at work. My thoughts were free food, delicious restaurant, good company. Score!

I had been hearing about Isa quite a bit and was surprised to see very few people in the restaurant when we arrived. We were given more menus than I would choose to flip through and after executively deciding against sushi, I was drawn to the prix fix menu. I found it a bit odd that a restaurant claiming to boast sharing dishes would have a 3 course prix fix, but we ran with it.

Overall, I would say this restaurant is confused. Pretty large portions that came at very random times on a table too small to even hold three dishes simultaneously. I was not particularly impressed by any of the flavors and had a hard time understanding what direction they were attempting to take with their assorted menu.

The wait staff was awkward and impersonal. At one point, I asked my waiter if a particular desert was good and when he had little to nothing to say about it, I commented that he didn't seem particularly excited by anything. He let me know it was because he was not American and chatty as we tend to be. Odd? It did end up turning into a bit of laugh for all of us and he gave us the desert for free, asserting it was quite delectable. 

Did I enjoy myself? Yes. Did I get full? Yes. Will I come back? It depends if someone else is paying.
author: Alicia J.

description:
I went here for a friend's birthday Friday, delicious! The food was served family style, and each plate I tried I loved. We first had the seafood risotto, which was pretty rich and creamy. You can only have so much of it, but it was still very tasty. Then the halibut, very succulent. Next, my favorite, the Fois Gras with peaches! I have never had fois gras before, and let me tell you..it was amazing. (I think i fell in love with liver that night) Then my other favorite, the duck. Served alongside with a balsamic salad I believe. Overall, Isa's food was great! 

The venue is a little small. Tables pretty close to each other---I felt like ol' grannie next to me was listening in to my perverted conversations. But it's nicely small in an intimate way I guess. So I suggest you go there with a small group of people or a one on one date.
author: Alexa M.

description:
This place was so far the best fine dining restaurant I've been to yet!!
My boyfriend and I went there last night for the first time and it was a great experience. The outside patio they have gets turned indoors with heaters and cute lighting. Not many customers the night we went since it was the day after Christmas. The waiter we had was extremely nice and so down to earth. He didn't treat us like second class citizens (as my boyfriend said) like other higher end places do.

Now for the food,
the plates are small but are to be shared. Our waiter recommended 4 plates between the two of us so we picked:
Dungeness crab salad
Salmon Tartare
Duck breast with Huckleberry Sauce
Rocky Jr. Chicken

and they were SO GOOOOOOOOOD. I cannot believe how well seasoned, flavored, all that good stufffffff it tasted.
The ingredients were also so fresh!!

My tongue was orgasming hahaha

Will come back again !!!
author: Teresa W.

description: I came here several times and love the mussels! I would like to come during the weekdays since they are always packed during the weekends. Their seafood are always fresh and the atmosphere is also really nice here. The only problem is hard to find parking here.
author: Jenny C.

description: This restaurant is absolutely darling! I went with my bf and we were really impressed with everything. The main dining room is technically an outdoor patio with heat lamps and string lights, but in such a sophisticated way. The server explained that every plate was small and the intention was to share, which was just perfect because my bf and i have the same taste in food, but more importantly, we share everything ;). I think we went through four bread baskets that night. We started with the butter lettuce salad and the baked goat cheese. the butter lettuce salad was amazing because of the beautiful pears and delicious dressing that came with it. my bf didn't love the goat cheese for some reason, but he seemed to eat most of it :P. I thought it was lovely because it was very easy to spread on our bread and i'm a huge goat cheese fan. the pesto and pinenuts that accompanied it really added a lot of flavor. Then we had the seared scallops with mashed potatoes, bacon, brussel sprouts and truffle sauce. This dish was AMAZING. i loved it so much because i havent seen too many scallop dishes prepared like it was at Isa. the scallops were succulent, the bacon was perfect, the sprouts were fresh, the potatoes were phenomenal and fluffy and the truffle sauce....self-explanatory. Can you go wrong with anything truffle-associated? nope! then we had the spaghetti with himalayan truffles. I've had better spaghetti but, again, the truffles just added so much to the dish. After, we had the pan roasted chicken with herbs, mashed potatoes, and jus de poulet. This chicken was cooked to perfection. So juicy and full of flavor. The potatoes on top of the jus were really delicious and the the herbs were underneath the crispy skin of the chicken, so every bite was awesome. For dessert, we had the semifreddo all'amaretto and the vanilla bean creme brulee. I love anything with amaretto, so the first dish was great with a beautiful presentation. My favorite dessert is creme brulee, and this one didn't wow me. Don't get me wrong, it was still good, but I always have high expectations of my desserts ;). I'm not a huge Malbec fan, but the wine we had was spectacular. Our server brought our food a little too fast, in my opinion, but he saved it when I was holding hands with my love across the table and he told us not to move because he "worked around moments like that" to encourage our romantic evening. Such a cute thing to say! Overall, this restaurant was darling and I can't wait to try more things on the menu.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Isa rivals Cortez as my preferred tapas restaurant in the city.  The food was amazing, but what really got me was the back patio area.  When my date told me he'd asked for patio seating I was nervous (it was really windy out), but with the tent and the heaters, it's really quite magical.  

The standout among the food we ordered was the salmon tartar, served on an avocado base.  It was simple enough, but the seasoning it did have was perfect.  For me that's what tapas should be all about--perfecting something simple & small without overwhelming you.  Isa really seems to have hit the mark with that.
author: Katie S.

description:
The listing for this place currently says that it's 'Asian Fusion'--what? The food didn't seem asian-influenced at all, unless you confuse American seafood with asian food because of the prevalence of seafood in Japanese cuisine. Whatever you call it, though, I call it delicious. 
The potato-wrapped sea bass was particularly good, as was the asparagus. Their salads were definitely overpriced, though, and the patio was too cold! I couldn't drink my water because I was freezing--I definitely should've asked them if they could turn on the heater closest to me. 

Be warned: This place definitely brings in the preppy Marina first-date crowd, and the tables are close enough together that you'll probably get to listen to the people next to you awkwardly (and annoyingly) getting to know one another. And you won't be able to make fun of them until later because they'd hear you. And let's face it--if you must expose yourself to Marina-ers, mocking them helps make it a lot more fun.
author: Rachel J.

description:
Yes, I gave it 5 stars.

I've recently discovered Isa, and I am saddened by how long it took me to find this gem. 

Every meal I have had here has been flavorful, succulent, outstanding...and I always leave wanting more.  The waiters are knowledgeable and very polite.  I love seafood, and the scallops I've had here are the best I have ever had.  HOWEVER: attention to the Isa staff:  i miss the scallops with the mashed potato and truffle sauce, please bring them back!  The newer version you've been preparing lately doesnt satisfy like those did. Oh, and I have to mention that truffle/basil/tomato spaghetti.  I dream of it.  And the baked goat cheese appetizer....

The only flaw in all of my experiences at Isa was one Friday trip a few weeks back...it was incredibly crowded and we had to wait 25 minutes for our table, and we did have a reservation.  However, they got back on my good side when a complimentary order of tar tar arrived at our table as soon as we were finally seated.  

Isa has crawled its way into my top 5 favorite restaurants.

Did I mention the charming ambiance?  Perfect date spot.  This one is a must, people.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
I came here once with my mom since I heard it was a little pricey and she's always looking for an excuse to hang out, SOOOOO....

Anyways, the table we sat at was kinda small, but we're not that big so it was bearable.  The food on the other hand was excellent.  The heirloom tomato caprese salad was yummy, the steak, tender, and whatever wine I was drinking hit the spot.  I don't really like fish at all, but the halibut my mom had was delicious.  The fact they could make fish taste good?  This place rocks.

It's a great date place, or somewhere to take the parents when they wanna treat you to some legit food thats not rice-a-roni.  Just dont be a scrub like me when you roll in.  oops.
author: Erika C.

description:
Isa has the BEST seared foie grois in SF!  Hands down.  Foie grois portions are pretty generous compared to other places in the city.  

Everything else was good, too, like the ceviche, Hallibut, service, wine, bathroom cleanness, etc.etc.  Honestly, I don't remember much other than the orgasm from the Foie Grois.
author: Sheryl S.

description: Really good food, but insanely slow service. The waiter said the kitchen was small and could cook all the entrees at one time, so they cycle through the different entrees on the menu.... whatever, it was slow.
author: Geoff R.

description:
This restaurant truly is excellent - one of the best that I've had since my roomie and I moved to the city.  We first went for a birthday dinner, and had the potato wrapped seabass, goat cheese spread and scallops....let me tell you each was amazing (I loved loved loved the goat cheese which was served with warm tomato and pesto/olive oil and bread and my roomie relished in the delectable scallops).  Wine list is fairly affordable - espcially for a restaurant of this caliber.  

Of course, we had to have dessert - and their chocolate cake and creme brulee did not disappoint!  In fact, we returned to the restaurant a week later in anticipation of most everything we ordered the first time!
author: Jen L.

description:
4.5/5.0
Went to Isa for Dine Out San Pellegrino a couple of months ago and was very impressed with the experience.  Everything we had was good, but the potato wrapped seabass was outstanding (I think I still remember what it tastes like...)!  I was not completely blown away by either of the desserts we ordered, but the seabass was a hard act to follow.
author: Grace W.

description:
Good food for a reasonable amount of money.  The front part of the restaurant is decorated in a more dark, subdued way, and in the back, there is a brighter "patio" type room, which seemed less swank and more "outdoor Italian pizzeria."  We sat the in darker front section.

The food was great.  We had the calamari, oysters, goat cheese, risotto, and duck breast with a side of green beans and mushrooms.  Everything was absolutely delicious, and reasonably priced.  I will definitely be coming back.

The service was friendly, if a bit odd.  I don't really know how else to describe it.  Beware of the floor - it's really slippery, and at least two patrons slipped while I was there (I was one of them!)
author: Rosalind C.

description:
Came here with the GF for last month as part of the San Pelligrino Dine Out program.  It's been a while so I don't remember exactly what we ate, but I do now that it was good.  The waiter was very attentive and we were seated promptly (despite being a little late due to the lack of parking in the neighborhood).  A few of the dishes that I do remember are the bruschetta, the GF's butterfish, the risotto, the creme brulee and the flourless chocolate cake w/ the gelato.

The butterfish was by far the highlight of the meal.  Nice and flaky wrapped in parchment paper.  The risotto seemed a little bland after having the butterfish first, so I wish these two had come out in the opposite order.  The creme brulee was a little sweet for me but the chocolate cake and gelato was very good.  I'd come back here again for their prix fixe menu.
author: Allan H.

description:
This was a last minute choice on our part and just phenomenal. The goat cheese with basil and pine nuts - very good. Very fresh tasting. The seared foie gras - some of the best we've ever had. The roasted duck breast . . . oh YUM YUM!! And the grilled flat iron steak, while the least "exotic" item we ordered, was still very good. The dessert, flourless chocolate cake, fell flat after all the delicious small plates. It wasn't offensive, just not distinctive either. Our server was that rare mix: attentive to our needs without being in our face and too cutesy and annoying. 

Awesome experience, we would highly recommend!

UPDATE: I'm taking back a star. On New Year's Eve we went to Isa and the food was phenomenal again. However - the service was beyond indifferent and just down right sucked. Another table got our dessert (which they proceeded to eat rather than mention the error to our waiter) and we ended up sitting there another 30 minutes waiting for someone to realize the error. Since we were in a corner, we couldn't even snag someone as they walked by because . . no one walked by! Very disappointing. We'll go back, because the food really is that good - but they may want to make sure they have people working who actually want to be there.
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
Isa is one of the best small plate restaurants in the city.  I've been there about four times and they've delivered every time.

Favorite dish was the duck with huckleberry sauce, and the truffled risotto was great.

The back patio is perfect for a date, but I'd avoid the tables by the kitchen.  Tables at Isa are so sought after that management has to stick people in nooks and crannies; I've dined by the kitchen and in a tiny nook by the front, neither have the ambiance of the back patio.
author: Nate H.

description:
I don't know what i was thinking with my last review. I think i was just on this trip that i was being too lenient, and Isa was the unfortunate casualty of that decision. Its easily one of my favorite spots in the city. The food is of high quality, prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere is casual. 

My GF and i took our folks there when both sets of them were in town, and even though it was like 2 months ago i can remember that we got goat cheese (oh my god), paella, risotto, a salad, a chicken dish, and a bunch of other stuff. It was all fantastic, and the food was better than any other time we've been there. I don't know how in the world they turn all that food out of that tiny kitchen. 

I think four is the ideal number for a meal at Isa. You can order a bunch of dishes, and everyone gets enough of everything that you can get a feel for the dish. Last time we went we had like 8, and that was just too many. Only two or three bits of each dish left me craving for more.

Yeah, the marina gets a bad rap, but this place is really good. Can't wait to go back.
author: Travis D.

description:
I wasn't quite sure what I was getting myself into. The only reason I gave this place 3 stars because I am not much of a seafood person. So aside from that...

grilled flank stank = awesome
creme brulee = more awesome

family style plates + lack of non seafood choices = not so awesome
author: Kevin M.

description: Cute little bar in the front until you walk into a circus tent that they call their main dining area. The lighting is atrocious. Yellow overtones doesn't do anyone or food any good. My former classmates and I gathered here for our quarterly girls night out. It was apparently tapas style so we all shared. The food was mediocre. Nothing to write home about except that there was a random lady wearing a pant suit (not sure if she worked there or was a lady off the street) that offered our table of 5 (3 pieces of bread) that were "straight from the oven" (really, who only makes 3 pieces of bread?), which our table thought was quite odd.
author: b p.

description: Came here with a group of 7 for 8pm rez, for Dine-About-Town.  The table was 40 min late, although the staff was very friendly.  Had champagne, wine, and an amazing 3 course dinner (all for only $60!).  The staff was trying their hardest, and even served us some dessert wine to compensate for the slow dessert arrival.  It seemed like throughout the night, there were consistent delays...small kitchen?  poor hostess skills?  Maybe it was the size of our party and this restaurant may be better for groups of 4 or less.  Excellent food.
author: Eric B.

description:
Foie Gras: heavenly. Pretty close to the one I had at Chapeau. 
Paper wrapped Butterfish: Buttery butterfish, all the flavors are seared in the fish because of the paper wrap.
Risotto was OK.
Duck Breast: yummy combination of flavors, love the huckleberries and port sauce.

Awesome patio area for a romantic dinner atmosphere. We kept getting comps because my friend knew the server/host very well. He gave us free oyster, free champagn, and muscato with our dessert. Sweet guy!

The whole dining experience is really really great, delicious food, excellent service, and intimate setting. A perfect place to take a date to.
author: Yuchi C.

description: Had eaten at Isa a couple of times many years ago and went again recently.  Still as wonderful as I remembered.  Happened to be there during the week at happy hour so sat at the bar and enjoyed drinks made with the freshest juices ever.  The paella was outstanding - a generous serving with fresh flavorful perfectly cooked sea food.  Ambiance is lovely, and staff was friendly.
author: Ash A.

description:
I heart Isa!
