We were a party of six and I think we ordered too much. But it was reasonable and we had fun. I would take my in-laws there.:-)
author: Neile R.

description: isa was an incredibly delicious surprise!  i had never heard of this restaurant, saw that it was french, and was not expecting too much for our dinner.  the food blew all of us away (and it did NOT seem french at ALL to me, but just fresh california cuisine).  we shared a lot of appetizers: heirloom tomato salad, dungeness crab salad, grilled calimari with honey spice and beans, sauteed wild prawns...they were all very delicious and flavorful.  everything tasted very fresh.  i ended up ordering the prawns as my main, too.  the dish was simple, but tasty, and the sauce made a great dip for the bread.  service was attentive, but not overly so, which was nice as well.  we had a great dining experience here!
author: micaela r.

description: This place is fabulous! I went for the second time on Friday night. Just as pleased as I was the first time! We had the ahi tuna, the goat cheese, the sea bass (which is my favorite) the steak, the rigatoni and the veggie medley. Our server was excellent, took care of everything and was very helpful in our selections.  I like that the food is prompt, but I have never felt rushed! Overall great experience both times!
author: Lisa K.

description: The outside area with lights is romatic. I like the portion size and food!  It is off Chestnut, so after dinner a neighborhood wine bar or movie are perfect!
author: Vanessa B.

description: I love ISA. It is one of the palces in the Marina that I will contiue to go back to . The patio is quaint, the waiters helpful and friendly, and (naturally) the food is phenomenal. From the pear salad to the risotto (a personal fav) to the tuna tartar...you won't be disappointed!  It's a good idea to make a reservation though...I'm not the only one who has found this great place! :) Now...it's your turn!
author: Tracy K.

description:
The food is good & fresh, the plates are small and fairly expensive. The meats were impressively tender (we had duck and lamb).

Four stars for the atmosphere, four stars for the food, three stars for the service. Overall good experience.
author: S. M.

description: These place have the nice oyster and the lobster bisque. Great customer service. Will go again one of these days
author: Peter C.

description:
This wasn't my choice, usually avoid the marina, but this choice is a winner!
the back patio seating area is a cool spot for dinner. Our waiter may have been the low point of the night, but he didn't take away from it either. but i won't go to dinner to critique waiters, i go to eat!
We started with foie gras with vanilla brioche and poached pear. the foie was perfectly seared, and there were 2 pieces, 1 for each of us. great taste combo.
next up was arguably the dish of the night, the butterfish en papiote(sp?) mushrooms and truffle, yum!
followed that up with the sweetbreads, which were yummy, nothing more to say.
and finished with the flank steak, which had the blue cheese sauce which was awesome. and the side veggies, squash in particular, were perfectly cooked.
no room for dessert, but we had a few nice glasses of wine with the meal. 
i may still avoid the marina, but i can return here for sure
author: Rich B.

description:
one of my favorite restaurants in the city and places to take friends from out of town. consistent good food and service. favorites include the sweetbreads, scallops, and chicken- i usually never order the chicken but this was cooked perfectly, and every bite was full of flavor.

was disappointed to see that the sea bass was missing from the menu this past weekend, it was one of my favorites. 

the desserts are fine but the highlights are the main courses
author: pancakegirl l.

description: The food is great, but not 5 star worthy.  Seating is a bit cramped so I wouldn't recommend this place for large groups.  Ask to sit in the back patio rather than the front room, which to me seems to lack decent lighting.  I was able to sample more than half their menu, but I'd have to say the one dish that pleasantly surprised me was the foie gras.  I've only had foie gras in Japan so this was my first experience of having foie gras here.  I definitely was not disappointed.  I'd return just to order the foie gras again.  The service was only okay.  We asked for things more than being offered and it always wasn't from our designated waiter.  Over-all though, Isa is a restaurant I would definitely recommend and come back to.
author: Caroline E.

description: I've been here a few times, once was stellar...the other...well....was not.  Sit in the back patio with all of the twinkle lights for nice atmosphere.  The service was slow both times so be prepared to be there for a while.  They have a great wine list and the food is creative and usually fairly good.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: My party of eight had a great time at Isa.  The food was really yummy.  Because of the tapas theme, we all had a taste of the great dishes.  We raved about the range chicken, flat iron steak, goat cheese, and risotto.  As mentioned by other reviewers, the kitchen is small, so the food come a little slow.  But once the first plate arrived, we were happy with the pace.  The following plates arrived before the previous one was completely devoured.  Great selection, great food, great time.
author: Funk G.

description: I try to come here when I'm in the area/in the mood for something special.  Service can be spotty, but the environment is very cozy/lovely, and the seafood dishes are especially flavorful and satisfying.  Portions run on the small side.  In my experience, this has been a great restaurant for 3-5 good friends (as opposed to large parties/families)
author: J T.

description: We went here for my bday and I've enjoyed every second of it, the scallops are the best. I had my first experience with foie gras and it was awsome, the lamb chops just about tops any i've had before. The food was well presented, eventhought it was small portioned its actually enough to keep you stuffed. The service was great very nice, explained how everything works and recommended the scallops which was the best suggestion.  i cant wait to go back, this place is well worth it.
author: kevin t.

description: The food here and the service here is excellent! Bojan was a very good waiter, catering to all our needs. The prix fixe menu had excellent choices, we couldn't go wrong! We ordered all seafood dishes and they aren't stingy on the portions either! Bojan makes very good drinks and when another waiter botched it, he personally went to remake it himself. I would definitely go back to have more of their mussels, ling cod, and bouillorbaise! Romantic ambiance perfect for couples too :-) Overall, excellent food at a very decent price!
author: Ellie Y.

description: Love this place! The back patio is lovely!  Its not super fancy and the food is delicious.  I always get the baked goat cheese-this is TO DIE FOR. the paella is delicious and full of fresh seafood, halibut is moist and fresh, steak is succulent, the truffle risotto is a must and the flourless chocholate cake is sooo yummy! the waiters are very friendly and attentive.  overall I love this place!
author: Erin Elizabeth K.

description: I have eaten there many times since my last review. Although the food is still good, it's not quite as amazing as it was the first couple of times I went there. Also, it's a bit overpriced.
author: Adelle W.

description: very cozy... food is very good and so is service... price point is not too expensive and it is best if u can sit in the back with the heat lamps... very romantic or as a group gathering.
author: Valerie A.

description: Honestly, I still don't get all the hype about Isa. The focus here is small plates. In fact, there are no large plates. Want a slab of meat? Better order 2 (or 5 if you're a group of 12). Salad? There are only a handful of greens on the plate, so again, order several. Yet the prices are phenomenally outrageous, so your normal-sized salad (3 plates or so) would cost $24. Also, when I ordered the "veggie" options of risotto and asparagus soup, I was told both used chicken stock. Why, people? What's wrong w/veggie stock, a little olive oil, and some salt? Tastes the same. Really. We're in California, not some backwards country like Florida. Wine list is great, as are desserts (which are normal-sized all on their own). Back covered patio is nice, but the wait staff can at times be pushy. Oh, and they serve foie gras. Ick.
author: Bee H.

description:
I don't know if its the twinkle lights or the feeling that you're so close to being outdoors, but the main room at Isa is always fun. The wide ranging menu doesn't hurt but its the quality of the food keeps me coming back.

A few nights ago I had reservations and we arrived on time. The waitress wanted to seat us near the bar but when I go to Isa the restaurant is the back room. Who wants to sit near the bar at Isa? She was friendly enough and quickly found us a table in the back. Nice. The place was packed and the  room was buzzing. The waitress definitely had her hands full but was friendly and zipped around the room. Menus came and we ordered quickly. Chilled Skookum Oysters on the Half Shell with a spicy citrus & mint sauce. Baked Laura Chenel Goat Cheese with basil pesto, tomato concasse & pinenuts. Leek & Potato Soup with fresh herbs & caramelized butter crushed truffles. Al dente Spaghetti with Crushed Black Truffles in tomato confit & basil broth. Baked Butterfish in Paper with truffles, king trumpets & haricot verts. Will that be enough for two? Absolutely. Yum. I ordered a half bottle of 2002 Red Burgundy, Chassagne Montrachet. (My dinner partner was my 18 year old daughter so I drank alone.)

The oysters were fresh and plump and disappeared quickly. The goat cheese was just right although its pretty hard to mess that up. The soup was fine although a bit light on flavor. The leeks were a bit shy but the texture was right and it was served hot...the way soup should be served but frequently isn't. The spaghetti was al dente and the truffle bits were wonderful. The butterfish was light, flakey and flavorful. Perfect.

Service, food and ambiance all work together for a place with its own personality. I've never been disappointed at Isa...it always delivers great food and fun.
author: Gary C.

description: Isa's is amazing! Its traditional menu offers portions to share with your party. I definitely recommend calling ahead because the wait times can be rather long. Even though you cram into the bar for a drink beforehand, it's worthwhile to make sure you have a reservation. I also recommend asking for a table outside on the back patio. The lighting and ambiance of the patio creates a warm feel, and for sure makes the meal that much more special. If you're in the Marina, stop by Isa's!
author: Jonathan D.

description: Some of the best food I've had in recent memory--very creative and beautifully presented. I was here for a private company dinner for 50 people and the restaurant reserved the back tent for us. Dinner consisted of a variety of small plates served family style. Most memorable dishes for me were the seared scallops with mashed potatoes and caramelized brussel sprouts, duck breast with roasted beets, and the to-die-for flourless chocolate cake with vanilla gelato. Downside was the risotto with mushrooms--the rice was undercooked, but someone said that that's how risotto is done sometimes. There was a recurring theme of truffle oil in our food; I don't know if that was the doing of our event planner or the chef's idea, but it was a little too much for me. Overall, great experience.
author: Susan H.

description: Great place, great atmosphere.  6 doods chillin and actually like the place.  Some of us actually talked about taking the significant others' back to try it.  Seafood was great and service was not too bad.  Had the iron steak and it was a bit salty but still great!
author: Chekmate M.

description:
While I'm typically more of a hole-in-the-wall crappy ethnic food joint kind of girl, I'm glad I gave this Marina restaurant a try.  Came here for a date, and ended up at the cozy little table for two in the front. Cute spot.

I'd checked out the menu before coming here because I wanted to be prepared, but when I arrived, the number of yummy options made my head spin.  I ended up ordering from the prix fixe menu (quite a bargain at $22), and my date did the same.  I chose the baked goat cheese with tomatoes and pine nuts and my date picked the asparagus soup for the first course.  The goat cheese was soft and warm and the combination of tomatoes, olive oil, pine nuts, and spices complemented it perfectly.  Nothing overpowered anything else, and it just melted in your mouth.  The asparagus soup was extraordinary - just salty enough, not too asparagus-y, and not the least bit bitter, as asparagus can sometimes be.   I was a little surprised to see that the food was served family style (kind of weird to share a bowl of soup with someone you don't know all that well), but I don't really mind that sort of thing, so it was alright.

For the second course, I ordered the seafood pasta, which was fabulous - a totally different kind of noodle than I've ever had before, and it was cooked just right.  The tomatoes and arugula were really nice, and the calamari, shrimp and mussels were perfect - not overcooked at all.  As good as all that was, nothing compared to the paella.  Now, I've lived in Spain (for a year and a half total), so I know good and bad paella.  I've had weird fusiony paella way too many times here in the states, and I'm always reluctant to order it (even at most Spanish restaurants) ESPECIALLY when the word "fusion" is attached to the restaurant.  This paella, on the other hand, was perfect.  Just the right amount of saffron, great seafood, and even lima beans (most places wouldn't even dare!).  Eaten with a piece of bread, it was like being back in Spain in my flamenco teacher's dad's restaurant.  Needless to say, I'd be glad to go back for a helping of this paella (or pretty much anything on the menu, for that matter)!

Great date spot, great food, great wine - I highly recommend it!
author: Jenni K.

description:
I planned on going to Isa with my 2 girlfriends to celebrate my birthday. I thought it would be a great place to take them, since they are from out of town, and Isa got a lot of great reviews. When we walked in the door however, it was a totally different story. 
First, the hostesses were no where to be found for a good 5minutes. Due to this fact, the entry way got extremely full, since everyone was trying to check in for their reservation. Get bumped and pushed in a restaurant by people trying to check in, is no way to start your birthday celebration. When the hostesses finally came, they checked in people one at a time, then would run off and leave the hostess station again! WTF! Its a Friday night! The restaurant entry is packed with people, and you are just going to leave them hanging???? 
When we finally got seated, our waiter gave us menus and began explaining the menu in great detail, which was very appreciated. However, he began to attend to the other tables around us, and didn't come back for 15minutes. My friends and I were STARVING at this point; we ate all the bread in the bread basket and still nothing from our waiter. Finally my friend had to track him down when he was in between tables to remind him that we had not ordered yet. Then he was trying to push us to order 6 plates for 3 people. When we only ordered 5 plates, he was so insistent that we order 6. Seriously, we do not need to be forced to eat, if we want to order more, we will! 

The only saving grace for Isa is its food. I must admit the food is EXCELLENT. We had the foie gras, crab salad, mussels, ahi tuna, and the lamb. Everything was sooo good! The back patio is decorated so well, it is a cute place to go with your friends, or a romantic date spot. 

If only the service was better....
author: yndrfn k.

description:
Isa offers among the best food I've had in my life, period.  We came here for dinner just happening to walk by, attracted by the delightful patio seating in the back, but were blown away by the food.  Every selection we ordered was delicious and incredibly well thought out by a master chef.  Ingredients that you wouldn't imagine together combined in literally sensational ways.

Don't miss out on the foie gras dish.  Eat all the pieces together as a combination.  I have never experienced such good foie gras.

Service was excellent, and the atmosphere was just right: classy yet casual.  Wonderful, wonderful experience.

I would recommend this place to anyone without hesitation.
author: B R.

description:
Unbelievably good.  Our favorite restaurant! (and there are obviously a lot of good ones in SF)

Food is amazing.... start with the Oysters, then a bottle of the Medlock Ames blend (red wine).  You can't go wrong with the goat cheese (one of my favorites), foie gras, scallops, risotto, and the flat iron steak.  My fiance never liked scallops until we ate them here, seriously.

Go for the oysters (again) as dessert... why not?

Also ask for Jonathan as your waiter - very cool guy and not pushy.  He knows his wines and can recommend something great for you.

We love sitting out in the tent area, as it helps to complete the experience.  What an awesome restaurant.
author: John S.

description: nice ambiance...really great foie gras! I had Seas Bass which was great...nice wine collection
author: Mahyar K.

description:
I visited Isa on this particular occasion for Dine About Town.  I've been to this restaurant maybe 3 times, but this was the first time I was extremely disappointed.  Usually when we do DAT, we decide on the restaurant based on what they post on the DAT website.  I had already picked out my dishes (yellowfin tuna, maple leaf farm duck breast, and a flourless chocolate cake for dessert).  When the waiter handed us the DAT menu, I was surprised that NONE of these options were on the menu.  Not only that, but none of the other solid backups posted on the website were on the DAT menu either, but all of the items were on the regular menu (and of course no exceptions).  I felt completely misled, and when I mentioned to the waiter that I found it disappointing, he just said "Oh really?  Not sure why they did that."  And that was all. 
      I ended up getting ordering off of the regular menu and while it was still good, I felt that their DAT menu on the website was incredibly misleading.
author: Lisa K.

description: Update:  I held my birthday here this fall with about a dozen people.  It was just wonderful.  Next year, I'm renting the whole back patio.  Which reminded me, this is a great place to have a festive event.
author: Down Dog Y.

description: Since I can't give 4 1/2, five it is.  We went for a friend's birthday, and everything was delicious.  Plus, the outdoor tent area was beautiful.  The truffle risotto had my veggie-hating "if it doesn't have meat in it it's not worth my time" friend's vote for favorite dish.  And it was THAT good.
author: Caitlin O.

description:
NIce patio as everyone describes.  I feel the place is over rated and has lost its quality -- the seasoning of the food -- the quality or knack that makes a place turn from ok or good to yuppy is missing.  The tuna crudo needed acid and a tad bit of salt -- the crab salad was good but needed the oomph. 

The Fois Gras did have the oomp with the brioche and the generous portions as were the oysters and their dressing.  The chicken was excellent as was the sea food Risotto

Service is mediocre when the restaurant is full and it can make a potentially good experience into an ok experience.  

Add more wait staff, taste the food and get it to yummy stage. . 

I do
author: Kam G.

description:
Great food & great ambiance....thx to Yelpers we requested a table on the patio and definitely worth it even if it was a little cold! Had the Tuna Tartare good, Sea Bass good but the AWESOME award goes to the Halibut!
Would give it 5 stars if it wasn't for the disappointing cocktails....luckily we took a nice bottle of Flowers Pinot.
author: dawn w.

description: Isa has the most charming atmosphere with an outside covered patio.  It would be a perfect date place, but I went here with a girlfriend.  I had a great bubbly champagne to go along with my dinner.  They have the most amazing lobster broth.  It tastes like a bisque without the heaviness and the calories!  I also had a lamb and mushroom risotto dish that was absolutely amazing.  Their dishes are unique and portions are appetizer like so you can taste many things without getting too full.  Isa is also reasonably priced and good value for your money.  I would definitely recommend Isa's and will be back.
author: Dbear T.

description: What can I say? You gotta go there...lots of lil plates...make sure you try everything...Will definitely soooooth the palate! Great service, good ambiance....and again another good eats...
author: bo y.

description:
4 stars is about right.

Good food, good service in an ok space.

A lot of good solid dishes, though nothing that stands out as extraordinary and nothing that is bad.  The tuna tartare was nice and the scallops were very good.  The maple flavoring on the squid was the low point of the dinner.  The black cod in paper was very good, especially because of the nice mixed mushrooms included.

The rear patio dining was ok, but way too hot with the gas lanterns lit and the lighting was way too bright.  The front space is nice and darkly lit, but also stuffy.  Korea is a mostly cold place, so why is the staff (which includes many Koreans) keeping the place so terribly hot???
author: Richard P.

description:
After a bit of a slow start getting us to a table, we realized we were in for a treat.  Anyone who goes to a restaurant for the first time looks at what people around them are eating.  My girlfriend and I knew from the second we sat down in one of their coveted outside tables this was going to be good.  Their menu is nothing elaborate or expansive.  This is ok.  There is most certainly something on the menu for everyone to enjoy.  As the food is brought out for the table to share, we decided to order two appetizers and two main courses.  We started with Tuna Tar-Tar, which was very fresh, tasted great, and presented very nicely.  Anyone who doesn't like avocado with fresh tuna can stop reading this NOW.  We then got the seared sea scallops.  Most definitely the sweetest scallops I have ever had.  We also got Paella and the stuffed chicken.  The herb stuffed chicken was fantastic, the paella was very good.  Of course we had to try the flour less chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream too.  Not too shabby at all.  If I could change anything about the restaurant it would be for them to have a full bar.  If you are a wine drinker, you will have no problem, they have a good selection.  
All in all, we were very pleased with our meal.  Good spot to go with a group of friends.  It seemed very casual outside, maybe inside it was a bit more formal.
author: Mike G.

description:
Isa only gets three stars because of what they have become over the past couple of years. My family and I use to go to Isa for all our birthday dinners and anniversarys etc etc...but not anymore because of their recent downgrade in food quality. 
Favorites of mine are the lobster bisque, crap salad, lamb, and foie gras.
Last time I went, I noticed that the prices for the dishes went down by $.25-.50   I was happy about that of course. But then I realized why they went down. The lobster bisque had noticeably less lobster, the lamb chops turned into poorly cooked cheaper parts of lamb, and the foie gras--my favoriteeee--was definitely not the same as it was before. 

yes price cuts are nice, but if it's to compromise the taste and quality of the food, then no thank you--i'd rather pay that extra 25 cents.
author: Leslie C.

description: I met my friend for dinner here the other night. The food was excellent and reasonably priced for what you get. My friend ordered the foie gras, and boy, what a bargain! The piece she got was the size of a steak. We shared raw oysters which were delicious. Her scallop entree and my sea bass entree were both generously portioned and really good. We'll have to go back during the week to try their pre fixe menu for a better deal.
author: Margaret C.

description: My boyfriend and I love Isa. We visited San Francisco last November and ate there. We were so pleased! The mushroom risotto was not a dish, it was an experience. We talked about it often(and even tried creating it ourselves) until we finally went back this November. We ordered the risotto again and wow, is it delicious! We also had the Laura Chenel goat cheese which is perfect. The arugula salad was so fresh and amazing. Let's just say I was tempted to lick each plate clean, but that probably would have been frowned upon in such a nice place :-)  Service was outstanding. Our waiter was so enthusiastic about food and wine, exactly what I like in a server. Nice romantic setting, but make sure you reserve in advance.
author: Dawn G.

description: Enjoyable outside patio.  Try the osyters (delicious citrus sauce!), lobster broth and salmon salad.  Skip the paella (bland) and roasted veggies (average.)  5 items, plus drinks and a 1/2 bottle of wine was $100 for two.
author: JP D.

description: Delicious.  Consistent.  Great service, wine list and menu.  Pricey but not ridiculous.  Get the goat cheese appetizer!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I really enjoyed my dinner here.  The food was fabulous.

The flat iron steak was the best I have ever had, no kidding.

The mushroom risotto was also excellent.

The hierloom tomatoes were fresh, but way too pricey for the portion. 

I was a little bit disappointed by how many tables are cramped inside the restaurant.  So I would not recommend this restaurant if you want some privacy with your date.  If you just come for the food, you have my wholehearted endorsement.
author: Alan P.

description:
I went to Isa for dinner last Friday. It was...okay. One might save a few dollars ordering from the DAT menu versus the normal menu, but if one tends to order a salad, a risotto or chicken and a dessert, you're probably better off with the normal menu pricing.

Food wise. I'm not sure why this place gets rave reviews.  The mignonette sauce for the raw oysters had too much vinegar/acid. The dungeness crab salad had a good balance of crab, and citrus fruit for acidity, but is missing another ingredient to take it to the next level. The baked goat cheese was okay, but the cheese taste and texture dominates the taste of pesto and pinenuts. The high point was probably the duck breast, but the fat wasn't rendered out enough, and the skin was mushy but the sauce and the meat texture were well executed. The sweetbreads were just mediocre. Taste, texture, plate composition were just messy and rough. A note for vegetarians: the soup and the risotto are not vegetarian friendly, as they use a meat broth. The "vegetarian plate" is only main dish available and is basically a mishmash of the vegetables and non-meat items from other dishes thrown into one plate. 

For dessert, the gelato was actually pretty good. I wonder from where they source it. The creme brulee has a decent caramel top, but the custard inside is definitely very light. It did not have texture of a normal custard.

Ambiance wise, the back seating room can get very,very loud and impossible to talk without basically yelling. At the end of the night, my throat was a little sore. The front room tends to be noisier earlier in the night, but 9pm on, it empties out and is quieter.

Overall, I think the price range of Isa allows people to give a good review partially because of value, but mediocre food is still mediocre food. Chapeau! is a better restaurant in the same price range.
author: Cary W.

description:
mmmm.....  food was good.  Service was just so so...  Or by my brother's definition, probably not good at all!  

We had a party of 6, and we were cramped at a table that's for four.  How could we tell?  Right next to us, there's a party of four and they had the same size table.  Well, I think we would have been okay if the waiter's response to us changing to a bigger/more comfortable table was more friendly or shall we say appropriate?

When we asked if we could get a bigger table, waiter's response was:  "Have you been to Defina?  (with an attitutude)  their table is much smaller than ours!"  Sheesh...  as I can remember, Delfina has much better food than they do!  And freaking waiter shouldn't be giving an attitude!

Anyways...  I really do hope that they'll keep up the good work with the food and hire servers with good attitude.

Food at the end was still goood....  Waiter at the end was still a bit annoying....  Parking is very difficult......
author: bubu s.

description:
Fantastic service (Almost over the top - could not digest the 5 minute spiel from our waiter regarding the menu and dishes), with average food.

The Foe Gras, as much as everyone raves about it, was disappointing in my mind. Probably due to the hype I had read prior to going to Isa.

Very nice, intimate setting on the patio.
author: Paul L.

description:
Isa is that kind of place that as soon as you discover it, you are talking about to go back every week.    Every dish is succinct, delish and has a balance of complexity that perks its aroma.  We ordered seabass, Fuji apple salad,  honey roasted calamari, and something i can not recall, each one could be a signature dish at any restaurant.  
The bread is so good that I can not stop eating, consider I usually don't touch bread basket at restaurant.  The place is warm, casual and festive. 
I am going back next week.
author: Josephine J.

description: A rare gem serving up culinary delights in an affordable price range.  One of the only restaurants where I wish I had a bigger stomach and four hours to spare for dinner.
author: Madama M.

description: Great service, I took my family there to meet my fiance's family prior to our engagement. It was a nice atmosphere and fun food. Everyone had a great time and the super attentative waitress made it great. Father is hard to please. The food was good, not great.
author: Kim K.

description: I'm not going to go into detail about this place.  I will say that it is a constant winner.  Lets just say I've been to the place over 10 times in 3 years.  It never fails to impress.  A great place for a casual dinner.  I've recommended it to many and they all have had great experiences.  One of my favorites for sure.
author: scott g.

description:
I finally tried Isa after hearing nothing but wonderful things about the restaurant from a co worker.   She was right the food was delicious and not to mention the ambiance was perfect.  

I went with my family and we sat outside surrounded by heat lamps it was perfect.   We were all so pleased with each dish we ordered.   I was told to order the scallops they literally melted in your mouth... they were amazing.  I also would recommend the butterfish, steak, and the crab salad.  I do not think you can go worng with anything you order from Isa.   

Not only was the food fantastic but the service was great.   I am defiently going to recommend this restaurant to everyone.   I can not wait to go back and enjoy a glass of wine and the impeccable food.
author: Margot H.

description: Tasty food, lovely atmosphere, great service and the plate sharing concept was lots of fun.  I'd definitely eat here again!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Lil things do come in Big Packages.  This is how i feel about this about a restaurant/bar called "Isa".    Food was "fantabulously" tasty w/ the sweet smell of fresh ingredients pouring out onto the dishes we ordered that sweet saturday night.  Dishes are served in a staggered system for the main Entree.  Meaning entrees are meant to be shared.  Almost like tapas style but not.  :D  I higly recommend the Maine lobster broth, Baked Chenel goat cheese and the Al dente crushed Black truffle spaghetti.  Saffron Paella i had mixed feelings about though.  I liked the fact that it was solely a "seafood" paella.  i am a big fan of this version than the ones w/ sausage or chicken kind.  although i was not to fond of the consistency of the rice when it was brought to our table.  Paella has nice al dente texture rice but i was looking for that part where there is a crusty top & bottom w/ chewy rice in the middle.   it would be also be nice if they presented the paella dish in a mini paella black iron pan to have that orangey saffron color contrasting w/ the black iron pan.

Overall though my wife and I had a wonderful dining experience from 1st course till the 4th.   It does help that this is one of our fave strip in the city where you find good stores (w/out too many tourist), good eats and places where u can chill out for a drink or two.  Parking on weekends gets crazy so to combat that we normally take the bus to get here to shop and dine. 

Let me make mention of the great service everytime so far.  You can tell servers are well informed and are focus on quality of service.  Our server even chased us out the door to thank us for dining at Isa although i was alil embarassed since i thought he was chasing me for the bill.  LOL!

Reservation is a must after 630pm since this place draws a crowd.   

Food = 4.3 stars, Service = 5.0, Ambiance = 3.5 & Parking = 2.0
author: Angel C.

description:
Uh...not what i expected...perhaps I'm fat and lazy, but I like to sit in comfortably seating during dinner. Instead, i was up on a high chair, pinned in a tiny little window space...

The food was good but, in this city, there's a lot of great food, so you have to do everything else right....

The wait staff was very friendly.
author: JD D.

description: Isa.... a place to truly wine and dine, The lobster bisque is truly dreamy. The other tapas depending on what you like is great. The owner wife is an exceptional hostess to our table. Oh yeah you have to try the butterfish it is smooth and velvety. Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm:)_
author: jacqueline c.

description: Loved this place!!! Went with our foodie friends and and had most of their dishes including the foie gras that was awesome and a large portion as well....scallops were good, lamb was great and so was the beef...delish duck and chocolate souffle w/ gelato desert...There's a few other items I'm not remembering.....loved the hot bread/ butter....bf kept eating it.....Overall an Awesome place...only downside was that they served the tapas mostly altogether instead of one by one...Have got to go back and get the short ribs! Price was right also....would definitely return again
author: lani p.

description: Truly excellent - I've loved it every time I've been there.  Get the two- or three-course options...definitely worth the money.  Really creative flavor pairings, a nice but low-key ambience, and friendly service.   Took my wife here for a surprise birthday dinner and she loved it!
author: S J.

description: The service was AWFUL!  Our waiter honestly couldn't be bothered to actually wait on us.  He got our orders wrong, was never available (even a mere drink order took forever), and seemed totally disinterested and rude.  The food was fine, but not worth the price.  I have no idea what all the buzz is about.  I will never come back here.
author: Em C.

description:
not only does this place serve delicious food, but the service is top notch. my water glass never got below 1/2 full! the staff is friendly and professional, the "french tapas" cuisine never disappoints. there is enough variety on the menu to appease adventuresome diners (sweet breads, duck, etc.), but enough "normal stuff" (chicken with mashed potatoes). my ultimate fav is the goat cheese...mmmmm!

oh, and you can almost always make a last minute reservation, even on the weekend. that in and of itself is worth 5 stars in sf!
author: A M.

description: Great Food!!! The scallops are well caramelized.....my favorite! Space wise, it's literally rubbing elbows with the table next to you. But great food....
author: freewill m.

description: they have a good deal, prix fixe menu if you go early.  It a nice small intimate place with good solid food, but i really believe they need to crank up the heat.  I had to keep my  jacket on and don't sit by the door.
author: Yen T.

description:
I can't say anything about the food as I didn't wait around to have any of it.   The place was pretty much empty when we got there, yet the hostess wouldn't even acknowledge our presence as she was on the phone.  She finally sat us in the patio area, but I asked to be seated inside.  She offered us the worst table in the house (side by side seating for 2).  I asked for another table.  Then we waited for a waiter to come and not until I got up to leave did he finally come by.  Admittedly I'm probably too impatient, but  c'mon can't someone come by and say "hello" or "I'll be right with you" something...throw me a bone!  It's not as if the place was slammin' busy.  

I don't expect staff to bow in my presence, but I've had it with being treated as if I had the plague.  I don't care how good the food is I will not tolerate bad service.
author: Roberto L.

description:
May I say that on the food alone, this is one of my favorite restaurants in SF, although the waitstaff is extremely knowledgable and willing to make suggestions.  It's hard to categorize, as it has Asian, French, and American influences, but its just damn good food.  The plates are fairly small, almost like tapas, so usually you would order two dishes or so per person.  

You must eat the steak, it is so tender and has this butter-herb sauce on it.  Also the roasted chicken with herbs under the skin is  some of the best I've ever had.  My wife is a big seafood fan and she loves the tuna tartare and the mussels as well.  

It does get a little loud, but the presentation of the food lends it to a communal atmosphere.  Also a little pricey, but totally worth it.
author: Josh B.

description:
owned by this chinese family who owns eliza (http://www.yelp.com/biz/elizas-san-francisco#hrid:2kn1zMZ8kYCKYA95BxaS0Q), which i think deserves high ratings of its own ... 

isa's a sweet romantic and a tad bit cozy restaurant... you walk in -- it's quite small ... 

i seem to have noticed a trend with most of these marina places ... there's always* something MORE in the back ... passing through the restrooms, you will be taken to the back (which is literally outdoors) covered with these christmasy lights with heat lamps in every corner ...

for a wed evening, it was busy but not overly busy to the tops, but manageable... but God knows how it is from Thurs-Sat. 

there is also a prix fixe menu, $21.95/person which i consider it to be a steal ... but i guess even though i'm all about dib dabbing different foodies, you just don't get the true flavor of what the restaurant has to offer. it's all bout the a la carte peoples! this place is tapa style, so ordering a few plates to share is common, even though we decided to go with our own... the good thing about this is that each plate of its own came from light to heavy ...  must i say, the food took F O R E V E R S!

the food? reasonably priced for french fusion food ...  and don't ferget to order the wine guys!! ;) see below

we started off getting their asparagas soup for $7 or $9.50 for 2, and even though it wasn't thick, it was rich with flavor, and i wouldn't mind ordering it again... 

next we went for the seared foie gras for $18-- definitely a winner, no cheapie, w/some yummy toasted bread & poached mangos (YUM) and they suggest pairing their wine with some dessert wine which paired well. 

now, for our foodies ... 

since i had started my strict diet with my personal trainer, i opted for their fish, but couldn't decide btwn the baked butterfish or the yellowfin tuna.

he suggested the yellowfin tuna, and since i'm all about sharing, i didn't hesitate -- you get like 8 pieces and they were sliced with flavor for $18.50, his flat iron steak $19.50 was sliced into 6 pieces...  not those everyday looking fat chunky ass, juicy steak, but more so, sliced enough for you and your s/o to easily dab the meat with your fork with no hard labor work involved. NICE!

and NOW ... for the grand finale ... :*(

the dessert person i am, i must say, it was difficult to refuse, but having to eat at 730, simply RIGHT AFTER my pilates session, it was hard enough to pack an extra few dessert lbs ... so we kindly told the server "nay" and walked home, even though i suggested that we sprint home so i could shed the few lbs i just packed on. LOL.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I recently found myself  at Isa as my gf and her husband wanted me to meet them for a weeknight dinner in the Marina's "restaurant row" (aka Steiner St). They are currently temporarily living in the Marina while their Sunset home is undergoing major renovations. Yay double income household!!! But I digress...Isa's definitely above average but I don't know if it quite lives up to all the hype. We all went for the prix fixe menu ($30) and shared "family style" at our server's suggestion. For appetizers, we had the tuna tartare (definitely my favorite dish of the meal), the arugula salad and potato leek soup. For entrees, we had the risotto, steak and seabass. The seabass was unique as it was wrapped in a very thin layer of potato...very original although the fish was a little overcooked. For dessert, we shared the grapefruit granite, creme brulee and Amaretto ice cream. I'm not a huge fan of ice cream but it was definitely my favorite dessert out of the three. The server told us that the plates are small, "tapas style" but when the food came out, the portions were bigger then expected. I would recommend ordering a bit less then an entree per person if you order a la carte and plan to go family style. Otherwise, I liked the warm ambiance (deep reds, black and just enough velvet but not too much) and modern decor.
author: Trinh T.

description: Although the food at Isa was ok (not amazing, but a solid 19 in Zagat), the service was shockingly bad.  We waited an hour and 10 minutes between our appetizer and our main course.  When we told our waiter we were dissapointed, he explained that this is "how the kitchen at Isa is run and that the chef has a specific way of doing things."  He also insisted that we were getting high quality food at a good value as to assume it is ok to make your customers wait over an hour between courses because they are getting such a good deal on the food (in fact, it's actually kind of pricey for what you get).  A pathetic explanation for mediocre service.  And when we followed-up with the management - they were as ambivalent to these issues as our waiter was.  A culture of zero accountability - unreal...
author: Lisa K.

description: We went for Dining About Town, and got seated on the back patio, which is basically a circus tent with gas heaters. The acoustics were terrible, and it was very difficult to have a conversation. The food was pretty good, but not amazing. Overall, I feel like there are better places in this city for amazing food, and there are better places in the city for casual dining. This place didn't really hit either mark.
author: Patrick K.

description: Two friends and I had dinner at Isa based on something one of my friends saw on a restaurant related television program.  We were very late arriving due to heavy Saturday night traffice, pouring rain, lack of parking, etc.  Our reservation was honored, and we were very well taken care of during our short wait.  The food (we had 6 or 7 dishes to share) exceeded my expectations; everything was delicious and very flavorful.  The service was also exceptional; not 'snooty', very helpful, and professional.  It was a very chilly night, and our table was on 'the patio' with a 'tent' type cover, drop-down 'curtains' on all sides and heaters.  It was slightly chilly at first but once the food started coming, we forgot all about the cool evening.  I plan to go back for more.  Our total bill for 3, including our many shared 'small' courses, dessert, coffee, our wine (by the glass), tax & tip was $150.00.  NOTE:  Don't let the 'shared small dish' concept fool you!  You will not go away hungry and all dishes we had worked very well together.
author: Ronald P.

description: Guess it's not terribly important for me to give another 5 * rating. but no need to hold back the love either.  Two dishes I hate to pass up on are the foie gras and the chicken.  I almost felt guilty the first time I ordered the chicken with all of the other choices, but I'm glad I did, and I rarely miss the chance to eat it now.
author: David K.

description: LOVED it! Went there about a month ago for a gal's night out +1 dude-so 8 total people. This is seriously the way to do it. The server (who rocked btw-wish i could remember his name!) recommended 2 dishes per person-1 from the top of the menu, 1 from the bottom half. So we abided. With pleasure.  With 8 people we were able to sample everything on the menu that caught our eyes.  The standout dishes were definitely the truffle risotto (had us scraping the plate and raving), the sweetbreads (my first experience with them..and one I won't soon forget-delicious!) and the duck. Everything was fab though.   Our server even managed to sway us from ordering a certain bottle of wine to ordering a different type without making it seem like we had bad taste or weren't wino enough.  The suggestion was only a couple dollars more than the other bottle, but it was really really excellent.  This place ain't cheap, but heck, it's totally worth it. AND last but not least, I completely recommend sitting in the back area. Reminiscent of a wedding reception (albeit not quite AS nice) or a fanciful dream, the white tented (and heated) area is lit by xmas lights and candles and sets a totally different vibe than the main dining room which is a bit darker and serious. Enjoy!
author: Natasha D.

description: This was my second time eating at Isa. The first time everything was great; food, atmosphere and service. Well I wish I could say the same about this last experience. So we started off with the tuna and oysters. Both item were great. Then it was time to order our main courses. So I decided to order off of the prefix menu. As I was ordering my prefix, which I thought was for one person, they say that their style is family style. Well if you offer family style eating why offer a prefix? So everyone ordered and when we were done ordering the waiter, he said he will try and get all of our dishes together. I didn't think that it would be an issue. Well we got our first course, which was good. I got the potato leak soup, which was a bit bland and needed more salt and pepper. Then it was time for our second course. The first dish came out. Then the second came out 5 minutes later, and then the last 2 dishes came out 20 minutes later. While waiting for my dish, which was the last dish to come out they offered nothing except for a bread plate so that we could have more bread. Then our dishes finally arrived. The steak was pretty tough, the polenta was burnt on the bottom, and the bournese sauce was way too tangy. The best part of the dish was the zucchini. I'm not exactly sure how or why they think that they are a family style eating restaurant. Especially with each main entree being over $20 dollars. I think that they have the concept all wrong. In addition I think that the overall service was horrible. The waiter was not very accommodating, and not interested in helping when I asked what wine he recommended. I was so excited to have dinner here, but it ended up being a huge disappointment.
author: Cortney H.

description: this is a great find in the marina. solid tapas style plates. they know exactly when to bring you the next dish. try the sea bass and duck you will not be disappointed. i don't like the marina, but i do like isa.
author: Dave S.

description: yes its that good!  i CANT believe that i have never been to isa before... i had the best dinner there the other night with my parents and friends.  parents were in town visiting and i wanted to try somewhere new, and had always heard the best about isa.  i was nothing but impressed - we shared about 10 small plates, and all were delicious.  my favorites were the scallops (yes please!), the tuna tartare (yes dad, the fish is raw), and the sweetbreads special (dont think about what they are!!).  wine list was great, and desserts were fantastic too.  i know i am gushing, but its so great to find a new place in the city that you love!!
author: Carolyn B.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this restaurant!!!  I just wish it wasn't a pricey.  My favorite is their foie gras.  YUM!!!  Seared to perfection!!  Unfortunately there isn't much else there that I really like hence the 4 stars.  But when I go with my BF we never share.  We always get our own dish since it's never enough.  It's too bad that the serving size of the foie gras has also decreased over the years too.  I've been coming to this restaurant since 2004 and I'm definitely a fan!
author: Anna Y.

description: so we were walking around the marina one night and decided to try this place.  it was fairly early, about 5:30.  we went in and the place was completely empty but they said that they had no seats available.  the greeter was pretty rude.  i figured, ok they have reservations coming in.  we sat at the bar, ordering this and that, and as time went on, no one came in.  by the time we left, the place was about half full and i'm not even sure about the outside.  i don't know why but they decided not to give us any service.  the food was good though.
author: Thom Y.

description: I went for dinner on 12/15 with 4 other girlfriends and had a great time at this cute place! We all ended up sharing quite a few of the dishes, which was right in line with our server's explanation that everything was meant to be shared--baked goat cheese (the only thing that was just ok) sole, scallops w/ brussel sprouts, duck breast, rack of lamb (sized to the number of us who wanted it), mushroom truffle risotto, grilled calamari, and dungeness crab salad. No dessert, but we did share a bottle of bubbly. Our server, who at first seemed a little pushy/annoying, really grew on us and gave us great recommendations and was able to explain all the dishes thoroughly and was overall just very attentive.
author: Ida L.

description: Perfect for my anniversary dinner. Customer service was awesome!  Their foie gra dish is my favorite.
author: s y.

description: This place has some of the most fantastic tasting tiny portions I have ever eaten. I tasted the tuna crudo, crab salad, many scallops and the truffle risotto. Everything was exceptional and I am glad the portions are small because the food is so rich and so great you could do some damage to yourself eating too much. Nice wine list although I stuck with Champagne. THE FOOD IS FANTASTIC!!! The service and the tent not so much. There are a lot of reviews pertaining to the service and they are all correct, so no need to add to them. I am not at all crazy about the tent with the gas heat blowing on you when you are paying what you are paying to eat here. Sweating and fighting with the other tables through the staff about heat blaster on and heat blaster off doesn't really make for a great fine dining experience. So with all that said, I suggest bar seating inside with the ala carte menu. Everybody looked like they were having a great time in there. With that twist I definitely think that this is a 5 star place for food and I will drop one for service and none for my personal experience in the tent. Lived and learned on that one.
author: William R.

description: I am not a foodie but I do like wholesome, tasty food.  There was a shortage of vegetable options on the menu.  The risotto and petrale were terribly oversalted.  The asparagus soup was barely within my sodium limit as well.  Also, what's so special about fried chicken and mashed potatos that taste no different than KFC?  The flourless chocolate cake was wonderful.  The service was great.  The atmosphere was nice except for the cannister light that was pointed directly down on my friend's face.
author: Trixie G.

description: This is a great little restaurant.  Usually made reservations and our call time was not honored on almost every visit.  It's always busy and the normal wait time is 20 to 25 minutes to be seated (with reservations).  That's the only negative thing I can really say about this restaurant.  The food is perfectly cooked and executed on every time.  Small plates (tapas) is great for sharing with groups and usually 4-5 plates is perfect for couples.  My favorite dish at Isa's is the pan seared sea bass wrapped with potatoes served with a tangy sauce.  That dish is outstanding!!!  The truffled mushroom risotto was ridiculously delicious.  It basically put my risotto to shame, and I stopped making it because I'm just so discouraged now.   The other dish that stood out from the rest was the Sweetbread and Foes Gras with a beautiful reduction sauce.  This dish may have been a special, so I'm not sure whether they offer it anymore.  If they do, I highly recommend this.  I agree with other fellow yelpers that the prices might be a little steep, but remember you don't eat like this all the time.
author: Hiro A.

description: Isa is certainly worth all the hype they get. First and foremost, the service here is almost unbeatable, super friendly staff with personalities and great recommendations, I always feel very well taken care of here. I hadn't been in about four months when we piled back in on a Thursday night. Res. were at 8:00 and we were sitting reading over their brilliant Asian fusion  menu by 8:01. The wine list is well put together to match their exquisite, sometimes daring food, so after ordering a bottle of 2001 Chteau Tournefeuille, we asked our server for recommendations, and per usual, the descriptions were dead on and oh my god are the scallops here from heaven. We had a crab salad, which was brilliant, and the lamb tenderloin, fois gras, which were all suggested, and everything was truly fantastic. We left much broker, but full of good food and wine. We we're so satisfied that we went over the california wine merchant for glass after and lo and behold, our server stopped in and chatted with us over a glass, super cool, I love ISA, and have never been let down, so just don't think about the money and enjoy one of San Francisco's greatest treasures!!
author: Steve l.

description: Good food; sobu-based cocktails only; indifferent service from a self-impressed Croatian guy.
author: Nanucktucktuc K.

description: I went there on a date.  The back room is fairly nice, I would recommend sitting there.  They did seat a couple right next to us even through the room was fairly empty which was strange.  The waitress was from the east coast (I guessed it) and she had a total NY type attitude "you ready yet?"  "You been here before, it's like family style", oh right like I've never had Tapas before.  It felt like I was at PF Chang's "Hey, you been here before, let me mix the sauce for you" type of thing.  Well, we ordered the Oysters which they said were from Hog Island so I thought I'd give them a chance.  They were fairly dried out, like they opened them 2 hours ago.  The next course was asparagus soup.  It needed a little salt just to add some flavor to it.  It had a nice sort of truffle taste, but it needed more truffle oil or truffles themselves.  Then we had the shrimp in some type of red sauce.  This was fairly good, the shrimp or prawns really had a great taste to them.  That was the best dish.  Then we had the sea bass wrapped in potato's.  It was definitely overcooked.  The fish was dry and had no taste and was hard to cut.  Overall, I wouldn't go back.  At the end it seemed like they were trying to rush us out around 10pm.
author: Mitch A.

description: This place is good and has the potential to be great, but there are several "dings" that our group had issues with. Firstly - the food is good. The wine is good. Favorites of the group were the lobster broth and baked butterfish. Secondly, the patio is extremely cute - definitely reminds me of Le Charm's patio, but larger. However, we all had issues with the timing of the food and the service. I understand that this is supposed to be a "family style" meal and plates will not come out at the same time. However, it just felt awkward - sometimes 1 plate would come out, then 3, then we would wait 15+ minutes for the next one, and so on. Also, the service was ridiculously slow - it may have been Friday night, but it was a late Friday night dinner and the place was not that packed...we waited 25 minutes to be seated, 15-20 minutes for our check and another 15 minutes for the card to be run. This place was a "nice to try" but there are definitely other places I would eat at.
author: Adrienne C.

description: wow. how boring. really nothing original. i'm not saying the food was bad, because it wasn't. good quality, but i can't see a reason to ever come here again.
author: Sarah G.

description: cool patio area in back that has heated lamps.  good food and fun crowd.  highly recommend.
author: Chris L.

description: we were absolutely blown away by isa, and some of us are really, really picky eaters. 4 of us went and we ordered the halibut, sea bass in potatoes, the risotto, oysters, lobster soup, goat cheese, flat iron steak. needless to say, the portions were huge (not at all like your usual skimpy tapas), the baguettes were unbelievable, and our waiter was so cool. we were in a rush and he managed to get everything to us in an hour. i expected it to be a little disappointing because we rushed our food, but it still came out impeccably tasty. i'm going back.
author: monkey l.

description: Have been for dinner twice with two very different experiences. The first time we were seated at a small table next to the front window. It was very quite and cozy. The second time we were seated out back very close to a large party and another table. It was a little crammed and lout. I much preferred the interior table but the service was good both times. The food is very good and the tuna tartare is excellent.
author: Adam C.

description: Isa was a great find with an easy menu.  Nearly everything on the menu was appealing - though none of the items was particularly creative. A table in the outside (heated) garden is a must, and if you get dessert, don't skip the ice cream.  Keep in mind that it is family style with small plates - be prepared to share with your dinner partners (and to enjoy their company). The baked goat cheese was one of the best I've had, the tuna tartare standard but reliable, the quail cooked to perfection but a little bland, and the lamb delicious with mashed potatoes that melt in your mouth.  Overall, a great choice.
author: Melissa N.

description: I thought this place was highly overrated.  The food was decent, but given that they recommend every person order two dishes, you are paying about $40 for an entree, and for that price I would expect better service, better ambience, better everything.  The service we received from our waiter was one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had - he was not just unattentive, but when he finally did come by, he was rude with an attitude.
author: Jenny H.

description: I love the small dishes here. A little on the pricey side if you are super hungry but the quality makes up for it! The atmosphere is nice and quiet enough to have a conversation.
author: Naomi O.

description: I have to say, I was a little concerned after signing up for the inaugural 'Yelp Grub Club' at ISA.  I read the reviews, and although favorable, I was thinking it was going to end up like a tapas-style dinner.  Because of the size of the group, we did end up ordering a variety of items to sample, based on our gracious waiter's suggestion of ordering 2 items per person.  It actually worked out ok, as the portions were not as small as my BLVD. experience.  Now I'm usually a picky eater, but everything we ordered (ok, except the Vegetable Medley) agreed with my palate...spicy tuna tartare, heirloom tomato salad, foie gras, roasted quail over risotto, risotto w/truffles n mushrooms, dayboat scallops, rack of lamb, flatiron steak, and potato encrusted sea bass...that's almost half the menu right there.  I enjoyed every taste.  Some may point out that everything seems rather simple and uninspired, but sometimes, simple is the best way to enjoy a meal.   Take a lesson from the Italians and they'll show you how good a meal can be with simple, fresh ingredients and prep.  I'll definitely go back to enjoy a couple of plates of my own.
author: JeFF T.

description: My friend's birthday went here last night. We have a party of 9 at 8p.m.... We ordered two bottle of wines, some drinks, 5 of us order 3 course, others are a la cart, we had Loch Duart salmon tartare, Hudson valley grade A foie gras , Spicy tuna crudo for appetizer..personally i am a big fan of salmon, so i love it... for main course, we have Seared Dayboat scallops, Maple leaf duck breast, Grilled creekstone natural flat iron steak and the daily special halibut... i like the scallop a lot, the duck taste like ham..but it's very nice and the daily halibut is fresh..of cuz the steak was not that great as i expect......  the dessert we bought our cake and they serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and we ordered 5 Vanilla bean crème brulée... i love the crème brulée..not too sweet it is just right... After all, 9 of us and out the door is $590.. a little bit pricey but we had a blast.... the only one star off is the portion are really small.... ( even though is a large plate)..but they have excellent service! Worth it a try!
author: marian l.

description: I can't believe this place is just around the corner from my apt but I never noticed it! It's probably one of a handful of eateries in SF that serves seared foie gras! A great place to go with a group of people because the food is served "tapas" style....but it's all about the seared foie gras...word
author: Roger T.

description: consistently great food!!  all the tapa dishes are delish.  i just wished the portions were bigger!
author: Dorothy L.

description: Solid 4 stars for Isa. I went late on Friday night with friends and they gladly increased the reservation to 5 on a moment's notice. Everyone waiting in the bar was incredibly beautiful and it was definitely happening and hopping at 9pm.  We sat in the back courtyard area and our waiter recommended that each person order two dishes. I am a big eater, and I was with three guys, but seriously, we could not finish all of our food! Thankfully they were out of the calarmari, because it would've been a shame to see it go to waste. So, we had truffle risotto and truffle spaghetti - omg they were so good and flavorful. The butter fish was also another standout dish. We had two lamb dishes that came on a bed of french green beans (also very good). The heirloom tomato salad was delish and so was the goat cheese plate. Seriously everything was delicious, but next time, I won't order two plates per person...we were so stuffed that we couldn't even sample their desserts. Till next time...
author: Natalie S.

description: *lovely* place for first date. extremely charming atmosphere (especially on covered patio) good french-ish tapas, and having just the right combination of neighborhood friendliness and elegance. slightly crowded, which allows for plenty accidental brushing of legs under table...
author: jenna p.

description: My bf brought me here for my birthday on Tuesday and it might be my new favorite restaurant.  I'll have to go back a few more times, but everything was absolutely delicious!  We did the prix fixe menu each, with the prosciutto and arugula bruschetta appetizer, goat cheese and tomato appetizer, and ordered the asparagus soup for two on the side.  Entrees were the seafood paella and the flat iron steak.  The soup was amazing, as the waiter had said.  It comes with drops of lemon oil which adds a nice contrast to the rich creamy soup.  Honestly everything was delicious and I loved the seating in the back, which reminded me of restaurants we went to in Europe, sitting outside but covered.  Next time I'd like to try sitting in the front inside the romanticly lit room.  For a "tapas" place, I felt the portions were great and we actually couldn't finish all this food.  Everything is very reasonably priced for the food you get and I will definitely go back!
author: Emiko M.

description: I loved this place. Went here with 3 people and we split everything...the mashed potatos were so good. Great atmosphere, especially if you sit in the back patio area.
author: Katie G.

description: Have been craving their crispy chicken with mashed potatoes and tonight was the night.  Along with the butter lettuce and endive salad, that made up my $24.95 prix fixe, which is a pretty good deal.  As I remembered, the flavors are clean and the preparations simple and basic, nothing cutting edge but definitely satisfying.  What they do is done very well.  As one of the original small plates establishments, its nice to see they've stayed the course, although I might not be craving crispy chicken again for awhile.
author: David T.

description: this place is okay. i think the food is okay but the portions are small.  my fiancee loves this place but its only so so for me. i think its expensive for what you get which is small portions. we never leave stuffed but one would think we should for the price we paid.
author: chloe w.

description: Very disappointing. Read the reviews before making a reservation and was looking forward to our meal. We arrived on time and dressed for a nice dinner out. The hostess seated us a table in the bar area next to some diners that had been sitting and drinking for awhile. Not only were they loud, but the tables were so close I could barley hear my husband talking. We had the asparagus soup, seafood risotto, tuna and the scallops. The star was the scallops everything else was OK at best. We will not go back.
author: Adele H.

description: The food is nice. It is a bit on the expensive side but it's worth it. Definatly try Foe Gras
author: angela s.

description: nearly flawless in every dish i've had there.  small plates allow you to try more.  tried these and they were great: dungeness crab salad, seared foie gras, truffled risotto, seared duck.
author: Will I A m.

description: easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city. the food is amazing, the service is good, ambiance is cozy and the price is not too bad. a great "first date" type of place.  try the scallops! yuuuuuuuuum
author: Cam N.

description: I dined here nearly four years ago. The fact that I have limited recollection of the many plates we ordered means that the food did not wow me. And yet, Isa has continued to flourish in the fiercely competitive restaurant business (especially in SF), so the experience must have been at least pretty good. I think we were seated next to the window so we had a nice view of the street. Our server was very friendly, and the overall atmosphere was peaceful (we like to dine in the early evening to avoid the crowd). I recall ordering the Lobster Broth. It came with foam on top, which I felt was completely extraneous, as it had no flavor; I know it was meant to provide contrast of "texture", but frankly, froth on soup just doesn't have the same appeal as froth on espresso. The broth itself had a very rich shellfish flavor. I also ordered the Duck Breast, and remember thinking that it was a tad undercooked for my taste: more rare-medium than medium-rare.
author: Yb W.

description:
3.75 stars. I wanted to fall in love with this place - but alas, there are a few things lacking. Our service was TERRIBLE. We sat in the cove by the front window and our server kept on forgetting about us and we RARELY ever saw him. I think he was definitely taking care of too many tables. I'm not terribly critical usually about service (I'm more of a food person...), but when you're very thirsty and you have an empty cup of water for 30 minutes, you get a bit sad.....looking at that empty cup... there was one incredible bartender/server (short dark haired male with glasses) - I saw him so intensely making the soju mojito and became intrigued with his attention to detail - really working to crush the limes and mint to ensure a perfect cocktail. We watched him as we sat at the bar and instantaneously became sold and ordered it.

Ambiance can definitely be nice for a first date or just a good girl hangout. Make sure to make reservations - not the biggest of restaurants.

Regarding the food, I'm somewhat torn. Everything was cooked perfectly (texture-wise) - baked butterfish was flaky, fresh, and definitely NOT overcooked and the duck breast was perfectly juicy was medium-rare just the way I like it. However, the flavors weren't necessarily very astounding. It was nice to try the huckleberry as a complement to the duck breast - but the duck overpowered any taste of the huckleberry (perhaps some citrus could have helped to draw out the flavors more)...mm maybe some more garlic... :) the beet accompaniment was great with the goat cheese (but the arugula could go away - it was on this night overly salted with too much lemon - almost to where it stung your mouth as it touched either your lips or tongue). The idea of adding green to the plate is good as otherwise the colors would not be very widespread (all purple, blue, brown), but the arugula just didn't work out for the dish. The problem with the fish was also similar, it was just sort of bland - the veggies that it came with (mushrooms, carrots, etc.) were good and well - flavored, but the fish would have been slightly better with some type of rub. We also got oysters, but it wasn't anything special.

I think I would come back again, but still alas, too many restaurants to try before I buckle down on anything...
author: Jeannette L.

description: Incredible to see the decline of this once incredible restaurant.  The food is truly nothing like it was in the golden age here of 2000-2007 when it was consistently in the top 100 Bay area Michael Bauer list.
author: Christin A.

description: DONT EVER GO TO THIS PLACE!!! This has been one of the most terrible experiences. I was hesitant to begin with to go to this place, but decided to give it a shot.... I mean 18 dollar small plate------grrrrrrrrrrr...I was so pissed...they brought me the DRYEST sea bass ever...when we complained to the waiter, he aswered in a very snobbish manner that the fish in fact is perfect and we are just nuts. Wow wow wow! 20 dollar steak is 2 bite size, everything is mediocre, and staff is snobby. Will never ever go back or recommend to anyone.
author: Irene K.

description: Isa has the most gorgeous, intimate outdoor dining set up, complete with heat lamps and a sprinkling of tiny white lights.  Perfect for special occasions and dates.  Enjoyed the huge portion of spicy tuna tartare over avocado the most.  And the baked goat cheese with pine nuts and pesto went wonderfully with a bottle of Ridge zinfandel.  Desserts are solid too.
author: Liz L.

description: i had one of their set nye dinners, and was very impressed.  my spicy tuna compote, foie grais, and lamb were all good.  my creme bulee was a little over burned and the foie gras was a little gamey  for my taste.  but good meal overall.
author: Richard Y.

description: Oh my! The butterfish on a bed of mushrooms is to DIE for! I crave it almost everytime I think about this place! GREAT food, awesome atmosphere and great service!
author: Luba R.

description: A bit crowded  and did not like the mirrors on the walls but the food was good and I like the concept of it being family style where you share everything.  Started with a bottle of Bourdeaux and then had the grilled calamari which had good flavor, it was perfectly cooked and a pretty good sized portion.  Next had the foie gras delicious with huckleberry and a piece of bread that was sweet and a good compliment to the dish, ithe portion could have been a bit bigger but it was super tasty.  Next we had the duck which was just ok not too memorable and finally the lamb with white beans which was very tender and had good flavor  When we finished eating we were left to sit and drink our wine with no pressure to leave which was nice.  Overall great food but the atmospere could be better
author: Melanie -.

description: Excellent food and good atmosphere.  This is another of the "small plate" restaurants that have been popping up around the city.  A cozy, modern interior out front, and a tent-covered patio in back (at least when we went).  The food is delicious and portions are decent for small-plates.  There wasn't anything that we did not enjoy.  The potato-wrapped halibut and duck breast are great.  We have wandered in two or three times over the past year.
author: George C.

description: It rocks!  A neighborhood restaurant, with amazing and consistent food.  The owners are great and the staff is friendly, warm and professional.  I wish I could eat there everynite.  I never miss bringing guests from out of town into this crown jewel in the neighborhood!
author: Sally S.

description: The food is good but heavy, the service can be spotty.   It is important to go with someone who has the same taste in food as you do or in a big group.  Although it is a small plates restaurant, everything is coursed out so the fois gras will not be served at the same time as the fish so you could be eating one dish alone.
author: Maria R.

description: Isa is one of my favorite tapas restaurants in the city.  Kitty and Luke are a wonderful couple who have always treated us well.  The food has been great and very consistent over the years.  I enjoy this place better than Cortez, Andalu and most of the others I have tried in SF.
author: Brian L.

description: 12 people...regular menu...great atmosphere...service was slow, but food was very interesting and tasty. We ordered 5 small plates (salads+tarters) and each person ordered big plates (lamb+chicken+steak), so it worked out well.
author: Ann S.

description: Not far from my appartment in the Marina ;) and this place is one that I always bring my friends to when they come visit. Great service and really tasty food. But don't go by yourself, it's definately a date place with big plates to share.
author: jane-paula s.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the Marina!  The food is very consistent and well priced for the quality you are getting.  The service is great and the atmoshpere is cozy.  Weather you are on a date or out with friends, give this place a try.  They also have the best tuna tartar and the chicken dish is awesome as well.
author: Danielle M.

description: i love the food. the seating outside atomosphere was great too. Much more open then fleur de lis
author: K K.
daniel s.

description: The food deserves a 3+, but my overall experience at Isa is a 1.  So, to be fair, I give it a 2.  They are doing some shady stuff with the SF Chefs. Food. Wine. Restaurant Week--CUSTOMERS BEWARE.  Long story short, they RIPPED ME OFF!  I noticed on their website that their regular menu (with a prix fixe menu of $28 for 3 courses) is almost the same as their "special" menu for Restaurant Week (with a prix fixe menu of $35 for 3 courses), so I called and asked what the difference was.  The host explained that they had to create a special menu to participate in Restaurant Week, so they created one based on their regular menu.  THAT'S IT.  I was like, "OK, so why is this special menu more expensive?"  Instead of giving me a straightforward answer, he said, "Well, you can just order off of our regular menu."  That should've been an indication to me that Isa is just not the restaurant for me.  But I already made a reservation, and my friends were already coming, so I'm like this sucks, but I'll try it out and just order off of the regular menu.  I got there, and once again tried to get the waiter to explain to me the difference b/t the two menus.  He was super evasive and was like, well, one has a dessert and the other one doesn't.  And I'm like whatever, let me just order off of the regular prix fixe menu.  So I ordered off of the regular menu and it got even more confusing because he kept trying to explain to me what to order for the 3 courses, and I found out that there is a dessert option, but it's smaller, and at this point I was a bit tipsy so I didn't really pay that much attention and allowed him to steer me towards ordering certain things.  THEN, at the end, I got a bill for all the dishes at regular price (no prix fixe prices, regular OR special)!!!  I freaked out, but didn't want to make a big scene in front of my friends, so I went up to the waiter to ask him what was up, and he said that I didn't order off of any prix fixe menu and that the regular prix fixe menu was different than the options that I chose, even though I clearly told him that I wanted the regular prix fixe for the table.  I didn't feel like arguing with him and ruin the night, so I just sucked it up and paid the FULL PRICE.  I seriously hate this place now and feel totally conned by my waiter.
author: Lucks N.

description: I have to say that this place exceeded my expectations for a last minute birthday party.  I literally made reservations late on Thursday for a party of  8  on Sat which they were able to accomodate at 8:30pm.  We were seated in the back room and that atmosphere was beautiful, albeit cramped.  They really pack them back there and it was quite loud.  We were worried at first that the server was taking a while to help us out and then continued to tell us that they were out of mussels, chicken and all the specials, but he really ended up turning it around.  We took his suggestion and ordered about 2 dishes per person.  It was really fun to share as the dishes came out.  They were all wonderful!  We had the salmon tartare, sauteed prawns, grilled calamari, warmed goat cheese, steak, sole, scallops, and truffle risotto.  We ordered 2 bottles of wine and some of our party had cocktails.  It came out to less than $60 per person!  Plus our server surprised the birthday boy with a chocolate cake (amazing!) and complimentary glass of muscat.  It was a great night!
author: L P.

description: possibly one of my worst restaurant experiences.  I have been here about 5 times before last night, the food and experience-always great.  But last night I sat at the bar as I usually do, my friend and I ordered 2 entrees and a salad to start to share.  His, ribs, mine a steak.  His came around 6:15p, mine never came.  I asked and asked.  finally I asked for the bill at 6:40p he was completely done eating at my insistance.  The "manager" came out and tried to justify the fact that my food never came!  "it takes longer" not all food can come at the same time  etc.  I have never been so insulted. Like I was wrong to expect my food to come at all?  I paid the bill for his dinner and my wine and left without any satisfaction, no apologies, no dinner,  nothing.  $50 for a salad we split and his dinner and some wine! I will NEVER go here again.  She could have said just about anything or given me a discount - anything, and I would have come back.  But nothing.  I hope the owner knows about this extrememly unprofessional and rude behavior from his manager.  nothing is worth that experience and I won't repeat it!
author: Merry D.

description: This was my, umm, millionth time there.  I started going when the owner's little daughter was running around the place barely the height of the tables.  Now she's probably... like driving now? I don't live in the City anymore so the visits are stretched.  Isa is one of the few places I will drive the hour just to visit and support the Asian owner/chef.  Always good.  I've never had a bad night there.  I'm not saying everything is excellent but once I dip into the foie-gras I'm good for the night and everything else is gravy.  Yes it can get packed.  If you can't adjust to that... in the City... during peak num-num time then I don't know what types of restaurants you frequent... and they can't be all that good... TGI Friday's gets packed but no one complains about that... for $10 a head.  I happened to go on a saturday night about 7:15pm.  We almost had the whole back patio to ourselves (4 ppl).  I love the patio.  It has a casual feel with the tent, heaters and light strings.  I wouldn't exactly call it "romantic" , since it can feel a bit crowded with a packed house, and still don't know why ppl recommend it as such...  unless you were to rent out the whole back for you and your date... then that would be romantic in my book.  Get there early because parking's a biatch in the Marina.
author: No I Don't Have Time F.

description: good food but a little expensive, like for lots of french places in SF
author: laurent i.

description: the portion was not too big, but it was just right! delicious!! i would def go back. presentation was very simple and basic. Overall, we had good service.
author: Karenka N.

description: I'm a bit torn between a 3 and a 4, but have decided to be generous.  The food is close to a 5.  The only thing we had that wasn't exceptionally tasty was the pasta, but it was by no means bad.  Highlights were the butter fish, steak with blue cheese, and creme brulee.  The reason for the lower review is I felt very manipulated and rushed, which isn't what you're looking for in a restuarant at this price point.  First, the waiter told us we would need to order 2 dishes each (total of 14 for the 7 of us), we ordered 10, he said it wouldn't be enough and it was still way too much food (and we have serious appetites).  He also told us that the chef would not allow us to order more dishes later in the meal if we wanted them. Second, the chef is in complete control of what food comes out and when.  I had no objection to the chef selecting the order, but the dishes rolled out so fast that we felt like it was a food marathon.  The table was small, so the dishes had to be cleared within a few minutes of arriving to make room for the next one.  The food was really good and I would really have liked to take my time and savor it instead of shoveling it in - especially for a final check of $70 each with only two bottles of inexpensive wine for 7 people.  Perhaps they would have been able to let us have more time if they'd sat us on time for our 6:30p reservation when our entire party was present.  If you want to brave it, I do think small plates in large groups is a great way to get to explore this excellent menu.
author: gretchen d.
